title: The default properties rules do not support multi-valued attributes
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : master
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : all

### Screenshots

![Capture-2021-02-16_10-34-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/108186152-533dba80-710d-11eb-9957-d50e617035bd.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create an EMF-based document from a metamodel which has multi-valued attibutes.
2. Select an element with such an attribute in the exporer.
3. In the element's properties view, the multi-valued attribute is represented by a radio group (i.e. a single value is expected), with no elment checked. Trying to enable one of the values causes a `ClassCastException` on the backend when we call `eObject.eSet(attribute, value)` with `value` not being a `Collection` as expected.

Using the sample Sirius Desktop VSM support in https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/38, this can be reproduced by selecting a node style element as shown in the screenshot above. In this case the exception is thrown in `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.compatibility.properties.EEnumIfDescriptionProvider.getNewValueHandler()`

### Expected behavior

For this kind of attribute (at least for EEnum-based ones), we should render a group of checkboxes and support checking/unckecking each one individually.

title: Direct Edit of representation names from the explorer is broken
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : latest (master)
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : tested on Linux, but also reported on macOS

### Screenshots

![Capture-2021-02-22_15-48-25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/108724253-6d203880-7525-11eb-840c-461cef8072a6.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open/create a project
2. In the explorer, select a diagram (create one if needed).
3. Open its context menu and select "Rename".
4. Type a new name, and hit "Enter".

### Expected behavior

The "direct edit" input is closed and the diagram is renamed, both in the explorer and in the tab (if it was opened).

### Actual behavior

The UI does not seem to react at all. The input field stays open and can not be closed (except by refreshing the browser page).

title: NA
body:
A first analysis shows that when validating the new name, the backend executes `EditingContextEventProcessor.doHandle(IInput)` twice with the `RenameRepresentationInput`. And a third time when the input field loses the focus (which is expected since focus lost triggers the rename).

Note that renaming documents of semantic objects from the explorer work fine. `EditingContextEventProcessor.doHandle(IInput)` has some special code for `RenameRepresentationInput`, which trigger the publication of an event. This may be related to the issue as this is specific to representation renaming.

title: NA
body:
Upon invoking the mutation (in `TreeItem.tsx`, see the `useEffect` associated to `renameRepresentation`), the frontend receives this from the server:

![Capture-2021-02-26_11-08-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/109286779-0059b680-7823-11eb-9067-639b360001ab.png)

So there are at least two issues:
* the backend returns a failure;
* the frontend is completely unable to handle these.

The second point about the lack of proper error handling on the front applies to all the other mutations in `TreeItem` which follow the same pattern.

title: NA
body: The root cause seems to be in `DiagramEventProcessor.handle(IRepresentationInput)` which does not return anything when handling a `RenameRepresentationInput`. The default `Optional.empty()`, which is considered by `MutationRenameRepresentationDataFetcher.get(DataFetchingEnvironment)` as an unexpected error.

title: NA
body: This is actually fixed by https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/2895c662eb2d04f1904f1dde1d14a2f075d29e1a.

title: Unset model operation handling is broken
body: The implementation in `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.compatibility.modeloperations.UnsetOperationHandler` which handles the `Unset` model operations that can be used in Sirius Desktop VSMs is broken. It does not match the Sirius Desktop behavior as defined in `org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.helper.task.operations.UnsetTask`.

title: NA
body:
There are at least two issues:
* Although it is not typed as an expression, Sirius Desktop actually evaluates the `featureName` as one (see` org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.helper.task.operations.UnsetTask.execute()`)
* The current implementation in Sirius Components never calls `eRemove`. It's either `eAdd` (which makes no sense for an "Unset" operation) or `eSet` (which is called will `null` to implement a "clear/unset" operation).

title: Add a correlation identifier
Improve the ChangeKind with additional information
body: The identifier of the representation is necessary along with the `kind` of the change performed. As such, `changeKind` should be transformed into a `ChangeDescriptor`.

title: The frontend cannot render diagram with edges containing multiple labels
body: If we have multiple labels for an edge they will have the same identifier.

title: Evaluate the possible removal of SubscriptionDescription
body: In order to support more easily additional types of subscriptions not related to the editing context, it would be nice to not have to rely on subscription descriptions anymore

title: Border node rendering is broken
body:
This looks like a regression.

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a "Topography" diagram on the sample "Robot" Flow model
2. Select the "Central Unit" element in the explorer and create a new object of type "Power Output" on it.
3. On the diagram, the new element should be displayed on the external border of the "Central Unit" container, with a small size. On `master` it is displayed inside the container, at the top-left corner and with a "normal" size (too big for a border node).

How is was before (on an older version of the code):

![demo-ok](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/109625833-15468a80-7b40-11eb-81c6-e47de2c8a49f.png)

How is it now on `master`:

![staging-broken](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/109625872-2099b600-7b40-11eb-8d15-6d31d728d2ab.png)

title: NA
NA
body:
Simpler scenario:

1. Start from an empty model.
2. Create a Topography diagram.
3. Create a composite processor (it appears on the diagram).
4. Create a "Power Output" object inside the composite: it appears *inside* the composite processor, like a normal child element.
5. Re-create a new "Topography" on the composite processor: this one is layouted by ELK and the power output node is correctly placed on the border.

![Capture-2021-03-02_10-51-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/109631196-01058c00-7b46-11eb-90cc-b40f8dd27dac.png)

![Capture-2021-03-02_10-51-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/109631208-02cf4f80-7b46-11eb-9771-2ebe0b6a0b95.png)

title: Creating a new diagram does not always use the automatic layout
Update Sirius Desktop to 6.5.0
body:
We are currently depending Sirius Desktop 6.4.2, but Sirius Desktop master is now 6.5.0.
Not that there is much of interest for Sirius Web on master, it's just to make sure we keep up to date.

title: Remove useless information from some of our payloads
body: Fields such as `status` in the `EditTextfieldSuccessPayload` are useless. They don't provide any value and they are unused.

title: Remove the toolbar from non-existing diagrams
body:
We don't need it and it creates errors

```
Material-UI: A component is changing the controlled value state of Select to be uncontrolled.
Elements should not switch from uncontrolled to controlled (or vice versa).
Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled Select element for the lifetime of the component.
The nature of the state is determined during the first render, it's considered controlled if the value is not `undefined`.
More info: https://fb.me/react-controlled-components 
    at SelectInput (http://localhost:3000/static/js/0.chunk.js:52774:24)
```

title: NA
body:
Hi,

The "The string resource '_UI_ParticipantGroup_name_feature' could not be located" message indicates that EMF Edit could not find the `plugin.properties` that contain this key in its classpath, or that is has not been updated/regenerated after a metamodel change.
Make sure the `_UI_ParticipantGroup_name_feature` key actually exists in the `plugin.properties`, and if it does then its a classpath configuration issue (which can be tricky when mixing Eclipse plugins/OSGi projects with Spring Boot, as they do not manage the classpath in the same way).

title: NA
body:
I didn't to include plugin.* in my jar, now it's working. For those who are having issues, I used this as a guide https://github.com/ObeoNetwork/Flow-Designer/

Thank you

title: Restore the real time feedback on representation renaming
body:
This feature has been disabled temporarily during the split Project/EditingContext

Steps to reproduce by PCD:

- Create an open a diagram
- In the explorer, rename it
- The name correctly changes in the explore, but not on the tab of the already opened diagram (true for the user who does the rename and also for others who may be watching the same diagram)
- Close and reopen the diagram: the new name is not correctly displayed in the tab

title: Make the stereotype descriptions editing context aware
body: The field `Viewer#stereotypeDescriptions` should instead be transferred on `EditingContext` in the GraphQL schema. On top of that the creation of new documents should be editing context aware too.

title: Deleted representations are still accessible and visible in the OnboardArea
Investigate how to make the ELK layout more stable
body: We may be able to give additional information to ELK such as the current position and size of the nodes and edges. It may help keep elements from moving everywhere in some situations

title: NA
body: Issue not precise enough given all the improvements done on the layout

title: Use UUID instead of String for Label ID.
body:
* [ ] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
Label should have UUID type ID as Node and Edge for instance.

...

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects
Currently, the label ID is based on the string returned by the idProvider from the labelDescription. We should compute a stable ID in the same way as for Edge or Node. That implies removing the idProvider from labelDescription and compute the stable id in LabelComponent.
...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: Make the child creation descriptions editing context aware
Load the domain documents as EPackages in the editing context
Make the representation descriptions editing context aware
body: Same issue as the stereotypeDescriptions, rootObjectCreationDescriptions, childCreationDescriptions

title: Make sure that the necessary redirection use a proper push state
The variables input contains a field name 'projectId' that is not defined for input object type 'CreateDocumentInput'
NA
body:
This should have been fixed in sirius-components by https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/ff3ffed7a597934c045fec85aa806d4155157e99, but the sirius-web sample application has not been updated yet to consume a version with the fix.

In the mean time you can create new models from the project context menu in the header. The dialog used in this part of the UI does not have the issue.

title: Add reference containment to the Domain DSL
body: The domain definition DSL implemented in `sirius-web-domain` is currently too basic. To be at least somewhat usable it needs to support containement references. Their translation into the corresponding EMF `EPackage` in the converter will be trivial. We ignore opposite references for now.

title: Add support containment references in the Domain DSL
body: The `View` DSL implemented in `sirius-web-view` does not currently support the definition of tools and behaviors associated to the node and edge "mappings". However the converter should still be able to provide some automatic "canonical" tools, in particular node and edge creation tools.

title: "IllegalArgumentException: resolve against non-hierarchical or relative base" when using dynamic model instances
body:
```

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: resolve against non-hierarchical or relative base
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI$Hierarchical.resolve(URI.java:3548) ~[org.eclipse.emf.common-2.21.0.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI.resolve(URI.java:5580) ~[org.eclipse.emf.common-2.21.0.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.JsonHelper.resolve(JsonHelper.java:928) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.getPackageForURI(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:677) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.getEClass(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:885) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.loadObject(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:366) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserializeContent(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:270) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserialize(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:253) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserialize(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:1) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at com.google.gson.internal.bind.TreeTypeAdapter.read(TreeTypeAdapter.java:69) ~[gson-2.8.6.jar:na]
	at com.google.gson.Gson.fromJson(Gson.java:932) ~[gson-2.8.6.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.resource.JsonResourceImpl.doLoad(JsonResourceImpl.java:299) ~[org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load(ResourceImpl.java:1563) ~[org.eclipse.emf.ecore-2.23.0.jar:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.services.EditingContextEPackageService.getEPackages(EditingContextEPackageService.java:71) ~[classes/:na]

```

title: NA
body:
### Analysis

The error occurs because for discovering dynamically contributed domains and views, at several points in the code we try and load *all* documents in the database as EMF models:
* `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.view.DynamicRepresentationDescriptionService.findDynamicRepresentationDescriptions(UUID)`
* `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.services.EditingContextSearchService.findById(UUID)`
* `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.services.EditingContextEPackageService.getEPackages(UUID)`

For most documents which are instances of statically known metamodels (including views and domain *definitions*), this is fine.
For documents which are *instances* of dynamically contributed domains, EMF JSON does not (and can not) know about the corresponding metamodel/`EPackage`, so it tries to resolve the declared nsURI, but in this case the nsURI is an UUID and fails to parse as a URI.
The problem is not the "shape" of the nsURI though, even if we used a syntactically correct nsURI, it can simply not be resolved at this point as the EMF EPackage is not known in this context.

### Proposed fix

Following @sbegaudeau's suggestion, we will add a finer grained query on `DocumentRepository`. In the locations mentioned above we are only actually interested in either domain or view definitions, so we can restrict our search and avoid trying to load problematic documents. This will also improve performance.

PostgreSQL provides the required features to find the JSON documents which are instances of specific metamodels we are interested in. For example to select (and load) only domain definitions:

```sql
SELECT * FROM Document document
WHERE document.content::jsonb @> '{ "ns": { "domain": "http://www.eclipse.org/sirius-web/domain" } }'::jsonb
```

title: NA

The stack is slightly different from the first one above, here it's the onboarding area which asks for the `editingContext { representationDescription }`, and the corresponding data fetcher which tries to load all documents in the db, include the newly created dynamic instance, in an EMF context where the corresponding EPackag is not known.

title: Move business specific code in Sirius Web
body:
### Problem

Our business concerns are too tightly integrated with some of our code sued to support the edition of representations in a collaborative environment and our newly introduced meta-modeling support.

### Solution

We will tighten the scope of Sirius Components and as a result some code currently in the repository will become out of the scope of Sirius Components. This code will thus move from this repository to the Sirius Web one.

The Sirius Components repository will be more focused on the workbench, its representations (diagrams, forms, trees), meta-modeling support and some core components (backend or frontend) while Sirius Web will still be a complete application showing how Sirius Components can be used. Since some of our users have very different requirements for their applications, we need to have a more visible separation between the core parts of the framework and our sample application.

Some unnecessary parts will be removed in our business layer and, by migrating this code in Sirius Web, it will way easier for our users to fork our business code to do anything they want instead of waiting for us to create a new specific entry point for their needs.

### Rabbit holes

* Do not move the code out of the Sirius Components repository unless the task is almost finished to deal with reeling issues only at the end.

### No-gos

### Test

* [ ] Automated developer tests merged and pass (with reasonable code coverage)
* [ ] Automated End-to-End tests  merged and pass (Cypress)
* [ ] Feature/bug fix manually tested/validated by at least one person not involved in the implementation
* [ ] Collaborative tests passed by hand
* [ ] Exploratory test passed by MEB
* [ ] Business acceptance test passed by MEB

### Doc
* [ ] Internal Doc updated
* [ ] External Doc updated
* [ ] Validation Doc updated

### UX/UI
* [ ] Zeroheight updated
* [ ] Storybook updated

### Next
* [ ] Any left-over tasks added to the issues on Github

title: It should be possible to validate/close the creation dialogs more directly
body:
Our new MUI-based dialog boxes (object creation, model creation, representation creation...) need the focus to be set on the "Create" button to be validated from the keyboard.
When creating e.g. a new representation, the initial focus is (correctly) on the text field for the new representation name.
Once I have set the name, assuming the representation type is correct, I should just be able to hit _Enter_ to close the dialog and create the representation.
Instead I have to use the mouse to click on the button or to hit _Tab_ to put the focus on the "Create" button.

title: When opening a diagram, the viewport should be adjusted to ensure its top-left part is visible
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : `master`
* [x] **I have specified my environment** :  Linux

### Screenshots

![2021-03-24_11-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/112291470-6efa2a80-8c90-11eb-99bf-7b0d3851dde4.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new diagam (e.g. a Topography in the sample Robot Flow model).
2. Scroll/span to display all the contents of the diagram in the center of the screen.
3. Select the most "top-left" element and move it upper and more to the left. At this point everything is still visible on the screen.
4. Close and reopen the diagram: the element moved in the previous step is cropped or even invisible.

### Expected behavior

When opening a diagram, either we should remember the previous zoom/scroll settings (but in a multi-user env I'm not sure it's a good approach, or we'd need user-specific properties for these like GMF, and it's another can of worms), or more realistically adjust the viewport to ensure the top-left part of the diagram is visible.

Currently we have no way for the user to see the position of the elements relative to the (0, 0) origin, so the beahvior is confusing.

Another approach would be to normalize the coordinates server-side after a refresh/layout, so that all the diagram elements are always in the lower-right quadrant of the coordinates system, and then the front can keep its simple behavior of showing the viewport on (0, 0).

title: NA
body:
Thanks for the feedback.
In Sirius Desktop, the `elementView` variable (and all the `*View` variables actually) point to elements in the Sirius EMF model for diagrams (`DDiagram` and related). These do not exist in the same form in Sirius Web, so we do not provide the corresponding variable.
The most common use case for `elementView`, like yours, is to get the semantic elements at the source or target of the edge.
For this we provide the `semanticEdgeSource` and `semanticEdgeTarget` variables instead, which can replace the expressions `element.sourceNode.target` and `element.targetNode.target`.
You can uses these in your _Element Expression_ and it should work in Sirius Web, but unfortunately it will stop working in Sirius Desktop (which does not provide this variable, at least at the time).

title: NA
body:
If we want to improve compatibility between Sirius Desktop and Sirius Web on this kind of stuff, I see two options:

1. in Sirius Web, "cheat" and provide the Desktop variables as fake objects which respond to the same kind of queries (e.g. here expose a `target` attribute which points to the semantic element). This would need quite a lot of work and would probably be very brittle.
2. in Sirius Desktop, add the same variables as mentioned above (`semanticEdgeSource` and `semanticEdgeTarget`), and maybe others as needed. This depends on what people are actually doing with `elementView` & co. in their VSMs: progressively identify the most common (and "legitimate") usage patterns/expressions, and expose the result of the expressions directly as variables that can be available in both versions of Sirius. At some point we could deprecate the direct `*View` variables in Sirius Desktop if we are confident we support all the legitimate use cases with more direct variables.

They are not incompatible but the second option seems preferable in the long term.

title: NA
body:
To be clear, my remarks above were only about the `elementView` variable/
The `element` variable is indeed missing. This should be fixed by PR #410 .

title: Add automatic canonical creation tools to `ViewConverter`
body:
We do not yet support the definition of tools in the _View_ definition DSL, but to make the resulting modelers slightly more usable we should try to provide automatic node and edge creation tools based on the mapping definitions.
Of course we will need to make some simplifying assumptions, and the automatic tools may not work in all cases, but this is a temporary feature until we decide exactly how tools will be specified.

title: Fix edge handling in `ViewConverter`
body: There are a few issues in how the `ViewConverter` translates `EdgeDescrition`s into our APIs, in particular for domain-based edges.

...

title: NA
body:
Thanks for the feedback. Currently this particular feature (or the extensibility of the properties view to support new widgets in general) is not on the roadmap, but we'll keep this particular one in mind when we look at this general area later.

For reference, this involves (at least):
* adding and integrating an `EDateIfDescriptionProvider` on the backend, following the same model as for `EStringIfDescriptionProvider(ComposedAdapterFactory)`
* adding a `DateFieldDescription` and its corresponding renderer (similar to `TextfieldDescription` and `TextfieldComponent`)
* on the front, adding and integrating a `DatefieldPropertySection` similar to `src/properties/propertysections/TextfieldPropertySection.tsx`, but using an appropriate Material UI component, e.g. from https://material-ui.com/components/pickers/#date-time-pickers

title: Add the support for list containers
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

For now, only two kinds of Node are supported in Sirius web, RectangleNode and ImageNode. We want to support a third one, the ListContainerNode which will make possible to display a rectangle with a header and some list items.

And this is the `Developer Guide` section in case the cached version gets deleted.

-----------------------
## Developer Guide

This sections describes the main APIs that are exposed by the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler to build custom modelers and extend the platform.

Every instance of the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler is a custom Spring Boot application built by using reusable frontend and backend components provided by the Open Source Sirius Components project. When running on the entreprise version of the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler, additional, proprietary components are available to provide more features, but the principles are the same.

The Sirius Web repository provides an example of a complete, ready-to-run studio based on the Open Source components. It can be used as a starting point to create your own modeler.
### 4. Business Domain Definition

While the architecture of the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler is not tied to the Eclipse Modeling Framework, EMF models are currently the first supported type of domain models.

If you have an existing EMF metamodel which represents your business domain, to use it in you modeler you need to:

1. Make sure the JARs for the metamodel itself and its .edit support are in your application’s classpath. Typically this involves publishing the two JARs in a Maven repository and adding their coordinates into your sample application’s POM file. Example in Sirius Web.

2. Register your metamodel in your application. This is done by creating a Spring @Configuration which provides your meta-model’s EPackage and AdapterFactory as Spring @Beans. Example in Sirius Web.

3. Provide an implementation of org.eclipse.sirius.web.api.services.IImagePathService which tells Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler in which folders (relative to the root of the JAR) the icons for your metamodel types can be found. Example in Sirius Web.

If you do not yet have an EMF-based domain model, you can use Ecore Tools to design and implement it, and then follow the same steps as above.
### 5. Sirius Desktop Compatibility

Modelers based on the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler can reuse Sirius Desktop modeler definition files (.odesign files). Only a subset of the Sirius Desktop features are currently supported, but you can safely use a complete odesign file in the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler. The features which are not supported at the moment will simply be ignored. Future versions of the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler will increase the scope of Sirius Desktop features supported. If you rely on specific features from Sirius Desktop, do not hesitate to contact us.

The Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler currently only supports a subset of Sirius diagrams and properties views. Tables, trees, and sequence diagrams are not supported at the moment.

For diagrams, the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler currently supports the main features of:

* nodes and containers;

* relation-based and element-based edges;

* border nodes;

* style customizations;

* creation tools, direct-edit tools, generic tools.

For properties view, the following widgets are supported:

* text fields and text areas;

* checkboxes;

* radio buttons;

* select/combos;

* lists (read-only).

To use an existing odesign modeler definition in the Obeo Cloud Platform Modeler:

1. Make sure the JAR which contains the modeler definition is in your application’s classpath. Typically this involves publishing the .design JAR in a Maven repository and adding its coordinates into your sample application’s POM file. Example in Sirius Web.

2. In your application, provide a Spring @Configuration which implements org.eclipse.sirius.web.compat.services.api.ISiriusConfiguration and tells the platform the path (inside the JAR) where the .odesign file is available. Example in Sirius Web

title: Default tools in contextual palette are no longer remembered
body:
In the contextual palette on a diagram, tools are organized by sections represented by openable "drawers".
It used to be that when the user opened the drawer and then selected, say, the 3rd tool inside, then that 3rd tool became the default one for that section when the palette opens (the others are still available by opening the drawer).

This is no longer the case, on `master`, and indeed when applying a creation tool on a diagram the frontend console shows this error message:

> react_devtools_backend.js:2430 Warning: No implementation found for action type 'setDefaultTool'

It looks like in https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/a6408c7bd8b82b72a5055ae784e4ed553ab44120#diff-808e980bed88253393ae0a9005bfd8e78277ac0f070fa51d258d46c4b55bc131L338, the `setDefaultToolAction` function that existed in the previous `machine.ts` was not ported into the new `DiagramWebSocketContainerMachine.ts` although an action by this name is referenced:
```js
SET_DEFAULT_TOOL: [
  {
    actions: 'setDefaultTool',
  },
],
```

title: Direct edit on diagrams is broken
body:
Since https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/1c9ade2d7226bac7ab66e593baf2b9a8195def70#diff-b0fb92edd302cb5295082fb7cc913a6d989ba62752e3506dcac977415deff787, label ids are proper `UUID`.

This makes the following test in `EditLabelEventHandler.handle(IEditingContext, IDiagramContext, IDiagramInput)` always `false`:
```java
if (input.getLabelId().endsWith(LABEL_SUFFIX)) {
```
and thus prevents direct edit tools to be excuted.

title: Remove `LabelDescription.idProvider` and `LabelDescription.LABEL_SUFFIX`
Increase the maximum size of projet names
body:
Currently we limit the name of a projet to 20 characters. I don't know what what the initial reasoning for this particular choice, but it seems arbitrary and quite small in practice. Somehting as simple "Basic Family - Studio" for example is already too long.

There may be impacts to consider on layout if we allowed for *really* long names, but moving to something more confortable like 64 characters seems reasonable and should not have that much impacts I think.

Something like `An awesome project name (with some additional comment)` for example takes 54 characters.

_64 characters should be enough for everyone_ :smiley:

title: Edge labels' position during move does not match the final location
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : master
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Linux

### Screenshots

![output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/114027677-eb3b6300-9877-11eb-9955-03ddb8e240ea.gif)

https://youtu.be/mT9zRdWCBfs

### Steps to reproduce

* On a diagram with an edge and a label, move one of the nodes attached to the edge.
* During the move, the edge itself moves correctly, and the label moves also.
* *However*,  at the end of the move, the edge's label position does not completely match the expected location. This is resolved automatically and one sees the label smoothly moving to its final location. This is not ideal, but worse is that during the animation the diagram is unresponsive. The animation is _relatively_ fast, and it's not that visible on the above video, but in practice it is rather annoying and breaks the flow.

title: Incorrect routing for edges with the same source and target node
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : master
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Linux

### Screenshots

![2021-04-08_11-39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/114027915-2e95d180-9878-11eb-8d03-b779b0119d36.png)

![output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/114027951-39506680-9878-11eb-8d56-7b1c028c691a.gif)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new diagram on which there is an edge "to self", i.e. with the same node as both source and target.
2. The initial, automatic, layout is correct (see the first part of the video above).
3. Start moving any element on the diagram.

### Expected behavior

The routing of the edge and placement of its label should stay consistent.
In the example on the video, the edge and its label should keep exactly the same layout/routing and simply move along the node.

### Actual behavior

- The edge's routing is broken. It seems that at least one bendpoint is added, the the source/target anchors do not stay on the same side.
- The edge's label is completely off.

title: Add support for editing multi-valued references in the properties view
body: We could probably use something like https://material-ui.com/components/selects/#multiple-select

title: Improve the Domain DSL
body: The current version of the domain DSL is very minimalistic. This was on purpose to get the first iteration of dynamic studio definition working, but now that this is (mostly) done, we can enrich it a little bit, in particular to support optional and many-valued attributes & references.

title: Reduce the cardinality of EdgeDescription's source and target mappings
body:
Our current properties view does not support the edition of multi-valued features, so as they are defined at the moment these properties of an `EdgeDescription` can not be edited by the studio maker.
Supporting multiple possible source & target is not strictly essential, and can always be added later when issue #428 is fixed.
For now we will just allow for a single source and taget node type.

title: NA
body: Sirius Web supports concurrent edition from multiple clients (web browsers), but they are all treated as the same user by the backend. Handling multiple separate users with fine grained access management is part of OCP commercial offering which is based on Sirius Web : https://www.obeosoft.com/en/products/obeo-cloud-platform

title: The `self` variable is not available to VSM-based edge creation tools
body:
In Sirius Desktop, edge creation tools defined inside a VSM can expect to get the `self` variable available, pointing to the semantic element at the source of the edge. See https://github.com/pcdavid/org.eclipse.sirius/blob/master/plugins/org.eclipse.sirius.diagram/src-core/org/eclipse/sirius/diagram/tools/internal/command/builders/EdgeCreationCommandBuilder.java#L203

In Sirius Web, we only have two (more explicit) variables, `semanticEdgeSource` and `semanticEdgeTarget`, but we already provide compatibility aliases for `source` and `target` (Sirius Desktop names) for these.

For these tools se should also expose `self` as another alias to `semanticEdgeSource`.

title: Unable to create relations using the domain modeler since a7f29b39
body: Commit a7f29b39  _[221] Tweaks the EMF metamodel definition_ changed the name and cardinality of of the `Relation.targetType(s)` reference, but did not update the corresponding VSM, so since then it has been impossible to create relations directly from the graphical modeler.

For now this is just for a "PoC", so a simple solution based on a hard-coded selection of shapes will be enough.
We will see later to make the node styles more configurable.

title: NA
body:
Hi, this is a known limitation.
At the moment we have no plan to support Acceleo 3 expressions.
Of course that can change in the future, but this is not on our roadmap at the moment as in general [AQL](https://www.eclipse.org/acceleo/documentation/aql.html) is better suited for this kind of usage.

title: Manipulating model-instances after creation
body:
Hi, first I would like to thank you for this amazing project. I think this has so much potential.

I really experimented a lot with this the past days and I am curious if there is the possibility to change the Model-Instances (EObjects) programatically. I've already seen that new EObjects are created in StereotypeDescriptionRegistryConfigurer and I can manipulate them there, which has the desired effect. But then they get wrapped in a JSON Resource and dissappear in the depths of sirius-components ;-)
Is there a way to retrieve them again that I am not aware of? Where should I start if i would try to implement such an api?

Thank you and have a great week.

title: NA
body:
Hi, thanks for your interest!

The behavior of a concrete Sirius-based modeler (be it Sirius Desktop or Sirius Web) is defined by a _representation description_ which is interpreted at runtime. These contain (among other things) _tool definitions_ which define what modification(s) to perform on the model when the end-user triggers the tool. Most tools have a very simple beahvior (e.g. change the value of an attribute, create a new `EObject`, etc.) but they can actually perform (almost) arbritrary manipulations on the model.

If your modeler is defined using a Sirius Desktop `odesign` file, please refer to [the documentation](https://www.eclipse.org/sirius/doc/specifier/Sirius%20Specifier%20Manual.html) on how to define the behavior of your tools (but note that Sirius Web does not currently support all features of Sirius Desktop modeler definitions.

If your modeler is defined directly using the Sirius Web APIs (i.e. you provide a `org.eclipse.sirius.web.diagrams.description.DiagramDescription` instance that you built programmatically), at some point you need to provide a `org.eclipse.sirius.web.diagrams.tools.CreateNodeTool` which has a handler of type `Function<VariableManager, Status>`. The Java function you provide here will get (through the `VariableManager`) information about the element (`EObject`) on which the user invoked your tool, and from there you can use classical Java/EMF APIs to perform the model manipulations you want.

Note that for diagrams we currently only support _CreateNodeTool_ and _CreateEdgeTool_, but the core does not really care what they do, and a _CreateNodeTool_ can actually do something else than creating a new node.

title: NA
body:
Thanks for your reply. 
Right now I am using an .odesign file to define my representation. The problem i have with tools is that they are always triggered by end-user as you have written. I want them to be triggered from an external event or something similar. 
To give an example with the flow model: I do not want to insert the temperature of the system manually but from an external source (e.g. the "real" System). 
I will have a closer look at the sirius web api to see if I can use it for that. Anyways thanks for your reply again, that already helped a lot!

title: NA
body:
I see.

Then the approach would be to extend our GraphQL API with custom mutations that correspond to the external events, and then invoke these mutations from the external system.
That's how the frontend asks the backend to perform operations, and the mechanism is extensible.

Have a look at the existing mutations like for example `org.eclipse.sirius.web.graphql.datafetchers.mutation.MutationCreateChildDataFetcher`. Adding a new one can be a little cumbersome but not complicated (at least if you are already familiar with GraphQL).

Basically you need:
* an input type which represents the parameters of the mutation (e.g. `org.eclipse.sirius.web.services.api.objects.CreateChildInput`)
* a data fetcher that GraphQL will invoke (with the input as argument) when it receives the mutation request (e.g. `org.eclipse.sirius.web.graphql.datafetchers.mutation.MutationCreateChildDataFetcher`
* make sure the mutation and new types you add are correctly registered in the GraphQL Schema
* in your data fetcher implementation, follow the pattern used by `MutationCreateChildDataFetcher` for example to dispatch the request to the `editingContextEventProcessorRegistry`, which itself will dispatch it to the `IEditingContextEventProcessor` that handles the target project (each project has a single event processor to manage it)
* create an actual event handler following the model of `org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.collaborative.handlers.CreateChildEventHandler`; it will get invoked in the proper context where you can have access to the actual model instances.

title: NA
body: Thank you. I tried it and it seems like this is going to solve my problem (when I am a bit further into GraphQL. ;-) ).

title: When editing a label on a diagram, clicking elsewhere on the diagram should abort the edition
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a diagram
2. Select an element which supports direct edition
3. Initiate direct edit (by any method, for exemple _F2_)
4. Start typing a new name but do not validate
5. Click somwhere else on the diagram (using either mouse buttons)

Expected (by me at least): the edition is aborted and the label "reverted" to its original value

Actual: the edition is validated as if I had hit "Return"

Whether this is indeed a bug is debatable. My own expectations was that the click would abort the edition, but maybe the current behavior is what we want. In that case it should be an explicit decision and propably documented (and this issue closed as invalid).

title: NA
body: Actually, I just checked the behavior on other web-based tools, e.g. Miro and diagrams.net, and clicking indeed _validates_ the current edition. So it seems my expectations were "wrong".

title: Various issues with resizing the workbench's panel
Ask for confirmation before all destructive operations
body:
### Problem

Some operations like deleting a representation or an element (and all its descendants) from the explorer are destructive, but currently they do not ask for confirmation before.
Deleting a whole document _does_ ask for confirmation, but there is no particular reason to treat documents differently from e.g. the root elements inside of them (deleting _them_ is as impacting as deleting the document).


### Solution

Make the confirmation dialog available on all concepts of the explorer (objects, representations, etc)

### Rabbit holes

### No-gos

* A large set of validation rules for specific DSLs
* Dynamic contributions of additional validation rules.

### Test

* [ ] Automated developer tests merged and pass (with reasonable code coverage)
* [ ] Automated End-to-End tests  merged and pass (Cypress)
* [ ] Feature/bug fix manually tested/validated by at least one person not involved in the implementation
* [ ] Collaborative tests passed by hand
* [ ] Exploratory test passed by MEB
* [ ] Business acceptance test passed by MEB

### Doc
* [ ] Internal Doc updated
* [ ] External Doc updated
* [ ] Validation Doc updated

### UX/UI
* [ ] Zeroheight updated
* [ ] Storybook updated

### Next
* [ ] Any left-over tasks added to the issues on Github

title: AQL expressions that include calls relating to the referenced metamodels fail to execute
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
> Apache Maven 3.8.1 (05c21c65bdfed0f71a2f2ada8b84da59348c4c5d)
Maven home: /usr/local/Cellar/maven/3.8.1/libexec
Java version: 11.0.10, vendor: AdoptOpenJDK, runtime: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/adoptopenjdk-11.jdk/Contents/Home
Default locale: en_GB, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.15.7", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"

### Screenshots

![Screenshot 2021-06-03 at 21 40 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64734/120702521-7883e800-c4b4-11eb-8639-e2fd925ede33.png)


![S38333EETT A](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64734/117003542-4466ad00-ace5-11eb-97d2-edde84e1285d.jpg)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Add to `SampleSiriusConfiguration` from https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web a Sirius model configuration for [ToolChainModel.odesign](https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.designer/blob/master/org.eclipse.lyo.tools.toolchain.design/description/ToolChainModel.odesign). It will reference [vocabulary.ecore](https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.designer/blob/master/org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.adaptormodel/model/vocabulary.ecore).
2. Add a bean method for providing an `AdaptorFactory` to be an instance of `VocabularyItemProviderAdapterFactory` ([package](https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.designer/tree/master/org.eclipse.lyo.tools.vocabulary.model/src/vocabulary)).
3. Add a bean method for providing an `EPackage` to return `VocabularyPackage.eINSTANCE`.
4. Add a bean method to supply for LabelFeature and Editable switches.
5. Add a stereotype description to `StereotypeDescriptionRegistryConfigurer`.
6. Launch the sample web application.

### Expected behavior

When I try to add a new element to a model, the initial AQL expression for the element is evaluated correctly.

1. I add a new element to the model.
2. The element creation includes some actions that need to be evaluated using AQL. For example, setting the element name with `aql:'Class ' + container.classes->size()`.
3. The element name should evaluate to `"Class 3"` if there are already 2 elements in the model.

### Actual behavior

The element name is always evaluated to `"Class "`, the AQL is evaluated incorrectly. AQL expression that do not rely on the `vocabulary.ecore` ECore model seem to run fine.

---

We have investigated the AQLInterpreter and found that it rejects our Vocabulary EPackage as invalid. 
We tried two possible fixes:

1. Replace the workspace reference to the .ecore from the .odesign to a URI reference just like in the Flow model.
2. Replace the implementation config in the genmodel from `MinimalEObjectImpl` to the default one.

Neither change seems to help (nor both together).

Thank you in advance!

title: NA
body: @pcdavid, I apologise for not stating the problem clearly the first time. I updated the description. Could you please take another look at it?

title: NA
body:
Hi.

From what I see in the screenshot the first solution you mention (referencing the metamodel's nsURI from the odesign instead of a workspace path (which only makes sense in an Eclipse context) should work.
Maybe there is something specific in how you set up your projects and their dependencies. We never had this specific issue, but maybe by chance. Hopefully we will find the issue later today during the SiriusCon Clinic.

Note that the implementation class (`MinimalEObjectImpl` or other) should not have any impact here. This only applies to the actual instances of your metamodel, not to the `EPackage(Impl)` itself which is at issue here.

title: NA
body: Thank you for your help today, @pcdavid! We can close this issue, the resolution is to: 1. Use a URI to reference an Ecore model instead of a workplace reference. 2. Make sure the URI reference terminates with the characters `#/` (no changes are necessary to the Ecore model Ns URI) Also, as you have indicated, the right place to verify the fix was correct is after `resource.load()` in the [`ODesignReader`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/v0.2.19/backend/sirius-web-compatibility/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/compat/services/representations/ODesignReader.java#L96) (the metamodel shall contain real instances of the EPackages and not EMF proxies): cc @jadelkhoury

title: NA
body:
Great news!
Thanks for confirming this was indeed the issue.

title: Edge creation breaks when vertical scroll bars appears in the properties side panel
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : `0.2.18`
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Linux 64bit

### Description
Using my own custom model, symbol connection breaks when vertical scroll bars appears in the properties side panel.

The connection issue usually appears if the browser window height is less than the height of the right side panel (causing vertical scroll bars to appear).

As the properties side panel for a symbol gets longer as more symbols are connected to, there (eventually) comes a point that connections stop working regardless of the browser size.

The issue appears on small screen, 13' or when simply using a smaller window. 

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59728838/117926896-cd609280-b33c-11eb-9398-f6649a5fe6d1.png)

### Steps to reproduce
 1. Create many symbols, say 25
2. Start connecting them to single symbol, the properties side panel this symbol gets longer as more symbols are connected to
3. eventually, a scroll bar will appear right hand side of the screen

If you can't reproduce the error, try moving the diagram, or set Chrome zoom to 200%, to force the scroll bar.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59728838/118132213-cae86080-b442-11eb-9dde-3fcf6fdb1691.png)


### Expected behavior

Symbols are connected 

### Actual behavior

error: `InvokeEdgeToolOnDiagramInput`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59728838/117926896-cd609280-b33c-11eb-9398-f6649a5fe6d1.png)

### Workaround

Scale the user desktop to fit everything. Entering full screen mode within chrome might help.

Symbol = node

title: How to deploy sirius-web into Tomcat?
body:
Hi!

I would like to deploy sirius-web into Apache Tomcat. Is there a guidance that I can follow? Could you help me about it?

Thanks.

title: NA
body:
Hi.

Sirius Web already uses Tomcat as its servlet enging, but indirectly via Spring Boot which does the heavy lifting for us.

I'm not familiar enough with Tomcat to help you directly, but it seems there are ways to deploy a Spring Boot app into Tomcat, see for example https://www.baeldung.com/spring-boot-war-tomcat-deploy
We use Spring Boot in a very "classical" way, so any general documentation on how to deploy Spring Boot apps into Tomcat should apply.

title: Add initial support for conditional styles in the View DSL
body: We will follow the same approach as Sirius Desktop for this inital version. There's probably a better/more generic way to support this and other related features, but that will come later.

title: Add support for tool definitions in the View DSL
body:
At the moment, modelers defined using the View DSL get some automatic behavior through "canonical tools" which are automatically created by looking at the node and edge definitions. These are based on simple heuristics and may not work for all domains, and even if they do the studio maker needs to be able to provide his own tools with custom behavior.

The studio maker should be able to specify different kinds of tools in the same way he define diagram elements.

We will support the following kinds of tools:
* **node tools**: associated to a _node description_ element, accessible in the contextual palette of the node instances and triggered by a single click. The actual tool's behavior can be to _create_ a new (child) node, but this is not required.
* **edge tools**: associated to an _edge description_ element, accessible in the contextual palette of the node instances of the edge's source type, and requiring the selection of a target node (instance of the edge description's target type). Again, the actual behavior may be to create an edge between the two elements but that is nor required.
* **delete tool**: can be associated to a node or edge description, invoked on delete (via the keyboard of the "Delete" action in the contextual palette)
* **direct edit tool**: can be associated to a node or edge description, invoked on direct edit (via the keyboard of the "Edit" action in the contextual palette)

The actual behavior of a tool is defined in its _body_ which is made of a sequence/tree of _operations_ (as in a Sirius Desktop VSM). We will only support a limited set of operations at first, and improve that later.

title: Improve the Domain modeler
body:
The current Domain modeler is a first great step but it misses some features:

* _Direct Edit_: to be able to change label directly from the diagram
* _Advanced Direct Edit_: if I type "myAttribute:String", it will set the type of the attribute to string, we could be inspired by EcoreTools here. It provides many shorctuts to make the life easier, especially regarding references and attributes. Typing "1" will make the reference or the attribute mandatory. Typing "*" will make it a "many". Just typing a name will only change the name, but typing ": someTypeName" will set the type.
* _Set Attributes Types_: Today all the attributes are String because of an `error with the expression 'aql:domain::Type::STRING': Invalid enum literal`
* _Improve the Design_: we could do netter than this yellow :), icons are low quality, some are missing the default ecore one is used
* _Make visible the different attributes on the diagram_: optional, many, abstract class...
* _Show Super Types_
* Need a tool in the palette to create Super types

title: Make it possible to create a diagram with automatic or manual layout
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The layout mode of a diagram should be determined by its diagram description.

title: Add support for rounded corners on rectangles and lists
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Sirius Desktop supports `RoundedCornerStyleDescription` with separate `arcWidth` and `arcHeight` attributes for various of its styles.

We will support a single `borderRadius` property at first. In the compatibility layer, if both `arcWidth` and `arcHeight` are set we will take the highest value.

### Cuttings backs

Ideally we would support the whole [CSS `border-radius`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-radius) features, to allow for different radius on each of the 4 corners. This is not directly supported by SVG's `<rect/>` element but it could certainly be implemented by combining/overlaying mutiple `rect` with different radius settings.

### Potential side effects

Edges which are connected to a rectangle or list container use the container's rectangular bounding box to compute their anchors, so with rounded corners the anchors can possibly looking disconnected. But this problem is already present with images for example.

title: Upgrade to Spring Boot 2.5.1
body:
See the release notes at:

title: The browser window/tab's title should include the current project's name
body: When you have multiple Sirius Web projects opened in different browser tabs or windows, the tabs are all named "Sirius Web". When we are in the project edition view we should update the window title to include the current project's name: `${projectName} - Sirius Web`.

title: NA
body: I have a quick'n'dirty patch which seems to do the trick without needed to bring a heavyweight dependency like https://github.com/nfl/react-helmet. I'll try to clean it a little and propose it here, at least to start the discussion and see if we need more.

title: Add support for providing Java services to dynamic modelers
body:
This is a followup on #501, which add support for custom tool definitions for modelers defined directly in the browser.
In these tools we want to be able to invoke Java services to perform more complex computations, invoke web-based APIs, etc.
This requires having the corresponding Java code deployed in the backend  (and thus a rebuild/redeploy), and for the moment that's fine, but we need a mechanism to _bind_ such Java service classes to a particular Diagram definition.

In the Sirius Desktop compatibility layer, we rely on the `JavaExtension` element in the VSM to find the Java services classs needed and provide them to the AQL interpreter (see `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.compatibility.AQLInterpreterFactory.getJavaServices(Viewpoint)`.

For now we will follow the same pattern, and have an element in the View DSL equivalent to the `JavaExtension` element in Sirius Desktop.

body: Update the current look to feel cleaner and more "modern".

title: Creating many children in a mono-valued feature throws an error
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Creates a view model, a diagram description, and a node description
2. Creates a first node style under the node description
3. Tries to create a second node style under the  same node description

### Expected behavior

The modal used to create the node description child should still be displayed, and the Material-UI Snackbar should appear with an error message.

### Actual behavior

A raw error is thrown.

title: NA
body: Under the hood, the EditService#createChild returns a dangling element, and thus, the CreateChildEventHandler returns a CreateChildSuccessPayload instead of an ErrorPayload.

1. Display the palette on the background of the Typography diagram

title: All edges's routing is reset to a single segment when the layout is modified manually
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : latest (0.2.30)
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Linux

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new "Topography" diagram (for example).
2. In the initial state, all edges are properly routed in a rectilinear style to avoid crossing nodes.
3. Move some element on the diagram (any one).

### Expected behavior

None of the edges which are not connected to the moved element should be impacted.
Ideally, even the edges connected to the moved element should be re-routed correctly after the move, but for now it would be OK if these (and only these) were reset.

### Actual behavior

*All* the edges on the diagram are reset to be single segment straight from their source to their target node, and can cross over other elements.

title: The moving element may not be the selected one
body:
### Screenshots

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7371042/122062414-adb30300-cdef-11eb-9989-b418d2dd4ef8.mp4

### Steps to reproduce

In manual layout:

1. Move an element to make incremental layout does some adjustment.
2. While elements are still moving, select another element and try to move it.
3. If you were fast enough, the moving element is the previously selected element, not the current one.

### Expected behavior

The current selection should move.

### Actual behavior

The previously selected element is moving instead of the currently selected element.

title: NA
body:
When an element (a not selected one) is moved, no selection event is raised. May be the problem comes from here.
Another consequence of that is the Properties view is not updated, even though the moved element seems selected on screen.

title: NA
body:
When an element is moved, the `handleMoveAction` in `WebSocketDiagramServer.tsx` is only called after a mouseUp event.


method | -- | file
-- | -- | --
handleMoveAction | @ | WebSocketDiagramServer.tsx:215
handle | @ | WebSocketDiagramServer.tsx:140
ActionDispatcher.handleAction | @ | action-dispatcher.ts:132
anonymous) | @ | action-dispatcher.ts:76
Promise.then (async) |   |  
ActionDispatcher.dispatch | @ | action-dispatcher.ts:72
actionDispatcher.dispatch | @ | DependencyInjection.ts:289
MouseTool.handleEvent | @ | mouse-tool.ts:72
MouseTool.mouseUp | @ | mouse-tool.ts:115
...

When the previously selected element is moving instead of the currently selected element, the element id in `handleMoveAction` is the one of the previously selected element.

The problem must comes from sprotty itself.

body: This concerned the old Sprotty-based diagram frontend. Obsolete.

title: Add support for a validation view
body:
### Problem

We need to help end users find out the mistake that they can introduce while editing models.

### Solution

First, the current views of the workbench would have a tab indicating their name (Explorer and Properties). The workbench would then be improved in order to support multiple views in the right area with the arrival of the Validation view. This new view would be used to display validation results using a representation.

A new representation would be contributed to the backend in order to compute the validation results. As an example, some basic validation rules for the `Domain` and `View` DSL will be contributed, such as:

* Detect domains without a name or uri
* Detect node descriptions without a proper domain type

### Rabbit holes

### No-gos

* A large set of validation rules for specific DSLs
* Dynamic contributions of additional validation rules.

### Test

* [ ] Automated developer tests merged and pass (with reasonable code coverage)
* [ ] Automated End-to-End tests  merged and pass (Cypress)
* [ ] Feature/bug fix manually tested/validated by at least one person not involved in the implementation
* [ ] Collaborative tests passed by hand
* [ ] Exploratory test passed by MEB
* [ ] Business acceptance test passed by MEB

### Doc
* [ ] Internal Doc updated
* [ ] External Doc updated
* [ ] Validation Doc updated

### UX/UI
* [ ] Zeroheight updated
* [ ] Storybook updated

### Next
* [ ] Any left-over tasks added to the issues on Github

title: Improve the default values of the domain and view
body:
### Problem

When we create new elements in the Domain or View DSL, most of the fields are empty. This helps creating invalid definitions.

### Solution

Populate some of the properties with relevant default values.

#### Domain DSL

- [ ] All elements should be created with an initial non-null name.

#### View DSL

- [ ] All attributes should be created with valid/non-empty values.
  - [ ] Styles currently have `rgb(0, 0, 0)` as both color and border color (which is used for text), meaning the default is an unreadble "black on black".
  - [ ] Conditions on conditional styles should be initialized with `aql:false`. Technically this does not change anything (an empty expression is treated as a false one), but it makes things more explicit.
- [ ] Object creation from the explorer delegates to EMF Edit's `collectNewChildDescriptors`, so be should customize this to automatically create required children elements. In particular both node and edge descriptions should be created with a default style already set.

### Rabbit holes

### No-gos

### Test

title: Add support for a selection dialog on diagram tools
body:
### Problem

We need to be able to open a dialog when a tool is used to select some elements before executing the behavior of the tool.

### Solution

Some information will be added to the relevant tools to indicate that prior to their "real" execution, they should start by displaying a dialog showing a "Selection" representation. This representation will be used to display a flat list of objects for the moment. The end user will be able to select some of those objects and validate the selection.

After that, the frontend will send the request to perform the execution of the tool to the backend along with the identifier of the selected objects. A small sample will be contributed with hard coded values for Flow as an example.

### Rabbit holes

### No-gos

* Tree based selection dialog
* Support of Sirius RCP selection wizard definitions (this will be done in another issue)

body:
In terms of expressivity (compared to Ecore):

* Add support for multiple inheritance (easy in the metamodel and conversion side, but depends on #428 to be usable in the properties view).
* Add support for "opposite references" (i.e. `eOpposite`).
* Add support for custom data types, i.e. user-defined enums and other types mapped to Java.
* Add support for extending/referencing other domains.

title: NA
body:
Additional features, more in the scope of "EMF Edit" but that could be useful to define directly as part of the Domain:

* Set a custom icon for entities/types (and make sure it is used when displaying instances).
* Maybe set an expression to compute the default label.
* Other EMF Edit features?

title: NA
body:
Not directly related to this, but from what I've seen it seems EMF JSON is not as resilient as EMF's XMI serialization when it comes to some "innocent" changes on the metamodel side. For exemple if I have serialized a model using v1 of a domain definition where some reference is single-valued (serialized as a direct object JSON) and then try to load the same document using an updated v2 of the metamodel where the reference is now multi-valued (serialized as an array of objects), EMF JSON crashes (deep in Gson) with a "not an array" message.

I'd have to test again to confirm, and see if there are other similar issues that could be fixed in EMF JSON directly to make the system more resilient to small changes like this.

title: NA
body:
It should not be possible to have a domain with an URI which can conflict with an nsURI from the "static" metamodel (in particular with EMF and the Sirius Desktop metamodels).

* At the very least, `DomainConverter` should refuse to convert/publish domains whose URI starts with `http`.
* Better: only consider domains whose URI starts with `domain://`
* Best: if the `domain://` prefix is mandatory, do not ask for it at all.

title: NA

The "CustomImages" table should probably include the image size and type (mime type), notable to allow filtering on "icons" vs "images" in the UI.
Maybe it should also have some notion of scope, i.e. an optional editingContextId reference, so that some images (with no editingContextId set) are globally available everywhere, and others would be only inside the same editingContext or, for "studio" editingContexts for contexts which contain instances of it.

body:
We may want to support some kind of "collection" / "library" mechanism to help organize images.
For example one could imagine an admin user to be allowed to upload an "icon pack" as a zip, and give a name to that collection (e.g. "Material Icons", "Pokemons", "UML", etc.), so that on the user side we can avoid proposing hundreds/thousands of unorganized images.

Even with such a concept, we will probably need a better UI than just a "Select" with textual names for users to choose an image.

title: Remove the type name from the object labels in the model explorer
body:
The model explorer displays all objects in the hard-coded format `${typeName} ${label}`.
In many cases, the information is relatively redundant given that we have different icons for different object types, but the most annoying thing is that this can produce very long labels which are not fully visible with the default explorer width.
Worse, the actually important part (the object's name/label) is the one which is most likely invisible or truncated.
Because the context menu icon is at the right of the tree items, it too is almost always inaccessible with the default explorer width.

The type information can be useful in some situations (although to be *really* useful it should be completed with the containment feature name), but it could be moved to a tooltip for example so that it is only visible when needed.

body: Now that the business dependencies have been removed from most of the projects, we can start removing useless parts.

title: Add support for multiple inheritance
body:
### Problem

* _As_ a studio maker,
* _when_ defining my custom business domain,
* _I want to_ define multiple super-types for an `Entity`,
* _so that_ I can share common definitions.

### Solution

The changes in the metamodel, converter (`DomainConverter`) and modeler (`domain.odesign`) are trivial, but to make the result usable we need support for displaying and editing multi-valued references in the properties view, see #428.

title: Reduce the dependencies provided by the sirius-web-spring-starter project
Add support for custom data types definition
body:
### Problem

* _As_ a studio maker,
* _when_ defining my custom business domain,
* _I want_ to be able to use custom data types beyond the basic hard-coded `number` / `string` / `boolean`
* _so that_ my domain definition can match the actual domain more closely (and not have to map *every* concept into numbers, strings and booleans).

### Solution

I see 3 kinds of "custom types" we may want to support:
* custom enumerated types (mapped to EMF's `EEnums`);
* new types "derived" from the hard-coded ones (`number` / `string`) but with additional constraints. For example a `Percentage` which derives from `number` with an additional constraint (that would be used by validation) to be between 0 and 100.
* completely custom types mapped into Java types existing on the backend (equivalent to EMF's `EDataType`). We do not want to allow for the studio maker to allow for any random Java class from the backend to be usable here, so we would need an explicit mechanism for the backend to expose types that can be used like this. For example we may want an `instant` type which maps into `java.time.Instant`, custom types to represent colors, etc.

The main challenge is how to model this at the EMF level as the "core" types are defined at the "meta" level but the custom ones are in the instance.

title: Add support for modeling bidirectional references
body:
### Problem

* _As_ a studio maker,
* _when_ defining my business domain,
* _I want to_ be able to indicate that two relations are opposite of each other,
* _so that_ I can navigate both ways in my model and be sure there are automatically maintained consistent for me.

### Solution

Follow the same approach as EMF itself.

title: Add support for referencing and extending other custom domains
body:
### Problem

* _As_ a studio maker,
* _when_ designing my custom business domain,
* _I want to_ be able to reuse (both reference and extend/subtype) elements from other domain definitions,
* _so that_ I can reuse/share/extend common concepts and not have to redefine them every time.

#### Solution

Without a better story about the lifecycle of domain definitions (versioning, publishing, access levels, how to handle transitive dependencies, etc.), I'm not sure it is a good idea to try and support this for now.

title: Add support for default values on attributes
body:
### Problem

* _As_ a studio maker,
* _when_ I define my custom domain,
* _I want to_ be able to set a default value for my entities's attributes,
* _so that_ instances are always created with valid/meaningfull values

### Solution

The easiest solution is to follow the same approach as EMF, with a `defaultValueLitteral` field on attributes definition, which will get parsed as an instance of the corresponding type. In case of parsing or typing error, we simply revert to the default value for the generic type (e.g. "0" for numbers, "false" for booleans, "" (empty string) for strings).

title: Add support for custom icons and labels for entities
body:
### Problem

* _As_ a studio maker,
* _when_ defining my custom business domain,
* _I want to_ be able to set a custom icon and label expression for my types,
* _so that_ their instances are displayed in a more meaningfull way to users.

At the moment, all instances of dynamically defined domains use a generic hard-coded icon, and get their label (in the explorer) computed using a generic heuristic (use the first string-typed attribute).

### Solution

This is related to #563 as we need a way to:
* contribute images the can be used as icons (maybe not by the studio maker himself, this could be an admin-level operation);
* select one of the available icons (ideally not from *all the images* available on the server, as many will not be adapted) to associate with a custom `Entity` in its properties page;
* associate the proper image with instances of the `Entity` at runtime. Currently `ObjectService.getImagePath(Object)` relies on an EMF `AdapterFactory` to provide an `IItemLabelProvider`, so either `DomainConverter` must be extended to also provide such an `AdapterFactory`, or we need a custom mechanism.

For the labels, `Entity` could have a computed `labelExpression`, but the way labels and direct edition is currently handled in the explorer would make it difficult to integrate it.

title: Add support for defining border nodes
body:
Currently `org.eclipse.sirius.web.view.NodeDescription` only supports sub-nodes as children, but the diagram engine itself supports the definition of border nodes.
It should be possible to define border nodes in the View DSL.

Note that in the explorer there is currently no way to distinguish children elements from different containment relationships, so if a container has one sub-node and one border node, it is impossible to know it by looking at the explorer (or anywhere else in the UI for that matter). See #597

title: The model explorer should distinguish children elements from distinct references
body: Currently if I have a container type (e.g. `NodeDescription`) with two or more containment references (say `subNodes : NodeDescription[*]` and `borderNodes : NodeDescription[*]` and an instance _N_ with children in both references, it is impossible to know if a child element displayed in the explorer is in one reference or the other.

title: Add support for node border size and edge width
body: The diagram engine supports these but currently it is not possible to configure them in a `NodeStyle` or `EdgeStyle`.

title: Add support for all text attributes supported in the engine
body: The core diagram engine supports the bold/italic/underline/strike-through attributes on labels (see `org.eclipse.sirius.web.diagrams.LabelStyle`), but it is not currently possible to configure these in the View DSL.

title: Add support for label color
body: Currently `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.view.StylesFactory` re-uses the style's `borderColor` for the color of the label, but it should be distinct attributes.

title: Switch to JUnit 5
The properties view can be in empty state while there is a selection
body:
It seems the properties view has a life cycle issue.
During the https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/554, experimentation has been made (and maybe merged) to add the properties view and the validation view in two different tabs next to each other.

The properties view content is lost when an element that has properties is selected, and the user switches from properties to validation view then switches back to properties view.
When the user switches from the properties view to the validation view, the properties view state machine is deleted and the subscription to the properties is closed. So, when the user switches back to the properties view a new state machine is created,  start at the 'empty' state, which not wanted.

The properties view's state machine should be improved to handle the case where an element is selected while the properties view is not displayed, to display the element properties once the properties view is displayed.
