title: New child creation does not take cardinality into account
body:
Assume I have a metamodel/domain with a type _A_ with a containment relation _child_ of type _B_ and of cardinality 0..1 or 1..1 (i.e. it is single valued).
If I have an instance of _A_ which already contains _child_ _b_, the "Create New Object" still proposes to create a new _B_ child.
Of could it will fail  at runtime, but this could (should) have been determined beforehand and not allowed at all.

![Capture d’écran de 2021-07-05 15-01-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/124475400-f6802b00-dda1-11eb-9c43-43b8d247aaa7.png)

title: NA
body: The root of the issue is that `EditingContextChildCreationDescriptionsDataFetcher.EditingContextChildCreationDescriptionsDataFetcher(IEditService)` is completely oblivious to the model on which the operation will be applied. It takes a class as argument, not an actual instance, so it can not test if the action makes sense for the particular object on which the user tries to apply it.

title: It should be possible to change the cardinality of a feature in a domain without losing existing data
body:
Sirius EMF JSON is as robust to small "metamodel" changes as it could be.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new project `studio`. The studio definition feature must of course be enabled.
2. Create a new domain with two entities `Root` and `Child`
3. Add a containment relation `Root.child : Child`. Keep it single-valued.
4. Create a new project, `instance`.
5. In it, create an instance of `Root` and a `Child` inside of it.
6. Close the `instance` project. You might need to wait a little bit (unless you customized `org.eclipse.sirius.web.editingContextEventProcessorRegistry.disposeDelay` to a low enough value).
7. In the `studio` project, make the `child` relation multi-valued.
8. Re-open the `instance`: it would be natural to still have the `Child` element inside `Root`, but it is gone.

The backend's log shows this error:
```
com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Not a JSON Array: {"id":"cbcb071a-0d7b-47b2-9486-7040c0cdf354","eClass":"sampledomain:Child"}
	at com.google.gson.Gson.fromJson(Gson.java:944)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.resource.JsonResourceImpl.doLoad(JsonResourceImpl.java:299)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load(ResourceImpl.java:1563)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.services.editingcontext.EditingContextSearchService.findById(EditingContextSearchService.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.collaborative.projects.EditingContextEventProcessorRegistry.getOrCreateEditingContextEventProcessor(EditingContextEventProcessorRegistry.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.graphql.datafetchers.subscriptions.SubscriptionTreeEventDataFetcher.get(SubscriptionTreeEventDataFetcher.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.graphql.datafetchers.subscriptions.SubscriptionTreeEventDataFetcher.get(SubscriptionTreeEventDataFetcher.java:1)
	at graphql.execution.instrumentation.dataloader.DataLoaderDispatcherInstrumentation.lambda$instrumentDataFetcher$0(DataLoaderDispatcherInstrumentation.java:86)
	at graphql.execution.ExecutionStrategy.fetchField(ExecutionStrategy.java:270)
	at graphql.execution.SubscriptionExecutionStrategy.createSourceEventStream(SubscriptionExecutionStrategy.java:91)
	at graphql.execution.SubscriptionExecutionStrategy.execute(SubscriptionExecutionStrategy.java:53)
	at graphql.execution.Execution.executeOperation(Execution.java:165)
	at graphql.execution.Execution.execute(Execution.java:104)
	at graphql.GraphQL.execute(GraphQL.java:557)
	at graphql.GraphQL.parseValidateAndExecute(GraphQL.java:482)
	at graphql.GraphQL.executeAsync(GraphQL.java:446)
	at graphql.GraphQL.execute(GraphQL.java:377)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.graphql.ws.handlers.StartMessageHandler.handle(StartMessageHandler.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.graphql.ws.GraphQLWebSocketHandler.handleTextMessage(GraphQLWebSocketHandler.java:260)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.handler.AbstractWebSocketHandler.handleMessage(AbstractWebSocketHandler.java:43)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.handler.WebSocketHandlerDecorator.handleMessage(WebSocketHandlerDecorator.java:75)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.handler.LoggingWebSocketHandlerDecorator.handleMessage(LoggingWebSocketHandlerDecorator.java:56)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.handler.ExceptionWebSocketHandlerDecorator.handleMessage(ExceptionWebSocketHandlerDecorator.java:58)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.adapter.standard.StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.handleTextMessage(StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.java:114)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.adapter.standard.StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.access$000(StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.java:43)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.adapter.standard.StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter$3.onMessage(StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.java:85)
	at org.springframework.web.socket.adapter.standard.StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter$3.onMessage(StandardWebSocketHandlerAdapter.java:82)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsFrameBase.sendMessageText(WsFrameBase.java:415)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.sendMessageText(WsFrameServer.java:129)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsFrameBase.processDataText(WsFrameBase.java:515)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsFrameBase.processData(WsFrameBase.java:301)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsFrameBase.processInputBuffer(WsFrameBase.java:133)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.onDataAvailable(WsFrameServer.java:85)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.doOnDataAvailable(WsFrameServer.java:183)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.notifyDataAvailable(WsFrameServer.java:162)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsHttpUpgradeHandler.upgradeDispatch(WsHttpUpgradeHandler.java:156)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.upgrade.UpgradeProcessorInternal.dispatch(UpgradeProcessorInternal.java:60)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:59)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:893)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1723)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Not a JSON Array: {"id":"cbcb071a-0d7b-47b2-9486-7040c0cdf354","eClass":"sampledomain:Child"}
	at com.google.gson.JsonElement.getAsJsonArray(JsonElement.java:107)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserializeMultipleContainmentEReference(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:731)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserializeEReference(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserializeData(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:428)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserializeEClassifier(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:404)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.loadObject(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserializeContent(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:270)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserialize(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:253)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.emfjson.utils.GsonEObjectDeserializer.deserialize(GsonEObjectDeserializer.java:1)
	at com.google.gson.internal.bind.TreeTypeAdapter.read(TreeTypeAdapter.java:69)
	at com.google.gson.Gson.fromJson(Gson.java:932)
	... 44 more
```

### Analysis

When loading the previously saved document, Sirius EMF JSON sees that the `child` feature in the current definition of the metamodel is multi-valued, so it expects to read the values in a JSON array. But at the time the document was saved the feature was single-valued so it was serialized as a JSON object.

### Expected Behavior

* When reading a multi-valued feature, Sirius EMF JSON should accept (maybe only if a particular option is set) single values.
* Conversely, when reading a single-valued feature, Sirius EMF JSON should accept multiple values (arrays), and only consider the first one (or consider the feature not to be set if the array is empty).

title: NA
body:
A first patch has been merged which makes EMF JSON's attributes handling more flexible, but before this issue can be closed I think we should:
- [x] add the same kind of support to references handling.
- [ ] make the new behavior opt-out via an option. It really changes the behavior and in some cases can lead to data loss (when loading previously multi-valued feature with a metamodel where they are now single-valued), and in some use cases clients might prefer a clear error/crash than a silent loss of data.
- [ ] bump the Sirius EMF JSON version, build/release it, and consume the new version in Sirius Components
- [ ] add some tests, at least in Sirius Components to validate the scenario described above

title: The order of the models in the explorer is not stable
body:
The order in which top-level models/documents are displayed in the explorer is not stable.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new project.
2. Create two models M1 and M2 in it. They will (usually) be displayed in this order, M1 before M2.
3. Go back to the projects browser.
4. Re-open the project: sometimes M1 is still before M2, sometimes it's the other way around.

This is a relatively small issue, but quite confusing/annoying in practice.

Either the documents should have an intrinsic order inside the projects (the order of creation would be the most meaningful from and end-user point of view, but that requires schema changes; maybe ordering by their id could do at first), or there is no intrinsic order but the presentation layer orders them in a consistent way (probably by name, even though this means the order will change if the models are renamed).

title: Edge partially overlap their target elements
body:
When an edge has a arrow decorator, the arrow is drawn partially _inside_ the target node/container:

![2021-07-06_14-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/124598526-03198780-de65-11eb-9666-bd1b40526e24.png)

Even when there is no decorator, the alignment is not perfect:

title: Use a Select widget for enumerated properties
body:
We currently use a group of radio buttons to display/edit attributes which have a `enum` type.
This works but has two issues:
1. if the enum in question has a lots of possible values and/or values with long names, the resulting UI takes a lot of vertical space  in the properties view and feels very crowded:
![2021-07-08_14-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/124921779-0ba2c700-dff9-11eb-8b18-7b53cbfba670.png)

2. if the corresponding attribute is optional, once a value has been set once, with a radio group it is impossible to unset it.

Moving to a `Select` (combo) widget would solve both issues:
1. it is more compact in terms of UI space used
2. it allows for a _None_ value to be added in the possible choices if and only if the underlying attribute is optional. (Yes, technically we could also add a _none_ choice to the radio group, but this means even more space taken, and IMO feels less clear when such a button would be selected).

![2021-07-08_14-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/124922278-a26f8380-dff9-11eb-8a64-4b6e27d49f91.png)

title: Use a combo instead of a text field to select ony valid domain types
body:
Currently when configuring a View definition, one has to type the name of the domain type in plain text field.
It is cumbersome and rather error prone.
The recently added validation rule improve things a bit but it is still far from ideal.
It would be better if we proposed users a list of valid domain types via a combo: it's more discoverable and less error prone.

title: NA
body:
There are a few issues to consider which makes this less than trivial:

First, there is a good reason for features like `org.eclipse.sirius.web.view.DiagramElementDescription.getDomainType()` to be plain strings and not single-valued references to `domain::Entity` elements (which would automatically produce the kind of UI we're lookong for here). If we did this, deleting an Entity which is referenced by a View definition in another project (and thus not saved together) would create dangling/proxy elements in the underlying EMF model (at best) or make them unloadable at all (and thus unfixable) at worst. In Sirius Desktop's VSMs, the choice to keep the "domain class" attributes plain string was made explicitly to reduce the coupling between the semantic metamodel and the VSMs. It has drawbacks (partial breakage of a VSM can happen silently), but with some validation on top the trade off has been rather successful.

Using strings instead of references would also in theory allow for "special values" and/or a mini-language to be more specific. For example, currently when we set the domain type to `SomeType`, all instances of that type _and any subtype_ will match. We could provide a special syntax to expression "exactly this type and not a subtype of it" (for example `=SomeType`). Or allow for multiple domain types (which could certainly also be done with multi-valued references), e.g. `TypeA | =TypeB`. I'm not saying these are good ideas :smile:, just that keeping this a string keeps thhings very flexible.

So assuming we keep these attributes as plain strings but want to present them via Select widgets:

* We need to provide whole custom details pages for the `DiagramDescription`, `NodeDescription` and `EdgeDescrition` types. As soon as we want to customize *one* of the widgets normally produced by the detault rules, we currently need to override and re-implement the whole page. See `ViewPropertiesConfigurer` which already does this for the Select widget for images.
* Finding all the valid candidate Entity types is relatively trivial, at least if we reduce the scope to domains defined inside the current editing context. Otherwise there can be several issues:
    * a potentiel performance issue if we need to scan all the domain definitions in all projects in the database to fill the combo;
    * a scoping issue: currently there is no way (at the moment) to prefix/scope domain types, so it's impossible to distinguish between types defined in different domains with the same name.
    * a UI issue: do we really want the studio maker working on his DSL to see possibly dozens of completely unrelated choices coming from domain definitions in other projects?
* Finally how to handle the lifecycle of the widget when the "referenced" (by name) entity has been removed of renamed. In this case the "current" value of the attribute does not correspond to any of the currently valid choices. The current value _must_ be among the possible choices for the Select widget to work, but we would like to make it clear that it is not valid. Would a simple suffix (e.g. "(invalid)") on the label and the accompanying validation rule be enough?

title: NA
body: Maybe https://material-ui.com/components/autocomplete/ with the proper configuration (`includeInputInList`) would better fit the requirements that a plain `Select`.

title: Default value for optional feature of "Domain.Attribute" and "Domain.Feature" should be `true`
body:
If we look in "domain.ecore" the default value of the eclass _Feature_ feature _Optional_ is `false`. That implies both _Feature_ subclasses, _Relation_ and _Attribute_, have the same default value for their feature _Optional_.
It has been decided the default value for the feature _Optional_ of _Relation_ has to be `true`, which is something Ecore is not able to do with ease. To do so, _DomainFactoryImpl_ has been modified.

It has created an inconsistency between both _Relation_ and _Attribute_ _Optional_ feature, which is not handled by emfjson, use to serialize and deserialize our emf model in/from json.

To summarize, we are not able to make a _Relation_ optional.

### Steps to reproduce

1. In a project, creates a new Domain with an Entity and a Relation
2. Unchecks the optional checkbox
3. In another project, creates an instance of the domain with an entity instance
4. Goes back back to the domain project
5. Displays Relation details

### Expected behavior

The Relation is still optional (the "optional" checkbox is unchecked)

### Actual behavior

The Relation is not optional anymore (the "optional" checkbox is checked)

title: Representation state is not restored on project upload
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : 0.3.9
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Cloud

### Steps to reproduce

1. Export an existing project with diagrams with incremental layout
2. Delete the project
3. Upload the project : for diagrams with manual layout, their layout should correspond to the manual layout at the time of export. But it is not the case, the manual layout is lost.

### Expected behavior

For diagrams with manual layout, their layout should correspond to the manual layout at the time of export.

### Actual behavior

For diagrams with manual layout, their layout don't correspond to the manual layout at the time of export.

title: NA
body:
This is because `org.eclipse.sirius.web.services.projects.ProjectImporter.createRepresentations(UUID)` completely ignores the actual content of the representations that have been exported in the archive. It uses only their metadata to build a `CreateRepresentationInput` and re-create an "equivalent" (same target, same description, same label) representation. Of course the new representation is created in its "default/initial" state and any existing customization is lost:
* For synchronized diagrams with manual layout, this means the manual layout is lost, as mentioned above.
* For diagrams with unsynchronized mappings, none of the explicitly created views will be visible. In the extreme case, the new diagram will be blank.

title: NA
body: This issue will become blocking for customers who only work with unsynchronized diagrams. For example, if the diagram is unsynchronized and it is filled with many node (such an activity diagram), the upload project functionality is not interesting. The solve this inconvenient, user should Drag&Drop semantically (if he implements actions) all its element and it takes very long time.

title: NA
body:
`ProjectImporter.createRepresentations()` is representation-agnostic, i.e. it must work for all kinds of representation. I think that's why its current implementation is to only take the representation's metadata, wrap them in a `CreateRepresentationInput` and send that to `editingContextEventProcessor::handle`.

Note that this means that this issue seen here on diagrams is also very probably present in all other representation kinds which have an actual state: Portal, Gantt and Decks...

I think we would need either an `Optional<IRepresentation> stateToRestore` additional parameter to `CreateRepresentationInput` (and then use that in `CreateDiagramEventHandler` & co.) or a clearly disinct `ImportRepresentationInput` (or `CloneRepresentationInput` or whatever) and implementations for *all* representations we support.

title: Switch to a schema first approach for our GraphQL schema
body:
### Problem

There are two main solutions to build a GraphQL schema, using a code first approach in which the schema is an artifact derived from the source code, which is the approach that we have embraced until now and the schema first approach in which the schema is the main source of truth and the code is derived (manually or automatically) from this schema.

Both approaches have various advantages and drawbacks, one of the main advantages of the code first approach is to have the code perfectly synchronized with the schema but it is harder to reason about the schema and communicate with others about changes on the schema.

At scale, multiple companies have embraced a schema first approach to have a better medium to synchronize multiple teams. Such change will also enable us to use other GraphQL frameworks instead of our own custom framework which made sense when we first started but which make less sense today with new solutions such as Netflix DGS.

### Solution

We will provide a text based version of the core part of our GraphQL schema used by Sirius Components. This schema will contain at least the following concepts:

- EditingContext
- Diagram related concepts (data structure, mutations, subscriptions)
- Form and Properties related concepts (data structure, mutations, subscriptions)
- Tree and Explorer related concepts (data structure, mutations, subscriptions)
- Validation related concepts (data structure, subscription)
- Selection related concepts (data structure, subscription)

All the concepts used by the frontend parts of the workbench should be available.

### Cutting backs

### Rabbit holes

### No-gos


### Test
* [ ] Automated developer tests merged and pass (with reasonable code coverage)
* [ ] Automated End-to-End tests  merged and pass (Cypress)
* [ ] Feature/bug fix manually tested/validated by at least one person not involved in the implementation
* [ ] Collaborative tests passed by hand
* [ ] Exploratory test passed by MEB
* [ ] Business acceptance test passed by MEB

### Doc
* [ ] Internal Doc updated
* [ ] External Doc updated
* [ ] Validation Doc updated

### UX/UI
* [ ] Zeroheight updated
* [ ] Storybook updated

### Next
* [ ] Any left-over tasks in the Github issues

title: Replace Status with IPayload as the return value of a tool
body:
### Problem

The `Status` returned while executing some functions is not very useful. It would be better to be able to return a proper payload.

### Solution

We will replace progressively our usage of `org.eclipse.sirius.web.representations.Status` by instances of `IPayload` in order to be able to return an ErrorPayload for invalid operations with appropriate messages.

We will move slowly on this topic because, while it seems straightforward, it will open a powerful API to a lot of code which will have to use it in a very limited scope. It will make possible some things which are not possible today but may also prevent us from doing things that we are actually doing today.

We may change our mind on this topic while trying to change the actual code so we won't start by removing `Status` and trying to fix all compilation issues but instead we will try to replace it progressively in the diagram part with all its functions (editLabelHandler, tools handlers, etc).

### Cutting backs

### Rabbit holes

### No-gos

title: Add the ability to contribute additional views to the left/right sites
body:
### Problem

Some projects want to add new views to the left and right sites of the workbench.

### Solution

We will add the ability to contribute new views to those sites. The views will be statically contributed at build time only. We will not try to perform any magical layout on those sites anymore (LeftSite only for now) since the combinatorial explosion will be massive.

Contributors will should only be able to provide the view with its name and content. A common TypeScript interface will be required in order to provide the same capabilities to all those views.

This issue should start with the contribution of an ADR and no development should start before the approval of said ADR.

title: Switch IEditingContext#id and IRepresentation#id from UUID to String
body:
### Problem

Projects integrating Sirius Components can face difficulties with our constraint for UUID identifier which lack some contextual information for some use cases. There are two ways to solve this issue:

- We could provide additional information pretty much everywhere
- We could let other projects define their custom identification policy

The first approach would require us to synchronize a lot of information without need per se for Sirius Components so we will opt for the second approach.

### Solution

Some of our identifiers will switch from `UUID` to `String` to let others implement complex identifiers easily (think primary key created from multiple columns in PostgreSQL).

### Cutting backs

### Rabbit holes

It's probably to early to start a real web diagram editor right now, we're simply looking into sirius-web and emf.cloud but most probably our GMF runtime implementation will have to live a little longer. 

Thanks,
Marian

title: NA
body:
The `sirius-web-spring`, `sirius-web-services`, `sirius-web-graphql` (among others) were previously (until 0.4.1) included in the `sirius-components` repo, which hosts only generic and reusable components. New use cases made it clear that these particular components are not _that_ generic and actually deal with "how to integrate the reusable components into a full-fledged application (with application-specific choices)", and different applications may want to do things differently.

They have now been moved into the `sirius-web` repo, which currently does not publish its resulting JARs.

Currently the best way to consume the latest version is to fork/copy the whole `sirius-web` repo and adapt it. You may only need to adapt `sirius-web-sample-application` to register your own metamodel and modelers, but now you can also extend/customize the other integration components which are there if needed.

title: Spring debug configuration
body:
Hello, we just updated our fork of the frontend/backend (with minimal changes to add our ODesign model) from 0.2.10 to 0.4.4 components. While the migration was successful and we are able to run the fat JAR from the command line, both IntelliJ and STS debug configurations are now broken with the following message:

```
***************************
APPLICATION FAILED TO START
***************************

Description:

Parameter 0 of constructor in org.eclipse.sirius.web.graphql.datafetchers.editingcontext.EditingContextDomainsDataFetcher required a bean of type 'org.eclipse.sirius.web.core.api.IEditService' that could not be found.


Action:

Consider defining a bean of type 'org.eclipse.sirius.web.core.api.IEditService' in your configuration.
```

The Spring Boot debug configuration in both cases:

- starts the Spring Boot app from `org.eclipse.sirius.web.sample.SampleApplication`
- activates the `dev` profile
- passes the `spring.datasource.url`, `spring.datasource.username`, `spring.datasource.password`, and `spring.liquibase.change-log` parameters for override.

Do you have any hint as to why the ordinary debug config does not work any more in 0.4 Sirius Web and how could we fix it? Thank you in advance!

P.S. The same problem occurs on 'origin/master' without any of our customizations.

title: NA
body:
There have been some structural changes since version 0.2, with some projects which were previously in Sirius Components (the generic parts) which have now moved to Sirius Web (the application-specific parts). Could it be that your fork does not contain some of the newly added projects on the Sirius Web side ?

Related to this, if in your fork you modified the base Java package, make sure the `SampleApplication` main class has the correct annotation: `@ComponentScan({ "org.eclipse.sirius.web" })`. It should contain both `org.eclipse.sirius.web` and, if you have one, your own base package.

title: NA
body:
I've just updated Sirius Web to consume Sirius Components v0.4.6 (the current master), and bumped it to v0.4.6 too.
Can you try with those versions?

One thing to be aware of is that if you have `sirius-components` master (say at 0.4.6) in your Eclipse/STS workspace and a version of `sirius-web` (or a fork of it) which declares in its POMs to depend on an earlier version of `sirius-components` (say 0.4.3), m2e will use the version declared in the POMs, i.e. your `sirius-web` projects will get resolved against `sirius-components` 0.4.3 JARs, *not* the version in your workspace. This can cause confusing behaviors.

As of this writing, the `master` versions of `sirius-components` and `sirius-web` are aligned: they are both at v0.4.6, and `sirius-web` depends on `sirius-components` v0.4.6.

title: AQLInterpreter: error finding variables otherwise available in Sirius-Desktop
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : my computer: Windows

### Screenshots

In Sirius Desktop, I am using typical variables normally provided in the context of the action or representation I am programming. For example, when creating an element, I can use the "container" variable in my AQL code.
Similarly, when defining the Source Path Finder on an Edge element, I can make use of the "diagram" variable.

**Example1: Action code upon Element Creation** 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7108694/131409232-6df09259-c521-4caf-8729-fe9d1e806360.png)

**Example2: Source Path Finder on an Edge**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7108694/131409277-9765dde2-0efb-4b3a-a797-0ca23134e281.png)

### Expected & actual behavior
While these variables are available in Sirius Desktop, I get exceptions in Sirius Web when this same code needs to be executed. 
For example,

`2021-08-30 23:28:53.803  WARN 24312 --- [81-6784f7c74463] o.e.s.web.interpreter.AQLInterpreter     : An error has occurred with the expression 'aql:diagram.containers->select(c | c.visible).target->select(c | c.oclIsTypeOf(adaptorinterface::Resource)).oclAsType(adaptorinterface::Resource)->select(r | r.resourceProperties->includes(self))': Couldn't find the 'diagram' variable
`
Besides "self" what variables are available for a given action? How can one work out what is available, and what is not. (In sirius desktop, I make use of the direct explanations in the interface).

This is similar to the closed issue #408, which was related to ElementView variable. I here have problems with other variables.

title: NA
body:
### `container` variable

In the context of an diagram element creation tool, the `container` variable defined in Sirius Desktop is just an alias for the current element (`self`) at the start of the execution of the tool. We could define it, but for now there is only `self`. The thing is that from the screenshot, the place where you want to use the variable is inside a _Create Instance_ operation, which will redefine the value of `self`.

I have not tested, but a workaround would be to wrap the body of your _Container Creation_ tool with a _Let_ operation to capture the initial value of `self`  in your own variable, and use that new variable instead of `container` in the _Set_'s _value Expression_.

I'm not really fond of the historical name `container`, which does not clearly indicate what it represents, but we could provide it as a compatibility feature for diagrams which are defined from an `odesign` file. I'll prepare a PR.

### `diagram` variable

In Sirius Desktop, this variable points to a `DDiagram` element, which is the EMF-based data structure Sirius Desktop uses to represent diagrams. Sirius Web has its own, completely different and non-EMF data structure for this, and we do not want to expose it (it would become API and be very difficult to change/improve afterwards). It wouldn't be of much use to you anyway as it does not implement the same APIs at all.

In general, when people had to resort to using this "internal" model in their modelers it was often to workaround some limitations and/or to improve performance via "tricks". We'd rather directly support the higher-level use cases, and be fast enough that performance tricks like this are not needed.

Can you describe what your AQL expression tries to achieve functionnaly?

title: NA
body:
As a general background, my hope was to use the same odesign model for both desktop and web. I am willing to modify the model to suit both. But I wonder even this will be a realistic approach. I am aware that Sirius-web is still under development, but would be good to know already if this is a wise approach altogether.

### Container variable
I have done some experiments now, and "container" is the same as self.econtainer() (not self).
but this can solve my problem, thanks. 

### diagram variable
I  normally rely on the documented variables (see figure below) and didn't think these are internal. But granted, i could not expect a "diagram" to be available in Sirius-web. Anyway, I'll explain what I am trying to acheive. I will make use of UML to avoid the unnecessary specifics of our own domain language.
* Consider that I want to model inheritance between classes. If Class A is a sub-class of ClassB, I want to show an arrow from A to B. 
* Now, each Diagram can represent one or more UML-Packages, within which the classes are graphically represented.
* My model consists of many such package diagrams.
* So, it is a likely scenario that a diagram contains a graphical representation of Class A but not ClassB (since ClassB is in another package that is not in the same diagram).
* In such a scenario, since there can be no arrow representation of this inheritance, I want to textually write "Class A extends ClassB" in the label of Class A.

For this to work, I needed AQL logic that can tell me which objects are visible. I believe this also worked in case the user happened to also "hide" some specific graphical elements.

`diagram.containers->select(c | c.visible)`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7108694/131578128-84ea5137-ded7-4235-ba44-ab116775c93f.png)

title: NA
body:
> I normally rely on the documented variables (see figure below) and didn't think these are internal. 

These were not technically internal (in the OSGi-sense for example), but they expose the implementation details of how Sirius Desktop represents diagrams, which makes them impossible (or at least very difficult) to evolve once people start (legitimately) to rely on them. We do not want to reproduce that mistake in Sirius Web.

I understand the use case, and it is valid. We could probably expose a higher-level Java service to answer the actual question you want to ask, i.e. something like "is the semantic element X represented somewhere on this diagram?". We'd need to think a little at the details to avoid creating something too specific to this particular scenario (so that over time we do not multiply ad-hoc services likes this).

A possible approach would be:
* in Sirius Web, expose a `diagram` variable, but make it an opaque object (*not* the actual `Diagram` data structure used by Sirius Web). On that opaque object, register an AQL service which corresponds to your use case (maybe generalized a little). Say for example `represents(EObject semanticElement)` (name to be discussed).
 * in Sirius Desktop, we could register an equivalent Java service on the `DDiagram` type which is used there. This could be added directly in your own modeler definition until maybe it would be available directly into Sirius Desktop later on.

On your side, your `odesign` model could use a single expression like `aql:diagram.represents(someSemanticElement)`, which would work the same in both Desktop and Web, just using different implementations underneath.

title: NA
body:
Hi

> "is the semantic element X represented somewhere on this diagram?".

Another related question is also " "is the semantic element X represented somewhere within this "container!"?"." I am not sure if the 2 questions can be generalized into 1 service or not. But sometimes one want to also know if the element exists within a containing element.

Otherwise, the suggested approach looks good to me. Currrently, I have created my own Acceleo query to do this, because the current query is relatively complex.
For what it's worth, see the method `visibleResources (diagram : DSemanticDiagram)` which is then used to identify which specific elements are visible or not.
https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.designer/blob/5a48187cfded3310523ff56f8bf91788482736d7/org.eclipse.lyo.tools.toolchain.design/src/org/eclipse/lyo/tools/toolchain/design/domainSpecificationDiagram.mtl#L19

title: NA
body:
> > "is the semantic element X represented somewhere on this diagram?".
> 
> Another related question is also " "is the semantic element X represented somewhere within this "container!"?"." I am not sure if the 2 questions can be generalized into 1 service or not. But sometimes one want to also know if the element exists within a containing element.

Yes, there are probably useful variants depending on the _context_ (the whole diagram or a particular container) and the _kind_ or representation (to filter on mapping types). What's tricky is that even if we expose a pseudo "diagram" (which is really just an opaque handle), there is no way to denote other _containers_ from an expression. And neither is there a direct way (except by name) to denote mappings.

The most general predicate which would cover all the cases would have this kind of signature:

    isRepresented(what: semanticElement, where: diagram | container, how: child | borderNode, by: mapping)

These four properties being what [uniquely identify](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/backend/sirius-web-diagrams/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/diagrams/components/NodeComponent.java#L249) an element on a diagram. But this is probably overkill for a first step, especially given that we do not have a good way for the specifier to denote containers and mappings.

AQL services support overloads, so starting with a much simpler version which only considers the diagram and semantic element would not prevent adding alternatives later. I'll have to think a little more about and maybe propose a first patch to discuss with the rest of the team. In particular, I'd like to see if such a service could be made efficient or if it will have to do a full walk on the diagram structure (which would be bad for an expression that can be invoked many many times during a single refresh depending on where it is used).

title: NA
body:
Reopening as the patch merged only solves one of the two issues.

I'll probably create a separate ticket for that, but in the meantime I'll reopen this so that the issue is not lost/forgotten.

body:
Confirmed.

Yes this is a scenario we want (and need) to support, but knowing how the current implementation works it does not surprise me.

`org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.controllers.DocumentController.getDocument(String, String)` and and `org.eclipse.sirius.web.services.documents.DocumentService.getBytes(Document, String)`  assume a given document (model) can be loaded/saved all by itself, but as soon as there are cross-model references we need to load the whole editing context / resource set for references to make sense.

From a user perspective, it would be nice if I can upload a number of models (instead of just 1), which I know fit together.
and if I upload 1 (or more) models that are not complete, I get a warning of the missing models.

title: NA
body:
Hi 
I was wondering if there is any planned progess on this issue?
We are also thinking if the following short term solution would be of benefit (until bug is fixed):
When uploading a model with a proxy object, instead of loading the missing/referenced EMF resource, simply remove that proxy reference? (and preferably mark the object as missing).
This means that one can still upload a model with proxy objects. Even if not 100% perfect, it can still be of value to have a less complete model.

title: DiagramCreationService should not save() the new/updated diagrams
body:
IMO it should be side-effect free and focus on producing a fresh (on create) or up to date (on refresh) version of the Diagram, nothing else.

Currently `CreateDiagramEventHandler.handle(IEditingContext, IInput)` uses that service to create (and refresh) a new diagram, and explicitly saves the result.
The second save is redundant (maybe it's optimised away by Hibernate, I don't know, but I don't think we should rely on it).

If the `save()` is removed from `DiagramCreationService`, it should be called from `DiagramEventProcessor.refresh()`.

Technically we could get the same result by keeping the `save()` call in `DiagramCreationService` and removing it from `CreateDiagramEventHandler`, but in terms of responsibility it seems cleaner to make `DiagramCreationService` side-effect free, and let both `CreateDiagramEventHandler` and `DiagramEventProcessor`, who explicitly deal with the lifecycle of diagrams, call `save()` themselves.

title: NA
body: Just a quick note, I don't have a strong opinion on this topic on way or the other but if we want to change that, we may need to change it also for other representations (at least, we should review this part of the lifecycle for all the relevant representations). It should not cost a lot to do so.

title: OverlapsUpdater is very slow on large diagram
body:
Large diagrams in manual layout mode are *extremely* slow to open due to (I suppose) some algorithmic complexity issue in `org.eclipse.sirius.web.diagrams.layout.incremental.updater.OverlapsUpdater`.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new project and upload the sample "Flow" model from this archive: [Big_Guy.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/files/7154371/Big_Guy.zip). It a synthetic Flow model created by duplicating the sample "Robot.flow" many times.
2. Open the top-level element of the model in the  explorer, and try to create a "Topography" diagram on it.

After waiting several minutes for the backend to create the diagram, I had to abandon and kill the server.

Measruing the CPU usage with YourKit reveals the issue is that the (initial) layout computation gets stuck inside `OverlapsUpdater`. I have not looked at the code but I suspect we're using a quadratic (or worse) algorithm there.

Note that creating a [_Topography with auto-layout_](https://github.com/ObeoNetwork/Flow-Designer/blame/18454ea7c84a3bdd621fbf06c30ea29e7d98c13a/plugins/fr.obeo.dsl.designer.sample.flow.design/description/flow.odesign#L363) diagram instead, on the same element, is slow too but ends up finishing (after a few dozen seconds). Because that diagram has auto-layout enabled, we invoke `ILayoutService.layout()` instead of `ILayoutService.incrementalLayout()`, and thus bypass `OverlapsUpdater` completely.

title: NA
body: The incremental layout is not used anymore with the React Flow-based diagrams; all this code will soon be removed.

title: Add support for computed node size in View definitions
body:
Sirius Desktop supports `NodeStyleDescription.getSizeComputationExpression()` and we support it when interpreting VSMs (see `WorkspaceImageDescriptionConverter.convert()`, but not when defining diagrams directly using the View DSL.

The corresponding field should be added to `org.eclipse.sirius.web.view.NodeStyle` and used when creating the style provider for a node in `ViewConverter.convert(NodeDescription, AQLInterpreter)`.

title: AQL expressions in dynamic View definitions can not use type literals to denote Domain classes
body:
The AQL interpreter used to evaluate dynamic expressions from a `View` definition (e.g. a `semanticCandidatesExpression`) can not use type litterals (`domain::Type`), which severly limits the capabilities of  the dynamic modelers.

The issue is that `ViewConverter.convert(View)` does not pass the `EPackage`s to the interpreter it instanciates.
It is relatively simple to pass _equivalent_ `EPackages` by using `this.editingContextEPackageService.getEPackages(editingContextId)`, but for packages corresponding to `Domain` definition, this will produce logically equivalent but distinct `EPackage` instances on every invocation.
In particular, this will produce `EPackages` which are distinct from the ones used by a project/editing context, and AQL expressions like `filter(domain::Type)` will always fail to match the actual objects inside a project.

title: NA
body: The fix requires making `org.eclipse.sirius.web.core.api.IRepresentationDescriptionSearchService.findById(UUID)` "scoped" by the actual `IEditingContext`, so that in the case of an EMF-based editing context the implementation can call `getDomain().getResourceSet().getEPackageRegistry()` to get access to the actual `EPackage` instances it uses, and not alternative "copies".

title: The ResourceSet of the EditingContext should be an IEditingDomainProvider
Add support for multiple source & target nodes for edge descriptions
body: This is supported by the diagram engine, but this was not added initially in dynamic View definitions as we had no widget to configure such multi-valued references. Now that #428 is fixed, it should be possible to expose this possibility.

body:
What is the point of such "meta-issues"? It will never represent what is really being done in the 0.5.0 release since it will require manual update contrary to what's in the milestone. Some of those issues are not in the milestones (and some will never be in it), others are in the milestones and have been done already but do not appear here.

The real up-to-date answer is [there](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues?q=milestone%3A0.5.0+label%3A%22area%3A+domain%22%2C%22area%3A+view%22) isn't it? Feel free to reopen it if I'm missing something but I've added the `area: domain` and `area: view` labels especially because our previous attempts at manually following this kind of things failed.

title: View validation reports an error when using qualified domain types
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Inside project, create a domain definition (`SampleDomain`) with an entity, say `Root`.
2. Inside the same project, create a view definition and inside the diagram create a NodeDescription.
3. Set the Node Description's "Domain Type" to `SampleDomain::Root`.

The Validation (both inline in the details view and in the dedicated Validation view) show an error "The node description "SampleDomain::Root" does not have a valid domain class."

The syntax is actually fine at runtime (see `DomainClassPredicate`) and should not produce a validation error.

title: NA
body: It would be more consistent for the validation code (in `ViewValidator`) to actually call `DomainClassPredicate` to ensure we use the same logic at validation time and at runtime. This would require a small change to `DomainClassPredicate` which currently requires an instance in its signature (`EObject`), but actually only needs the type of that instance.

title: In view definitions, Node and edge descriptions should have a proper name
body: When configuring a View definition, node and edge descriptions appear in the explorer with a label that simply reflects their Domain Type. The result is not very readable, and it's relatively easy to have several elements with the same label. When this occurs it becomes impossible to select the correct one for example when choosing the source or target node for an edge.

title: Domains should be simplified to have a single name attribute
body:
Currently a `Domain` is defined with a name and an URI.

The name is used both for the corresponding `EPackage`'s `name` and `nsPrefix`, but `nsPrefix` is not really used.
The URI is used as the `EPackage`'s `nsURI`, but users can put anything there, including URIs which collide with other EPackages.

It would be simpler and less confusing/error-prone to have a single `name` attribute:
* `EPackage.name = Domain.name`
* `EPackage.nsPrefix = Domain.name`
* `EPackage.nsURI = "domain://" + Domain.name`

title: Canonical node/view creation tools do not work if domain types use quafilied names
body: If a _Node Description_ uses a qualified named for its domain class (`domain::Type`), the corresponding canonical creation tool will fail. In `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.view.CanonicalBehaviors.createSemanticInstance(EObject, String)` it expects the domain type string to match exactly the name of the `EClass` to instantiate.

title: There is no minimum size when resizing a node/container
body:
It is possible to resize a node/container until it has a size of 0×0. Once such an element is deselected (and the resize handles are no longer visible), it is very difficult (impossible?) to re-select it on the diagram.
The workaround is to find it in the explorer (if you can guess which one it is), select it there, and then you can use the resize handles to give it a more appropriate size (though even this is not particularly easy/ergonomic).

There should be a minimum size enforced on resize (maybe 10×10) to avoid these situations.

title: Labels are not shown for edges created using a dynamic view
body: When configuring an _Edge Description_ in a _View_, it is possible to specify a _Label Expression_, but it is not used. No label is displayed for these edges.

title: Event handler should be able to communicate data to the editing context event processor
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Thanks to Reactor Flux every event handler should communicate their result through sinks.
A sink will be used to communicate with the editing context event processor. Another one should be able to communicate the payload to the data fetcher.

title: Property change can be lost when selecting a new element
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select an element in the explorer
2. In its _Details_ view, start editing one of its text properties, but do not validate (keep the focus in the text field and do not hit _Return_).
3. Select another element in the explorer.

Expected: normally, leaving the focus from a text field should perform the corresponding change. This is what happens if you click somewhere else in the details view for example.

Actual behavior: the text change you started to make is lost, and the text property has kepts it original value.

title: NA
body: This happens because when we change the selection to another element, we compute a new _Form_ representation for the _Details_ view, and *immediatly* dispose the previous one. If this disposal happens before we treat the `EditTextfieldInput` (which is highly likely in practice), when we end up trying to handle the `EditTextfieldInput` there is no matching event processor, so the input is dropped.

title: NA
NA
body: I updated the title, as the issue can also happen on combo/select widgets.

title: NA
body:
(I'll write here my opinion on the topic to communicate it to everybody even if @pcdavid and I talked about it already)

I don't think that we can solve this problem in 100% of the use cases because of possible network lag but I think that adding a small delay would solve 90% of the occurrences of this problem. The current error message could be replaced by a more specific message indicating that the representation has maybe been disposed. or something like that. I think that we can have this issue with all representations but it's just visible with forms since it's very easy to reproduce it there.

A small variation of the code proposed above could make it work for all representations. By adding something like this:

```
representationEventProcessor.canBeDisposed().delayElements(Duration.ofSeconds(5))
```

in `EditingContextEventProcessor.acquireRepresentationEventProcessor(Class<T>, IRepresentationConfiguration, IInput)`

title: NA
body:

> representationEventProcessor.canBeDisposed().delayElements(Duration.ofSeconds(5))
> ```

> in `EditingContextEventProcessor.acquireRepresentationEventProcessor(Class<T>, IRepresentationConfiguration, IInput)`

This corresponds to what I proposed [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/749#issuecomment-924700272) but I have not tested yet.

title: Arrange All may produce edges which are no longer visually connected to their source/target
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project with a _Robot_ sample model.
2. Create a _Topography_ diagram.
3. Select (for example) the _Engine_ processor, and change its name to a very long text. It should be long enough that the label's width is larger than the _Engine_ node's width.
4. Apply the _Arrange All_ operation.

In the resulting layout, the edge which targets the _Engine_ is now visually disconnected from the node:

![2021-09-21_17-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/134197536-d5976a9b-798b-4c59-918a-beb118183779.png)

Selecting the node reveals that the edge correctly stops at the bounding box of the node, but that bounding box is incorrectly sized (probably to account for the label's width, but it should not be relevant here as the label is on the outside):

![2021-09-21_17-11_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/134197939-32873474-da7f-4d67-9457-50123474acbe.png)

On a manually layouted diagram like this one, the next (non-Arrange All) operation on the diagram will trigger the incremental layout which will fix the issue, but it will come back on the next "Arrange all" invocation.

On automatically layouted diagrams, the issue will persist.

title: NA
body: The issue is caused by the application of the ELK layout (either a bug in ELK itself or in the way we configure it) in `org.eclipse.sirius.web.diagrams.layout.LayoutService.layout(IEditingContext, Diagram)`.

title: NA
body: @gcoutable found the fix: use `EnumSet.of(SizeConstraint.MINIMUM_SIZE, SizeConstraint.PORT_LABELS, SizeConstraint.PORTS)` fir the ELK `NODE_SIZE_CONSTRAINTS`. I'll prepare a PR soon.

title: Add the ability to provide a status error message
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Current handlers can only return _Status.OK_ or _Status.ERROR_. It should be possible for them to return a bit more complex data.
For that, there will be a _Failure_ status and a _Success_ status with a common interface _IStatus_.

The first contribution will make the _Failure_ status returning a message. The _Success_ status will do nothing more than just existing. It is meant to be improved in a not too distant future.

title: View definitions are only considered if they are the first element of a model/document

title: Improve support for unsynchronized diagrams in the compatibility layer
body: We need support for both `createView` and `deleteView` model operations in order to move forward with this feature. A proper example based on flow is also needed.

title: Inconsistent diagrams can be produced with lists and list items
body:
If a node is configured to be a list but one of its sub-node is configured to be an image, the result is an inconsistent diagram. The sub-node has a type of `node:image` (which is wrong by itself) but a style which correctly corresponds to a `ListItemNodeStyle`.
Once serialized, the result can not be read again as `INodeStyleDeserializer.deserialize(JsonParser, DeserializationContext)` uses the `type` tag to determine the expected class of the style.

When a container is in "list mode", all its sub-nodes should be list items with corresponding styles, regardless of what their "native" definition says.

title: NA
body: This whole area seem very brittle. There is a strong expectation in the code that the node type declared on a node, which is just a string, is one of the constants we declare in `NodeType` *and* that the actual Java type of the node's style is the matching subclass of `INodeType`, though the connection between both is more "by convention" than anything.

title: Possible collision between dynamic diagram definitions with the same names
body:
When creating a dynamic modeler definition, the studio maker must give a name to his diagram description (the default being `"New Diagram Description"`).
Currently to id of the `IRepresentationDescription` this produces (in `ViewConverter`) only depends on that name, but that id is supposed to be globally unique.
If two dynamic representation descriptions have the same names, they will have the same id, and which one is returned at a given moment by `IRepresentationDescriptionSearchService.findById(IEditingContext, UUID)` is undefined, which can lead at the very least to surprising behaviors or to crashes.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new studio project with a basic domain definition (say a Root entity containing Items).
2. Inside the same project, create a diagram description on Root which displays Items as blue rectangles.
3. Create an instance of the domain and diagram on a new project.
4. Create another project with a new diagram description on Root which displays Items as red rectangles. Give the diagram description the same name as the first one.
5. Go back to the instance project and reload: the blue rectangles turn red as the new diagram definition with the same name is picked up instead of the opriginal. (This may not happen every time as part of the behavior is not completely deterministic).

title: Preconditions from the tools are not respected
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- other: 0.4.6
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

### Screenshots

Edge Creation forbidden in Sirius Desktop, as expected (due to preconditions set to `aql:false`):


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137632685-0568f972-6632-467b-b1a0-111d66430f66.mp4

It is allowed in Sirius Web (neither Start nor Complete conditions are checked):


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137632693-6a1bb604-e666-4225-8832-5298925bab5d.mp4




### Steps to reproduce

Add _Conneciton Start Precondition_ or _Connection Complete Precondition_ to an _Edge Creation Tool_:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137632736-9c826bc1-3152-43d0-87ad-167576931ca1.png)


### Expected behavior

1. The edge creation tool does not appear at all or appears but is disabled (when the _Connection Start Precondition_ results in `false`)
2. The edge creation tool has the _disabled_ icon when _Connection Complete Precondition_ results in `false`

### Actual behavior

Despite preconditions being `false`, the edge can be freely created, as if they were not taken into account.

title: NA
body:
Thanks for the detailed report. This is a known limitation at the moment.
We can not (easily) have the same interactive behavior as Sirius Desktop, as the expressions can only be evaluated on then backend, and getting the same behavior would required requests to the backend every time the end user moves the cursor on a different element.
We *could* probably however let the creation request pass to the backend but check for these before actually executing the tool, and report a message to the end-user if the tool was not applied because of these.

title: NA
body:
> We could probably however let the creation request pass to the backend but check for these before actually executing the tool, and report a message to the end-user if the tool was not applied because of these.

This sounds like a logical solution :+1: 

I understand it will take some time to implement and may not be a priority at the moment. Is there any way I can replicate this functionality (disallowing edges to be created under certain conditions) in Sirius Web?
I am in control of the metamodel and the Sirius Web app, so I can modify both and hardcode the condition somewhere.

title: Add support for multilines labels
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- other: 0.4.6
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

### Screenshots

Sirius Desktop
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137633043-14826c84-e44b-434a-99e0-1d727d317d2b.png)

Sirius Web (a long single line label)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137633050-5103a1d3-1d85-4cbd-b61c-cbdaaba47635.png)


### Steps to reproduce

In the _Label Expression_ for a node, add a newline

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137633071-1a78db44-dfd7-46f1-9645-063c96449a25.png)


### Expected behavior

The newline makes the rest  of the text appear on a new line

### Actual behavior

The text appears on a single line. The newline is turned into a space.

title: NA
body:
It looks like Sprotty might support this [since 0.8.0](https://github.com/eclipse/sprotty/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v080-apr-2020) via https://github.com/eclipse/sprotty/pull/171
See also https://github.com/eclipse/elk/issues/476. Maybe we'll ask @lredor for his ELK expertise :-)

title: NA
body:
## Specification
### Model
The model owns somewhere an entity with an attribute of type string. There is currently not the information about if the string is mono or multiline.
So let's consider that or line return is serialized with `\n`
The end-user '\n' string will be serialized escaped with '\\n'

### Representation
Every representation of a string attribute should manage the mono or multiline information based on th `\n` character

### Form representation
By default, the form representation represents a string with a textField. But a string could also be represented by a textArea

The textField will display `\n` with `\n` and `\\n` with `\\n`

The textArea will display `\n` with a carriage return and `\\n` with `\n`

### Sprotty

The label will display `\n` with a carriage return and `\\n` with `\n`
Idem when editing the text

As a second step, we could configure a maximum text length for the label display. That means that if the label is longer than the maximum length, a line is cut and returned as many times to comply with the maximum length

### backend layout
The ELK and incremental layout should adapt to mange the fact the a label can be displayed on many lines.
The is necessary so that the parent node have the right size and so that the children nodes will not overlap the parent node label

body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- other: 0.4.6
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

### Screenshots

Sirius Desktop (there are borders with style customizations)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137633043-14826c84-e44b-434a-99e0-1d727d317d2b.png)

Sirius Web (I manually had to add a border to the icon image)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137633050-5103a1d3-1d85-4cbd-b61c-cbdaaba47635.png)


### Steps to reproduce

Add a border for the bordered node.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/137633230-4167400e-b6fd-463b-85e5-59e052286aef.png)



### Expected behavior

The border is shown.

It would be great if it also handled all border colors that Sirius Desktop handles, as well as style customizations for the border color.

### Actual behavior

The border is not shown.

title: NA
body:
Actually, this does not seem related to the fact that these are border nodes. I can reprroduce it with plain nodes:

![2022-01-31_16-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/151820802-e9d016f4-38b7-4a94-aaa5-8f32292c7d13.png)

Here the node at the top and its border node are plain nodes and their border size and color is correctly represented.
At the bottom, both the image node and its own border node have the same border configurations as the ones above, but neither have a visible border.

The issue is that the border (size, style, color) is completely ignored for image nodes (whether they are border nodes or not):

* `org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.diagrams.WorkspaceImageDescriptionConverter` does not consider the border-related properties of the `WorkspaceImageDescription` (color, line style, size computation expression);
* `org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.ImageNodeStyle` does not support them anyway;
* the corresponding types (and code) on the frontend also needs to be made aware of these properties.

title: Fit to screen does not work after panel resize
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**

* [x] **I have specified the version** : latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
Cloud
### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1185863/137734257-08b06c59-195c-4862-b787-3dc9d1ce32cd.png)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open a diagram
2. Select the diagram's background
3. Select Fit to screen
-> The diagram fits all in the editor
4. Resize the Dateils view panel
5. Select the diagram's background
6. Select Fit to screen
-> The diagram does not fit in the editor

### Expected behavior

The size used to fit a diagram should be the size of the diagram editor after resizing the panels.

### Actual behavior

THe sisze used to compute the fit to screen seems to be the first one before the panel resize.

title: Error does not appear in validation view, only in details view
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- 0.4.10
- other: please specify
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All
- my computer: MacOS

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new project.
2. Create an Empty View Definition model.
3. Under the New Diagram Description, create a node description.
4. Select the NodeStyle.
5. Remove the Color text field value.
6. Check there is a diagnostic under the Color text field.
7. The diagnostic message should be "The color should not be empty".
8. Open the Validation accordion

### Expected behavior

-> There should be two "Errors" diagnostics and one is about the Color feature.

### Actual behavior

-> There is only one "Error" in the diagnostic and it is not related to the Color feature.

title: NullPointerException when executing a Remove action in a `null` context (different from Sirius Desktop)

Looks like the code is pointing there: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/0fe4572463080222683ae698f7fe15719a178bea/backend/sirius-web-emf/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/emf/compatibility/modeloperations/RemoveElementOperationHandler.java#L67

The exception does not happen in Sirius Web after adding _If_ `aql:self != null`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/138227191-8b3103ae-feb2-4a90-adcf-fd23d2525e3a.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add a Delete Tool for an object that deletes a referenced object while deleting the main object.
2. In the model in Sirius Web, add that element, but don't set the reference (so it is set to `null`)
3. Try to remove the main object

You can use my metamodel [CAL-web](https://github.com/Gelio/CAL-web/tree/fbc800a49c8218a6fa6142034e9a3a8020f68766/backend/model). It has 2 Delete Tools that cause NPEs. The workaround is adding `If` `aql:self != null` https://github.com/Gelio/CAL-web/commit/9f6d13747c44c2bcedc297e70a88b2d4647d68e0

### Expected behavior

The object is removed and there is no exception.

### Actual behavior

The first time I try to remove the element, it is not removed and there are logs from that NPE. The second time I try to delete it, the element gets removed.

The tool is defined like so:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/889383/138228925-704b9d82-cc7a-4118-9f01-be9921f67235.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add a Delete Tool for an object that deletes a referenced object while deleting the main object.
2. In the model in Sirius Web, add that object and set the reference to another object
3. Try to remove the main object

You can use my [CAL](https://github.com/Gelio/CAL-web/tree/https://github.com/Gelio/CAL-web/tree/9f6d13747c44c2bcedc297e70a88b2d4647d68e0/backend/model/backend/model) metamodel. Create 2 application data pins, connect them together via a `DataFlow`, and then remove one of them. The `DataFlow` should be removed when removing the application data pin (unless https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/791 happens).

### Expected behavior

Both objects are removed and are no exceptions.

### Actual behavior

Both objects are removed and there is a `DanglingHREFException`

title: Prioritize custom-defined domains in the new root object modal
body:
Currently when opening the "Create new root object" modal, the available domains are presented in no particular order. Custom-defined ones tend to appear *after* the statically contributed ones, but that is more "by chance" than "by design".

It would be better to propose custom-defined domains first, then statically contributed ones, and in a more controlled order (i.e. alphabetically sorted) to make the list more scannable.

title: NA
body:
Before: static ("http") domain appear before dynamic ones ("domain") but in each category the order is semi-random:
![2021-10-22_09-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/138412332-e34b5bed-0c9b-40af-b5bc-137d4958b230.png)

After: dynamic/custom domains appear first, and in each category everything is sorted alphabetically and easier to parse/scan
![2021-10-22_09-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/138412456-b9810480-0316-4bd2-afe2-486a328a728d.png)

Some icon are obvious to understand but others not, so it would be intersting to have a tooltip on the icon
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12660743/138706257-23b1bea5-5856-470c-85e3-8591f6a01684.png)

title: Edges connected to moved elements are reset to a single segment
body:
This is a followup to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/550.
It used to be that moving any element on a diagram (in manual layout mode) would reset all (or at least most) edge to single segments with no bendpoints, even if the edge was between elements which were not moved at all.
The fix for https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/550 improved the situation, be we still reset the edges connected to a moved element to single segments, losing any previous routing information.

title: NA
body: It will be fixed when https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/997 will be merged

title: Remove ArchUnit's DEBUG messages from the build logs
body:
When running `mvn clean verify -f backend/pom.xml`, the logs are dominated by ArchUnit DEBUG-level messages which makes the build logs hard to read (especially inside the GitHub Actions UI).

For example:
```
14:06:36.632 [main] DEBUG com.tngtech.archunit.core.importer.JavaClassProcessor - Analyzing class 'org/eclipse/emf/ecore/EGenericType'
14:06:36.634 [main] DEBUG com.tngtech.archunit.core.importer.JavaClassProcessor - Analyzing class 'org/eclipse/emf/ecore/EAnnotation'
14:06:36.635 [main] DEBUG com.tngtech.archunit.core.importer.JavaClassProcessor - Analyzing class 'org/eclipse/emf/common/util/TreeIterator'
14:06:36.636 [main] DEBUG com.tngtech.archunit.core.importer.JavaClassProcessor - Analyzing class 'java/lang/reflect/InvocationTargetException'
14:06:36.638 [main] DEBUG com.tngtech.archunit.core.importer.JavaClassProcessor - Analyzing class 'org/eclipse/emf/ecore/EParameter'
14:06:36.638 [main] DEBUG com.tngtech.archunit.core.importer.JavaClassProcessor - Analyzing class 'org/eclipse/emf/ecore/ETypeParameter'
```
On a full build with tests, out of 9867 lines 6929 are of this type. That's 70% of the total.

title: NA
body: With https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/803, a complete build with tests goes from 9867 lines down to 2778.

title: List and update the various configuration properties
body: We have a significant number of configuration properties and this number is growing rapidly. We need to list those properties and adopt a pattern to find the easily. Some basic documentation would also be needed to find their purpose.

title: NA
body: This will impact everything using `@Value` or `@ConditionalOnProperty`

title: NA
body: Closing this since it has been merged in master

title: Change the namespace to Sirius Components
body:
Projects should be named "sirius-components-xxx" and packages "org.eclipse.sirius.components.xxx". On top of that some concepts named "SiriusWebXxxYyy" should be renamed.

Such change should be made when a low amount of pull requests would be affected since it will break everything.

title: Switching back to a deleted representation tab crashes the frontend
body:
When deleting an open representation, its tab is not closed but simply indicates that the representation no longer exists.
It is then possible to create a new one, which opens in a new tab.
If you then switch back to the previous tab which used to show the deleted representation, the frontend crashes.
![crash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/139828013-51e7df5d-46ce-4468-8a0e-fbc93b3b78b9.png)

title: NA
body:
It looks like this was specific to the Sprotty-based frontend. Can't reproduce on React Flow diagrams.
I'll try to add a non-regression test if I can before closing this.

title: NA
body: Can't reproduce with React Flow diagrams.

title: "Invalid input type" when a property is readable and not changeable

### Summary

When a containment reference is marked as `readonly` and not `changeable`, when trying to change the reference (in the child object properties, change the property that points to the parent) (`ComputedDataPin`'s `call` in this case), the input is not disabled, but trying to change it results in the following error:
