title: Potential NPE when creating a DiagramEventProcessor
body:
In `DiagramEventProcessor`'s constructor, we do this:

```java
Diagram diagram = this.diagramCreationService.refresh(editingContext, diagramContext).orElse(null);
diagramContext.update(diagram);
```

It's possible for the calls to `refresh` to return an `Optional.empty()` (for example if the diagram points to a diagram description which does not exist anymore). In this case we blindly pass `null` to `DiagramContext.update()`, which throws an NPE in this case.

I'm not sure what's the proper fix is. Creating an empty `Diagram` instance instead of `null` in the `orElse` branch would fix the immediate symptom, but not the root issue: it does not really make sense to create a `DiagramEventProcessor` for a diagram that can not be refreshed/rendered.

title: Support richer/more user-friendly domain definitions
Support object-based preconditions for representation descriptions
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : 2021.12.12
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Linux

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add precondition expression containing `self` variable for a representation specification in odesign-file
2. Try to create the representation

### Expected behavior

The representation kind is available in the new representation dialog and successfully created.

### Actual behavior

The representation kind is not available in the new representation dialog. The following exception is raised: "An error has occurred with the expression 'aql:self.getModelKindMnemonic() = 'EventDrivenProcessChain'': Couldn't find the 'self' variable"

### Details

Class `org.eclipse.sirius.web.emf.handlers.EditingContextRepresentationDescriptionsEventHandler` contains the following code:
```
VariableManager variableManager = new VariableManager();
variableManager.put(IRepresentationDescription.CLASS, optionalClazz.get());
Predicate<VariableManager> canCreatePredicate = description.getCanCreatePredicate();
boolean canCreate = canCreatePredicate.test(variableManager);
```
Only `class` variable is added.

I guess the problem is that `org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.collaborative.dto.EditingContextRepresentationDescriptionsInput` has only a `kind` parameter. The selected object is not even send in a GraphQL query.

However property forms support preconditions with `self` variable. `org.eclipse.sirius.web.spring.collaborative.forms.dto.PropertiesEventInput` has `objectId` parameter instead of `kind`.

Maybe behaviour for representations should be aligned with the behaviour for forms? Both of them should support `self` in preconditions?

Some services will need to have access to the context of the request triggering their execution.
In order to do so, the ExecutorService of the EditingContextEventProcessor needs to wrap all of its tasks with the request.

Consumer of Sirius Components will have to provide the RequestAttributes in the RequestContextHolder to make the EditingContextEventProcessor work. It should be very easy for those in a Spring environment, but it is not free for those outside of a Spring environment.

title: Update our naming convention to distinguish events from their imagined behavior
body:
We have concepts such as:

- CreateNodeTool
- CreateEdgeTool
- NodeCreationEvent
- EdgeCreationEvent

None of those concept does exactly what it describe. A "CreateNodeTool" can create edges and no nodes at all, a `CreateEdgeTool` can rename a label and not create any edge, a CreateNodeTool could actually even be used to delete nodes, etc. We need to make those concepts more factual with regard with what they do. We could for example start by renaming `NodeCreationEvent` to `SinglePositionEvent` and `EdgeCreationEvent` to `DoublePositionEvent`.

I think that a first step necessary in order to start considering the impact of the existing NodeCreationEvent when it triggers the creation of edges for example.

title: Support internationalization (i18n) for frontend
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

1. Sirius Components are localizable
2. Doesn't contain duplicated strings
3. Supports plurals for strings

### Cuttings backs

No.

### Potential side effects

No.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

There are several localization frameworks, but https://react.i18next.com/ seems to be optimal.

### Some notes

1. At first I tried to create separate localization files for each React component, but it's very unhandy. Because there are a lot of files, it's hard to find them, to edit them. Much easier to have one localization file per-module.

2. You can use any string as a key in localization file. For instance "Arrange all elements". But I guess that it's better to have short keys in camelCase, for instance just "arrangeAll".

3. I think it's a good idea to unify keys. For instance here is a fragment for project creation form:

```
{
  "siriusWebApplication": {
    "project": {
      "create": {
        "title": "Create a new project",
        "description": "Get started by creating a new project",
        "name": {
          "label": "Name",
          "placeholder": "Enter the project name",
          "helperText": "The name must contain between 3 and 1024 characters"
        },
        "submit": "Create"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

- `siriusWebApplication` is a name of module
  - `project` is a name of entity
    - `create` is a name of action for that entity
      - `title`  is a form title
      - `description`  is a form description
      - `name` is a name of an entity attribute
        - `label` is a field label for the attribute
        - `placeholder` is a placeholder for the field
        - `helperText` is a helper text for the field
      - `submit` is a name of submit button
      - `cancel` is a name of cancel button
      - `close` is a name of close button

I find this template very useful, it allows to unify form localization.

4. Some of the strings are duplicated now, for instance, `rename`, `delete`, ... Probably they can be moved to some common section. But I guess it will complicate localization, maybe I'm wrong.

5. If you don't want to bother with ru locale, I can remove it and add on the application level. But maybe it will be useful for someone

body:

I have not localized all components, but I think it's a good starting point

title: Web-based diagram can not define border line style
body: When configuring the style of a node in a web-based view definition, it is possible to set the border size/color/radius, but not the line style to use (solid _vs_ dash _vs_ dot, etc.).

title: Scalability issue with deep/complex diagram descriptions
body:
Since https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/960/commits/e3a37e883cb7ab5c3712c190926cd06e5e9f54f9 we send (a subset of) the `DiagramDescription` to the frontend so that it can make more informed decisions, in particular [whether or not  to provide a 'Delete from diagram' tool for unsuynchronized nodes](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/960/commits/1e2b89770d2d399f114e78a568f28d537c513efb#diff-6e6411fb31a0ef4291f8485a118f217275ccf5865830f8053dd649c5bc84362dR66).

This works fine for relatively simple diagram descriptions, but does not scale well for more complex ones.
For example for a diagram with, say 20 different kinds of nodes which can all contain each other with no depth limit, [the GraphQL query](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/960/commits/e3a37e883cb7ab5c3712c190926cd06e5e9f54f9#diff-3c6a2180a0b55ca6fdeaec04c280c9df0239a1d7ffd15ed7523019c9b7b69fd8R363) to retrieve the diagram description's structure, even if it is limited to a depth of 4, will return at least 20×20×20×20 = 160000 elements! With 30 different kinds of node, 30^4 = 810000, etc.

Note that the changes planned for https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/779 may indirectly solve this by replacing this whole static query with on-demand queries about the tools and properties of a node only when it is selected, which will not be recursive.

title: NA
body: The frontend does not retrieve the diagram description anymore.

title: Stop updating the Sprotty internal model to show the edge creation tool's feedback
NA
body: Sprotty-specific. Obsolete.

title: Providers should return List<?> instead of List<Object> whenever possible
body:
Having an API that exposes List<Object> as a return type prevents simple reuse of existing services that return List<SomethingElse>. This forces implementors to copy lists, which is a waste of time in many cases.
Also, quite often, the API of sirius-components providers exposes providers that return List<Object>, but the returned list is actually not intended to be modifiable, only to be read. Hence, typing with List does not convey the proper meaning, typing with Iterable would be better to indicate that what's returned is supposed to be read-only.
Examples:
- TreeDescription elementsProvider & childrenProvider
- ListDescription itemsProvider

title: It should be possible to expand/collapse items in the explorer without impacting the selection
body:
Currently clicking on the ">" marker of an item in the explorer to expand it and see its children automatically selects it.
This can be annoying as this changes the contents of the details view, and possibly  moves things around to focus on the newly selected element if it is visible on an open diagram.
In some contexts (e.g. when details are costly to compute) this can also have performance impact.

It should be possible to expand and collapse a tree item without selecting it if the user clicks on the icon (if navigating and expanding/collapsing using the keyboard, one has to already have the item selected to expand/collapse it, so it's not really possible in this case).

title: NA
body: This was broken by the change made for https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/3056

title: Remove URL.ts and simply ask for a server URL
body:
The code of `URL.ts` should not exist in Sirius Components. It hardcodes into Sirius Components a dependency to the node.js API  `process.env` in order to let Sirius Components figure out the URL of the server. Sirius Components should just require the URL of the server and let anyone who want to use Sirius Components leverage any mechanism they want to compute the URL.

We should not have a dependency to node.js APIs and it should not be necessary to mock nodejs' `process.env` in order to use Sirius Components.

title: Stop considering the source and target connection points as routing points
Tree items for which no operation are available should not display the "hamburger" menu
body:
It is possible to have tree items which are non-editable, non-deletable, and for which no other operation are available.
In that case we still display the "..." menu on the right, except that it opens an empty "context menu" (it is so small that it does not even look like a context menu, which is even more confusing).

![2022-02-15_11-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/154039867-e68a78e0-ac28-4d42-9d4b-acaaa766e494.png)

We should not display the "..." menu at all for these items.

title: Add support for displaying details on arbitrary element kinds
It should be possible for different representations of the same kind to have different icons
body:
Currently `IRepresentationImageProvider` determines the icon to use based only on the representation's kind: `getImageURL(String kind)`. This means all diagrams (for example) have the same icon.
The icon should be specific to a particular representation instance so that (for example) different diagrams.

title: When opening a representation from its URL, it should be automatically visible and selected in the explorer
body:
When opening a representation from its direct URL (by following a shared link, or simply opening it from the onboard area), the representation is open in the main area, but may not be visible in the explorer.
If it _was_ already visible in the explorer, it appears selected, but for example when directly opening a link to a representation in a new browser tab, the explorer is initialized in its default state with only the root elements visible.

This results in a state which is different than when opening the representation by selecting it in the explorer, and does not show contextual information on the element to which the representation is attached.

title: Add support for the label of border nodes
body:
The aim is to display the label associated to the border node.

### Current behavior

Both nodes and border nodes are considered as node.

Currently the the two types of label positioning are
* label:inside-center: the label is inside the node. It is centered horizontally and on top vertically
* label:outside-center: the label is outside and right above the node. It centered horizontally.

cd `org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.components.NodeComponent.doRender(VariableManager, String, Optional<Node>)`
```
LabelType nodeLabelType = LabelType.INSIDE_CENTER;
if (NodeType.NODE_IMAGE.equals(type)) {
    nodeLabelType = LabelType.OUTSIDE_CENTER;
}
```

The label may overlap its node whatever its type. So the *node size does not depends on its label*

### Expected behavior

The label for the border node must support both `label:inside-center` and `label:outside-center` types
The behavior is the same than nodes's.

The padding and margin are those used for ELK layout 

ELK layout must have the same behavior than the incremental layout

title: NA
body:
### The validated specification:

The auto layout uses the CoreOptions.PORT_LABELS_PLACEMENT with the
value PortLabelPlacement.outside(). It means that the label is
positioned on a corner of the border node without entering the parent
node.
The incremental layout uses, for the border nodes label, the same
policy. It is applied when the border node is
* resized
* moved on its container
* when it is newly created.

title: Support undo/redo
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

Do we have a plan to support the undo/redo command?

title: NA
body:
Undo/redo would be a great feature but it comes with some unique challenges in a collaborative environment. If Bob and Alice are working on a diagram. Bob creates an element then Alice creates a new reference to this element. Bob wants to undo the last change, what is undone? His change or Alice change? What if there are 5 persons working on the diagram and new changes are coming very quickly so while Bob wants to undo something others are adding new changes again and again? Since they are working on the same project, now let's consider that they are both manipulating the same data but using different diagrams for example.

I'm not saying that it can't be done or won't be done, far from it, but it would take time to specify the user experience that we want to provide and to build it.

title: NA
body: If we want to implement this feature ourselves, any suggestions? Sirius-web front-end does not seem to provide a command stack.

title: NA
body:
+1

this would be really useful , especially when discovering the UI and creating elements at the wrong place, it that case we need several click to delete the element instead of a simple  Ctrl+z

title: Allow customization of the main/oboard area component displayed when no representation is open
body:
Currently when no representation is open, the main area of the workbench displays the `OnboardArea` components.
This should be configurable so that specific applications can provide a different component to display in this case.

title: Change the type of IRepresentationDescription#id from UUID to String
body:
The fact that we are using UUID for the type of the identifier of the representation description means that we can't determine some information on a representation description from its identifier. While it may not be an issue for most use cases, it prevents us from having the ability to distinguish how a representation description has been created.

Without this ability, we can't know in a stateless manner which part of the code should be in charge of supporting a feature for a given representation description id (the view support, the compatibility layer or a regular programmatic API). For example, we could easily encode the origin of the representation description in the identifier while still keeping a relatively opaque identifier.

#### Compatibility layer

In the compatibility layer, we could thus encode the odesign and the representation description used. Something like this `siriusRcp://ODESIGN#REPRESENTATION_DESCRIPTION`. Using this approach, we would produce identifiers such as `siriusRcp://b0d9929d-10a4-4e5c-9020-fd85412b6070#7638d850-52e0-4c14-8290-83a2d11c9509`. Currently, only the last part of the identifier is used as the identifier `7638d850-52e0-4c14-8290-83a2d11c9509` in our example.


#### View

In a similar fashion, we could encode the origin of the representation description from the view DSL with something like `view://RESOURCE#REPRESENTATION_DESCRIPTION`. This would produce a fairly similar identifier as the previous one with things like `view://b0d9929d-10a4-4e5c-9020-fd85412b6070#7638d850-52e0-4c14-8290-83a2d11c9509`. In an application like Sirius Web, it would give us quite easily the identifier of the document which contains the representation description. It would thus remove the need to look everywhere in every projects to find where a representation description is coming from.


#### Representation descriptions created programmatically

Anything else would be used for representation descriptions created programmatically

title: NA
body:
:+1: for having more structured (and helpful) ids.
Regarding the details of the syntax, I'm wondering if we should generalize the syntax already used for elements kinds, and tend towards identifiying all our elements using the `siriusComponents://` scheme.

title: Creating an edge may mess with the position of other edges
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- Cloud

### Screenshots

...

### Expected behavior

The edge between _GPU_ and _DSP_ stays in place after the creation of the edge between _Radar_Capture_ and _Motion_Engine_

### Actual behavior

The edge between _GPU_ and _DSP_ is completely overlapped after the creation of the edge between _Radar_Capture_ and _Motion_Engine_

title: NA
body:
The problem comes from the way edge IDs are calculated.

To calculate edge IDs we are using the edge description id, the source id, the target id, and the index of the edge in its container, which is the diagram itself.

Starting from a diagram without any edge. If we create an edge its index will be _0_ and will give `id = a`. If we create another edge the renderer could consider the new edge has the index equals to _0_ which gives `id = b`. The renderer will consider the existing edge index will be _1_ which gives `id = c`, and thus, the renderer will not be able to retrieve layout data from the existing edge which has been stored with `id = a`. This is a problem since we are using IDs to retrieve layout data of existing element to let the layout engine computes the layout from the rendered diagram.

So, after the second render the layout engine will consider that both edges are new and use data to create the second edge to also create the first edge "again", which gives the _Actual behavior_.

title: NA
body: Some improvements have been made for https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1148 to compute edge IDs. The count is not based on the index in the edge container anymore. Now, it relies on the couple (`source id`, `target id`) which means the issue could happen the moment many edges are created between two same elements.

title: Opening a representation from a tab does not update the selection
body:
When a representation is opened from the explorer by clicking on it, it is opened *and* becomes the current selection.
This is also the case when it is opened from the "Representations" view.

However, when the same representation is re-opened by clicking on its tab (if it had been opened before), it becomes visible but is not actually selected:

![Image Pasted at 2022-3-28 10-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/160371826-9ddfc771-0b68-40ec-a7ca-1a174075ab26.png)

The diffrerent scenarios should be more consistent and result in the same state whichever UI action was chosen to open the representation.

title: Add the ability to minimize the content of a site
body:
We need the ability to minimize the content of a `<Site />` in order to have more space for the representation area. For that, we want to stop using the `<Accordion />` component from MaterialUI and instead use a vertical bar which will display the icons of the various views to display. When the user will click on one of those icons, the selected view should be displayed.

On a `<Site />` located on the right, the vertical bar should be located on the right and on the left for a `<Site />` located on the left. Each view should thus come with an icon (from MaterialUI) in order to identify the view in the vertical bar.

This change should not involve any change on the backend. The only difference in behavior will come from the fact that the views which are not displayed will be unmounted and as such they won't subscribe to the relevant subscription. This will help lower the CPU and Memory footprint of the `<Workbench />`.

An ADR will be required in order to describe at least the change in API for the contribution of new views. Unit tests should also be provided in order to validate the new behavior of the `<Site />`.

title: Add support for a tree widget in forms
body:
We need to be able to display trees in form representations. For that, we will rely on the `<TreeView />`from MaterialUI since the use of the tree representation would be overkill for our need and it would require a large refactoring of the explorer.

We will need to write an ADR showing the necessary GraphQL API for the tree widget in order support the needs of the `<TreeView />` along with the Java API of the tree widget description. We may need to discuss the ability (or not) to reuse the existing `TreeDescription` and `Tree` GraphQL type.

title: Add support for a ToggableAreaContainer in forms
body:
We need to provide support for a `ToggableAreaContainer` (if anyone has a better name, feel free to contribute it) which will be used to display several areas layout horizontally or vertically if there is enough room with a button for each area on top used to show / hide any area. As a result, it should be possible for the end user to select which area to view and to resize the browser / panels in which the `TogglableAreaContainer` is displayed to view its content horizontally or vertically.

An ADR will be necessary to fine tune the details regarding the API and behavior of the `ToggableAreaContainer` along with unit tests when the implementation will be submitted for review.

title: NA
NA
body: It makes sense to have this option on `Group` instead of creating another kind of widget just for that 👍

title: Add support for a "Related Elements" view
body: This new view should leverage the new `ToggableAreaContainer` and the tree widget support in forms in order to display the objects which are related to the current selection. It should support multiple selection entries like the details view. It should not provide a specific description, it will be up to the project reusing this view to provide one (like the explorer).

title: Add Support for Editing Context Action
body:
In order to allow for more flexibility, Stereotypes descriptions will be deleted and replaced by Editing Context Actions. 
They should be supported by both the programmatic API and the GraphQL API. The actions will be able to manipulate the editing context or contact a remote service.

title: Shapes for NodeStyle
body: Hi :)  I want to use some shapes for NodeStyle (e.g. Actor in your youtube demos). But the Spape select box displays "None". Probably, I should provide shape resources (svg, png, etc) in somewhere. How can I provide shapes to the sirius web example app built myself? Many thanks in advance for your consideration...

title: NA
body:
Hi.
At the moment there is no UI to add new shapes.
The only way to contribute shapes is to start the backend with the Java system propertyu `org.eclipse.sirius.web.customImages.path` pointing to a directory with the images you want. All images found inside the directory (recursively) will be added as custom images/shapes on startup by the [`CustomImagesLoader`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/backend/sirius-web-sample-application/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/sample/configuration/CustomImagesLoader.java).

title: NA
body:
It works :) Thanks very much for your quick response.
Best regards,

title: NA
body:
One more note for the interested users:

I realized that the custom images are loaded by [CustomImagesLoader](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/backend/sirius-web-sample-application/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/sample/configuration/CustomImagesLoader.java) and then stored in `customimage` table in the PostgreSql db. 

So,
-  It is sufficient that you can load the images in folder once, i.e., no need to use  [CustomImagesLoader](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/backend/sirius-web-sample-application/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/sample/configuration/CustomImagesLoader.java) by setting the system property in **each** app start.
- After a while, you may want to change the resources and want not-to-use the old images. In that case, I think that you may purge the unwanted images from the `customimage` table.

title: NA
body: Note that it is now possible for users to upload custom images, since https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1386 (available in [v2023.1.0](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/CHANGELOG.adoc#v202310)).

title: ConcurrentModificationException in ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter
body:
The following exception can easily occur when creating custom studios:

```
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: null
	at java.base/java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextNode(HashMap.java:1584) ~[na:na]
	at java.base/java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:1607) ~[na:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.emf.view.diagram.ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.createToolSections(ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.java:281) ~[sirius-components-emf-2022.3.7.jar!/:2022.3.7]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.emf.view.diagram.ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.convert(ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.java:146) ~[sirius-components-emf-2022.3.7.jar!/:2022.3.7]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.emf.view.ViewConverter.lambda$convert$2(ViewConverter.java:71) ~[sirius-components-emf-2022.3.7.jar!/:2022.3.7]
[...]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.emf.view.ViewConverter.convert(ViewConverter.java:57) ~[sirius-components-emf-2022.3.7.jar!/:2022.3.7]
```

This is probably caused by a85988f62a9e8fe2e9b70a582d79775327453f81 which made `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter` a singleton (`@Service`), but the conversion code is not thread-safe or even reentrant as it keeps some mutable state during the conversion in `convertedNodes` and `convertedEdges`.

It will be similar to sirius desktop's precondition/connection start precondition/connection complete precondition.

title: Edge layout is broken with diagram containing at list a node list item
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
- Cloud

### Screenshots

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7371042/165752419-bccfa25f-d3a9-4c9e-b782-9f92227cfe76.mp4

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a _domain_ model and _Domain_ diagram
2. Create two entities (A & B)
3. Create an edge (relation) between A and B (A is the source)
4. Create a self-loop edge (relation) on A (A is both the source and the target of the edge)
4a. If nothing wrong happen, try to move B. 

### Expected behavior

The first created edge stays in place.

### Actual behavior

The first create edge has a very strange layout

title: NA
body:
After a small analysis, it seems there are at least two issues (It may have some more):
- `NodePositionProvider#getNodeListItemPosition`: The algorithm may be wrong.
- There is a difference between the node list item positioning between `NodePositionProvider#getNodeListItemPosition` and `ContainmentUpdater#updateContentPosition`.

Those issues mark the NodeList that contains at least a node list item as _changed_. Since edges are layout every time their source or target is marked has changed, data used to calculate the position of a new edge will also affect existing edges.

title: NoSuchElementException when trying to export an empty diagram as SVG
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : 2022.3.9
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Linux

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create an empty diagram
2. Try to export it as SVG using the context menu in the explorer
3. Nothing happens from the user's point of view, but an exception is logged on the backend:

```
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present
	at java.base/java.util.Optional.get(Optional.java:148) ~[na:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.export.svg.DiagramExportService.computeViewBox(DiagramExportService.java:116) ~[classes/:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.export.svg.DiagramExportService.addSvgRoot(DiagramExportService.java:78) ~[classes/:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.export.svg.DiagramExportService.export(DiagramExportService.java:59) ~[classes/:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.handlers.ExportDiagramEventHandler.handle(ExportDiagramEventHandler.java:51) ~[classes/:na]
```

Why would someone want to export an empty diagram? Here in the example scenario it's triggered manually, but it could be part of a programmatic export/publication of all the diagrams in a project for example.

The technical issue is [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/backend/sirius-components-collaborative-diagrams/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/collaborative/diagrams/export/svg/DiagramExportService.java#L116) when the code does `this.xBeginPositions.stream().min(Double::compare).get();` on lists like `xBeginPositions` that might be empty (which is the case on an empty diagram).

title: NA
body: Note that the "SonarLint for Eclipse" plug-in highlights this potential issue when opening the file (that's how I found it when looking for something else in that file).

title: NA
body:
Seems to be related to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/7def1df13e88abaf63c3fcd3cfee4efef759774f#diff-3f2b8b215db497f666e84a8d10d3c8fe6b26e0c721245aada11d3e331bccd0e9R28 which (from my reading) allows for edges with no routing points at all.

@gcoutable do you think that is a possible explanation?

title: NA
body:
That is a possible explanation.
Before, edge anchors were the first and the last routing points. Now edge anchors are calculated from the `sourceAnchorRelativePosition` and `targetAnchorRelativePosition`. To get the exact edge start and edge end position look at `EdgeLabelPositionProvider#getCenterPosition`.
Now, routing points are used to route an edge only.

title: Move the label feature up in the generic Widget type
body:
https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1140 needs to be able to display a label for any of the widgets inside a `Group`.

In practice, all conrecte widgets types have a mandatory `label` attribute of type String, but the attribute is not defined on the generic [`AbstractWidget`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/backend/sirius-components-forms/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/forms/AbstractWidget.java) (on the backend) and [`Widget`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/frontend/src/form/Form.types.ts#L38) (on the frontend) types.

This change is just about moving the common `label` attribute up into the common Widget supertype.

@sbegaudeau I don't think an ADR is needed for this, but if you really want I can write one.

title: Add an optional icon for widgets
body:
For https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1140 we want to display a toggle button for each widget inside a `Group` to allow the user to hide/reveal them individually.
The planned UI needs a label and an icon for these toggle buttons.

For the labels, see https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1214.

Currently, none of the widgets have an associated icon. We do not want to overcrowd the default forms UI (details page, form representations) with an icon per widget, but *in the context of the toggle buttons for #1140*, we want to be able to display such an icon.

This change will add a new `iconURL` on all widgets, but will keep it optional.
For now it will only be used (if defined) in the toggle buttons group for #1140.

title: NA
body: Do we want such an iconURL to be optional and configurable? Couldn't we have some frontend hardcoded icon representing the type of widget (textfield, checkbox, tree, etc)?

title: NA
body:
I wanted to minimize the impact, but sure we could make it mandatory, even if we do not display the icons in the default _Details_ view.
I guess the form description editor itself has/should have icons for each type of widget, and the default provider for a given widget instance would use the one corresponding to its type.

title: NA
body: For the "configurable" part of the question: yes we want to be able to provide different icons for different instances of the same type of widgets. Case in point: the "Related Elements"  view (https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1141) will display (by default) 3 instances of the _Tree_ widget, and each should have a different icon.

title: Add support for reused node mappings (incl. border nodes) in the compatibility layer
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to find out if Sirius-web is mature enough to use for a few of our models. 

An example EMF model is shown below, where the `InPort` and `OutPort` classes are used as bordered nodes on the `Model` node.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2264267/170002889-24b4af9f-e749-4975-a76f-a47624911fbd.png)

In Eclipse-Sirius this is visualized as follows: (with an example model instance):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2264267/170028686-4aca30be-58f6-4dfa-85d3-94e1b1f5e7ea.png)

When trying to deploy this in Sirius web, the `Port`s are not shown and the log says when trying to create border nodes:
`The representation with the id 00d9eef6-0961-35c4-a7eb-535e87620512 does not exist`

Any idea how to solve this? Are bordered nodes supported at all?

title: NA
body:
Hi.

Border nodes are normally supported. It's difficult to know what's going wrong in your case without more details:
* Given the example from Sirius Destkop, I assume you are using an existing odesign file? How is it defined? In particular the border nodes mapping and their creation tool.
* You mention ports are not showing, I assume this means the Model and InputFiles are correctly displayed?

title: NA
body:
Hi,
Thanks for the quick response. 
Yes: Model and InputFile are correctly displayed.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2264267/170111335-a9e1aea8-a16e-47e5-b881-247414ff3882.png)


I am using an existing odesign file. I've attached the odesign for reference (as a txt file). I read that reused bordered node mappings currently don't work. This is actually the case for the InputFile class (where I reuse them from the Model class), but I'd expect that adding bordered nodes to `Model` should still work (and is ignored for InputFile). The behavior I see when I add an InPort to a Model, the model object in the tree on the left is replaced by the InPort in the visualisation.
Manually adding an InPort to a Model in the tree does not visualize it either (but gives the same error in the log)


[emi.odesign.txt](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/files/8765540/emi.odesign.txt)

title: NA
body: Note that reused nodes (incl. border nodes) are now supported for diagrams using the View DSL (which replaces the odesign files for Sirius Web), but this is not supported in the compatibility layer (which reads odesign files).

title: Remove the two hardcoded dependencies to Spring MVC from Sirius Components
body:
The diagram SVG export has introduced a hardcoded dependency to Spring MVC at two specific locations:

- The `DelegatingRequestContextExecutorService` and its related classes
- The `ImageRegistry`

The first dependency can easily be extracted since we already provide an extension mechanism to let applications integrating Sirius Components customize the executor service used. We just need to provide the default Spring MVC implementation somewhere else in a dedicated projects where we can isolate this dependency.

The second one can also easily be mitigated since the `ImageRegistry` does not have any interfaces, applications integrating Sirius Components cannot replace its behavior without having to fork it. Extracting this class in such a project would simplify the use of Sirius Components.

We could fulfill this goal with a project like `sirius-components-starter-web` which would both contain the default implementation of the executor service and which would register automatically the `ImageRegistry` service.

title: Regression: Create View does not work anymore on studios
body:
[This change](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/1161/files#diff-793124e970aba6af45770ad845fbe6244dbb869ccac16d01de170fdc02358698R444) introduced a regression which breaks the use of the "Create View" operation in studios to create new views for unsynchronized nodes.
The "Create View" operation (for example inside a "Drop Tool") correctly creates a _Create View Request_, but when actually trying to render the corresponding nodes, `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.getUnsynchronizedSemanticElements(VariableManager, NodeDescription)` is called to find the actual semantic elements for which (unsynchronized) nodes should be rendered. `getUnsynchronizedSemanticElements()` is supposed to return the list of these semantic elements (used [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/backend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/diagrams/components/NodeComponent.java#L81)), but since 9947fcd9dee740fa3d8b1d21780cad0b40295b71 it returns a list of `Optional` wrapping these elements. Then `targetObjectId` computed for these optional is null, so the nodes are not rendered...

title: NA
body:
I don't know the details of the actions you do create your node, but it seems your semantic model references an EMF object (autoDesigner1.impl.NodeImpl@215e3e82) which is not *contained* inside any resource. These kinds of "free floating" elements are not supported by EMF (or more precisely they work perfectly fine as long as everything stays in memory but prevent serialization).

Check that when you create the "Node" instance it is actually added inside a proper containment reference and lives inside your model/resource.

title: NA
body:
This is not related to Sirius Web, it's purely about Sirius Desktop.
That said, it seems the expected behavior: if you run the validation inside an Eclipse runtime where your metamodel only exists in the workspace but is not installed/loaded in the running instance, the metamodel is not known to the validation code (which itself runs inside the Eclipse instance).

title: NA
body:
I'm not sure I understand what you mean by "a new popup should be shown".

If you mean a sub-menu in the contextual palette, as shown in the screenshot, we only support one level. Each combo/section in the palette [corresponds to a tool section in the odesign](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/backend/sirius-components-compatibility/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/compatibility/services/diagrams/CompatibilityToolSectionsProvider.java#L87).

If you mean "open a dialog box" (where the user can select a more specific type), this is not supported at the moment.

- Cloud

### Screenshots

...

### Steps to reproduce

When an Enum has a literal not equals to its name, then in the PropertySections the name is used by default for the label and for the new value. 
It causes two problems:
- The label displays the name (the literal is meant for that as it allows values with special characters)
- When trying to apply a new value, it causes an error.

By using literal instead of name in both label provider and new value handler, there are no more problems.

title: The layout of edge is broken
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- my computer: Windows
- Cloud

### Steps to reproduce

1. Import the project [Broken Egde Studio.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/files/9027734/Broken.Egde.Studio.zip)
2. Create a project, a model, and the root entity based on the `brokenEdge` domain
3. Create a new diagram based on the `Broken Edge Description`
4. Create three entities
5. Create an edge between two of them
6. Create another edge between two different entities
7. Try to move each entity separately

### Expected behavior

When the second edge is created, the first created edge should not be moved.
When entities are moved separately, edges should follow their ends.

### Actual behavior

When the second edge is created, the first created edge is moved to the same location as the newly created one (they overlap each other).
When entities are moved separately, some edges seem to fly.

title: Rename SiriusWebJSONResourceFactoryImpl to JSONResourceFactoryImpl
Add support for inter model references
body:
### Add support for having a scheme for resource URI used in EMFEditingContext
A valid URI must have a scheme.
Every application based on `sirius-component` should instantiate a resource in a ResourceSet with a valid URI otherwise some part of EMF may raise an IllegalArgumentException (URI.resolve for example)

This ticket adds support to help applications instantiate JSON resource with a common scheme

### Add support to serialize necessary data for intermodel resource
The concrete type of the proxy from an object1 of resource1 to an object2 of a resource2 should be serialized so that it can correctly be resolved .

The core behavior of Sirius Components relies on having some data fetchers which are currently located in Sirius Web. Giving access to those data fetchers directly in Sirius Components would allow consumers of Sirius Components to setup their Sirius Components based application more easily.

This will mostly be a transfer of code from Sirius Web to Sirius Components.

title: Add support for injecting platform services/beans into Java service classes used by studios
body:
Studio definitions are configured using the View DSL, which (by design) has a limited scope. For more complex operations it is possible to drop down to Java using service classes/methods invoked from AQL expressions and registered with an `IJavaServiceProvider`.

However, the way these Java service classes are currently instantiated means they can not have access to the APIs the platform defines (e.g. `IObjectService`) and thus their power is very limited.

We need to allow for these Java service classes to be injected with the platform services/beans they need.

title: The selectedNode variable is not defined at all when dropping on a diagram's background
Provide high-level APIs that can be used by studio makers in their Java services
body:
With https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1318 it is possible for a studio maker to inject any bean available in the platform inside their Java service classes.
While this is technically enough, it is not obvious for a studio maker to know which beans to inject and how to use them for common tasks.
We should provide a few high-level APIs for common tasks that studio makers will often need.
The first and most obivous set of services correspond to the ability to create or delete views for unsynchronized mappings (e.g. to be called inside the body a of "Drop Tool").

title: The convertedNodes variable is not exposed consistently in View-based diagrams
body: `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter` exposes the `convertedNodes` variable in the context of node creation tools, but not in others (in particular the drop handler) where it could be useful.

title: NA
body:
From a quick look at the code, it seems that this variable is exposed only once and never used anywhere in our code (it can be used in a View instance but I haven't seen one using this). What kind of use cases do you have in mind for this variable?

We should probably list somewhere the various variables available -.-

title: NA
body:
It's currently needed for some studios which use Java services.
Inside the Java service you may need to reference instances of `org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.description.NodeDescription` (for example to build a `ViewCreationRequest`).
Inside that service, if you need to locate "the `description.NodeDescription` which corresponds to the `view.NodeDescription` named 'MyDomainClass_Description'", the easiest way at the moment is to find it in this map with something like:

```java
convertedNodes.entrySet().stream()
  .filter(entry -> entry.getKey().getName().equals("MyDomainClass_Description"))
  .map(Map.Entry::getValue)
  .findFirst();
```

There might be other ways to do this without the map, searching inside the converted `DiagramDescrition` and relying on how `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.idProvider` currently works, but its even more convoluted and seems brittle.

Ideally, https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1328 would provide injectable APIs that hide all this complexity from the studio makers and render this variable useless, but in the meantime this variables enables these scenarios.

title: Potential resource/document leak when renaming a domain
body:
Steps to reproduce (in Sirius Web):

1. Create a new domain named 'foo' with some types/classes
2. In another project, create a new document with instances of the 'foo' domain types inside
3. Go back to the domain definition, and rename the domain from 'foo' to 'bar'
4. Try to reopen the project with the instance: the previously created document is not visible (which, in a way, is expected)

In the database, the document with instances of 'foo' is still present, and will be there "forever" (at least until the enclosing project is deleted) as there is no way for users to access it and delete it, or even know it is there.
Even the server of DB admins do not have any easy way to detect these "dead" documents and GC them.

Note that the documents can be "brought back from the dead" if the domain is renamed with its original name 'foo'.

title: NA
body:
While I agree 100% with everything you said here, this issue is bigger than Sirius Components. It may be specific to the way we do things in Sirius Web. We could clean those unusable objects from the editing context while we are loading it in Sirius Web. I am not sure if that's the responsibility of Sirius Components to handle this.

There does not seems to be a single piece of code in Sirius Components which uses `DomainConverter.convert(Domain)` so  it's more a lifecycle issue on the use of the DomainConverter and the lifecycle of the editing context by Sirius Web which is the issue.

It looks like a Sirius Web specific issue to me.

title: Get the documentId in sirius-web
body:
Hi everyone,
is it possible to get the documentId of  the current representation through a graphql request?
Or can I access it somehow in the "DiagramWebSocketContainer.tsx" of the frontend?

title: NA
body: A representation may not be related to a specific document. So in theory there are no links between a representation and a document. The tree representation used by the explorer is for example link only with the editing context.

title: NA
body:
> A representation may not be related to a specific document. So in theory there are no links between a representation and a document. The tree representation used by the explorer is for example link only with the editing context.

Thank you for the reply. I actually ment the editing context. I want to access the documentId in the "DiagramWebSocketContainer.tsx"

title: NA
body:
`DiagramWebSocketContainer` (now called `DiagramRepresentation`) manages a single diagram at a time, and there is no specific `documentId` associated to a given diagram.

Representations (incl. diagram) are not Documents, and not stored *in* Documents. They appear inside the structure of a Document in the explorer because they are "attached" to a specific semantic element, which itself belongs to a document, but that's all.

### Steps to reproduce

* Create a NodeTool or EdgeTool using a service that returns null.

* The error message appears (and still happing after but this mis another problem)


### Expected behavior

In such case, I would expect no error to appear.

The workaround is to always return an object but it often ends up with odd code in the service.

An error message appears saying that something went wrong with the execution of the tool.

title: NA
body: Is it that odd/complicated to just `return self`?

title: NA
body:
First, I find it is not really intuitive.

But my main problem that it makes my code inconsistent.

I have a creation service that should return the new instance. However, in some cases the creation might fail (for some business reasons). It seems a bit strange in that case to return _self_.

I found it a bit strange to document the return value of my service like this,  "Return the new instance or self if the creation fails?"
Moreover, what happen if there is another operation using that service result. Returning self would maybe do unwanted stuff and hide a bug.  Returning null would fail and make it clearer.

title: NA

When implementing a deletion service. If the service returns void the same kind of error occurs. 
In such case it seems to me that returning an object is a bit weird.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a project with a View model
2. On the low-level View element, create a "Form description" object
3. On the Form object, create a new "Form Description Editor" representation

The new name is taken into account, reflected in the whole UI, and persisted.

### Actual behavior

The new name is not taken into account, reflected in the whole UI, and persisted.

title: Semantic Candidates Expression are bypassed on Unsynchronized children nodes
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [ ] **I have specified the version** : 2022.7.14
* [ ] **I have specified my environment** :  All

### Steps to reproduce

* Create a modeler with a node with _Unsynchronized_ children. On _Ecore_ create a container node for _EClass_ and creates children node for each features using query _aql:self.getEAllStructuralFeatures()_.
* Create an EClass _A_ with one feature _feature1_ and an EClass _B_ that inherits from _A_
* Create a diagram with a view for _B_ and a view for _feature1_ in _B_ (_feature1_ can be displayed in _B_ since it inherits from _A_)
* Using the property view, remove _A_ from the _superType_ of _B_

### Expected behavior

The view of _feature1_ should be deleted since it no more belongs to the result of the _semanticCandatesExpression_

### Actual behavior

The view of _feature1_ remains.

The idea here would be to rename each file's prefix `sirius-web-spring-*` to `sirius-components-*`.

title: Add support for a basic Image view widget
body: A basic Image widget which simply displays an image from an arbitrary URL (computed by the backend). - No user interaction on it, just displaying an ``. - Can be used to display images hosted by the backend itself (i.e. `/api/images/*`), but could possibly be used to display images from anywhere else. - Available in the core, in the View DSL and in the visual form editor.

title: Switch to Spring Boot 3 and Java 17
body:
This change will only be performed after the general availability of Spring Boot 3 (we won't move to a milestone). We may not switch to the release 3.0.0 just after its release and we may wait for a 3.0.x or even a 3.1.x release. This issue is just here to start discussing this migration and the changes required by this new version.

See https://spring.io/blog/2022/05/24/preparing-for-spring-boot-3-0

title: NA
body:
Among the changes which may impact us :

- Switch from `javax.xxx` dependencies to `jakarta.xxx` for example `import javax.servlet` to `import jakarta.servlet`
- Potential switch to `PathPatternParser` from the `AntPatternParser` (not strictly required but encouraged)

title: NA
body: See https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/releases/tag/v3.0.0

title: NA
body:
Things to consider:

- Spring Security 5.8 to prepare the migration to Spring Security 6.0.0 [here](https://docs.spring.io/spring-security/reference/5.8/migration/servlet/config.html)
- Migration to Spring security 6.0 [here](https://docs.spring.io/spring-security/reference/migration/index.html)
- Spring Data 2022.0 release notes [here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/wiki/Spring-Data-2022.0-%28Turing%29-Release-Notes)

We will have to keep in mind that:

- Methods like `authorizeRequests` and `antMatchers` have been deprecated in Spring Security 5.8 and removed in 6.0 and this will have some impact on our security configuration. By switching from Spring Boot 2.7.x to Spring Boot 3.X, we will directly move from Spring Security 5.7.x to Spring Security 6.x and thus encounter the API breaks in question.
- We are extending `PagingAndSortingRepository` in multiple interfaces in `sirius-web-persistence` and this interface will now longer extend `CrudRepository` so any piece of code using things like `IProjectRepository` or `IDocumentRepository` would stop having access to methods such as `findById`, `delete`, `save`. To restore this behavior, our various repositories will have to switch to `extends PagingAndSortingRepository<XXX, YYY>, ListCrudRepository<XXX, YYY>`.

We may also encounter some changes in websocket support or method security, but I haven't evaluated those parts yet.

title: NA
body:
The migration to Spring Boot 3.0.x will be put on hold for now since it will require a new version of AQL which will have to rely on Antlr 4.10 like the [recent versions of hibernate](https://github.com/hibernate/hibernate-orm/discussions/4975). After multiple tests, hibernate cannot work with anything less than Antler 4.10 and AQL does not work with this version. It's a bit surprising since AQL, which requires Antler 4.7.2 was working fine with Antler 4.8 at least (with a red warning in the console).

The code required for the migration is done, it works until you have to evaluate and AQL expression.

title: NA
body: https://spring.io/blog/2023/01/11/spring-framework-6-0-4-available-now

title: NA
body: If we stay on Spring Boot 2.7 for now, we should upgrade to the latest. As of yesterday this is https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/releases/tag/v2.7.8

title: The edge creation feedback is still activated when the connector tool tries to display available tools
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- my computer: Windows

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7371042/193235541-c8b89308-399f-4b9f-a4dc-a103de02d374.png)

### Steps to reproduce

#### Create View

1. Create a Diagram Description in a new View Model (domain type: `flow::System`)
2. Add a Node Description (domain type: `flow::CompositeProcessor`)
3. Add an Edge Description (domain type: `flow::DataFlow`)
4. Add two edge Tool for the Edge Description (no need to make them actually do something)

#### Reproduce

1. In the same project, create a robot flow model
2. Create a new diagram based on the created diagram description above
3. Create an edge using the connector tool (first tool in the palette)

### Expected behavior

A sub-menu should display the two edge creation tool defined in the edge description.

### Actual behavior

An error is raised instead of displaying available tools and, the edge creation feedback is still activated.

title: NA
body: The issue may be fixed by making the payload from `GetConnectorToolsEventHandler` not return a `null` payload.

title: NA
body:
> The issue may be fixed by making the payload from `GetConnectorToolsEventHandler` not return a `null` payload.

That will not be enough (I tested). If the handler returns an empty list of candidate tools, the frontend never displays the context menu, so no edge tool is invoked.
1. The end user gets zero feedback about what is wrong.
2. The `edgeCreationFeedback.reset()` is never called on the frontend (it's normally invoked after we call a tool), so the edge creaation feedback stays active.

title: NA
Move Sirius Web to the Sirius Components repository
Allow users to upload their own custom images
body:
Currently the only way to add custom images to the backend so that they can be used is via APIs (see `org.eclipse.sirius.web.sample.configuration.CustomImagesLoader` for example).

It should be possible for end-users to upload their own custom images via the web interface. The resulting images should then automatically be usable:
* in diagrams as the image for an `ImageNodeStyle`;
* in forms via the `Image` widget (see #1381).

- latest

- All

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28688370/195862192-04f04c22-f97f-4b06-ad76-d3da972a1cc5.png)


### Steps to reproduce

```
cd vscode-extension
npm ci
npm run compile
vsce package
```
Import the resulting `.vsix` file as extension in VSCode.

### Expected behavior

The image is displayed.

### Actual behavior

Error 404 due to the fact that VSCode is looking for the image in the repository instead of packaging it in the `vsix` file. Since the image is not in `/images` but in `/vscode-extension/images`, VSCode cannot find it.

title: Unable to build project on windows
NA
body:
Hello,

This is a known issue.
Since the prettier v2.0.0, the _end of line_ option changed from `auto` to `lf` (https://prettier.io/docs/en/options.html#end-of-line)

We have a fix being addressed here https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/1380
In the meantime you can execute `npx turbo run format` before `npx turbo run start`.

That being said, windows users may meet another build issue without a proper npm `script-shell` configuration.
To build the package `@eclipse-sirius/sirius-components-diagrams` the command `mkdir` command is required.
According to the [npm documentation](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v8/using-npm/config#script-shell) the default value for `script-shell` configuration on windows is `cmd.exe` which does not support the `mkdir` command.

You can set the `script-shell` configuration with the following command:
`npm config set script-shell "path\\to\\bash.exe"`.

We should document this in the `README.md` for Windows users.

title: Remove useless fields from most representation descriptions
body: Fields such as `DiagramDescription#tools` or even most handlers should be removed as they are using the representation descriptions as delivery boys since we lack the proper identification mechanisms to distinguish the origin or our representations, and thus the behavior to adopt.

title: Add the ability to retrieve the source of a representation description
body:
An URL could at the very least help us identify representation descriptions created from the view DSL, the Sirius desktop compatibility layer or programmatically and thus simplify countless of situation where we do not know how to interact with a representation.

It could also increase the performances of the application since we may not have to scan all the view document in the database to figure out where a representation description is coming from.

title: NA
body: This has been done months ago.

title: Disable spell-checking on text fields
body:
The text fields displayed by the _Form_ representation have spell-checking enabled (it's the default). In the majority of cases, these text fields are used for technical information (part names/identifiers, AQL expressions, CSS colors etc.) which end up littered with red squiggles:

![Capture d’écran du 2022-10-18 14-10-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/196425849-7c312db3-1d5f-4388-9223-fd97d7fadf89.png)
![Capture d’écran du 2022-10-18 14-10-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/196425853-0037fab1-8673-43ca-9cda-0f3a5e66f4a8.png)
![Capture d’écran du 2022-10-18 14-10-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/196425856-afc38896-0a2f-4ec9-a8e7-8ff3ec6fb95f.png)

This sends the signal to the user that something is wrong with his names or expressions even if they are correct.

title: The inner label of a node could overlap the border node
body:
### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4439675/197498644-1dfcb59e-e722-40cb-9462-8b2bf6d4f629.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a domain model in a new project
2. Create a Domain representation
3. Add an `Entity`
4. Update the name of the entity with a very long name

### Expected behavior

The padding-left and the padding-right should always look the same.

### Actual behavior

The label could overlap the border node.

title: NA
body:
Under Chromium/Linux, I see a difference of about 1.85% between the label width computed/esimated on the backend using AWT (in `org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.TextBoundsProvider.computeBounds(LabelStyle, String)`) and what the browser shows (as indicated by the `getBoundingClientRect().width)` on the `text.sprotty-label` element).

![2022-10-25_08-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/197704828-3e3cff48-3f7b-43eb-8f61-3a8a745da32b.png)

If I hard-code the corresponding adjustement on the backend computation:
```java
double height = labelBounds.getHeight() * 1.0185;
double width = labelBounds.getWidth() * 1.0185;
```

This fixes the issue *in this particular configuration* (not sure how reliable/portable that is):

![2022-10-25_08-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/197705076-a81cbc47-030d-4c15-9651-8b1b3a127541.png)

title: NA
body: Note that the difference is already present on smaller labels, but not as visible. With a much smaller text like `NewEntity`, the backend estimates the width to 72.0px, but in Chromium the label's width is 73.38px.

title: Improve the customization of parametric SVG
body:
We should be able to customize the layout of a specific parametric SVG like adding a wider label padding right.
The actual behavior does not make that possible:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4439675/197499273-54c4f3b2-272b-4f02-a8bf-d4555ad5f060.png)

title: NA
body:
If I understand things correctly we can currently configure ELK for all SVG mapping but not one kind of mapping specifically ?

I haven’t looked in details to the code of the SVG integration but is the padding around the label something which has to be configured in ELK or could it be specified in the SVG directly with some padding there?

title: NA
body:
Currently, we have no information regarding the Label in the SVG image. 
So the idea was to have a way to add ELK information by Parametric SVG type.

Basically in this use case I would like to express for a Parametric Image of type "Note" set the width of the figure always X pixel bigger than the label. 
I'm not sure it if it is related but in the case of a Package, I would like to express the fact that the children should not be moved in the top box header. But in that case it depends on the size of the header, so I don't think it related.

title: NA
body:
Thanks to [custom node](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/2499), you can manage the label rendering as you wish.



![Image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/128395825/3fbf4f32-eba6-4e11-a761-27323342518e)

title: Apply the (static) styles defined for widgets to their "preview" in the Form Description Editor
body: When configuring forms using the Form Description Editor, the widgets visible in the editor all have the default styles. For the `WidgetDescriptionStyle` attributes which are static (not computed expressions, not in conditional styles which depend on dynamic expression evaluation), the widgets' preview should show directly the customized style value (e.f. foreground and background colors, text style, etc.).

title: NA
body:
`FormDescriptionEditorComponent` creates instances of the same `FormDescriptionEditorWidgetComponent` type for all types of widgets, but the actual style properties are different for each one.

I see two options:
1. we pass some generic structure with all the style properties, determined reflectively/dynamicaly, and re-interpret this generic "style map" on the front in each widget (e.g. `sirius-components-formdescriptioneditors/src/LabelWidget.tsx`) to display them.
2. we create specialized types of components/props (on the back) and widgets/widget props (on the front).

The second option would be more type-safe, but involves *a lot* of additional, very boring and mechanical code.

title: NA
Add support for action buttons on groups/sections
body:
- [ ] Add `org.eclipse.sirius.components.forms.Group.buttons : List<org.eclipse.sirius.components.forms.Button>`
  - Update the GraphQL Schema, the `GroupDescription`, `GroupComponent` etc. to allow the description and rendering of these.
- [ ] Update `FormEventFragments` to fetch the new field `Group { buttons }`
- [ ] Update `Group.tsx` on the front to display the buttons in group's header
  - Actual UI to be defined.
  - Reuse `ButtonPropertySection` for the actual implementation, but this may be by copy/paste instead of trying to extract some shared code.
- [ ] Update `view.ecore` to allow the configuration of these buttons from the View DSL.
- [ ] Update the _Form Description Editor_ to allow for adding/removing buttons *on groups*
  - The Form Description Editor does not support the definition of additional groups. It's basically for designing a single Group. So buttons will be dropped in a single new drop area at the top of the preview area.

title: Better organization for diagram palette tool sections containing a large amount of tools
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The tool sections on the diagram palette should be able to display any amount of tools with suitable UX.

Currently, if a tool section contains more than about 10 tools the vertical list can easily overflow out of the browser's window and is hard to read anyway if it doesn't.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

* Sub tool sections
* Tools displayed in something more flexible than a vertical list

title: Provide diagram and diagram elements ids in addition of the semantic elements to the style providers
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Implementations of style providers may want to compute the style of nodes and edges depending on the state of the diagram rather than the state of the semantic model, in which case the variable manager supplied to the style providers should contain the diagram and the ids of the diagram elements that are being styled.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: NA
body:
We can provide some ids but we can't give you the Node, Edge or Diagram instance.

We, the `NodeComponent`, are asking you, the `NodeDescription.getStyleProvider()`  to provide us with the style that will be used to create the `Node`, after that we will create the `Diagram` once all the nodes and edges are computed.

We can't give you the instance because we can't create them without the style but we could give you the `nodeId`.

title: NA
body: Well the nodeId is enough for the particular case I need it for, I thought the previous diagram might be useful in other cases but we indeed don't have the previous diagram in NodeComponent.

title: Selecting an element in a diagram can hide others
body:
Selecting a diagram element in Sprotty can change the order of the element in question and its related elements.
It can hide edges between those other elements.

Those edges should either stay visible or the order of the elements should be preserved.

title: The hover and selection feedback are broken on parametric svgs
Add the possibility to hide and fade diagram elements

title: Textarea widgets created from the Form Description Editor do not have a default style
body:
In the Form Description editor, creating a new widget by DnD from the sidebar normally creates a widget and its corresponding default style.
This is not the case for _TextArea_ widgets.
This is due to `AddWidgetEventHandler.createStyle(WidgetDescription)` which tries to create the style instance reflexively using assumptions on the name of the style which does not hold for _Text Areas_:
```java
widgetDescription.eClass().getName() + "Style"
```
In the case of the _Text Area_, the names are `TextAreaDescription` and `TextareaDescriptionStyle` (note the `A` _vs_ `a`).

Breaking change for current FormDescription implementations.

title: Add a mechanism to filter synchronized edges using source and target node

In some case we want to prevent the creation of a synchronized edge only based on graphical element.

A solution would be to have access to a _preconditionExpression_ called on all _source_ and _target_ pair that would prevent the creation using graphical business rules.

### Potential side effects

title: Add the possibility to provide the value used to initialize the direct edit tool textfield
body:

### Expected behavior

title: The id of a converted DiagramDescription/NodeDescription/etc. depend on its index in the View model, which is not stable
body:
In `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.convert(RepresentationDescription, AQLInterpreter)`  when we convert a View-based DiagramDescription into an actual Java DiagramDescription, we do this:

```java
String diagramDescriptionURI = EcoreUtil.getURI(viewDiagramDescription).toString();
return DiagramDescription.newDiagramDescription(UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes(diagramDescriptionURI.getBytes()).toString())
```

i.e. the id of the resulting DiagramDescription is based on the View model element's URI... which includes its index. Something like `sirius:///d79a46d4-272b-49f9-b1a5-747f778853ea#//@descriptions.1`. This index is *not* stable.

1. Create a View model with two diagram descriptions D1 and D2 (they can be empty).
2. In another project, create an instance of D2.
3. Go back in the View model, and delete D1. It was not used anywhere so this should not have any impact.
4. Try to reopen the instance of D2:

```
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at java.base/java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:221) ~[na:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.DiagramContext.update(DiagramContext.java:53) ~[sirius-components-collaborative-diagrams-2022.9.8.jar:2022.9.8]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.DiagramEventProcessor.<init>(DiagramEventProcessor.java:89) ~[sirius-components-collaborative-diagrams-2022.9.8.jar:2022.9.8]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.DiagramEventProcessorFactory.createRepresentationEventProcessor(DiagramEventProcessorFactory.java:82) ~[sirius-components-collaborative-diagrams-2022.9.8.jar:2022.9.8]
```

Indeed, we try to find the diagram description for D2, but it does not exist anymore at the expected id. Because we re-convert the current version of the View model on-demand, `DynamicRepresentationDescriptionService.findDynamicRepresentationDescriptions(IEditingContext)` will return, for the same D2 description, a Java DiagramDescription with a different id.

Note that in this particular case the id we search for does not exist anymore.
I think it is also possible (though I have not tested) for a diagram to "change its nature", for example if in the View model I had a D3 *after* D2. Once D1 is removed, D3 "steals" the id previously used by D2. Re-opening an existing D2 instance would transform it into a D3...

title: NA
body: Note that this does not only concern the representation descriptions, but also all the elements inside, e.g. the different NodeDescription inside a particular diagram.

title: NA
Charts widgets created in the Form Description Editor are incomplete/invalid
body:
When creating a BarChart or PieChart in the Form Description Editor (by DnD), the WidgetDescription instances created are incomplete. In particular they have no `name`, which causes an NPE in `ViewFormDescriptionConverterSwitch.casePieChartDescription(PieChartDescription)` or `ViewFormDescriptionConverterSwitch.caseBarChartDescription(BarChartDescription)` (on `.label(viewPieChartDescription.getName())`).

Once one of these widgets have been added, and until the user configures them properly, the resulting Form Description is invalid. It can not be instanciated, and existing instances of the form can not be re-opened: `ViewConverter.convert()` catches the NPE and returns nothing for this form description.

This is related to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/1449#issuecomment-1303624548: the way `AddWidgetEventHandler` creates instances of the Widget Description classes can not ensure they are well-formed.

For this particular issue we could try and initialize the `BarCharDescrption` and `PieChartDescription` with non-broken values in `AddWidgetEventHandler` but that is rather _ad-hoc_.
Note than setting a non-null name is not enough: it fixes the conversion but produces a Form which crashes when rendered.

title: The id of a converted DiagramDescription/NodeDescription/etc. depend on its parent document's id, which is not portable
body:
This is similar to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1470 but occurs in different scenarios.

1. Create a view with a diagram description
2. In another project, create an instance of that diagram
3. Export the view project and the instance project in two zips
4. Either delete both projects or switch to a different instance of Sirius Web
5. Import the project with the view definition (should be OK)
6. Import the project with the diagram instance: this fails.

The backend shows in its logs that the representation stored in the instance project's archive could not be recreated.

What happens is that the `diagramDescriptionId` is computed like this:

```java
String diagramDescriptionURI = EcoreUtil.getURI(viewDiagramDescription).toString();
return DiagramDescription.newDiagramDescription(UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes(diagramDescriptionURI.getBytes()).toString())
```

i.e. it depends on the URI of the `viewDiagramDescription`, which is of the form:

```
sirius:///4553afdc-10bb-452c-a06e-85f7aa288e80#//@descriptions.0
```

and thus depends on **the enclosing document id**.

When the exported view is re-imported the second time, it is in a new document which will get a different UUID. The diagram description created from this re-imported version will get a `diagramDescription` which *can not* match the one stored in the diagram instance.

Note that the issue will occur even if the view and diagram instance are exported/imported in the same project. `ProjectImporter` adjusts explicit id references to the id changes but here the reference is not directly to the modified document id but to a UUID derived from it.

title: Add Cypress tests to Sirius Components

title: Canonical creation tools from contextual toolbar have no icons
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- 2022.11.13
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- my computer: macOS

### Screenshots

![ToolNoIcon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/717752/207323270-7412de3c-7d04-42fc-b29d-75360c39739b.png)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Your SiriusWeb instance should not have the Domain package, only View package
2. Create a View model 
3. Create a Diagram Description that applies on an existing class from a metamodel (not from a Domain)
4. Create a valid Node that applies on an existing class from the same metamodel
5. Create a Diagram from the Diagram Description
6. Click on the diagram background: a creation tool is provided by default, based on the Diagram Description and the View.

### Expected behavior

The canonical creation tool provided by default should have an icon, ideally the icon associated to the EClass/DomainClass.

### Actual behavior

The canonical creation tool provided by default doesn't have any icon.

### Help resources

The problem comes from `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.java`. `String NODE_CREATION_TOOL_ICON = "/img/Entity.svg";` & `EDGE_CREATION_TOOL_ICON = "/img/Relation.svg";` refer to SVG coming from Domain package.

### Solution proposed

1. `String NODE_CREATION_TOOL_ICON = "/img/Entity.svg";` & `EDGE_CREATION_TOOL_ICON = "/img/Relation.svg";` should refer to SVG from View package.

2. Canonical creation tools should try to get icons associated to the EClass/DomainClass and fallback to a default icon on failure.
