This could/should be available on all representations (e.g. forms) as there is nothing really diagram-specific in it.
The only issue is that currently only diagrams have a "toolbar" at the top where this kind of operations can be surfaced.
An option would be to make this kind of toolbar more generic/present on all representations, or to move this button elsewhere (in the context menu of the representation in the explorer, somewhere in the tab-bar...).

title: Most view model operations fail to be executed without a change context
body:
In `OperationInterpreterViewSwitch`, most operations start with finding `self`. If it does not exist the model operation is not considered. It does not matter if the root model operation does not use the variable self. If all the tools do not start with a change context, they will not work. We can't do a simple setValue without starting with a change context in an edge tool for example since it relies on `semanticEdgeSource` and `semanticEdgeTarget`, we have to affect `semanticEdgeSource` to `self` to get started.

The value of `self` is not even used in this class, it's just to check if something called `self` is available.

Hi,
This repository is for Sirius Web.
Your issue concerns Sirius Desktop which, for the moment, is still hosted on the Eclipse Foundation's infrasructure. In particular, issues related to Sirius Desktop should be created on [the Eclipse Bugzilla](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/enter_bug.cgi?product=Sirius).

title: Disable the diagram actions which cannot be used in read only
body: Some actions in the toolbar, key bindings, and palette may still be enabled when a diagram is in read only

title: NodeStyleDescription can only express square shapes
body:
It should be possible to specify the width and height of nodes separately.
Currently we have a single expression which is expected to return a single number that is used for both dimensions: `size = Size.of(computedSize, computedSize)`

Options:

1. replace `sizeComputationExpression` with separate `widthComputationExpression` and `heightComputationExpression`: simple to understand and implement, makes it possible to specify one dimension of not the other, but breaks existing diagram modeles and adds yet more elements in an already crowded details view.
2. allow `sizeComputationExpression` to return full-blown `Size` objects, either as a string representation (`aql:'150,' + self.computedHeight()`) or with a new globally acessible service: `aql:self.makeSize(150, self.computedHeight()`). Feels cleaner but more costly to implement and brittle in the case of a string-based representation (need to define the syntax, to parse it properly).

title: EditingContextCompletionProposalsDataFetcher is never used
body: `EditingContextCompletionProposalsDataFetcher` introduced in #1426 is never used.

title: Make the default/canonical tools' behavior callable from standard AQL expressions and/or operations
body:
The behaviors of the "canonical" tools which are applied on a View-based diagram when no tool is specified is hard-coded inside an opaque/internal class.

It should be possible to invoke them explicitly from inside a user-defined tools, using either a plain AQL expressions (through Java services) or if that is not possible through reified `org.eclipse.sirius.components.view.Operation`s.

title: NA
body:
The tools/behaviors to expose as AQL services are implemented in `org.eclipse.sirius.components.view.emf.CanonicalBehaviors`:
- `createNewNode(NodeDescription, VariableManager)`
- `createNewEdge(VariableManager, EdgeDescription)`
- `editLabel(VariableManager, String)`
- `deleteElement(VariableManager)`

title: Remove implicit behaviors/tools in View-based diagrams
body:
Currently, when a View-based diagram element (Node or Edge) does not specify any behavior for a given kind of tool (e.g. direct edit, delete, etc.), the runtime automatically provides a default one.
This is nice for quick startup, but it also means it is impossible to *disable* any of these tools, as even if the studio makers does not provide a tool, some behavior will be provided.

- The new rule will be that if a particular tool (for a given diagram element) is not explicitly present in the View model, the corresponding behavior should be simply disabled.
- When the user will create a new Node or Edge, in the same way as they currently get a default style element automatically created, they will get automatically configured tools for all the standard beahviors. These will be implemented thanks to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1562 and provide the same behavior as the current default, only explicitly visible in the view model.

title: NA
body: `org.eclipse.sirius.components.view.emf.diagram.ViewToolSectionsProvider` will need to be updated not to provide tools (direct edit, delete from model) which are not explicitly configured in the View model. Except that in `ViewToolSectionsProvider` we do not have direct access to the actuel View model, only to the converted and "opaque" `DiagramDescription` & co.

title: Use richer data types for the View DSL
body:
In #1426 we introduced the `InterpretedExpression` (resp. `DomainType`) EDataTypes in `view.ecore` to identify string attributes which are expected to contain AQL expressions (resp. domain type names). This is useful to provide richer details view with widgets more precisely chosen/configured than what the generic choices would make.

There are other kinds of attributes which are currently encoded as raw `EString` or `EInt` but could benefit from being more precise:
- `Color` (EString): could be represented with a color picker when we get support for that.
- `Dimension` or `Length`: currently any string, but if we (the widget) knew it is supposed to represent a [CSS length](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length) we could provide some [client side validation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Forms/HTML5_input_types#numeric_field).
- `Feature(Name)` (EString): this is similar to `DomainType`. It is supposed to reference the name of a meta-model element feature (for example in `CreateInstance.referenceName`) and could benefit from some completion/validation support with a more precise definition than "a string".

Note that adding these data types would be useful even just in terms of documentation if we do not exploit them immediatly.

title: Add support for templates to speed up the creation of a project
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

We want to speed up the creation of a basic project with some data and representations.
For that, we will introduce project templates, created by a specifier, in order to have a one-click solution to get started.
Project templates will be displayed in the `/projects` page.
Each template will be displayed using an image statically provided by the backend and a label.
Clicking on the template on the frontend should redirect the user to the workbench with everything properly initialized.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: Delete Tool in View-based diagrams can/should only handle semantic deletion
body:
Currently, if a View-based diagram definition provides a custom _Delete Tool_ for a diagram element, that tool will be invoked for both semantic deletion ("Delete from model") and graphical deletion ("Delete from diagram") if the element is unsynchronized.

The default tool behavior, implemented in Java, does the appropriate thing in case of "Delete from diagram" (based on the value of the `deletionPolicy`), but for a user-defined tool, it is currently not possible directly in the View DSL to implement different behaviors depending on the value of the variable (there are no `if/then/else` statements/expressions).

Arguably, the studio maker should not have to define this behavior, and should not even be able to. The behavior of "Delete from diagram" (when enabled) should always be the same, and user-defined delete tools should only have to handle the "Delete from model" case.

title: Delete Tool in compatibility-based diagrams can/should only handle semantic deletion
body:
This is the equivalent of https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1569 for compatibility-based modelers (defined in Sirius Desktop `odesign` models).

`org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.diagrams.ToolConverter.createDeleteToolHandler(DeleteElementDescription)` is invoked fro both "Delete from model" and "Delete from diagram" operations and deletes to the `DeleteElementDescription` from the VSM in both cases (if there is one). This is not [what Sirius Desktop does](https://github.com/pcdavid/org.eclipse.sirius/blob/master/plugins/org.eclipse.sirius.diagram/src/org/eclipse/sirius/diagram/tools/internal/command/builders/DeletionCommandBuilder.java#L122), where `DeleteElementDescription` are only invoked for "Delete from model", and "Delete from diagram" (if available) is hard-coded (`buildDeleteDiagramElementFromDiagram`) to simply remove the `DDiagramElements` (views).

`DeleteElementDescription` elements in a VSM are not designed to be invoked on "Delete from diagram", and are unable to determine the "deletion policy" which triggered them (the corresponding variable and Java type only exist in Sirius Web).

title: Remove css propery overflow from Panels used by WorkbenchViewContribution
body:
Currently, the css property overflow that allow a scrollbar on a WorkbenchViewContribution apply to all contribution.
Letting each contribution be responsible on how to handle the overflow can allow for more precises comportements.
An example would be to contribute a view with a toolbar where we want the toolbar to be fixed and not inherit the overflow property.

title: Add support for diagram nodes labels' auto-wrap
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Today, in diagrams, nodes' inside labels are displayed on a single line (except if the text includes line breaks), no matter the size of its node. The label may exceed the size of its node.
Also, in case of diagrams with manual-layout, when the user clicks on "arrange all" button, the size of nodes sometimes adapt to the size of their labels, sometimes not.
Furthermore, the nodes inside a container node are not overlapping the container node' label after the arrange all.

The goal is that inside label of a node should never exceed the size of its node.

### Cuttings backs

The outside labels are out of scope of this feature request.
The vertical labels are out of scope of this feature request.
The auto-layout is out of scope of this feature request.

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: Keep custom node size on Arrange All when possible
body:
When the end-users resizes a node, we mark it with `CustomizableProperties.Size`.
This is supposed to mean "the size of this node has been set explicitly by the end-user and should be kept if possible".

The incremental layout does take this flag in consideration, but not ELK, which will revert these nodes to their default size.

For container nodes that is expected, as this is the point of the "Arrange All" to re-compute these, and trying to force a size set by the user could lead to invalid layouts.

For image nodes the issue is less clear-cut, as is depends on different factors, notably if we want to enforce the image's aspect-ratio.

For rectangle leaf nodes (i.e. nodes with no chilren), we should try to conserve the size set by the end-user.

title: Deactivate link with editor
body: Add a tool in the tree explorer to deactivate the synchronisation between elements in the tree explorer and elements selected from the diagram.

title: Objects may be created using multiple strategies which can create incompatible objects in a single model
body: When we are creating the root objects of a resource, we are loading on the fly the EPackages from scratch without considering existing EPackages loaded in the package registry of the editing domain. When we are creating objects using a dedicated tool from the view DSL with some model operations, they are created using the EPackages available in the package registry of the editing domain. Let's consider a click on `New Operational Entity` which comes with a dedicated node tool using the view DSL. As a result, it is quite easy to create a model in which the root object and objects created using the view DSL do not share the same EPackage. For some reason, this does not seems to create any issue in my case. The problem becomes obvious since, when we are creating objects using the view DSL thanks to a canonical tool, the EPackage used is the EPackage of `self` and thus the source of the metamodel to use may change depending on the target of the tool. Let's consider a click on `New Operational Actor` which rely on the canonical behavior. Now we will end up with two subgraphs of objects in our domain using the same concepts from two versions of our EPackage.

title: Provide better control on contextual palette's content
body: In View-based diagrams, the rules which define the content of the contextual palette of an element from the actual View model are hard to understand and require all sorts of workarounds in concrete modelers to get a usable behavior.

title: ImageSizeProvider does not work for custom images
body:
`ImageSizeProvider.getImageURL(String)` expects the image path (e.g. `/custom/b18f6f3b-fd7e-3921-888e-dc868ed3a75f`) to correspond to a resource in the classpath.
It's not the case for custom images (or parametric SVGs either I guess).
So `ImageSizeProvider.getSize()` always returns the default `{width: 10, height: 10}` for custom images.

Hi,
Thanks for your interest.
I'm not sure this particular ticket is a good first issue to work on, unless you're already familiar with Sirius. It's requires some in-depth knowledge of how different kinds of images are handled and how the diagram layout works. Are you already a user?

https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22difficulty%3A+starter+%F0%9F%91%A7%22 has a list of issues marked as "difficulty: starter" which should be easier to get started.

Aslo, note that Sirius is an official Eclipse project, which means contributors must sign the Eclipse Contributor Agreement. See https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING for details. This is required for contributions to be accepted in the project.

title: Remove the obsolete DiagramDescription.getTools() field
body:
It is not used anywhere, tools are found in organised `DiagramDescription.getToolSections()` instead.
The only place we provide an actual value for this field is in `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.createTools()` where we create converted versions of the edge reconnection tools. But even that is not actually used as `ViewReconnectionToolsExecutor` will look for the reconnection behavior to apply directly inside the View model and ignore the converted versions.

The following odesign used to create border nodes with a good size, now they have to be resized manually.

title: Child nodes may not be resized properly in a parent with a list layout
body: I think that we may have not indicated whether or not the child nodes should act as if they had the property `flex-grow: 1`. Should they behave like this: Or like that: Because currently they can do both and while both results make sense for example an UML class may prefer the first approach while a lane in a BPMN diagram may prefer the second one. Steps to reproduce: - A parent node with a list layout and child nodes in a free form layout (even if I'm not sure that it is related) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gpM5vavGwk4

title: NA
body:
> (even if I'm not sure that it is related)

That is not related.

About the behavior:

- Using the creation tool initialize the node with the minHeight possible.
- Using the resize to decrease the container height does not resize children since they are already at their minimum size.
- Then, using the resize to increase the container height also increase the child nodes' height. I choose to implement the resize like this without having this case in mind.

title: NA
body: To go even further on this topic, I have here another node with a list layout and I really like the fact that its children do not grow to occupy as much of the available space as possible: And I can resize their parent any way I want, they never seems to stick to the bottom of their parent to grow as their parent grow. The only reasonable approach I can think of is to let this behavior be configurable using something like `ListLayout#justifyItems` which could take `start` and `stretch` as values because both behavior have their use. So in the end, it seems that we want both kinds of behavior while not giving any way to choose the expected behavior. We both need to make this configurable and explicit in our algorithm.

title: Hiding a child node inside a parent with a list layout may not update the size of the parent node
body: See it in action : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m3vQoVx95e0

title: NA
body: It should update the width of the parent node only. There is nothing done to reduce the height of a parent node if a child is removed or hidden.

title: NA
body: To see that in action, make the label of one of the compartments really long, then try to hide it.

title: The selection feedback of a child node in a list layout is off by a couple of pixels
Reconsider the concept of aggregation of the form descriptions to create a single form description
body: We can have multiple form descriptions for various form representations. Yet for the details view, we are creating an aggregate of form description from multiple sources.

title: Add computed labels and initial direct edit expression to Papaya
body: Something like `FirstClass extends SecondClass implements IFirstInterface, ISecondInterface`

title: Make the contextual palette self contained
body: We should be able to move all the code using `useMutation` used by the `ContextualPalette` from the `DiagramRepresentation` to the palette directly. It would start removing so much code from the oversized `DiagramRepresentation` and `operation.ts`.

title: Ensure that the size of a node with a wrapped label stay stable over time
body:
- Create a node with a wrapped label
- Resize it to make it small enough
- Use arrange all multiple times

The size of the node can be changed multiple times by the arrange all.

title: A wrapped label can be be cropped while resizing a node
body: Especially easy to trigger if you have a node with a small height and if you resize it only horizontally.

title: Ensure the consistency of our various payloads
body: Several of our diagram payloads are returning the diagram in the payload, and thus are requiring a dedicated payload while others are just returning a new `SuccessPayload`. If we don't need those dedicated payloads, we could remove them entirely. For example `DropOnDiagramSuccessPayload` vs `ArrangeAllSuccessPayload`, we should pick one pattern and stick with it.

title: Validate the commit messages during the build
The fade and hide tools are available on the background of the diagram
Tree items without children are not aligned with their siblings
body: Since their siblings have an expand / collapse button, they are not aligned

title: Use interfaces to express dependencies between the layout services
body:
See classes such as:

- LayoutService
- IncrementalLayoutDiagramConverter
- ELKLayoutedDiagramProvider

All those classes should require interfaces to be injected instead of a specific instance.

title: Remove sirius-web-services-api
body: The project by itself does not make sense, it should be merged with `sirius-web-services`

title: Closing a representation when multiple ones are opened does not update the selection
body:
- Open three representations, A, B, C
- Select B
- Close B
- C will be selected but in the explorer the selection will still be on B

The workbench machine should update the selection when a representation is hidden

title: Add support for tree item context menu entries retrieved from the backend
Add support for trees in the form support of the view DSL
body: We can only define tree widgets in a form programmatically. This should be supported in the view DSL too.

title: Improve the data structure of the layout algorithm
body: We could probably use a box model similar to the one available in the DOM (with border nodes)

title: The size of the nodes is not stable over time
Creating a new edge after the ELK layout can change the layout of all edges
ELK does not layout properly edges involving a free form layout in a list layout
body: Incremental layout ELK

title: Users should get immediate feedback when the current project is deleted
body:
When a user is working inside a project (for example interacting on a diagram inside of it), 
If the project is deleted (by another user or the same user in a differente tab/window),
Then the user should get an immediate notification about the deletion and be prevented to continue interacting with the workbench elements. Ideally a clear modal saying something like "The project does not exist anymore" with a redirection to the project browser on close.

In the current state, the user gets no immediate feedback, just errors from the backend when trying to interact on the (noew dead) project. Only when the browser page is refresh does he get a clear "The project does not exist" message.

title: F2 and double-click triggers direct edition of edge labels even when there is no corresponding tool
body:
When an edge does not provide a (center) label edit tool, the corresponding tool does not appear in the edge's palette.
However it is still possible to trigger the first part of the direct edit workflow by hitting F2, double clicking on the edge or starting to type a new label.

title: Edge labels, even when very long, are never wrapped
body:
We now support auto-wrapping of node labels, but edge labels have no maximum width, which can result in less-then-optimal layouts. We probably do not want to make labels selectable/resizable, but maybe impose some reasonable maximum width and reuse the existing auto-wrap logic?

![2023-02-16_14-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/219381877-ce00f18b-f0e5-4548-a6fe-da0abf7daf5b.png)

title: F2 does not trigger direct-edit on "edges to self"
body:
When an edge has the same source and target, even if it has a direct edit tool, F2 does not trigger direct edition. It can still be triggered by double click or from the palette.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/219383083-73963269-d882-4711-a400-481f1a9678d4.png)

title: The tree widget is not available in the View DSL (and Form Description Editor)
body: Forms include support for `org.eclipse.sirius.components.forms.TreeWidget` (as used in the Related Elements view), but this widget can not be used/condifured in View-based forms (and of course not in the Form Description Editor based on it).

title: The "Related Elements" view crashes when using dynamic instances (e.g. domain instances)
body:
1. Create a domain model with two entities Parent and Child, with a containment relationship beween them.
2. In another project, create a instance of Parent, add a Child in it.
3. Select the Parent.
4. Open the "Related Elements" view in the right panel.

> Exception while fetching data (/relatedElementsEvent) : The string resource '_UI_Parent_children_feature' could not be located

`CurrentTreeProvider.getContainmentReferenceLabel(EObject, EReference)` (and maybe other providers) do some EMF.Edit-specific magic to get the label of the containment feature which breaks for domain instances.

title: NA
body: The exception above is actually one of many. Several parts of the 3 `{Current,Incoming,Outgoing}TreeProvider` break/incorrectly return `null` on dynamic instances.

title: NA
body: Caused by `RectangleIncrementalLayoutEngine.processChildrenAreaLayoutResult(ChildrenAreaLaidOutData, NodeContext)` (and the other `*IncrementalLayoutEngine`) which modify the position of the current node to something different from `Position.UNDEFINED`. This makes `NodePositionProvider.getPositionFromSinglePositionEvent()` a no-op as it tests for `Position.UNDEFINED` before consuming the `SinglePositionEvent`'s coordinates.

title: The width of a list container expands when needed but never reverts
body:
In Papaya: the width of a class expands when an attribute's name become too long (but note the labels of the connected edges overlap the class after it has been resized), but when the label's length becomes smaller it does not "retract", although the height of the internal containers is (wrongly) modified. Even after a full layout, the class width never goes back to a more reasonable size.

title: Duplicate edge instances created when an Edge Description has multiple potential source node descriptions
body:
If an Edge Description declares N > 1 potential source node descriptions (say N1 and N2) and (for example) a single target node description T, we should have *1* edge between an instance of N1 and a corresponding T, and *1* edge between an isntance of N2 and T.

Instead we get N edge instances between a given source/target node couple.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/219682028-ec99e4a1-00ab-43b4-ab5b-c72a8dd3af4c.mp4

title: Event handlers that do not finish can block the whole backend
Contribute a specification of the behavior of the layout
It is possible to trigger the direct edit on a diagram element which does not have direct edit tools
body:
Steps to reproduce:

- Create a diagram with a node without any direct edit tool

title: Explore the ability to provide a variable giving access to additional graphical data
body:
For example, if a node using a description D is created inside of a node with the description C which is in turn in a node with a description B in a diagram A, we could provide as a variable something like this to the expressions of C:

```
[
  { id: 'A' }, { id: 'B' }, { id: 'C' }
]
```

This way, the node to be created could find out in which kind of container it will be located.

2. Select the System item in the Explorer View
3. Create a new representation on the system element with name > 50 characters

### Expected behavior

The new name is taken into account or is not taken into account but an error message appears in the snackbar.
It is possible to rename any other tree item or any field in the details view after that.

### Actual behavior

The new name is not taken into account.
It is impossible to rename any other tree item or any field in the details view after that.

title: Problem with tests when building backend (sirius-web-persistence)
body:
I am trying to build the project from scratch. I have followed the instructions provided in the README file. However when launching the build with Maven, I encounter errors during the test phase of the sirius-web-persistence package. Here is an example of the errors I get in the surefire report files :
```
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: org.eclipse.sirius.web.persistence.repositories.AccountRepositoryIntegrationTests
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 2, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 30.987 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.eclipse.sirius.web.persistence.repositories.AccountRepositoryIntegrationTests
testInsertAndRetrieveAnAccount  Time elapsed: 0.015 s  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Could not find a valid Docker environment. Please see logs and check configuration

testFindByUsername  Time elapsed: 0 s  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.eclipse.sirius.web.persistence.repositories.AccountRepositoryIntegrationTests
```

All files have similar errors. Regarding the docker part, I checked that a docker environment was installed and configured, and tried executing the build with sudo, since apparently this error can come from rights issues. I have tried generic solution that I found for the encountered errors, but could not succeed to make it work.
I tried on another machine as well, thinking there might be a problem with my computer's configuration, but got the exact same result. 
Maybe I did something wrong while following the steps to build, but as of now, I can not find what. I apologize in advance if this issue was already tackled in the documentation, I tried to look for it but could not find anything.

Do you have any idea of what may cause this issue ?

title: NA
body:
Hi,
You reported this in the `sirius-web` repo, but all of the code which was there has been transfered into https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components to have simplify things with a single "mono-repo". Do you reproduce with the current master of eclipse-sirius/sirius-components? It's possible there was something wrong at one point in the `sirius-web` repo and we did not notice as development now happens in `sirius-components`.

title: NA
body: I initially built the sirius-web repository, as you guessed. However, the issue is reproduced when trying to build the code from sirius-components.

title: Open a diagram always imposes an animation
body:
Each time we open/switch to a diagram, Sprotty imposes an animation phase which causes a slight delay, and IMO, is slightly disorienting. I expect an animation when launching an Arrange All, but here things are moving one screen for no good reason.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/222166361-f4b4ebc5-2fe8-4c05-9e03-9d3528ab299b.mp4

title: Name collision on labelFields GraphQL fragment
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All

### Frontend Error

`Warning: fragment with name labelFields already exists. graphql-tag enforces all fragment names across your application to be unique; read more about this in the docs`

### Proposition

There are two graphql fragments with the same name `labelFields`: one in `packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/representation/operations.ts` and one in `packages/forms/frontend/sirius-components-forms/src/form/FormEventFragments.ts`.

The one from `FormEventFrgaments.ts` should be renamed to `labelWidgetFields` to avoid name collision.

title: The ELK layout removes nodes from the diagram
body:
When we are converting our nodes to ElkNode, the following nodes are removed from the diagram entirely:

- BorderNode#childNodes
- BorderNode#borderNodes

As a result, a border node can only be a leaf of the diagram, its child elements are completely removed from the diagram data structure

title: A view creation request can create multiple nodes
body: We cannot distinguish a view creation request to create a child node and a border node as such with a reuse node description, we could end up creating both.

title: The diagram lacks the concept of reuse mapping
body: We can reuse mapping as child or border nodes of a node but not as the top level nodes of a diagram.

title: A description from the view DSL cannot reference concepts outside of its containing description
body: Since representation descriptions are converted one at a time, they cannot reference anything outside of themselves. For example, none of the two node descriptions indicated in the screenshot are working:

title: Contribute a first version of the new layout algorithm
body: We currently have some data in the style of the nodes, the previous layout data and the node themselves. We should transform that into a simple data structure for the layout.

title: Contribute rich data structure for the layout algorithm
body:
We need richer data structures such as Rectangle, Box, etc in order to give us some advanced primitives for our layout algorithm.

These new classes will both contain data and relevant operations in order to minimize the amount of code where we have to give countless individual parameters.

title: Explorer toolbar and item background color width do not take all space available
body: * [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else** * [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome** * [x] **I have specified the version** : - latest * [x] **I have specified my environment** : - All ### Screenshots ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create/open the Robot Flow demo project 2. Rename one of the Robot item in the explorer with with a very long name 3. Click on the root document tree item 4. Click on the renamed Robot tree item ### Expected behavior The toolbar takes all the width available, its icons stay on the right. The selected item's background color takes all the width available. ### Actual behavior The toolbar only takes the min width, its icons do not stay on the right. The selected item's background color takes the min width.

title: Add the ability to create a {node|edge} description extending another {node|edge} description
body:
With a very complex view model, it could be useful to have a {node|edge} description extend another one in order to share most of the properties of an existing {node|edge} description. Let's consider the following use case:

- I have a very complex node description with all its style and conditional styles, palette and countless of tools
- I want to create the exact same node description somewhere else in the view DSL but with another semantic candidates expression

I would have to recreate everything from scratch while it could be more efficient to just say that I create a new node description extending the first one and thus inheriting all of its properties without having to do anything. From there, I could simply write a new semantic candidates expression.

title: Collapsing a node and then expanding it remove all its unsynchronized children
body: Collapsing a node should maybe be closer to marking all the children as hidden instead of preventing their rendering but in this case, we should ensure that revealing everything would not reveal the children of collapsed nodes

title: AQL expressions provided by default cannot work
body:
As discussed before, since we now have moved the tools in a palette where they should be used some default expressions cannot work anymore such as `aql:semanticEdgeSource.defaultCreateEdge(edgeDescription, semanticEdgeTarget)`

Variables like `nodeDescription` and `edgeDescription` cannot be provided since they represent some magic coupling that we would have figured out in order to provide some default behavior. We cannot find out magically what the specifier expect and thus we cannot create a generic default behavior. We should probably remove them.

title: Retrieve the autolayout state of a diagram when we are loading it the first time
body:
We should remove the GraphQL field `Diagram#autoLayout` and instead use the real source of the value: `DiagramDescription#autoLayout`. As such, the auto layout state of the diagram should be retrieve in `DiagramRepresentation` when the component is mounted.

This would greatly simplify future improvements

title: Unload resources by default when the editing context is disposed
Add a debug mode for diagrams
body:
Using a field like `DiagramDescription#debug`, we should be able to activate a debug mode for a diagram. In the debug mode, the frontend should display positions, sizes for all the relevant elements.

This will make it easier to debug the layout of the diagrams.

title: NA
body:
- In `diagram.graphqls`, a new field `debug: Boolean` on `DiagramDescription`
- `DiagramDescriptionDebugDataFetcher` which should return `true` if we have a configuration property `sirius.components.diagram.debug=true`
- In `DiagramRepresentation`, you should retrieve the value of `debug` when we are retrieving the diagram description (see the `getDiagramDescriptionQuery` and its types)
- In `convertDiagram.ts`, you should add a debug property to `Diagram` (and its type too)
- In `RectangleView.tsx`, detect if debug is true (try to retrieve the diagram from a node and check the value of `debug`)
- If it is `true`, display the position `{ x: 285.99, y: 317.343 }` in the top left corner of the node, then display the `width: 2343` on the bottom and `height:343` on the left

title: Convert the hardcoded SVG icons to proper react components
body:
- Most of them should probably be replaced by MUI icons
- For the remaining ones, we should convert them to proper React components to remove the errors which comes from the import of `.svg` files

title: Remove our dependency to the `uuid` NPM package
body: We only use it to generate v4 UUIDs on the front, and the standard [`crypto.randomUUID()`](https://w3c.github.io/webcrypto/#Crypto-method-randomUUID) does the same and seems to be [available everywhere that counts](https://caniuse.com/mdn-api_crypto_randomuuid).

title: NA
body: I assign myself this issue

title: The explorer can still be expanded even if the synchronization is deactivated
body: Selecting an element in the diagram can still expand the explorer and reveal it

title: Add the IDiagramElement(s) id in SinglePositionEvent and DoublePositionEvent
body:
Correctly interpreting these events requires knowing inside which node(s) the user clicked when triggering them.
For example when reacting to a node invocation which creates several new nodes/views, this information would be useful to determine which of the new nodes/views rendered should "consume" the `SinglePositionEvent`.

title: NA
body: It may also be an edge id in `SinglePositionEvent` ok technically it may also be an edge id in `DoublePositionEvent` but that's tricky 😛 (I should really try that one day)

title: It should not be possible to resize a node outside of its container.
body:
The frontend prevents the user to _move_ a node outside of its container, but authorizes a resize operation to "overflow" outside of the container's area:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10608/223984454-a2786e29-e09c-4a0f-ab56-672e04be02fc.mp4

It is handled/fixed by the incremental layout, but it's inconsistent with how moving nodes is handled.

title: Add the ability to deactivate the synchronization of the selection with the workbench to most representations
body: We should be able to tell most representations to stop being updated by a new selection in the workbench and/or to stop updating the selection in the workbench.

title: Specify the coordinate system used in the layout specification
body:
- Relative vs absolute
- Double vs int
- Position vs ratio

title: Improve project template cards layout
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Project template cards may lead to have the sirius web projects page larger than the  web browser full screen width.
So, we suggest to all templates are equally distributed along a grid.
Furthermore, if a template name exceeds its card size, the name is wrapped on several lines.
We suggest to let the template name on one line with an ellipsis if it exceeds its card size. A tooltip will also be added to be able to read the full name in every case.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: The palette of reused node descriptions from another diagram description is always empty
Move tree-specific event handlers in sirius-components-collaborative-trees
body:
Concepts like these should be in the tree related projects:

- CreateRootObjectEventHandler
- CreateChildEventHandler

Along with their inputs, payloads, declaration in the GraphQL schema, datafetchers, etc

They should also stop from implementing `IEditingContextEventHandler` and use instead `ITreeEventHandler`

title: Invalid thread usage to access semantic data and representations
body:
- Subscribing to a representation event processor is not done properly in the thread of the editing context event processor
- Payloads published by the various representation event processors are done in the thread of the editing context event processor (as a result it's very easy to create deadlocks)

title: Specify the input of the layout algorithm
body:
Here are some questions that need to be answered?

#### What are all the sizes that are required by the layout algorithm?


#### Do we even have a need for label without any width constraint?

How could we both "compute the size of a node to give it enough room to display its label on one line" and "keep the size of the node stable and wrap the label instead"? Shouldn't we just says that a node has always a requested size which can be requested by:

- the application (think about the default sizes of the new nodes)
- the specifier (think `widthExpression` / `heightExpression`)
- the end user (think about the end user having resized a node in the past)

And as such, we should always ask to display a label with a width of something like `requestedSize.width` minus 

- `node.border.width`
- `label.border.width`
- `label.padding`
- `label.icon.width`
- `gapBetweenIconAndLabel`

title: Split the layout specification in dedicated modules
body: It is becoming a bit complex to manage such a large document and it would help us work in parallel on various concerns of the specification.

title: Make the explorer toolbar configurable
body:
See how the tree item context menu contributions are registered to be able to do something like this in EditProjectView:

```
const treeToolBarActionsContributions = [
  <TreeToolBarActionContribution
    canHandle={(tree: GQLTree) => true} // We should be able to detect only the Sirius Web explorer using it's id for example
    component={NewDocumentToolBarActionContribution}
  />,
  <TreeToolBarActionContribution
    canHandle={(tree: GQLTree) => true} // Same predicate here
    component={UploadDocumentToolBarActionContribution}
  />
];

<TreeToolBarActionsContext.Provider value={treeToolBarActionsContributions}>
  <Workbench ... />
</TreeToolBarActionsContext>
```

title: Navigate to the first child with the right arrow if a node is expanded
body: The right arrow can only be used for expand, not to navigate to the first child. One has to switch between the right arrow and the bottom arrow

title: Allow edge labels to be visible only when the edge is selected
body:
Edge labels are useful but on diagrams with many edges, possibly each of them with up to 3 labels, they can cause a lot of visual clutter. In some cases the information given by the label (or at least some of them) is only really useful when focusing on the edge itself, or maybe the source and/or target node.

Proposal: allow each of the 3 labels of an edge to be configured so that it is not displayed by default, but only made visible when the edge itself is selected. Optionally we may want to also reveal the labels if its source node or target node are visible.

This would result in less cluttered diagrams while still giving all the details of an edge when needed.

title: Review issues detected by Sonarlint
body:
- Optional.get() without a check for Optional.isPresent()
- List.get(index) without a check for the size of the list first


etc...

multiple issues like that have been detected in files like `ListLayoutStrategyEngine`

title: Edges can be created twice
body:
If a semantic element appears twice in the node to be considered as target of the edge, then edges are creating twice:

```
  return semanticCandidates.stream()
                .flatMap(semanticObject-> cache.getElementsRepresenting(semanticObject).stream()) <---- Here
                .filter(this::isFromCompatibleTargetMapping)
                .filter(Objects::nonNull)
                .toList();
```

We should consider only distinct objects for the semantic elements.

title: Update some of our architectural constraints
body:
While the project was started a couple years ago, we had to integrate contributions from a lot of newcomers which required us to define a set of rules for everyone to follow. Nowadays, those rules are pretty well understood and respected but we are facing new issues. Some of the rules that have helped us create a coherent code base are now getting in our way and some others have not been updated to prevent new kinds of errors.

As a result, we need to change some of our architectural tests in order to make our safety net evolve with our code.

title: Automate some tasks related to issues and pull requests
body: In order to welcome new contributors more easily, some tasks should be automated. It will be especially useful since external contributors do not have the necessary rights to perform some actions by themselves and requiring core maintainers to perform them is getting in the way of our progress.

title: NA
body:
Hello,
Do you have a github personal access token? You need to follow this step: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components#github-access-token to be able to build sirius-web.
Regards,

title: NA
body:
You will also need to add your personnal access token in your `.npmrc`

Create or edit `$HOME/.npmrc` and add the following line:
`//npm.pkg.github.com/:_authToken=$GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN`
Be sure to replace $GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN with the value of your acess token.

title: NA
body:
To complete Axel's answer a little, our frontend packages are not published in the default NPM registry (`registry.npmjs.org`) but only on GitHub Packages.

You first need to tell NPM that these packages are to be found on GitHub Packages. This is done  by adding `@eclipse-sirius:registry=https://npm.pkg.github.com/eclipse-sirius` into your `.npmrc` (either global in your `HOME` or local to your project).

Then, even though `eclipse-sirius` is a Open Source & public project, GitHub requires that you use a token when accessing the corresponding GitHub Package, see https://docs.github.com/en/packages/working-with-a-github-packages-registry/working-with-the-npm-registry#authenticating-to-github-packages. So you need to create a personal token as mentioned by Axel, and again tell NPM to use that token to authenticate on `npm.pkg.github.com`.

title: Compute tools from View
The "Show all templates" button does not work if there is no project
body: Starting from an empty server where the Project List shows "No projects available, start by creating one", clicking on "Show all templates" does not open the corresponding modal.

title: Sanitize the input of the SVG export
body: We should at least use URLEncoder to properly encode characters

title: Remove the need to create fake handlers to compute the palette
body:
Create new records for ToolSection and for the various related concepts:

- SingleClickOnDiagramElementTool
- SingleClickOnTwoDiagramElementsTool
- SingleClickOnTwoDiagramElementsCandidate
- Along with an interface ITool

in the package org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.dto and ensure that IToolSectionProvider reuse this new ToolSection record (not the existing one) in order to stop having to create fake handlers to compute the palette.

title: NA
body: After this exception, some representations are not disposed anymore since the thread which would have disposed them is now dead and thus the editing context event processor is never disposed. As a consequence, the editing context event processor will never see any update in the view / domain models on the server.

title: NA
body:
I can't always reproduce, but with the following steps I can get the stack quite often still:

1. Start from an empty server (probably not necessary, but easier to analyze).
2. Import [created-before.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/files/11234774/created-before.zip). Its a basic project with a "Robot Flow". Select the "Robot" element and note that all the expected representations can be created on it.
3. Go back to the projects list (do *not* keep "created-before" open in a tab/window) and import [studio.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/files/11234779/studio.zip). It contains a View with an empty diagram definition which applies to `flow::System`.
4. Go back to the projects list and import [created-after.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/files/11234800/created-after.zip). Except for the name, it's identical to "created-before" and just provided for convenience.
5. In "created-after", select the "Robot" system element. The "NewDiag" (defined in the studio) should be available. Create it. *Sometimes* the stack appears then, but most of the times I tested, there was still no error at this point.
6. Go back to the projects list and re-open "created-before" (it should have been closed for at least 6 seconds at this point, the longer the better).
7. Select the "Robot" system element. The "NewDiag" (defined in the studio) **should** be available. Create it. Here I get the stack quite regularly, but not always.

title: NA
body:
I can sometimes get in a state where, a Tree (from the explorer) is not properly "unsubscribed" from the subscription manager even though I (the end user) have closed the project. This causes the tree event processor to never get disposed, and by cascade the editing context event processor itself is never disposed/closed, and hence never properly reloaded.

This can happen without the exception above even occuring. I'm not sure yet, but maybe the exception is a symptom after the fact, and the root cause occurs before.

title: NA
body:
I think I have reproducible steps for the stack trace, but it seems to be a different case than the one from my previous comment (where an editing context is never released/disposed, and thus never reloaded).

1. Create a project which takes a significant time to load. For example create 3 or 4 "Big Guy" flow models in it.
2. Go back to the projects list, and wait for it to be released.
3. Click to re-open it, and *as soon as the project edition page becomes visible* (with the explorer still empty as the editing context has not yet loaded), go back to the project list.

This systematically reproduces the stack trace for me, but still the project/editing context gets released properly after a while.

title: Add support for the input variable for the form representation
body:
### In Sirius Desktop

In Sirius Desktop, the `input` variable is an instance of `org.eclipse.sirius.properties.core.api.SiriusInputDescriptor` (see [here](https://github.com/pcdavid/org.eclipse.sirius/blob/master/plugins/org.eclipse.sirius.properties.core/src/org/eclipse/sirius/properties/core/api/SiriusInputDescriptor.java)).

It represents the selection/context which triggered the display of the properties view.
It can be seen as a more structured/richer version of `self` with additional services.

It is created in `org.eclipse.sirius.ui.properties.internal.tabprovider.SiriusTabDescriptorProvider.get(IWorkbenchPart, ISelection, IEEFTabbedPropertySheetPageContributor)` from the Eclipse `ISelection` and then exposed as a variable to "everyone" inside the EEF-based view:

```java
variableManager.put(EEFExpressionUtils.INPUT, input);
```

### In Sirius Web

We need to expose a variable named `input` of a *new* type (it can not be the Sirius Desktop `SiriusInputDescriptor`, which is tied to Sirius Desktop itself, EEF and the Eclipse platform).

The variable must be available in all contexts where View expressions originating from the converted `umlProperties.odesign` will need it.
All "core" services (methods from `SiriusInputDescriptor`) must be implemented in the Web version of `input`.

Further analysis is needed to characterize more precisely the actual usages.
For example, it seem all 238 occurences of `input.getContextSelections()` are actually to test if `input.getContextSelections()->size()>1`.
It would be enough to some "dummy" singleton collection, even through `getContextSelections()` in Sirius Desktop actually returns a `List<SiriusContext>`, but `SiriusContext` is itself specific to the desktop version, and given the usages we do not care about the actual content of the list returned.

title: Add support for custom widgets for the form representation
body:
The _Form_ representation currently supports a fixed set of generic widgets.
Even if we enrich this set, it will never account for all the specific needs of concrete applications.
The Sirius Components framework should be open for custom applications to provide their own widgets.

If an application provides such a custom widget, its use both by the studio maker and by the end users should be indisguishable from the core widgets.

## Core support

Make the core _Form_ representation extensible with new widgets, independently of the View DSL.

- [x] [Shape written, reviewed and merged](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/514f5691f471ef80febcb35d06c19f3aa31be44f)
- [x] ADR written (will be reviewed and merged in [the main PR](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/1958) along with the code)
- [x] Make the Form representation core extensible (backend)
- [x] Backend code for a basic Slider widget
- [x] Make FormEventFragments.ts extensible
- [x] Make PropertySection.tsx extensible
- [x] Fontend code for a basic Slider widget

## Support in the View DSL

Make the View DSL itself and the conversion process (View -> core) extensible to new widgets.

- [x] Enable support for child creation extenders in the View DSL (#1946)
- [x] Create slider.ecore which extends view.ecore with the Slider widget definition
- [x] Make ViewFormDescriptionConverter extensible to support new widgets
- [x] Implement the conversion logic between the view-based SliderDescription and the API-based one.
- [x] Create an example View definition which uses the new Slider widget and add tests for it

## Support in the Form Description Editor

Allow the _Form Description Editor_ to display and edit custom widgets as if they were "normal" widgets.

- [x] Make the backend extensible (`FormDescriptionEditorGroupComponent`)
- [x] Make the frontend extensible (`WidgetOperations`, `FormDescriptionEditorRepresentation.*`)
- [x] Test using the Slider widget

## Finalization

Transverse tasks.

- [x] Document the steps needed to create a custom widget
- [x] Integrated tests updated

title: Add an example showing how to contribute to the details view with the view DSL
body:
We need to show how to use a form from a view DSL in order to contribute to the properties view.

We could convert the content of the class `org.eclipse.sirius.components.view.emf.diagram.NodeStylePropertiesConfigurer` to multiple form description using the view DSL and load them, convert them to programmatic FormDescription and finally register them in the configurer.

title: NA
body:
The original idea was to to rewrite the `NodeStylePropertiesConfigurer` but it is a relatively complex use case which exposes some limitations and bugs in the current View-based Form support (for example, it is not possible to provide a completion provider for a text field defined with the View DSL). This would result in a functional regression if we replaced the existing `NodeStylePropertiesConfigurer` with a more limited version.

Instead, we chose to provide a slightly customized _Details_ view for the Attribute elements in the Domain DSL.

Before, with the default/generic rules applied:

![screenshot-2023-05-24_16-45](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/10608/676dec56-975d-488c-92c5-a42b221dc21f)

After, with the Form defined in the new `org.eclipse.sirius.web.sample.configuration.DomainPropertiesConfigurer`:

![screenshot-2023-05-25_11-01](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/10608/1f804392-ab22-4929-85ad-6217f285a50c)

Differences:
- the page's title shows the attribute's type
- the type is displayed before the cardinality
- the type is selected using a Select/Combo instead of a radio group
- the type names are "Capitalized" intsead of "FULL_UPPER_CASE"
- an additional read-only label shows the cardinality corresponding to the optional/many flag combination.

title: Investigate an issue with list based nodes in the VSCode extension
Add the ability to filter tree based representations like the explorer
body:
Textual filtering of the tree on the frontend just like what is being done in VSCode using a simple textfield.
There should be two possible options:

- highlight the match text in the tree
- only display the tree items with a matching label

Nothing here should involve some backend communication. See the screenshot below for an example of the behavior in VSCode:

![231191316-40eab713-0065-4d86-baf5-f257b109f26d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/422587/231685350-e0e217b5-90ba-422e-b6b3-789d3e80cee2.png)

title: Simplify the programmatic creation of view models
body:
In a project `sirius-components-view-builder`, depending pretty much only on `sirius-components-view`, we should provide utility classes to help the creation of view based models. You can have a look at the content of `org.eclipse.sirius.web.sample.papaya.view` to see some of the needs of such API.

A detailed ADR will be necessary to gather some feedback first.

In order to show that the view DSL can support everything the compatibility layer support, we should migrate flow to the view DSL. Using a dedicated package named `flow`, we should add a new project `sirius-components-flow-view` which should contain the view model for the various flow diagrams.

This view model should be done using the soon to be introduced Java APIs to create view models.

title: View-based Forms can no longer be instanciated with 2023.4.0
body:
In https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/1d3e4f3401f648e2a0d11ad6d2e13a70ec6b81e1#diff-67f9c31957f203241dd3af3eaf627223232eb55d8f44aba9fbe9526e2221d878L53 we modified the test to allow the creation of View-based representations, but did it in a way which assumes Diagrams are the only View-based representations that exist.
`canHandle(IRepresentationDescription representationDescription)` on a View-based form will always return `false`, which make them imppossible to instanciate.

title: Color references are only searched in the first `ColorPalette`.
body:
Since https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/commit/d33d8a8fc1b780be72252e4bf5339464006e8abe, we add a `ColorProvider` to get the `UserColor` from the `ColorPalettes`. There may be several palettes, but in the code we search only in the first one.
```
public UserColor getColor(String colorName) {
        return this.view.getColorPalettes()
                .stream()
                .findFirst()
                .map(ColorPalette::getColors)
                .stream()
                .flatMap(Collection::stream)
                .filter(userColor -> userColor.getName().equals(colorName))
                .findFirst()
                .orElse(null);
    }
```
Change that to browse in all available palettes.

title: Make node inside label optional
body:
An optional label is not an empty label.
No label means no direct edit support (double click, typing, F2, direct edit tool in the palette).

- [x] Rename node label into `InsideLabel`.
- [ ] Papaya should be updated in order to display nodes without an inside label
- [ ] ReactFlow should also be updated to support nodes without an inside label
- [ ] List node support should be updated to handle the lack of a label

title: Add support for in-memory View-based representations
body:
It is possible to register View-based representation create programmatically or loaded from a `.view` model using `IRepresentationDescriptionRegistryConfigurer`, but the resulting representations can not actually be instanciated. This is because in Sirius Web, `ViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService` only consults the `documentRepository` to resolve a respresentation sourceId, i.e. it only knows about View models which are actually stored in the database.

It should be possible to contribute in-memory View-based representations and use them even if they are never stored in the DB.

title: Add support for optional help text on widgets
body:
In Sirius Desktop's EEF-based property views, it is possible to associate a help text on widgets that can display additional text in a tooltip.
We should also support this kind of mechanism in our Forms (including in View-based forms).

## Tasks

- [x] [Shape written](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/pull/1987)
- [x] ADR written
- [x] Core support for `AbstractWidget[Description].helpTextProvider` and `hasHelpText` flag.
- [x] Implement the GraphQL Query to invoke a widget's `helpTextProvider`.
- [x] Frontend: display the "?" hint for widgets with `hasHelpText` (need more discussion on the icon and layout)
- [x] Frontend: invoke the GraphQL Query and display the result (as a tooltip)
- [x] View: add `WidgetDescription.helpTextExpression`
- [x] View: create a proper `helpTextProvider` from the expression during the View conversion.
- [x] Frontend: display the "?" hint in the FormDescriptionEditor version of the widgets (if the `helpTextExpression` is defined)
- [x] Add tests
- [x] Update documentation and CHANGELOG with a screenshot/animation.

title: Contribute an alternate rendering for diagrams
Widgets from different groups share the same ID
body:
The representation ID of all widgets is calculated using a counter defined for each group. In a form with multiple groups, the widgets in each group will share the same id.

In this example : 

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/128395825/209dadfb-5ba1-48b3-b1cd-7af2aa9e4669)

The _BUTTON 1_ and _BUTTON 2_ have `id = sirius:///ae4ea49a-ecc1-4144-af1d-6a2d4388dabe#/#0`.

In the backend, to get the behavior of the widget, we use this identifier to retrieve from all the widgets the one that has been triggered. It will always be the one of the first group that will match, so in our example, by triggering the _BUTTON 2_ it will be the _BUTTON 1_ behaviour used.

title: NA
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new studio and upload the View model in this zip: [ViewNewModel.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/files/11561872/ViewNewModel.zip). It defines a Form on `flow::System` with two groups, each with one button. The button in the first group increases the weight of the `System` instance, the button in the second group increases its temperature.
![screenshot-2023-05-25_08-49](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/10608/93407b18-40ed-4223-9b32-f2b762d40717)

2. Create a new "Flow" project, and create an instance of the Form above on the top-level System.
3. Make sure the System is selected in the explorer so that its details are visible.
4. Click on the first button: the System's weight increases (OK)
5. Click on the second button: the System's **temperatrure** should increase, but instead it's the weight (**KO**). Clicking on the second button actually invokes the behavior of the first one (more precisely: clicking on the _N_th button on *any* group invokes the _N_th button of the *first* group

https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/10608/a2d2e6ba-7745-4f1d-a2fc-14bcc8375a30

title: SelectPropertySection should not impose the presence of None
body:
I want to use a Select widget to choose a non-optional value among a fixed list.
On the backend, my _candidatesExpression_ only returns the set of valid choices.
On the frontend, `SelectPropertySection` adds a _None_ choice that I can not remove and that makes no sense in my case.
When the user selects the _None_ entry, I get `null` on the backend, and can decide to select a default choice among the possible values, but this is confusing the the end-user:
* the presence of _None_ implies to him that the value is optional (it is not)
* when he selects _None_, the value is not unset, just set to the default.

title: Add support for completion configuration in View-based Forms
body:
The core `Textarea` and `Textfield` widgets support an optional completion proposal provider (of type `Function<CompletionRequest, List<CompletionProposal>>`), but it is not possible to configure it when creating the corresponding widgets with the View DSL.

It should be possible to add this with an optional AQL expression.
Maybe we could provide some helper Java services to manipulate/create `CompletionProposal` instances directly from AQL, but it might not be necessary. Most actual completion code would probably require to drop directly into a Java service, where manipulating these is trivial.

### Implementation

* In `view.ecore`, add `Textfield.completionProposalExpression : InterpretedExpression`
* In `ViewFormDescriptionConverterSwitch.caseTextfieldDescription(TextfieldDescription)`, if the `TextfieldDescription` has a non-blank `completionProposalExpression` create a `.completionProposalsProvider()` that invokes it.

### Usage

* In the View-based `TextfieldDescription`, setup a `completionProposalExpression` like `aql:self.getCompletionProposals(currentText, currentPosition)`.
* Implement (and register) the actual `getCompletionProposals()` like so:
```java
public List<CompletionProposal> getCompletionProposals(EObject self, String currentText, int currentPosition) {
  // The actual business logic
  return List.of(proposal1, proposal2, ...);
}
```

title: Use prettier-plugin-organize-imports to let prettier do the organize import
body:
To prevent inconsistent import order in frontend files we could add [prettier-plugin-organize-imports](https://www.npmjs.com/package/prettier-plugin-organize-imports) to our dev dependencies in order to check the import order thanks to the existing npm script `npx turbo run format-lint`.
The check will also be done during the CI.

title: Scoped services potential issue
body:
Since #1912 we have started to use scoped services (Request scope in that case). During the review, it appeared that using such services outside the scope they are supposed to be, fails with:

```
org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ScopeNotActiveException: Error creating bean with name 'scopedTarget.feedbackMessageService': Scope 'request' is not active for the current thread; consider defining a scoped proxy for this bean if you intend to refer to it from a singleton
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.doGetBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:374) ~[spring-beans-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.getBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:200) ~[spring-beans-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    at org.springframework.aop.target.SimpleBeanTargetSource.getTarget(SimpleBeanTargetSource.java:35) ~[spring-aop-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.CglibAopProxy$DynamicAdvisedInterceptor.intercept(CglibAopProxy.java:686) ~[spring-aop-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    at org.eclipse.sirius.components.web.services.FeedbackMessageService$$SpringCGLIB$$0.addFeedbackMessage(<generated>) ~[classes/:na]
    at org.eclipse.sirius.components.view.emf.diagram.ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.lambda$33(ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter.java:364) ~[classes/:na]
    at org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.components.NodeComponent.render(NodeComponent.java:96) ~[classes/:na]
    at org.eclipse.sirius.components.representations.BaseRenderer.renderComponent(BaseRenderer.java:200) ~[classes/:na]
...
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: No thread-bound request found: Are you referring to request attributes outside of an actual web request, or processing a request outside of the originally receiving thread? If you are actually operating within a web request and still receive this message, your code is probably running outside of DispatcherServlet: In this case, use RequestContextListener or RequestContextFilter to expose the current request.
    at org.springframework.web.context.request.RequestContextHolder.currentRequestAttributes(RequestContextHolder.java:131) ~[spring-web-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    at org.springframework.web.context.request.AbstractRequestAttributesScope.get(AbstractRequestAttributesScope.java:42) ~[spring-web-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.doGetBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:362) ~[spring-beans-6.0.8.jar:6.0.8]
    ... 69 common frames omitted
```

This stacktrace can be reproduced using the `feedbackMessageService` in the function returned by `ViewDiagramDescriptionConverter#getSemanticElementsProvider` and then, displaying a diagram.

A solution to prevent such stacktrace to be raised will be to check before the call of the service if it is in the scope it is supposed to be thanks to, a try-catch or, in a case of a request scope: `if(RequestContextHolder.getRequestAttributes() != null){} ` or equivalent.

This issue is meant to trace a potential issue with scoped service.

title: Tool reconnection doesn't work anymore for applications with a custom IViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService
body:
### Screenshots

![reconnect](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/128395825/630a320f-272e-4d31-8b10-ca766dae2c85)


### Actual behavior

The reconnection tool return an _ErrorPayload_ with an empty message.

title: NA
body:
Actually, tool reconnection works fine in Sirius Web's sample application.

My understanding is that Sirius **Components** hard-codes in `ViewReconnectionToolsExecutor.execute()` the logic to locate the `EdgeDescription`. This hard-coded logic happens to work in the context of Sirius **Web**, but for other applications which manage their View instances differently, we should delegate to `IViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService.findViewEdgeDescriptionById(String)` so that their own implementation of `IViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService`, consistent with their View models integration, is used instead.

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a new studio project using the "Studio" template.
- Download the studio project.
- From the projects page of Sirius Web, click on "upload project" and choose the downloaded studio.

### Actual behavior

When uploading a studio project into Sirius Web, the project is never imported and the upload query receives from the backend an error payload: "An unexpected error has occurred, please contact the server administrator". No feedback is displayed in the UI about this error.
On the backend, no errors but the logs indicate that no documents have been loaded:

title: Stop the form description editor from stealing the focus
body: While the form description is open, select a page description. Edit a textfield in the details view and switch using Tab to the next property. The focus will be stolen by the form description editor.

title: Add some horizontal padding to the slider to prevent overflow issues
Document creation should be configurable using the editing context
body:
The creation of documents (NewDocumentModal) is based on the stereotype description API. This API is very static (you need to compute the raw content of the document to create) and not configurable since everything must be setup at startup.

As a result, all kinds of documents are available in all projects.

- The API should be renamed to something like DocumentDescription, DocumentStereotype, or DocumentTemplate since it is now only used by the NewDocumentModal
- The useless documentName field should be removed since it is specified by the end user
- This API should be called at runtime in order to compute the document to create using the editing context

This would give us additional capabilities such as:

- Propose some document stereotypes only for relevant projects (no domain or views outside of studios)
- Dynamically computes the documents to create (creating a view in a document with a domain could initialize the view with data from the domain for example)

title: An exception can occur in the explorer while using Papaya
body:

title: Fix the project view-builder not passing all archunit tests
Support node resize with react-flow
Add custom widget to edit EMF references
body:
On the desktop side, Sirius (via EEF) provides rich widgets in its properties view to edit object references.
They support both mono-valued and multi-valued references, either contained or not, with all the relevant operations directly available in the widget: value selection, re-ordering, creation of new objects to add to the reference, etc.

On the web side, we only support a limited subset of this with the `Select` and `Multiselect` widgets, but by default they are only used for non-containment reference, and they do not support the richer behaviors of the EEF counterparts.

We should provide a new _custom_ widget to edit references which can be used either directly from the core APIs or via the View DSL.
They will provide the same level of configuration and features as its EEF counterpart: the specifier simply indicates which setting (owner and reference) to edit, and the widget adapts its look and features to the characteristics of the reference.

title: Improve the IWidgetDescriptor API
body:
In #1914 a new `IWidgetDescriptor` API was introduced on the backend to allow the the Form redering to handle custom widgets not defined in the core.
The shape of the API was modeled "naively" to match how `FormInstancePropsValidator`, `FormElementFactory` & co. handle the core component, but it lacks flexibility.
In particular it assumes that a given component type/class can only produce a single type of element (and a single type of corresponding props).

title: Completion is not enabled on expression fields from custom widgets
body:
The Slider widget introduced in #1914 defines 3 attributes typed `InterpretedExpression`.
There are normally rendered with a yellow background and have completion support enabled, but this is not the case for Slider.
This is because the test to detect these `InterpretedExpression` fields is too strict and assumes all widgets are defined inside the `View` EPackage itself.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new FormDescription.
2. Add a Slider widget inside a Group.
3. Select the widget in the explorer.

In the _Details_ panel, the 4 expression attributes should be rendered with a yellow background and support completion.

title: NPE when trying to render multi-valued widgets (List, Select, MultiSelect) with empty candidates expression
body:
Newly created List/Select/MultiSelect widgets (in a View-based form) have empty expressions for theirs values/candidates.
This should mean "no candidate", but because of how `ViewFormDescriptionConverterSwitch.getMultiValueProvider(String)` is implemented this results in a non-null and non-empty list of candidates/items, with a single `""` (empty string) item.
This causes NPEs later when when e.g. trying to determine the id/label/kind of `""`.

Basically, an empty expression should mean "no candidates" (`List.of()`), and not as is the case now "a single candidate that is the empty string" (`List.of("")`).

It's quite annoying because it means these widgets are not "ready to use" (even in an empty but valid state) on creation, and one always has to provide explicit configuration for them.

title: Create an interface for EditingDomainFactoryService
Add borderStyle for containers group and flexbox
Improve the integration of ReactFlow to match the capabilities of Sprotty
body:
### Shape

#### Problem

The current layouts face difficulties when handling complexity, such as compartments, multiline text, and edges.

#### Key Result

We have successfully achieved correct rendering of the Papyrus Web class diagram and state machine.

#### Current State

The layout computation is performed on the backend and rendered using Sprotty.

#### Solution

To address this, we propose shifting the layout computation to the frontend of each user. We adopt React Flow and stay true to the principles and spirit of React Flow. This approach allows for more flexibility and customization in handling complex layouts. We have implemented a specific layout known as the "incremental layout." This layout ensures that when an element is moved close to another one, the first element automatically adjusts its position to create space between them.

#### No-go

We have ruled out the option of having a specific electron process managed by the server to compute the layout once for everyone.

### Scope

- sbegaudeau
  - [x] #2087 
  - [x] #2095
- gcoutable
  - [x] #2090
  - [x] #2094
  - [x] #2104
- mcharfadi
  - [x] #2083
  - [x] #2086 
  - [x] #2142
  - [x] #2091
  - [x] #2103
  - [x] #2185


#### To be assigned later
- Snap to grid does not resize nodes on the grid
- Add support for border nodes (Handle in a special div to layout them with a custom style) (MIC ?)
First version: only display handles of selected nodes
- Add support for free form nodes within list based nodes
- Add Cypress tests
- Fix the issue where the diagram switches back to Sprotty
- Add support for shortcut (del)
- Fix an issue with the z-index of edges when a node is selected (SBE should edges have a z-index of 999999?)
- Add support for the edition of routing points (SBE?)
- Persist the layout in the local storage
- Drag and drop between containers?
- Add support for custom node types (Package)
- Add support for custom tools / panel actions
- Export to SVG / PNG

title: Add a modal to select a new value for single-valued references
body:
The newly added reference widget only supports *setting* a reference value through drag'n'drop from the explorer (which is not easily discoverable).

It should provide a "Browse"/"Select" button to open an explorer-like modal where the user can search for and select the new value for the reference.

The reference widget supports both single and multi-valued reference, but we will start here with the simpler case of single-valued references. Multi-valued ones require a different UI (two-pane) and will be handled afterwards.

title: Add a modal to edit the content of a multi-valued references
body:
This is followup to #2116 to provide a two-pane modal/dialog to edit the value of multi-valued references.

The left pane will be similar to the explorer-like "model browser" used for single-valued references, but the right pane will show a list of the selected values, with buttons to add/remove/move up/move down values from the list.
