title: Add support for non-selectable tree items
body:
For the various modals we will need for the reference widget (see #2116, #2117, #2118) we will need tree representations which *display* all the elements in the project but only all the selection of the elements which are type-compatible with the reference being edited.

The frontend can not compute this type compatibility by itself, and we do not want to query it each time the user selects an element.

Instead we will add a new flag to `TreeItem`, named `selectable`.
It will be `true` by default so that the current behavior does not change.
When rendering a Tree, the backend will be able to set the flag individually for each item.

On the frontend, the non-selectable items will have a different style.
They will still be focusable/expandable/collapsable and have a context menu (if relevant for them).
The only behavioral difference is that they will not participate in the selection.
In other words, they will never invoke the provided `setSelection` callback.

title: Move DocumentMetadataAdapter into sirius-components-emf
body:
The notion of Document only exists in the Sirius Web layer and is not available in Sirius Components.
However there are cases in Sirius Components where we want to display in the UI the EMF Resources which correspond to documents, and for that we need to know the user-friendly name of the document.
This is accessible with the `DocumentMetadataAdapter` attached to the resource, but this type is defined in `sirius-web-services`.

We will rename this adapter into a more generic `ResourceNameAdapter` and move it into `sirius-components-emf`.
The document-specific code which currently sets up `DocumentMetadataAdapter` will setup the new adapter (to which it has access), and this way all parts of Sirius Components which depend on `sirius-components-emf` will have acces the the user friendly name of the resources (however they are named at the application level).

title: Add the possibility to programmatically order and filter the pages of a form
Add support form multiple different "explorer-like" tree representations
body:
In the `sirius-components-collaborative-trees` most of the code is generic, but `TreeEventProcessorFactory` is hard-coded to support a single `TreeDescription` source, namely `IExplorerDescriptionProvider`.

For the various modals we will need for the reference widget (see #2116, #2117, #2118) we will need tree representations which use a different `TreeDescription` definition.

`TreeEventProcessorFactory` and the related code (both back and front) should be made more configurable to support for multiple `TreeDescription` definitions, so that the modals can use/subscribe to tree definitions adapted to their case.

body:
Today, only copyright from EMF generated classes are not with the format :

but

```
 * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
 * https://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0/
 *
 * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0
 *
 * Contributors:
 *      Obeo - initial API and implementation

```

Change them to a single format.

title: TreeItemContextMenuContribution should be Tree-specific
body:
It's possible to contribute context menu entries to be added to TreeItems, but this is done in a global context (`TreeItemContextMenuContext`) and `TreeItemContextMenuContributionProps#canHandle` is only given the `TreeItem`.
From that it is not possible to discriminate between different trees (not possible at the moment, but coming soon with #2126).

Tree item actions which make sense in the global Explorer may not make sense in other Tree representations (and vice versa).

title: Default form description provider should take EMF meta models into account regarding the read-only feature
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
 
Latest

* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 

All

### Problematic 

Meta models expressed with EMF specify their features with a `changeable ` flag. This means that if this flag is `false`, the feature won't be editable and should be displayed as read-only.
The default form description provider should take into account this changeableness when it provides all widget descriptions for features of the selected element.

Papyrus web Advanced page of Details panel leverages this default form description provider in order to display agnostic widgets for all features of the selected element. This is confusing that a feature that is declared as read-only can be changed in that page.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/128463513/624d51b6-fccd-4dac-b3b1-3fc05d7d1d23)
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/128463513/55ab5c9e-2ac9-443f-8ffe-29d087ee62cb)

Impact on:

- `org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.emf.properties.EStringIfDescriptionProvider`
- `org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.emf.properties.EBooleanIfDescriptionProvider`
- `org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.emf.properties.EEnumIfDescriptionProvider`
- `org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.emf.properties.MonoValuedNonContainmentReferenceIfDescriptionProvider`
- `org.eclipse.sirius.components.compatibility.emf.properties.MultiValuedNonContainmentReferenceIfDescriptionProvider`

### Steps to reproduce

Using the UML meta model for instance:

1. create a Class element
2. Select this node in the Explorer
3. Open Details panel if needed

### Expected behavior

 In Advanced page, `Qualifed name` should be read-only:

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/128463513/4728f4ac-cf0d-4023-8e32-c291ea8667af)


### Actual behavior

 In Advanced page, `Qualifed name`, which is declared in the meta model as rad-only can be modified:

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/128463513/cd3f52f8-611a-4161-a372-c06edc97e38f)

...

body:

Do you plan to go further and convert read-only widgets (all kinds) into a textual representation with Label? For instance, a read-only Select is only the default entry as a String, a List could be flattened as a coma separated String of values etc...
Maybe this approach is too much.

body: If you are on Windows, could you follow this please: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/issues/1417#issuecomment-1280803993?

title: TreeView should be configurable to allow only single selection
body: In the modal dialog used for the single-valued reference widget, we reuse the `TreeView` component (though with a different tree content definition and configuration). In this context the user should only be able to select a single value, but the `TreeView` currently always supports selecting multiple elements (using Ctrl+Click or Cmd+Click).

title: Multi-valued reference widget should support re-order using DnD instead of up/down buttons
body:
Currently, the reference widget allows the re-ordering of values (when showing a multi-valued reference) using Up & Down arrow buttons present on every item in the list.
It works but uses a lot of horizontal space (especially when the widget is displayed in the _Details_ panel) and creates some visual noise.
It would probably be cleaner in terms of UI to allow this re-ordering using direct manipulation of the items / Drag'n'Drop. We would still need a drag marker (maybe only visible on hover?) as a visual affordance that this operation is possible.

title: NA
body: This is now irrelevant with the new chip-based UI. Reordering (with DnD) will be handled inside the edition dialog (see #2117).

title: In the Reference widget modals, the filter bar should be initially visible
body:
The various modals opened by the _Reference_ widget use an _Explorer_-like tree representation.
In this context where the user will use that tree to search for new values for the reference, it would be nice to show the filter bar initially (or even always?). It's possible to open it by hitting Ctrl+F, but there is no visual clue that this feature is available.

title: The tree representation used by the Reference widget modals should prune sub-trees with no compatible values
body:
The tree description used by the modals for the Reference widget already mark values which are not type-compatible with the reference being edited as non-selectable.
If the backend can detect that a given sub-tree only contains incompatible values, it should simply prune it from the rendered tree. Otherwise the end-user can not know if there might or might not be some interesting/compatible value somewhere deep inside the tree that he can only discover by repeatedly expanding elements.

title: Add a button to invoke "Expand All" on the reference widget's modals
body:
The _Expand All_ operation is very useful when trying to locate elements in a tree (especially combined with the filter bar). In the content of the _Explorer_ panel, it is available in the context menu of a given element, but in the reference widget's modals we disable the context menu.
We could add an explicit button "Expand All" at the top of the tree view to invoke a global "Expand All" operation (on all the root elements of the tree).

title: Only display the Delete (Trashcan) icon on hover in the Reference widget
body:
To remove a value from the reference being edited, the _Reference_ widget provides a Delete/Trashcan icon on every item.

![screenshot-2023-07-10_15-11](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-components/assets/10608/db0ab294-2b85-408a-9d19-89f287d18024)

When showing a multi-valued reference with many values, this creates visual noise as the icons for all elements are always visible. Maybe the icon should only become visible when the mouse cursor is "hover" a given line/item.

title: NA
body: This has become irrelevant with the new design for the multi-valued reference widget.

title: Make the reference widget's UI more compact
body: It currenly uses quite a lot of space (especially vertical space), even with the underlying MUI `List` component in `dense` mode.

title: Initialy reveal & select the current value(s) of a reference in the corresponding modals
body:
When opening one of the selection modals for the (single or multi-valued) reference widget, the initial state of the tree is that everything is collapsed, and only the top-level nodes are visible.
We should ensure the tree is expanded just enough for the current value(s) of the reference to be visible and selected.
If the reference is currently empty, we should probably still expand at least one level (just showing the root elements inside the documents).

title: Add support for drop tool from the explorer
body: Add support for drop tool from the explorer with React Flow

title: Add support for manipulating transient data in forms
body:
Define dialogs on the view model to be rendered dynamically in the front end according to a set of interpreted expression

### Root Constraints

* intrinsic to the client server architcture. Only one mutation is done when applying on the dialog box from the front end. No mutation is done by any components of the dialog
* performance: no lag should appears when using the dialog
* simple: The definition of the dialog must be easy to do

### Features

* a dialog is an assembly of reusable components(widget, containers)
* a library of widgets:  so that advanced dialog box can be designed
  * select, radio, field etc
  * support semantic reference or any primitive type
* displayed data in the widgets can change according to other widget value
* advanced layout : based on CSS grid or flex
* validation :
  * messages can be dynamically displayed according to data displayed by the components
  * the apply button is enable only if all defined rules are filled
* a wysiwyg editor enables to define dialog in the front-end
* a way to access the dialog box from a semantic element
  * from explorer, diagram
  * with conditional expression

title: Add styled string for tree item labels
Add Cypress tests to ReactFlow
Add validation on models coming from domains
body:
* [ ] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Today, to register a new validator, you have to declare a new @Configuration as it is done for `org.eclipse.sirius.components.domain.emf.configuration.DomainEMFConfiguration`.

Unfortunately, it is not possible to register a package coming from a Domain with this registration method.
For example, if I declare a new `Family` domain, then I want to add a new Validator on it, I can't do this:
`this.eValidatorRegistry.put(getFamilyPackage(), new FamilyValidator());`
because the `FamilyPackage` is created by `org.eclipse.sirius.components.domain.emf.DomainConverter` each time it is needed.

So, even if I succeeded in retrieving my `FamilyPackage` using `IEditingContextEPackageService` then it will not be the same instance of the `FamilyPackage`.

title: Creating a domain from the onboard area action does not initialize its name
body: `EditingContextActionHandler.createEmptyDomainResource(ResourceSet)` does not call `domain.setName(this.domainNameProvider.getSampleDomainName());` like `StereotypeDescriptionRegistryConfigurer.getEmptyDomainContent()` does.

title: Extract the fullscreen capacity with react flow in a hook
Move the Arrange all behavior in the diagram panel
Reduce the amount of business code in DiagramRenderer
body:

title: Add initial support for EEF's DynamicFor/If to Forms
body:
Sirius Desktop, via EEF, supports [dynamic mappings](https://eclipse.dev/sirius/doc/specifier/properties/Properties_View_Description.html#dynamic_mappings) that offer the specifier/studio maker powerful control on how many instances of a given widget (including zero) are instanciated when a Form is rendered.

We will port this capability to the Sirius Component's Forms, including the View DSL.
As a first step (this ticket), we will implement the exact same feature as is present in EEF.
We'll see afterwards if/how it can be generalized.

title: [Question] How to use ReactFlow diagram?
body: I found that starting from the 2023.6.6 version, the ReactFlow module has been added to the Diagram components. How should this component be used? Will Sprotty be completely migrated to ReactFlow in the future?

title: NA
body: Yes, the end-goal is indeed to replace the Sprotty-based diagram rendering with one based on React Flow. For the moment, the React Flow version is considered experimental and not ready to be used. We hope to get feature parity with the Sprotty version (with a more reliable layout), and maybe make the switch around October.

title: Cleanup the multi toast integration
body:
It does not make much sense to have a custom context to return something which looks like a hook `useToast` but which is not a hook, in order to return the value of a real hook `useSnackbar`.

`useToast` and the `ToastContext` should probably be removed as they do not make sense.

In a similar fashion, I am barely sure why this was working in the first place since we have `ToastContext.types.ts` with the following content:

```
import { ProviderContext } from 'notistack';

export interface ToastContextValue {
  useToast: () => ProviderContext;
}
```

while we do not have a single dependency to `notistack` in the package.json of `sirius-components-core`:

```
  "peerDependencies": {
    "@apollo/client": "3.6.9",
    "@material-ui/core": "4.12.4",
    "@material-ui/icons": "4.11.3",
    "@xstate/react": "1.6.3",
    "graphql": "16.5.0",
    "react": "17.0.2",
    "xstate": "4.32.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@apollo/client": "3.6.9",
    "@eclipse-sirius/sirius-components-tsconfig": "~2023.8.0",
    "@material-ui/core": "4.12.4",
    "@material-ui/icons": "4.11.3",
    "@types/react": "17.0.37",
    "@vitejs/plugin-react": "2.0.0",
    "@xstate/react": "1.6.3",
    "c8": "7.12.0",
    "jsdom": "16.7.0",
    "graphql": "16.5.0",
    "prettier": "2.7.1",
    "react": "17.0.2",
    "rollup-plugin-peer-deps-external": "2.2.4",
    "xstate": "4.32.1",
    "typescript": "4.7.4",
    "vite": "3.0.4",
    "vitest": "0.21.1"
  }
}
```

All our packages should currently depend on `notistack` but this dependency has never been added.

title: Ensure that layout constraints are respected
body:
## Goals

- [x] https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2480
- [x] https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/1982
- [ ] https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2481
- [x] https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2482
- [x] https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2483
- [x] https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2484
- Support for multiple labels

## Decisions

### Remove GQLNode#type in ReactFlow and don't fetch this info in the GraphQL fragment `nodeFragment`

### Feature parity between rectangular and image nodes

Combine both `RectangularNode` and `ImageNode` into a `FreeFormNode` in the frontend. In a similar fashion, we should thus have only a `FreeFormNodeLayoutHandler`. We may change the GraphQL API / Programmatic API later but this is not an issue for now. It will allow image nodes to have children and to support the drop of semantic elements. The image could be connected to the node by using CSS background property.

See:
- `background-image: url("../img/blog.png") no-repeat center center;`
- `background-size: contain;`
- `background-repeat: no-repeat;`

Test with an image node with child nodes to see the result

### Inside Label

#### Optional labels

There will be two kinds of labels, 0..1 label inside (and 0..12 labels outside, will be done later).
The inside label should be optional. An optional label is not an empty label, there are no direct edit support (double click, typing, F2, direct edit tool in the palette)

In the View DSL, the inside label should be a dedicated concepts `InsideLabelDescription` contained by a `NodeDescription` with the `labelExpression` it should not change anything on the label style properties contained by NodeStyle.

- Papaya should be updated in order to display nodes without an inside label
- ReactFlow should also be updated to support nodes without an inside label
- List nodes support should be updated to handle the lack of a label

#### Position

The inside label can be positioned on:
- TOP_LEFT
- TOP_CENTER
- TOP_RIGHT
- LEFT_CENTER
- CENTER
- RIGHT_CENTER
- BOTTOM_LEFT
- BOTTOM_CENTER
- BOTTOM_RIGHT

The label needs to contain its location. We need to add the following concepts:

```
public enum InsideLabelLocation {
  TOP_LEFT,
  TOP_CENTER,
  TOP_RIGHT,
  LEFT_CENTER,
  CENTER,
  RIGHT_CENTER,
  BOTTOM_LEFT,
  BOTTOM_CENTER,
  BOTTOM_RIGHT,
}
```

```
// Rename the existing LabelDescription to InsideLabelDescription
public class InsideLabelDescription {
  private Function<VariableManager, InsideLabelLocation> location;
}
```

```
// Rename the existing Label to InsideLabel
public class InsideLabel {
  private InsideLabelLocation location;
}
```

```
public class Node {
  private InsideLabel label;
}
```

At this point in time, we will not be able to have outside labels anymore. In the odesign compatibility layer the inside label will be configured to `TOP_CENTER` while it will be configurable in the View DSL.

This should be tested with list nodes

### Header

A header can be used to prevent child nodes from overlapping the label area. The header can be located at the top for TOP_XXX labels, the bottom for BOTTOM_XXX labels and on the left for LEFT_CENTER and on the right for RIGHT_CENTER labels.

A CENTER label cannot have the property header -> This should not be possible in the creation of the InsideLabel#build() and we should thus throw an IllegalArgumentException here to prevent this use case from ever reaching the frontend. Add the class in a whitelist for the GeneralPurposeTests class. In the view DSL, always remove the header option, when converting, even if the option is true when the label's location is CENTER.

In a node with a list layout strategy, the label must be a header. Throw an exception if that's not the case. In the view DSL, always set the header option to true if the parent node has a list layout strategy even if the option is set to false.

`org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.RectangularNodeStyle#withHeader` should move to `InsideLabelDescription`.

### Outside label

- Add the ability to have multiple outside labels:
  - TOP_{BEGIN | MIDDLE | END}
  - RIGHT_{BEGIN | MIDDLE | END}
  - BOTTOM_{BEGIN | MIDDLE | END}
  - LEFT_{BEGIN | MIDDLE | END}

title: The existence of large models can slow down unrelated operations
body:
If some user creates a large model/document in a project _A_, then this can have a negative impact on the performance of completely unrelated operations, in particular opening other projects.

For example, create a dummy project an import [Voltron.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/files/12452013/Voltron.zip) (after unzipping it) a few times.

Then create a new, empty project. You'll notice a delay, and in the backend logs something like:

```
SlowQuery: 441 milliseconds. SQL: 'HikariProxyPreparedStatement@1672484306 wrapping SELECT * FROM Document document
WHERE length(document.content) > 0
AND document.content::jsonb @> ('{ "ns": { "' || 'domain' || '": "' || 'http://www.eclipse.org/sirius-web/domain' ||'" } }')::jsonb
'
```

This is because to detect the available Domain & View models we scan all existing documents *as JSON*. For large models, most of which will not be Domains or Views, but we still pay the cost of their conversion to JSON by PostgreSQL so it can make a precise query.

Adding a `AND document.content LIKE ('%' || ?2 || '%')` clause before attempting the JSON conversion improves the performance quite a lot, although it's still not perfect (I get down from ~400ms to ~40ms in my case).

I've tried `AND SUBSTRING(document.content FROM 1 FOR 512) LIKE ('%' || ?2 || '%')` to only scan the beginning of the documents (where the `ns` clauses are), but it's actually counter-productive (about twice as slow in my case, i.e around 80ms).

We should probably also store this kind of "document nature" outside of the document itself, but that is a more involved change for later.

title: Add customizability to the reference widget
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

As an Application integrator, I would like to control how the reference widget handles the reference. 
For instance, I would like to control how the candidate list is built or how the widget's actions are performed.

The goal is to provide a more detailed widget EMF model that provides all AQL expressions that guarantee fine control over each operation and property.

For instance, candidatesExpression might be introduced to control the way the compatible reference objects are retrieved.
At the moment, the reference widget is inferring this candidate list through an EMF search which may be insufficient in certain situations.

title: Robot flow with react-flow is broken
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a blank project
2. Create a Robot flow diagram and topography
3. Open the diagram with React-flow
4. Click on a _flow::Processor_ in the diagram

### Expected behavior

The application is still working

### Actual behavior

The application fails badly with `An error has occured, please contact your administrator or refresh the page...` is displayed and An `Uncaught TypeError: Cannot destructure property 'id' of 'tool' as it is undefined.` is raised in the console.

title: NA
body:
1. The first line of the `ToolSection` filters single click on diagram element tools. 2. It assumes the default tool is at index 0 3. It displays the default tool no matter what _ToolSection.tsx_: ```typescript const tools = toolSection.tools.filter(isSingleClickOnDiagramElementTool); ... let defaultTool: GQLTool = tools[0]; ... return (
onToolClick(defaultTool)} thumbnail /> {caretContent}
... ) ``` A _flow::Processor_ does not have any "single click on diagram tool", and thus, `defaultTool` is `undefined` then it fails to destructure properties of `undefined` in the Tool component.

title: NA
body: I will discuss with @sbegaudeau to add `noUncheckedIndexedAccess` to the strict configuration to prevent such issues from happening again.

title: It is possible to create inconsistent instances of domains
body: The `SetValue` operation [delegates](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/43efc4f43c8f23696d567c4b1b475e59e7b8f0fa/packages/view/backend/sirius-components-view-emf/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/view/emf/OperationInterpreterViewSwitch.java#L117) its implementation to [`EcoreIntrinsicExtender#eAdd`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-desktop/blob/master/plugins/org.eclipse.sirius.ecore.extender/src/org/eclipse/sirius/ecore/extender/business/internal/accessor/ecore/EcoreIntrinsicExtender.java#L94) from Sirius Desktop, which adds the requested value to the `Collection` value of the reference, but at least in the case of a dynamic EObject, nobody checks if the value is type-compatible with the corresponding EReference.

title: ViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService does not look into reused nodes
body:
When looking for a node by id (`ViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService.findNodeDescriptionById(DiagramDescription, String)`), we only search in:

```java
Stream.concat(node.getBorderNodesDescriptions().stream(), node.getChildrenDescriptions().stream())
```

This ignores reused (sub, border) nodes.

In "normal" cases, where we only reuse nodes defined from the same `DiagramDescription`, it does not cause any issue because the recursive walk on the `DiagramDescription`'s content will end-up finding the element.

In a case where the reused node is defined in another `DiagramDescription`, `findNodeDescriptionById` can return `Optional.empty()`. 
Clicking a such a node (which is correctly rendered) then causes an NPE:

```
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at java.base/java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:208) ~[na:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.dto.GetPaletteSuccessPayload.<init>(GetPaletteSuccessPayload.java:30) ~[classes/:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.handlers.GetPaletteEventHandler.handle(GetPaletteEventHandler.java:117) ~[classes/:na]
```

`GetPaletteEventHandler` is not ready to handle the case where `findDiagramElementDescription` is empty. In that case it leaves `palette` to `null`, and `GetPaletteSuccessPayload` rejects it.

Note that (I think) we can not "simply" do:

```java
List<NodeDescription> nodeDescriptionChildren = Stream.concat(
        Stream.concat(node.getBorderNodesDescriptions().stream(), node.getChildrenDescriptions().stream()),
        Stream.concat(node.getReusedBorderNodeDescriptions().stream(), node.getReusedChildNodeDescriptions().stream())).toList();
```

This could cause infinite loops if e.g. A reuses B and B reuses A (even indirectly).

title: NA
body: Note that `DropNodeCompatibiliyProvider.forEachNodeDescription(DiagramDescription, Consumer<NodeDescription>)` tries to work around the issue for its use case.

title: VS Code Integration for React Flow diagrams
The ChangeContext operation modifies the self value for the next siblings, not just for its children
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [ ] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version**: latest
* [ ] **I have specified my environment**: All
- my computer: Windows

### Steps to reproduce
- Have a tool/widget with three operations `A`, `B` and `C` with B child of A and C following sibling of A. By default, the self is a model element `foo`. `A` changes the context from `foo` to `bar`. `B` sets a value of `bar`. `C` sets a value of `foo`.
- Create a model based on the initial metamodel and a representation and execute the tool/widget.

### Expected behavior
The correct attributes of `foo` and `bar` have been modified.

### Actual behavior
Only `bar` has a modified attribute. If the attribute the language designer wants to modify for `bar` is also present in `foo`, the attribute of `foo` is modified instead of the `bar` attribute.
The `changeContext` doesn't introduce a new context where the value of `self` is only modified for its children. This has side effects on the next siblings.

title: The SetValue operation can create containment cycles
body:
In `OperationInterpreterViewSwitch.caseSetValue(SetValue)` we delegate to `EcoreIntrinsicExtender.eAdd(EObject, String, Object)` which for many-valued referencesd will blindly add the provided value to the EMF reference.

In the case of a containment reference, if the value to add is an ancestor of the reference owner, this can create containment cycles. When this happens the backend soon becomes unresponsive and/or crashes with OOM error because such cycles can cause infinite loops in many parts of the system.

title: Align the format of description id used in Form generated from View with the one used in diagram
body:
In the current implementation the id of those elements are simple UUID and do not carry any semantic information. On the contrary ID used in the diagram description part look like this:

```
siriusComponents://nodeDescription?sourceKind=view&sourceId=9de59fe4-7cf2-4b40-83cb-309b35d7ce29&sourceElementId=9ec8d9fc-bcb5-4cac-b839-3605130b698a
```

This issues aim to provide the same kind of mechanism to build the ID of the FormElementDescription than the one used in the diagram part. This will help to decouple the information required for the rendering and the code required for interaction (mutation etc...). Indeed with those ID it is simple to retrieve the source of the description that could later be used to provide tool, mutation handler etc...

title: ExplorerNavigationService#getAncestors fails on non-UUID selectionEntryId
body:
The following line in `ExplorerNavigationService` produces an `IllegalArgumentException` when the `selectioEntryId` String is not an UUID.  
```java
var optionalRepresentation = this.representationService.getRepresentation(UUID.fromString(selectionEntryId));
```

The exception is thrown by `UUID.fromString(String)`. 

Note that `ObjectService#getId(Object)` can return a non-UUID String (e.g. a URI fragment), and the `getAncestors` method can handle non-UUID IDs in the following line:
```java
var optionalSemanticObject = this.objectService.getObject(editingContext, selectionEntryId);
```

It seems that the method shouldn't look for a `RepresentationDescriptor` if `selectionEntryId` is not a valid UUID.



* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : 2023.8.3
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : windows (didn't try on another platform)

### Screenshots

Relevant stack trace
```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid UUID string: UML.metamodel.uml#ReduceAction
	at java.base/java.util.UUID.fromString1(UUID.java:280) ~[na:na]
	at java.base/java.util.UUID.fromString(UUID.java:258) ~[na:na]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.services.explorer.ExplorerNavigationService.getAncestors(ExplorerNavigationService.java:51) ~[sirius-web-services-2023.8.3.jar:2023.8.3]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.web.services.explorer.ExplorerTreePathProvider.handle(ExplorerTreePathProvider.java:54) ~[sirius-web-services-2023.8.3.jar:2023.8.3]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.trees.handlers.TreePathEventHandler.handle(TreePathEventHandler.java:71) ~[sirius-components-collaborative-trees-2023.8.3.jar:2023.8.3]
	at org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.trees.TreeEventProcessor.handle(TreeEventProcessor.java:118) ~[sirius-components-collaborative-trees-2023.8.3.jar:2023.8.3]
```

### Steps to reproduce

Call `ExplorerNavigationService#getAncestors` with a non-UUID `selectionEntryId`. 

### Expected behavior

`ExplorerNavigationService#getAncestors` returns the list of ancestors or an empty list when the `selectionEntryId` is a non-UUID String.

### Actual behavior

`ExplorerNavigationService#getAncestors` throws an `IllegalArgumentException`.

title: NA
body:
Just a couple of comments:

- `IObjectService#getId` lets specifiers provide any kind of String. `ObjectService#getId(Object)` can indeed return something other than an UUID but in Sirius Web right know, I don't think there's a single valid use case which should return something other than an UUID. It should only happen in applications derived from Sirius Web.
- `ExplorerNavigationService#getAncestors` does not support anything other than UUID, that's not what the input can be (any string is a valid input here) but in Sirius Web, as of today, we should only have UUIDs here too.

While Sirius Components allows any String, Sirius Web uses UUID all the time. In order to match more closely what can be expressed with Sirius Components, we should support `String` instead of `UUID` as the identifier of the representation (even if we keep storing a UUID in said string). We should thus change `RepresentationDescriptor#id`, the repository, the database schema etc.

title: Some success payload need to have Messages
body:
When some tools are used, some message should be displayed to the user from the frontend.
For example, when a user try to Drag and drop an element in an other one, the user should be informed that the DnD is not possible or user could be informed of additional information.

To inform user, we would like to use `org.eclipse.sirius.components.representations.Message`. Unfortunately the DropOnDiagramSuccessPayload cannot encapsulate Message. Only failurePayload could display Message. 
But `org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.diagrams.handlers.DropOnDiagramEventHandler` return failure only if `org.eclipse.sirius.components.view.emf.diagram.DiagramOperationInterpreter.executeTool(Tool, VariableManager)` return a failure. The DnD  AQL expression is evaluated with no error so there is no failure.

It would be interesting that DropOnDiagramSuccessPayload  can encapsulate Message to display to the user. For example, on EditTextField request, we can see that the successPayLoad can encapsulate Message (see screenShot).

Several successPayload could be completed with Message : 
- DropOnDiagramSuccessPayload 
- DeleteFromDiagramSuccessPayload
- SucessPayload from ReconnectEdgeEventHandler
- EditLabelSuccessPayload

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.1
* [X] **I have specified my environment** :  Windows 11

### Screenshots

![serviceLogger](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/c755fe58-027e-4cbe-b274-a22a0a713ff6)

### Steps to reproduce

* try to add Message on Drag and Drop service

### Expected behavior

* Message is displayed to inform user 

### Actual behavior

* No Message is displayed to inform user.

title: Allow to remove "Hide"/"Fade" tools from given node description
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

From specific diagram, a root node Description is always displayed on the diagram and the user can only create element inside this root node description. If the user "hide" this root element and open the diagram several weeks later, he could be lost because its diagram will be empty and no tool will be available on the diagram. The user will not have the reflex to look at the list of hidden items.

Tools Hide and Fade should be removed from given node description to avoid this behavior. 
If user display tools on a node Description Hide and Fade tools should be absent. 

It could be driven from the DSL view with AQL precondition expression to explain when tools should be removed or some check box "isHideToolDisplayed"/"isFadeToolDisplayed".

### Cuttings backs

Checkbox are acceptable to simplify development.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

No alternative to remove "Hide"/"Fade" tools (hard coded in Sirius Web)

title: [ReferenceWidget] Unable to select in a non containment reference one of my ancestor
body:
The Reference widget prevent the selection of an ancestor of _self_ in a _ReferenceWidget_. This true for the _dropDown_ candidates and for the modal selection. This use case should not be prevented. For example with this use case, we should be able to select an Entity2 ancestor of Entity1 in the linkedTo feature.

title: Consider Rectangular and Image nodes as the same kind of node
body:
### Remove GQLNode#type in ReactFlow and don't fetch this info in the GraphQL fragment `nodeFragment`

### Feature parity between rectangular and image nodes

Combine both `RectangularNode` and `ImageNode` into a `FreeFormNode` in the frontend. In a similar fashion, we should thus have only a `FreeFormNodeLayoutHandler`. We may change the GraphQL API / Programmatic API later but this is not an issue for now. It will allow image nodes to have children and support the drop of semantic elements. The image could be connected to the node by using CSS background property.

See:
- `background-image: url("../img/blog.png") no-repeat center center;`
- `background-size: contain;`
- `background-repeat: no-repeat;`

Test with an image node with child nodes to see the result

title: Add InsideLabelDescription to View DSL
Add the support for label location (TOP_CENTER only)
body:
#### Location

The inside label can be located on:
- TOP_LEFT
- TOP_CENTER
- TOP_RIGHT
- LEFT_CENTER
- CENTER
- RIGHT_CENTER
- BOTTOM_LEFT
- BOTTOM_CENTER
- BOTTOM_RIGHT

The label needs to contain its location. We need to add the following concepts:

```
public enum InsideLabelLocation {
  TOP_LEFT,
  TOP_CENTER,
  TOP_RIGHT,
  LEFT_CENTER,
  CENTER,
  RIGHT_CENTER,
  BOTTOM_LEFT,
  BOTTOM_CENTER,
  BOTTOM_RIGHT,
}
```

```
public class InsideLabel {
  private InsideLabelLocation location;
}
```

At this point in time, we will not be able to have outside labels anymore. In the odesign compatibility layer, the inside label will be configured to `TOP_CENTER` while it will be configurable in the View DSL.

This should be tested with list nodes

title: NA
body: For the first implementation, we will support only TOP_CENTER labels

title: Add the support for header in nodes (TOP_CENTER only)
body:
A header can prevent child nodes from overlapping the label area. The header can be located at the top for TOP_XXX labels, the bottom for BOTTOM_XXX labels, on the left for LEFT_CENTER, and on the right for RIGHT_CENTER labels.

A CENTER label cannot have the property header -> This should not be possible in the creation of the InsideLabel#build() and we should thus throw an IllegalArgumentException here to prevent this use case from ever reaching the frontend. Add the class to a whitelist for the GeneralPurposeTests class. In the view DSL, always remove the header option, when converting, even if the option is true when the label's location is CENTER.

The label must be a header in a node with a list layout strategy. Throw an exception if that's not the case. In the view DSL, always set the header option to true if the parent node has a list layout strategy even if the option is set to false.

`org.eclipse.sirius.components.diagrams.RectangularNodeStyle#withHeader` should move to `InsideLabelDescription`.

title: Select a semantic element in the explorer does not select the corresponding edge on a diagram
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a blank project and add a Robot model to it.
2. Create a _Topography_ diagram on the top-level _System_, and rename it into `Topography__REACT_FLOW`.
3. In the explorer, select the _WiFi_ element. The corresponding node is selected in the diagram and the diagram is centerd on it (OK).
4. In the explorer, select the _standard_ DataFlow element inside _WiFi_: the selection is changed in the explorer and the _Details_ view, but *not* on the diagram (KO).
5. Select _WiFi_ again in the explorer, and then select on the edge connecting _WiFi_ to _DSP_. The "standard" DataFlow is correctly selected everywhere, which confirms that the edge is indeed representing the DataFlow element.

https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/67ba094f-e085-4961-bbaa-4e18c7cb35cd

title: NA
body: It looks like in [`DiagramRenderer.tsx`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams-reactflow/src/renderer/DiagramRenderer.tsx) the `useEffect(() => {....}, [selection]);` hook invocation finds `edgesMatchingWorkbenchSelection` but then the code only handles nodes selection.

title: Graphical Dnd is not possible on container node description from hight depth level
body:
Graphical DnD is only possible on container display on the diagram or on container in an other container. On deeper container (for example a container in an other container contained in an other one), graphical DnD is not authorized. The container is not fade but it is not highlighted 

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.4

### Steps to reproduce

Create 3 nested containers and try to DnD a node description on the deepest container.  It should work.

### Expected behavior

It should be possible to DnD element graphically on each container, whatever their depth level on the diagram. 

### Actual behavior

It is only possible to DnD element graphically on node description on the first or second depth level.

title: Split sirius-web frontend module to reduce reuse effort
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The sirius-web frontend project contains a lot of things (index, modals, contributions, papaya, widgets...).

Developers who want to create a Sirius Web based application don't want all these things.

Developers who want to create a Sirius Web based application need a minimal `sirius-web` frontend module.

Thus, developers may create their own Sirius Web based application by creating their own `sirius-web` frontend module with a minimal effort.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

`sirius-web` frontend module will have a new dependency: `sirius-web-core` module.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

No alternatives considered.

title: DnD target detection does not ignore hidden nodes
body:
**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create a (React Flow) diagram with (at least) two nodes _N1_ and _N2_ (which can not be dropped on each other);
2. Select _N1_ and hide it (using the "hide" tool in its palette). Remember its position/footprint before.
3. Select _N2_ and try to move it to a position that overlaps the footprint occupied by _N1_ before it was hidden.

**Expected result**: it should be possible to move _N2_ to said position, as it is visually "free".

**Actual result**: _N2_ is reset to its initial position.


https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/3fcf9f84-1a7a-4869-8237-993b5fbb0990



This is because the node DnD code considers that the new request position overlaps a node which is not a compatible drop target, so it cancels the position change. Hidden nodes should not be considered when computing DnD targets & node overlaps.

title: Prevent list items being moved to inconsistent positions
body:
Since node DnD has been added, it is possible to move all nodes to arbitrary positions, including outside of their parent.

When a node is moved only partially outside of its parent, we currently leave it there.

For rectangle/image/list nodes, this is voluntary as in such a case we want the parent to expand to include the new node's position (this will be handled as part of a more general work on node resize and overlap handling).

For list items however this never makes sense. It should be possible to DnD list items, but not to change their position inside their parent like this:

https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/bcb345a2-f138-4585-aa36-05136a2d9b5d

title: Edge labels can be hidden/covered by other nodes
body: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/63febef6-86ad-47ff-8669-e2cf85f309e0

title: NA
body:
We set our edge label's `z-index` to 999 [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/dc1b9647ec555937efa0c06865ce315204a60db0/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams-reactflow/src/converter/convertDiagram.ts#L49), but React Flow [sets a selected node/container to `z-index` of 1000](https://github.com/xyflow/xyflow/blob/11.7.2/packages/core/src/store/utils.ts#L87):

```js
const selectedNodeZ: number = elevateNodesOnSelect ? 1000 : 0;
```

title: Close the diagram palette on Escape
body: Contextual palette should close by clicking on the X at the end of the toolbar => K.O. no X at the end.

title: NA
body: For palette closing on move/zoom, see https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2550

title: NA
body: We do not want an"X" anymore but it should be possible to close the palette with "echap". It works for pretty well on a node but not when the palette is open on the diagram directly.

title: NA
body:
Actually what happens when we hit "Esc" while a node is selected (and its palette visible) is *not* that _we_ close the palette.

It's that React Flow de-selects the node, and *that* triggers the disappearance of the palette. In every node component we have somehting like:

```jsx
{selected ? <DiagramElementPalette diagramElementId={id} labelId={data.label ? data.label.id : null} /> : null}
```

But when it's the diagram that is selected, hiting "Esc" does not "unselect" anything.

So we got the expected behavior for elements "for free" but also by chance, and we need to do something specific for the case of the diagram.

title: Add separate edge creation handles
body:
This is a first subset of #2443 which will only add the _edge creation handles_.
These will be different from the handles (black dots) used as connection points between edges and nodes.
They will only be visible when a node is selected (if the node can have edges), and will only serve to initiate the edge creation process.

The implementation will be based on the part of PR https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/2474 which corresponds to this subset.

title: Allow to target the whole node when creating or reconnecting an edge
body:
Currently when creating a new edge or reconnecting an existing one, the user is required to point to one of the 4 relatively small handles on the target node.
It would improve the ease of use if the use could point anywhere inside the target node (except of course inside subnodes).

title: NA
body: This is already implemented in https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/2474/files#diff-d29a5fc16e96ca28669d02308a431814124cf62eb4a01453e75eb7d7ecf711aa, using a new, transparent handle which covers the whole area of a node. The implementation (at least an initial version) will be based on extracting the relevant part of that PR.

body:
Since edge creation handles have been introduced, edges are only drawn up to them instead of up to the old "black dots" which where much closer to the actual target node's edge:

[Capture vidéo du 2023-11-14 14-56-37.webm](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/534f0a9a-2189-433e-a1ce-c83ddf02a023)

title: Use one handle per edges
body:
Right now, we are defining 4 handles per nodes.
Each edge's path start or end on an handle.
When we have several edges that share the same handles, the layout is messy.

We need to have one handle per source/target of an edge.

title: Invalid text cursor position when triggering direct edit on React Flow diagram
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create/open a diagram which uses React Flow and with at least one node with an editable label.
2. Select the node.
3. Start typing a new text for the label (e.g. "New Label").

The first character you type is placed at the end of the input, but the cursor is at the beginning of the input (so before the initial character). The resulting text is "ew LabelN" with the "N" at the end instead of the beginning.

title: Hitting "Esc" while editing a label in a React Flow diagram validates the edition instead of cancelling it
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create/open a diagram which uses React Flow and with at least one node with an editable label.
2. Select the node. Say the initial label is "initial"
3. Hit F2 and start typing a new label, "new label", then hit "Esc" to cancel the current edition.

**Expected:** The edition should be canceled and the label reverted to its original value ("initial") without any call to the backend (except for getting the initial text, but not after hitting "Esc").

**Actual:** The label edition tool is invoked with the current text at the time "Esc" is hit, validating the label change.

title: NA
body: This is because the `Textfield` used for the label input is configured with `onBlur={doRename}`.

title: Delay while palette tools are displayed
body:
The palette is composed of tools coming from a call to the backend and tools directly instantiated in the frontend.
While tools from the frontend are displayed directly, depending on the backend response time, others may be displayed with a delay, creating an unpleasant visual effect.

### Expected behavior

All the palette tools are display on the same time.

### Actual behavior

![palette_no_loader](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/128395825/c74ca7ab-4d68-4108-950a-6764c76e2330)

(For example purpose, I added a delay on the palette retrieve)

title: Add feedback during edge creation
NA
body: Only edge *creation* will be handled in this issue. Edge reconnection requires more work and will be done later.

### Expected behavior

The reconnection of an Edge on an incompatible source/target mapping is forbidden.

### Actual behavior

The reconnection of an Edge on an incompatible source/target mapping is allowed.
The backend raises an exception.

The fix should probably be done in `ReconnectEdgeEventHandler` or `ViewReconnectionToolsExecutor`.

title: Add customization possibilities for node labels

When contributing custom node, we should be able to change the rendering of the label while preserving its behavior as the direct edit

### Expected behavior

We must at least be able to :
* change the gap between icon and text label
* change the text label overflow style to applied ellipse if too long

body:

![Capture d’écran du 2023-11-20 11-50-11](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/d003a1b4-d073-491c-8507-d1e80cfdd790)

title: It's difficult to create new edges from nodes which already have many
body:
On a React Flow diagram, when a node has edges on all of its sides, it's difficult/impossible to create new ones because the "creation handles" are overlapped with the "reconnection handle" of the existing edges.

For example from an initial situation like this:

![Capture d’écran du 2023-11-20 15-48-22](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/13618f74-1192-4c97-86d7-d260e0ba033a)

All the edge creation handles (the ">" around the selected node) are "overridden" by the various edges. There is no location on the screen where the user can click to trigger an edge creation, all the selection zone for these handles are masked by the selection zone from the edges.

title: NA
body:
The issue is tricky because:
* all handles are children of the node DOM element
* all edges (and their labels) are part of another hierarchy of DOM element (an SVG actually)

The two are in "parallel" parts of the DOM, and the SVG used for the edges has a `z-index: 2000`. And we *want* it to be displayed above all the nodes, includes the selected ones.

![Capture d’écran du 2023-11-20 16-14-44](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/27f59d3d-263e-4a28-bff1-a4c4eaa38aa7)

title: NA
body:
The structure is:
* `react-flow__edges` (an `<svg/>` element) at `z-index: 2000`
* `react-flow__edgelabel-renderer`, which does not define a `z-index` by itself, but all the edge labels inside are at `z-index: 1001`
* `react-flow__nodes` which does not defines a `z-index` itself but contains all the `<div/>` for the nodes. These are at `z-index: 0` by default, but move to `z-index: 1000` when selected.
  * inside the `div` of a selected node, we find the creation handles at `z-index: 9999`.

title: NA
body:
The current conclusion is that with the current structure of DOM elements, we *can not* have both:
* edges (and their labels) which are always visible and thus above the nodes (including the selected ones)
* children (in the sense of DOM containment) of the node elements (which is the case for handles) which appear above edges.

title: EditingContextCrossReferenceAdapter delete too many objects
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- 2023.10.8
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All

### Steps to reproduce

Try to move an object from a container to another (in the same document).
All references to this moved object are lost, because they are cleaned by `EditingContextCrossReferenceAdapter`.

### Expected behavior

The references to a moved object are kept.

### Actual behavior

The references to a moved object are lost.

title: Tool sections could be expanded when the mouse is over it
body:
### Expected behavior
When the mouse cursor enters the area of a given tool section, the tool section could be automatically expanded to display its content.

Until now, only tooltip is displayed when the cursor is over the tool section. Around twenty tool sections can sometimes be displayed on some diagram. Waiting for the display of tooltip is not really productive in this case. Moreover it is complicated to describe content of tool section with just few word.
It would be more convenient to automatically unfold the toolsection when the user cursor is over the tool section icon (ant not only the arrow)

Example of toolsection when the cursor is over the tool section : 
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/e5f7521a-f061-48d9-9b00-e86cd66e9d52)


### Describe alternatives you've considered

In order to manage many tool sections, alternatives are : 
- display tool section name close to the icon,
- change the strategy to display tool section (menu with sub menu ?)

title: Diagram selection does not match with model explorer selection
body:
From ReactFlow, the selection in model explorer does not match with the explorer selection. The selection on diagram is not refreshed after selection of a semantic element (from explorer view) not represented on the diagram
(Maybe linked to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2500)

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.6
* [X] **I have specified my environment** : Window 11

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/4b85d76d-915f-4b73-8efd-637129a59ee8)

### Steps to reproduce

1- Create a project and a representation with entity domain
2- Create one entity1 on the diagram
3- Create one entity2 semantically only 
4- Select the node entity1 on the diagram : entity1 is selected on the diagram, entity1 is selected in explorer and properties of entity1 are displayed
5- Select the semantic element entity2 in explorer : entity2 is selected in explorer, properties of entity2 are displayed but entity1 is still selected on diagram

### Expected behavior

The node on diagram should be deselected.


### Actual behavior

The node on diagram is still selected after user select an other semantic element in the explorer view.

title: Add default free space at the bottom of full filled compartment
body:
### Expected behavior

From full filled compartment, it will be useful to have some space after the last element of the list.
This space could be used to create an other element for example or to drag and drop something in the compartment when this one is full filled. Indeed, you cannot have the compartment palette tool from a full filled compartment because you always click on element from the compartment instead of the compartment. 
Goal : add free space left to access the tools for children creation.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/4dd769ac-6fae-427e-89c7-0d907aa38d35)

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Some hacks from the specifier can be found but it’s weird to do this bypass for such a simple need.

title: Edges connected to the left or right side of a node are not properly centered
body:
See for example:

![Capture d’écran du 2023-11-20 11-50-20](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/dcbeb4ff-69a1-4712-bf1c-7e8fb8119209)

The edge should start from the middle of the right side of "DataSource 1" and end on the middle of the left side of "Composite Processor".

Currently they are at 1/3 of the side, because of the presence of an invisible "virtual" handle. That handle is required for internal/technical reasons, but should not be accounted for when placing the actual _real_ edge handles.

title: Reduce edges crossing
body: Since handles are ordered arbitrarily, edges can cross each-others.

title: The palette remains open when the selection is changed outside of the diagram
body:
Tool palette should be displayed when an element is selected. 
When we open a new project, if user select element in explorer view, the matching node is selected on the diagram but no palette tool is displayed. If user select the node on the diagram, the palette tool is displayed. Then if user select an other element from explorer view, the palette tool is still displayed. 
The display of tool palette is not coherent. 

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.6
* [X] **I have specified my environment** : Window 11

### Screenshots

![toolsPalette](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/a0cb4375-b493-4e73-bb24-504c5fa1127d)


### Steps to reproduce

1- Create a project and a representation with entity domain
2- Create entity1 and entity2 on the diagram
3- Close and open the diagram
4- Select entity1 from the explorer view : entity1 node is selected on diagram but no palette tool is displayed
5- Click on entity1 node from diagram 
6- Click on entity2 from explorer view : entity2 node is selected and palette tool appears

### Expected behavior

Palette tool should appear when entity1 is selected after opening the project and selected it from explorer view. 

### Actual behavior

Palette tool does not appear when entity1 is selected after opening the project and selected it from explorer view.

I strongly disagree on the expected behavior, here the user as not performed any interaction with the diagram, the palette should be closed if the selection is changed from the workbench, not opened on the second element. An interaction in another representation should not start triggering things like that.

title: Diagram selection is not synchronized with Explorer selection
body:
When a node is selected, the palette tool appears systematically in ReactFlow. User can close the palette with "echap" (see https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2552)  but the node is then deselected. This behavior is weird because the semantic element is still selected in Explorer view and because Properties view still display properties about this element. 

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.6
* [X] **I have specified my environment** : Window 11

### Screenshots

![synchSelectionDiagram](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/2b91f473-1594-4b99-895e-0686e7664d47)

### Steps to reproduce

1- Open project with entity domain
2- Select an entity node on the diagram
3- Press "Echap" : the node is deselected

### Expected behavior

The node should be still selected in order to be coherent with selection in explorer view and in Properties view.

### Actual behavior
The node is deselected.

title: NA
body:
> The node should be still selected in order to be coherent with selection in explorer view and in Properties view.

We could also remove the node from the selection of the workbench... I don't have an opinion on either solution, whatever is the easiest to implement.

title: NA

This issue is fixed on sirius web2024.3.0
It seems https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/3044 has fixed it.

title: When invoking a tool from a tool section with multiple choices, the last one invoked should become the default
body:
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create/open a Domain diagram (React Flow mode).
2. Create an _Entity_ if needed.
3. Click on the _Entity_, its palette opens.
4. The tool section for attribute creation defaults to "Text" attributes.
5. Open the tool section and select "Boolean". A boolean attribute is created.
6. Re-open the entity's palette

**Expected**: the "Boolean" creation tool should now be the default proposed for the tool section as it is the last one invoked.

**Actual**: the default is still the "Text" attribute creation tool.

[Capture vidéo du 2023-11-22 09-28-32.webm](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/8bb076ed-2eaa-4e62-beb6-d1d05224b2c5)

title: The useDropNode hook has an invalid lifecycle
body:
### Issue

The useDropNode hook is responsible for several pieces of behavior related to dragging and dropping nodes. As a result of this complexity, it has many responsibilities which do not work properly.

- It contains a function named `onNodeDragStart` used by the `DiagramRenderer` to know which node is being dragged
- It contains a variable named `dropFeedbackStyleProvider` used by the various nodes to know how the style of the various nodes should be impacted
- It contains a GraphQL query used with `useQuery` to retrieve compatibility information

As a result of all those responsibilities, this hook is used at several location in the code such as:

- `DiagramRenderer`
- `ImageNode`
- `ListNode`
- `RectangularNode`
- `EllipseNode`

By the way, it seems a bit odd that it is not used in `IconLabelNode`...

With the multiplication of those responsibilities, the hook has now three ways to store pieces of informations with `setDropData`, `setDraggedNode` and `setDropNodeCompatibilityData`. The lifecycle of those individual pieces of state is invalid and creating bugs.

The multiplication of `useState` / `useContext` to store things here and there is creating very subtle issues.

#### Dragged node

If we were to inline the code of this hook to understand its impact a bit better, we have at least five locations in the code which are each storing what they think is the currently dragged node. So in memory, for a diagram displaying "n" nodes, we will have this information stored in "n+1" location and "n" of those will have the wrong information since only the instance of this hook used by the `DiagramRenderer` will be properly updated.

#### Compatibility query

We will also have "n+1" location trying to perform calls to `useQuery` to retrieve the compatibility data, "n" of those are useless since the query depends only the editing context id and the representation id.

### Solution

The hook `useDropNode` should be separated in smaller hooks with a proper lifecycle. The hook `useDropNode` should only be used by the `DiagramRenderer` and it should provide the following API:

```
export interface UseDropNodeValue {
  onNodeDragStart: NodeDragHandler;
  onNodeDrag: NodeDragHandler;
  onNodeDragStop: (onDragCancelled: (node: Node) => void) => NodeDragHandler;
  dropData: NodeDropData;
  diagramBackgroundStyle: DiagramBackgroundStyle;
}
```

- It should be the only one performing the retrieval of compatibility data
- It should not have any `useState<GQLDropNodeCompatibilityEntry[]>([])`, it's not necessary
- It should not have both a `DropNodeContext` and a ` useState<Node<NodeData> | null>(null)`, the `draggedNode` state should probably be removed since it's not necessary

A second hook, which would not perform any GraphQL query nor store any state named `useDropNodeStyle(nodeId: string)` should be introduced with the following API:

```
export interface useDropNodeStyleValue {
  style: React.CSSProperties
}
```

This hook should only request the relevant data from the `DropNodeContext`

title: NA
body: It should also be noted that errors from the backend are not considered while retrieving the compatibility data. They should be displayed as usual

title: NA
body: Even better, as suggested by @gcoutable the retrieval of the compatibility data could be done in the `DiagramRepresentation` which already retrieves similar kind of data

title: With React Flow the connection line is lost during relation type choice
body:
If there are two or more connectorTools on an edge creation, a popup is display to select the wanted connection.
But at this point, we lost the connection line betwenn the two nodes, which can be disturbing for the user.

In sprotty with the magic connector we don't have this behavior.

title: An error may occur when switching representation
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Switch react_flow representation from explorer

### Expected behavior

No error

### Actual behavior

![error_switching_representation](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/128395825/865f4c4a-0446-4688-8727-24f3d622abfc)

title: NA
body:
This error happens because the `getDiagramDescriptionQuery` is called before the eventProcessor is created.
It doesn't occured on the first opening thanks to `skip: state.diagramRefreshedEventPayload === null` in `DiagramRepresentation`, but when switching between representation the state is not reset so `diagramRefreshedEventPayload` exist from the previous representation.

- The key in `DiagramRepresentation` could be removed
- The various SWITCH_REPRESENTATION state in some state machine are not necessary anymore

title: Node handles are always on right or left
NA
body:
Initially handles were initialized on the left and the right of nodes every time a refresh event payload was received, which was happening rarely.
Since https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2262 we share the position and size of nodes between all opened diagram instances which implies a diagram refresh payload for all opened diagrams on every change, and thus, always initializes node handle position to the left and right of nodes

title: NA
body: The first thing to do will be to execute the algorithm that sets the position of handles on the conversion.

title: The palette rerenders too much
body:
### Steps to reproduce
Log something in the DiagramElementPalette or DiagramPalette composant.

### Expected behavior

When the palette is closed, we should not see any logs.

### Actual behavior

Since we're using the useViewport(); hook, the palette re renders when the viewport changes, meaning the palette gets re rendered a lot during a move.

### What to do

We should get the value of the viewport directly from the store instead of using the useViewport() hook.
```
  const store = useStoreApi();
 const [viewportX, viewportY, viewportZoom] = [...transform];
```

title: Tools from the palette are not triggered if the mouse is moving (even a little)
body:
It's relatively tricky to trigger, but actually happens quite often in practice, and can be confusing.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a (React Flow) diagram.
2. Select a node, its palette appears.
3. Move the mouse on one of the palette tools.
4. Without moving the mouse press the left button and _keep it pressed_.
5. Move the mouse (as little as possible, e.g. 1px).
6. Release the mouse button.

The tool is not invoked/triggered. The "scroll/pan the diagram and close any palette" behavior is triggered on the move.

In practice this happens very often when trying to trigger a tool; even a very small mouse move while clicking can make the tool not trigger.

title: Nodes can be temporarily faded when clicking/selected another one
body:
With the support for node DnD, when we start moving a node _A_, we fade all other nodes which are not compatible drop targets.

In the first version of DnD, we considered a DnD to be "in progress" only when React Flow had called `onNodeDrag` on our node. See [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/commit/591ddb493cf4a5920a62370c72fbc0f0e69ac1bd#diff-304b6768613ae0428dba2ab4709d1f857ff8816e6a71020094c202cbedcc3d15L198) where we set `draggedNodeId` to `null` in `onNodeDragStart` and only set it to `node.id` in `onNodeDrag`.

After the refactoring done in https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/2620 we now consider a DnD to be "in progress" as soon as React Flow calls `onDragStart`. However this happens even on a plain click to select a node without moving. `onDragStop` is called when the mouse is released.

The consequence is that when clicking on a node, we temporarily fade all nodes which are note compatible drop targets, which causes "flickering" on the diagram.

[Capture vidéo du 2023-11-29 11-10-27.webm](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/e00405b8-adca-4325-a259-07bd6e6b0c7c)

There is a moment where the "Entity 2" and "bob is typing" nodes are incorrectly faded:

![Capture d’écran du 2023-11-29 11-12-49](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/0730ac44-dabc-46e6-a5bc-6f9b7c4e4503)

title: NA
body: It should be possible to use the [node-drag-threshold](https://reactflow.dev/api-reference/react-flow#node-drag-threshold) by upgrading ReactFlow to v11.9.0

title: ConnectionHandles rerender too much
body:
ConnectionHandles rerender too much because we use useStore in combination with a selector that changes identity each time.
`const edgesSelectedSelector = (state: ReactFlowState) =>
  Array.from(state.edges.values()).filter((edge) => edge.selected);`
  The selector return an array, we should return a string.
  
  Also we should wrap ConnectionHandles in `memo`.

title: Several hooks impact performances
body:
We're relying on several ReactFlow hooks to get informations about nodes or edges.

There is an expensive performance cost associated with the use of `useNodes()` `useEdges()` and `useStore(selector)`.
Components that are using these hooks rerender each times the nodes, edges, or the selector change.

Since we mostly need the values returned from this hooks to perform an action based on an event, we should use `useReactFlow().getNodes()`  `useReactFlow().getEdges()` or `useStoreApi(selector)` instead to prevents unnecessary rerenders and optimize performance.

Note that you can also provide an equality function to `useStore()` to reduce rerenders.

When user create an edge between source an target (which are not exactly aligned), a Manhattan edge is systematically created whereas it is not always necessary. For example, sometimes, it is possible to create a rectilinear edge.  When it is possible, it should be interesting to the user to have a rectilinear edge with position of the source handle computed according to the position of the target handle.

![coude](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/9806c196-92fd-4689-9490-a0bb77c87747)

### Potential side effects

Too much customization ?

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Move the handle source manually

title: Message contained by GraphQL answers is not systematically displayed to the user
body:
Some answers of GraphQL request have message but they are not always displayed to the user.
For example when user create a new edge, we can see that the GraphQL answer contain a message but it is not displayed. 
See https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2453: Edge creation tools weren't part of the supported tools for feedback messages.
It could be interesting to check that GraphQL message of every action is well displayed.

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.9
* [X] **I have specified my environment** :  Windows 11

### Screenshots

The GraphQL answer with the message : 

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/b8e52a28-0cc0-4743-a5d0-310b340d1ddc)

### Expected behavior

When GraphQL answer contain message, it should be displayed to the user.

### Actual behavior

When GraphQL answer contain message, it  is not always displayed.

title: Palette tools displayed on two lines and unfold tool section are mixed
body:
### Expected behavior

When user display palette tool with many tool section (or tools), the palette is too long and it is displayed on 2 lines. If user unfold a tool section, tools in tool section are mixed with tools from the second line of the palette.

![mixedPalette](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/3ed86115-7724-40df-9d18-05f1b93588fc)

### Potential side effects

If the second line is hidden when user unfold tool section, it could be difficult to click on tools of the second line if the functionality of automatic unfold tool section is set up.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

When user unfold the tool section, the second line of the palette could be hidden or the palette could be displayed on one line (not two lines).

The integration tests of the `sirius-web-persistence` module need a running Docker to launch a containerized PostgreSQL database.

Check https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ for installation instructions for your OS.

You can also pass `-DskipTests` to the Maven invocation so that the tests are ignored if you do not want (or can not) install Docker.

A portal can be created anywhere (on any semantic element in the project) and is just a kind of dashboard where the end-user can add other representations (of any kind) so that they can be all opened at the same time.

See https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/2691 for the corresponding shape.

A more detailed ADR focusing on the technical aspects will be proposed soon.

title: The Tree/Explorer should not prevent dragging representations
body:
In `TreeItem` we do:

https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/2e8ab3bb2a0a3dd16567346bb18d8018429cc8da/packages/trees/frontend/sirius-components-trees/src/treeitems/TreeItem.tsx#L374-L377

which prevents dragging any tree item which represents something else than a semantic element.
In particular, this prevents dragging representations, which is something we want for e.g. #2765.

The tree representation should no try and impose any restriction on what can be dragged. It's up to each drop target to decide if it supports a particular kind of item.

title: Remove sprotty related code
Diagrams can be slow to open
body:
In some use cases, visible in projects like Eclipse Papyrus Web or Eclipse SysOn, some diagrams can be slow to display. 

While part of the issue may come from our new integration with ReactFlow, the fact that the diagram panel can take a couple seconds to be displayed makes me believe that something may be going on on the backend side of the application.

The first goal of this issue is to ensure that we have the proper monitoring capabilities, based on on micrometer on the backend, in order to evaluate the time spent on the various steps of the following use cases:

- with a simple syson project, when I open an empty diagram, then I want the diagram to be loaded quickly
- with a simple syson project, when I switch from one diagram to another (after more than six seconds on the current diagram), then I want the diagram to be loaded quickly

The following steps should be monitored to have some timing data:

- loading of the editing context event processor
- loading of the diagram event processor
- refresh of the representation
- sending the diagram refresh event payload to the frontend
- time to process each input (to detect that an input is being processed while another one has been sent)
- rendered of the diagram on the frontend (using something like console.log on the frontend)

We should be able to retrieve monitoring data from an instance of syson running locally using prometheus and grafana and after that monitor how things are running on the real demo instance on AWS. Once we will have those data, we will see how to proceed to fix the issues detected.

body:

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**

### Steps to reproduce

Activate direct edit on a node.

### Expected behavior

When user activates direct edit, the feedback should be more general such as "Enter the new value" or "Enter the new {featureName}" (last proposition is the prefer one from some client). An other solution could be to remove the feedback (maybe a bad idea because the color of the field to enter the new text is the same than the node so it could be difficult to identify that direct edit is activate).

### Actual behavior

Direct Edit feedback is not correct for some node. For example, when user activate dire edit on a comment, the feedback propose "Enter the new name" but a comment has no "name", just a "body".

title: Space between the first compartment and the header of its container
body:
There is some space between the first compartment of a container and the header of the compartment. This space can be shown when user click on the first compartment. Besides, we can see that the first element element of the first container has not the same position (vertically compare to the compartment separation) than the first element of the second container because of this space.

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
