![espPremierCompartiment](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/ecbade84-d6b8-4f79-85a8-894a286a81c2)

### Steps to reproduce

create a container with 2 compartment and fill each compartment with element.

### Expected behavior

The north border of the first compartment should coincide/overlay with the header separation. 

### Actual behavior

There is some space between the first compartment of a container and the header of the compartment. This space can be shown when user click on the first compartment. Besides, we can see that the first element element of the first container has not the same position (vertically compare to the compartment separation) than the first element of the second container.

title: "Fade" feature hide some compartment borders
body:
The "Fade" feature does not behave correctly on container with compartment. When user "Fade" the container, the container is "Fade" but its compartment are half revealed. Two solutions : we should see border of compartments and their content or we should see all compartments and their content "Fade".

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.9
* [X] **I have specified my environment** : Window 11

### Screenshots

![fade](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/c5d34078-3544-4381-825d-b73735fb9eff)

### Steps to reproduce

Use functionality "Fade" on container with compartment

### Expected behavior

Each border of the compartment should be revealed when its container is "Fade". In fact, East/West/North border of compartment should never be transparent. 

### Actual behavior

The "Fade" feature does not behave correctly on container with compartment. When user "Fade" the container, the container is "Fade" but its compartment are half revealed. Two solutions : we should see border of compartments and their content or we should see all compartments and their content "Fade".
I suppose that only south border of compartment are revealed because by default, East/West/North border of compartment are always hidden/transparent.

title: Compartment separation line is not drawn completely
body:
The separation border between compartment of container is not complete. Missing pixels can be seen at the ends of the split bar.
This behavior is probably due to the fact that East/West/North border are transparent so south angles of compartment are hazy. 

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**

### Steps to reproduce

Create a container with two compartments

### Expected behavior

The split bar between compartment should be complete. 

### Actual behavior

The separation border between compartment of container is not complete. Missing pixels can be seen at the ends of the split bar.
This behavior is probably due to the fact that East/West/North border are transparent so south angles of compartment are hazy.

title: Diagram exported in SVG are not completely usable
body:
It exists  "Export to SVG" action in the main toolbar on reactflow diagrams. This action export the diagram in SVG. While the SVG image can be opened with a browser to display the diagram, the SVG image is not usable outside of  a browser. For example, if user opens the SVG image with inkscape or if he wants to insert image in document, the result is a blank image because of html content inside the SVG image.

* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.10.9
* [X] **I have specified my environment** : Window 11

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/281ede40-f8e5-4e86-a406-f664edbb4a72)

### Steps to reproduce

Open a diagram and click on button "Export to SVG" from the main toolbar. 

### Expected behavior

The SVG image should be usable without any browser.

### Actual behavior

It exists  "Export to SVG" action in the main toolbar on reactflow diagrams. This action export the diagram in SVG. While the SVG image can be opened with a browser to display the diagram, the SVG image is not usable outside of  a browser. For example, if user opens the SVG image with inkscape or if he wants to insert image in document, the result is a blank image because of html content inside the SVG image.

title: Add a way to customize the tree displayed to selected the candidates in a Reference Widget
body:
The "..."button in the reference widget always use the same tree. This tree is defined by a list of roots (using _IReferenceWidgetRootCandidateSearchProvider_ service) and the type of the target. This might not be enough in some use cases.
For example, the candidates might need to match an extra criterion to be selectable.

### Expected behavior

It could be great if in the widget description we could define the tree to be displayed in the modal.
For example, by creating the "treeId" using an expression. That would allow the user to create its own tree or define its own "isSelectable" expression.

To avoid duplicating code from _org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.widget.reference.browser.ModelBrowsersDescriptionProvider_ it could be great to extract method _org.eclipse.sirius.components.collaborative.widget.reference.browser.ModelBrowsersDescriptionProvider.getModelBrowserDescription(String, Predicate<VariableManager>, Function<VariableManager, Boolean>, Function<VariableManager, List<?>>)_ in its own class. So it would be easy to create a _basic_ tree and only customize the _selectableProvider_.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

In the use cases we have for now, we only need to customize the _isSelectable_ feature. So it could be possible to only provide this by an expression. However, it gives less extension capabilities.

title: Split the view DSL support into dedicated projects
body: While it's not an issue today, if someone wants to add support for the view DSL to their application, they have to take all the compatibility layers at once. You can't add support for the Sirius Diagram View DSL in an application without adding all the other view DSLs (forms, etc).

title: Organize module in starters to ease the definition of what is part of application
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**

### Actual behavior

Currently `sirius-web-sample-application` owns a lot of spring `@Configuration`. It implies dependencies to every representation and various meta-models.(charts, diagram, gantt, deck etc)

### Expected behavior

We should split those configuration and put them in starter module so that an application would have just to choose the starter

Example  of Gantt & Deck:

`ViewGanttDescriptionBuilder` is an example of Gantt view which depends on Gantt and Task meta-model
Gantt and Deck should be used independantly from the Task meta-model and independantly from each other
Using Task for Gantt or Deck should not imply respectively the usage of Deck or Gantt

For such reasons we could imagine having 
* a module containing the Bean for Task
* a module, depending on gantt(`sirius-components-view-gantt` `sirius-components-view-gantt-edit` , `sirius-components-XXX-gantt`, containing for example the Bean for view Gantt (EPackage, AdapterFactory) and ViewGanttConverter (that convert view modele to POJO description)
* a module, depending of the two previous, containing the Bean for the Gantt stereotype that uses `ViewGanttDescriptionBuilder`

title: Provide a common ShareRepresentationDialog
body:
Most representation kinds have (or should/will have) a "share" button in their toolbar, which opens a modal dialog with the direct URL of the representation and copies it into the system clipboard.

* Diagrams have [`ShareDiagramDialog`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams-reactflow/src/renderer/ShareDiagramDialog.tsx)
* Gantt have [`ShareGanttModal.tsx`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/gantt/frontend/sirius-components-gantt/src/share-gantt/ShareGanttModal.tsx) which is very similar but takes the URL to share as a prop instead of hard-coding the use of `window.location.href`.
* Portals and Deck representation will need one.
* Forms should also probably have one, but they currently do not have a toolbar where to place it.

Anyway, there is nothing specific to the nature of the representation shared in this modal, so it would be better to have a single common implementation.

In addition, the use of `window.location.href` (either hard-coded or passed as a prop) will soon become incorrect. For representations embedded inside a portal, sharing the representation should not share the current URL, which is the portal's URL.

Proposed interface for the shared implementation:

```js
export interface ShareRepresentationModalProps {
  editingContextId: string;
  representationId: string;
  onClose: () => void;
}
```

The URL shared would need to be computed from `editingContextId` and `representationId`.
The issue is that this mapping between `editingContextId` and `representationId` on one side and the URL on the other side is defined in `sirius-web-application/src/router/Router.tsx` at the application level.

title: NA
body: Inside the proposed `ShareRepresentationModal` we could use the `ServerContext` to get the `httpOrigin` part of the URL. Should this context also expose the application-level routing/rule determining the URL of a representation?

title: NA
NA
body: It's probably overkill for our case, but we could defined the path "pattern" (`/projects/:projectId/edit/:representationId?`) only once, refer to it in the  `<Route/>` and use it again with React Router's [`generatePath`](https://reactrouter.com/en/main/utils/generate-path) to implement the function above.

title: RepresentationsView should not filter on the selection type
body:
Currrently the RepresentationsView, which is not (yet) a FormBasedView but shares 99% of the code, filter out selection entries which are not semantic elements.

This prevents having e.g. a details view on a _Representation_, or (more to the point) a _Representations_ view showing the contents of a _Portal_ representation.

There is no particularly good reason for the frontend to perform any filtering. It should pass the selection to the backend, and let the backend decide which _Form_ to display, which may be an empty one or one with a single _Label_ widget displaying a message that the selection is not supported.

title: NA
body: This will not be needed it #2875 is implemented, as FormBasedView does not have this limitation, at least on the frontend.

title: The Representations view should be a normal FormBasedView
body:
It shares 99% of the code (except for some bug fixes and improvements which where only made on FormBasedViews, e.g. #1068).

The only tricky part is that although the _Representations_ view uses a Form-based List widget, its frontend does not display the whole form with the tabs/pages and groups.

I was able to get the same result by adding an optional `postProcessor` function to `FormBasedView` to extract the relevant part of the _Form_ returned by the backend and only display that. This feels a little hackish but I'll push a draft PR to start a discussion.

body:

In other words, if "Topography unsynchronized" from below were embedded in a portal, the frame header should be "FlowNewModel > NewSystem > CompositeProcessor1 > Topography unsynchronized", with each segment a link to select the corresponding element (and in the case of the last segment, open the representation itself "in full").

title: All success payloads need to have messages
body:
This feature request is a follow-up of the one described in https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2453. Some success payload can now contain messages to display to the user, while some other don't. It could be interesting to uniformize this behavior and let the specifier push log messages to the user on all the requests.

In our project we specifically need to embed a message in the response of this request: `getConnectorTools`. In our use case we'd like to show a message to the user when he/she attempts to create an edge between two elements that cannot be connected together.

Note: this issue is also related to https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2732: the messages added to the success payloads should also be displayed to the end user.

* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
The message set via the `ServiceLogger` is added to the payload and displayed to the end user.

### Potential side effects


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Supporting message for `getConnectorTools` success payload would solve our current issue, but we may have similar issues with other payloads in the future.

title: NA
body:
While we intend to have most of our representation success payload carry messages since they are used as a response to changes in the system, we won't add messages to every random field of the GraphQL schema. In this case, `DiagramDescription#connectorTools` is just one field among countless which are queried to make diagrams work. We can't possibly just add messages like that everywhere, it would not be practical.

That being said, we could figure out on the frontend that if we don't find any connector tool, we could display a message to the user saying that the two elements cannot be connected together. I think it would match the behavior that you are trying to achieve.

title: The ViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService cannot work beyond basic use cases
body:
We had the `DynamicRepresentationDescriptionService` which was responsible for loading the various view models to be converted by the editing context. This service has been improved multiple time to handle more complex use cases over time. As an example, it loads all view models to resolve proxies or it supports the static view model containing the default color palette. On the other hand, the `ViewRepresentationDescriptionSearchService` can end up loading one view document straight from the database without any support for those features. It ends up creating EMF resources with proxies which cannot be resolved.

As a result, several features ends up being broken such as the support for drag and drop since we have proxies:

title: Reduce the loading time of the view models
Display the contents of a Portal in the Representations view
body:
When a _Portal_ is selected, the _Representations_ view should display a tree of all the representations embedded in the portal.
It should be a tree to also show the internals of any sub-portals.
Selecting a node in this tree should open the corresponding representation in "full mode".

![Capture d’écran du 2024-01-09 10-20-50](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/75c8b3a0-d186-4c7f-be4e-b6f6f883a7fc)

Note that the _Representations_ view on a semantic element shows a *list* of the representations attached to this element, where each item (representation) can be selected but also *deleted*. This is not possible when using a tree widget, where tree nodes do not support a delete action (or any other).

title: nsURI of Sirius web metamodel are not uniform
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.12.4
* [X] **I have specified my environment** :  Windows 11

### Screenshots

![nsURI](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/64c71aba-a766-4c5a-bdb8-cf2eeea9346a)

### Steps to reproduce

1- Open sirius-web\packages\forms\backend\sirius-components-widget-reference-view\src\main\resources\model\reference.ecore
2- Open sirius-web\packages\domain\backend\sirius-components-domain\src\main\resources\model\domain.ecore
3- nsURI of both metamodel are not consistent

### Expected behavior

All nsURI of SiriusWeb metamodel should be uniform.
For example, we should have "http://www.eclipse.org/sirius-web/widgets/reference" instead of "https://www.eclipse.org/sirius/widgets/reference".

### Actual behavior

nsURI of SiriusWeb metamodel are not uniform. For example, some of them are prefixed with "http" and other one with "https". Besides, some use "/sirius/" and other one use "/sirius-web/".

title: Add support for read-only on portals
body:
Portals pass the `readOnly` prop to their embedded representations, but do not use it for themselves.
In read-only mode, it should not be possible to add or remove representations in a portal, nor to change their layout. It should no be possible to switch to the "Edit portal configuration" mode at all.

title: Make the initial drop area larger and more visible on empty portals
body:

title: Canceled graphical DnD should not move the dropped element
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2023.12.4
* [X] **I have specified my environment** : Window 11

### Screenshots

![noOpDnD](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/db8ee1d9-2673-4336-89a5-5f9f7aee37a9)

### Steps to reproduce

DnD a node inside a container but the DnD do nothing

### Expected behavior

When user try to graphical DnD a node in a container, if the DnD do nothing (because container should have specific attribute), the dropped node should not move. 
Maybe a precondition could be added on the D&D tool or the DnD action (and the move) is canceled if the backend service return an exception.

### Actual behavior

When user try to graphical DnD a node in a container, if the DnD do nothing (because container should have specific attribute), the dropped node is moved at the click position despite nothing is done. So the dropped element is hidden by the overlap container.

title: Support for libraries in Sirius Web
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Users want to store and have access to read only data (a.k.a libraries).
Users should be able to click on a template/project and have in their projects a set of documents with objects referencing objects from libraries.

### Cuttings backs

In a first iteration, the objects from libraries and the libraries will not be visible by default in Sirius Web UI.

title: Handle to create edge can overlap with existing edges
body:
* [*] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Actually handles to create new edge from a Node can be overlap by an edge such described in the following screenshot.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/db195168-16f7-410f-8686-a0f44b6c36b0)

This overlay create two problems : 
* a user can interpret the handle on the edge like an arrow to describe direction of stream
* if user wants to create a new edge from an handle on existing edge, he cannot because when he click on this area, the reconnect action of existing edge is chosen.

Some solutions appear to figure out this problem but they are not satisfying : 
* handle can be drown inside the node but in this case, they can overlap existing subnodes and on border node, it won't be convenient
* we can play with Z-index to put forward the handle except when an edge is selected, in this case existing edge is put forward to authorize re-connection,
* shape of handle could be change in arrow more flattened and longer. In this case, the handle will not be compared to an arrow and the area to click on handle will be more important.

I do not know what is the best solution but it is a real drawback.

### Potential side effects

According to project, solution could be bad

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Open to all alternatives

title: Graphical Drag&Drop when target nodes overlap
body:
* [*] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

When two nodes overlap, graphical Drag&Drop should be able to chose the good container.
In the following example, it is not possible to the user to Drag&Drop the comment in Package2 node (we can overlap node with creation tool or resize tool).

![DnDFail](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/7749f754-f093-46b3-a210-f1b14e2f71f0)

I suppose that when two nodes overlap, the deepest node is chosen. 

User should be able to chose other container than the  deepest target node.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Disable all overlap behaviors (but probably not a good idea since overlap could be authorize with an option in futur)

title: Evaluate the precondition of the edge tool the then connector tools are requested
body:
* [*] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

When user try to create an edge between node, DSL view use "Target element descriptions" field to fade not authorized target. In some case, we need more. 

User should be able to not create an edge between node N_A (representing an element E_A) and a node N_B (representing an element E_B) by using some condition on elements E_A and E_B even if nodes N_A and N_B are not fad.
We should have some precondition filed to check information on source and target. This field could be checked just before displaying edge palette when user releases the click on target. If precondition on edge is not to true, the edge is not displayed in the palette (with maybe a message to warn user why the edge is not here). Other authorized edge are displayed.

### Cuttings backs

None message could be displayed when an edge is finally not authorized, it could be driven by the project.

### Potential side effects

When no edge are available, nothing is done. Without any message, it could be confusing. 
Be careful with performance degradation.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

It would be wonderful if precondition can be take into account during "fade" computation without any performance degradation.

title: NA
body: The only way forward on this issue it finally remove `DiagramDescription#getPalettes()` which makes no sense whatsoever.

title: Hidden compartment should not create empty space after moving other compartments
body:
* [*] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

When user hide a compartment from container, result is the same than the one using collapse action (see https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2846).
Besides, when we hide a compartment, followings one are jumped up one spot. With this behavior, there is empty space after the last compartment. Visually, with this empty space, user  always see the initial number of compartment. If he opens his diagram few weeks later, he will try to create element in compartment without understanding why it does not work as usually. After hiding compartment, there is nothing to warn user that there is a compartment hidden.
When all compartment are hidden, the container node  looks like a container node with FreeFormLayoutStrategy. User will try to Drag&Drop something inside.

![hideCompartment](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/fe29f204-bc73-49bc-b752-53d3da964ffb)

I think it could be interesting to remove empty space after hiding a compartment or it could be interesting to add decorator or at least reduce empty space to show that something has happened. 

### Potential side effects

Decorators is weird since it does not exist anymore in Sirius Web 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I do not know if there is a meaning to hide compartment if we can collapse them.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a blank studio
2. Create a View
3. Inside the DiagramDescription, create a NodeDescription.
4. Its style is a RectangularNodeStyleDescription, with propertly initialized background/border/label colors.
5. Create a sub-node inside of it.

7. Same with a border node of the top-level node, or any other level ob sub/border nodes.

title: Change the icon used to remove a representation from a portal
body:
We currently use a "trash can" icon for the button to remove a representation from a portal.
This icon is usually used to delete/destroy an element, and can be interpreted as "delete the representation", instead of just "remove it from this portal".
A simple cross icon would be better:

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/0f8487f3-d19c-4a4c-bd1c-a5be184de321)

title: Improve the UI for the two modes in portals
body:
A portal can be either in "edit" mode (where the user can change the portal's own content and layout but not interact with the embedded representations) or "direct" mode (the opposite).
The current UI with two buttons (a pen icon & a hand icon), which are not obviously related in the UI is difficult to understand.

I don't have yet a better idea, but it's certainly possible to do better.

title: It's difficult to distinguish connection line from edges
body:
ConnectionLine and the temporary edge used when there are multiples connection possible are difficult to distinguish from edges.
We should use the theme.selected color to distinguish them.

title: There are some architecture issues around the reference widget
body:
- Since `PropertySectionComponentRegistry` is exported, `PreviewWidgetProps` and `PreviewWidgetComponent` should be exported.
- The typing should be improved. (Activating the strict mode in sirius-web highlight the typing errors)
- There are multiple implicit references to sirius-web, `siriusWeb://document` appears in `CreateModalMachine.ts`, in `CreateModal.tsx` and, in `ModelBrowsersDescriptionProvider`.
- Since the `new-root-object` and `new-object` modal are declared in the application, the modal used to create a new reference may have to be declared in the application too.

title: Diagram performance degrades over time when moving elements
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create and open a relatively large diagram (it's easier to see), for example a Papaya Diagram.
2. Select one of its containers and move it to a different (available position).
3. Move it back to its original position.
4. Repeat steps 2 & 3 a few times.

Initialy the effect of the move is relatively quick (though not immediate), but the more you move the element back and forth the slower it gets. You can quickly get a 2 or 3s second delay where the diagram is inactive after the element has been moved to its new place.

title: NA
body:
The delay occurs purely on the front, between the moment the user finished the move (or resize) and the moment the frontend sends the "layoutDiagram" mutation.

title: Fix pane events slowing down the application
body:
The pane events `hadnelPaneClick`, `onKeyDown `,`onMove`, `onEdgeClick `and  `onNodeClick `should be wrapped in a `useCallback `to avoid unnecessary rendering.
The function `onDiagramElementClick `is already wrapped in a useCallback but the object passed in the dependancy array makes it as if no useCallback were used.

2. Create a composite processor anywhere in the diagram (to have a standard)
3. Increase the left panel width
4. Click anywhere in the diagram (see results)
5. Click on the node creation tool (see results)

### Expected Result

4. The palette is displayed where the user has clicked
5. The node is created where the palette was

### Actual Result

5. The node may be created with an offset from where the palette was.

body: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/3310

title: Fix edge and drop events slowing down the application
body:
The events `onConnectStart`, `onConnectEnd`, `onDrop`, `onDragOver`, `onNodeDrag`, `onNodeDragStart`, `onNodeDragStop `should be wrapped in a `useCallback `to avoid unnecessary rendering.
The way we calculate drop position is costly since we're using `useViewport()` and that fonction is making components rerender with each change of the viewport. Since we need to have the actual viewport only when the drop is applied we should use `screenToFlowPosition` from `ReactFlowInstance`

title: Only display the diagram's palette/panel when the diagram has focus
body:
When a diagram is opened it currently always displays its top-level palette.
The palette can hide some elements placed in the top-left of the canvas, and when a diagram is embedded inside a portal where there is much less room available, it can hide a significant part of diagrams the user is not directly interacting with.

title: Prevent infinite loops in portals
body:
Currently we prevent adding a portal into itself, but it is still possible to cause recursive loops indirectly, e.g. portal P1 contains portal P2 which contains portal P1.
This does not cause any issue on the backend, but opening such a portal on the front causes infinite rendering loops.
Creating such a structure should be prevented.

title: Fix OnNodesChange event slowing down the application
body: `handleNodesChange `should be wrapped in `useCallback `to follow ReactFlow guidelines and avoid unnecessary rerender.

body:
This looks more like a lack of support for read-only mode in Form Description Editor.
In the video, the portal is in "edit" mode, so it is expected that it reacts to dnd operations (though maybe it could *only* react to dnd from representations dropped from the explorer).

body: Reworded, as the core issue is actually that Form Description Editors do not support the "read-only" mode. Clearly the Portal's UI could be improved to avoid the confusion, see #2949 for ideas.

title: Portals should open in "direct" mode when non-empty
body:
When a portal is first created and is empty, it makes sense to default to the "edit" mode so that the user can add the appropriate representations and configure its layout.
However once this has been done, the actual _usage_ of a portal will be dominated by interactions with the representations it contains, with changes to the portal configuration itself only once in a while.
Thus when a portal is opened, it should be in "edit" mode if empty, but in "direct" mode otherwise.

title: Bind Reference Widget's body operations on set/add instead of click
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Today, specifiers can declare a set of operations (the body) on a reference widget (like most of other widgets). These operations are executed on a click on a selected item in the reference widget.

The click action is not really used and we can't provide a custom behavior on set/add operations.

So I suggest to modify this behavior, by executing the body on set/add actions instead of the click one.
If no body operations are provided, then the default (i.e. the current) behavior on set/add operations will apply.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

Existing Body operations, today bind to click action will be now bind to set/add operations, so there will be potential side effects for existing Form Views.


### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

IDanglingRepresentationDeletionService should be the responsibility of each representation
body:
Currently all representations use the same implementation of `IDanglingRepresentationDeletionService.isDangling(IEditingContext, IRepresentation)`, which is essentially `this.objectService.getObject(editingContext, targetObjectId).isEmpty()`.

This does not work for representations whose target is not a semantic object, for example [a Form showing details about another representation](#2890) or document.

This detection of whether a representation is dangling (and thus can be disposed) or not should be the responsibility of the representation' event processor.

title: NA
body: For the moment, I'm focusing on an alternative approach where `IObjectService` is aware of representations and not only of semantic elements. This way, the current implementation of `IDanglingRepresentationDeletionService` correctly finds that a Form which targets a Portal representation is not dangling (as long as the Portal exists of course).

title: NA
body: This is obsolete now that IObjectService knows about representations. IDanglingRepresentationDeletionService will no longer delete a "representation on a representation" as it will correctly detect that the target object (a representation) still exists.

title: Wrong diagram palette position when multiple diagrams are open (in a portal)
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a portal
2. Place 2 Topography diagrams beside each other in the portal
3. Click on the background of the diagram on the left
4. The palette opens in the second diagram

See the video below:

[Capture vidéo du 2024-01-29 10-38-28.webm](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/5fa5c8a2-cf41-4cf3-9c91-1084e6552b55)

title: NA
body:
I _think_ this is caused by:
```
const wrapperRef = document.querySelector('.react-flow');
```
in `PalettePortal.tsx`, which assumes there is a single `.react-flow` element visible at a time.

When N diagrams are visible at the same time, `document.querySelectorAll('.react-flow')` returns _N_ elements, but we use `querySelector` and get whichever is the first one returned.

title: NA
body: Note that in `DiagramRenderer.tsx` we already get _the_ actual `React.Ref<HTMLDivElement>` we need.

NA
body: Some context: in my case I tried to implement an `RepresentationObjectServiceDelegate` that can see `IRepresentation`s as "semantic objects" (to work around #3023). For this particular case, maybe we would prefer to have "native" support for this in `DefaultObjectService`, but the issue would remain for other cases where multiple `IObjectServiceDelegate` would need to coexist.

title: NA
body:
- I think that the `canHandle` method should indeed take the `objectId`
- I think that the getContents method should only take the `Object object`, I'm not sure we need to give it back the editing context

I think I talked about this with Axel when we discussed future improvements in order to split the `IObjectService` interface into multiple smaller ones. I did started this work but it's currently a work in progress on a local branch on my machine. It is relevant for the extensibility of Sirius Web but it had a lower priority than other key architectural issues.

If you need as a quick fix, to had something like `objectId` to canHandle and change `getContents` to take the object just go for it, I'll make the split into smaller interfaces later. From my analysis the last time I worked on it, we could simply switch to `getContents(Object object)` without issues, unless I'm mistaken, just break the existing interface and change the signature, we will break it even further "soon" with the split.

title: NA
body:
For the moment I have hard-coded support for resolving `IRepresentation`s directly into `DefaultObjectService`. This is not ideal, but sufficient for me to move on with other issues revealed by #2890 on my own branch.
The new APIs that will replace `IObjectService` being developed in #3042 should solve this whole issue. Depending on what needs to be merged first, the changes proposed here to the current `IObjectService` may never need to be done.

title: Forms always render the same element
body:
In `FormEventProcessor.refreshForm()`, we currently do:
```java
VariableManager variableManager = new VariableManager();
variableManager.put(VariableManager.SELF, this.formCreationParameters.getObject());
```
In other words, the `self` element on which the `FormRenderer` will be invoked will always be the initial object passed when the form was initialy created.

This works "by mistake" in the standard case where this `self` object is a mutable `EObject`: each render sees the same object, but each time in the correct/expected state.

However this breaks when the target object is immutable, and a new, different Java object is used to represent the successive states of that object (with the same id). For example when [creating a Form on the content of a Portal representation](#2890). In such a case, the `FormEventProcessor` will always render the same `Form` on every refresh as the original object from `formCreationParameters` is immutable.

Diagrams solve this (not sure that was exactly on purpose) by re-resolving the target object from its id on every refresh:
```java
var optionalObject = this.objectService.getObject(editingContext, previousDiagram.getTargetObjectId());
```

Forms (and other representations which may have the issue) should do the same.

title: NA
body:
From a quick look at the other RepresentationEventProcessors, it looks like they are all fine (they probably took DiagramEventProcessor as a base/inspiration), *except* for `SelectionEventProcessor`, which resolves its `selectionConfiguration.getTargetObjectId()` only once in `SelectionEventProcessorFactory.createRepresentationEventProcessor(Class<T>, IRepresentationConfiguration, IEditingContext)` and then reuses the same Java `Object` for all refreshes in `SelectionEventProcessor`.
I'll open a separate issue but this is much more minor.

title: The Selection representation always render the same element
body:
See https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/3061

`SelectionEventProcessor` resolves its `selectionConfiguration.getTargetObjectId()` only once in `SelectionEventProcessorFactory.createRepresentationEventProcessor()` and then reuses the same Java `Object` for all refreshes in `SelectionEventProcessor`.

Not an issue in practice when these are mutable EObjects, each refresh sees the current state, but in general this can be a problem when the target object it immutable.
Other representations avoid this by re-resolving the target object from its id on each refresh to make sure they see the current version.

title: Add initial support for search
body:
Currently the only way a user to find elements of interest inside in his documents is to manually look into the explorer.
We should provide support for search. The first version will keep things simple but extensible/customizable on the backend (how to perform the actual search, result scoring/sorting, etc.) with a default implementation in Sirius Web Sample Application, and will be improved in later iterations.

title: Add support for representations in DefaultObjectService
body:
I'm not entirely sure this is the right approach, but for #2890 I need to avoid the current behavior where a representation which uses another representation as a semantic element is considered dangling/obsolete as soon as it is created, and thus disposed immediately.

One approach outlined in #3023 would be to handle specifically this behavior in by changing how `IDanglingRepresentationDeletionService` works. This would fix this particular unwanted behavior but feels ad-hoc.

Another approach, implemented here, is to consider at the _core_ of the framework, that representations can be considered as "objects" (as seen by `IObjectService`).
This would also fix the issue mentioned above, and remove the need for other "hacks" (i.e. in `RepresentationsEventProcessorFactory`, resolving the `targetObjectId` with either `IObjectService` _or_, explicitly, with `IRepresentationSearchService`).
Conceptually it also feels like a more "satisfying" approach as it removes a disctinction between "semantic elements" on one side and "representations" on the other.
However because it changes a rather fundamental assumption in the system, it can have some hard to predict side effects.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/bebb6f07-13f9-4662-8e6b-f25b176bd5ca)

It should be interesting to have the capacity to manipulate edges by shifting it in these moments.

### Potential side effects

Maybe customers will someday ask to have the capacity of overlapping edges to represent inheritance between class for example. It should work.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/e70d8a03-54bd-4516-9081-d984360ec2ff)

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We do not allow the overlap of edge (but it is not a good idea, let see potential side effects).

title: Add a useRepresentation() hook
body:
There are several places where we need the current `editingContextId` and `representationId`.
We tend to pass them as props.
This is particularly visible in `FormDescriptionEditor` where Page, PageList, ToolbarActions, WidgetEntry, etc. all drill down `editingContextId={editingContextId} representationId={representationId}` and would need to also drill down `readOnly` to support #2999.

In React Flow diagrams, we have introduced `DiagramContext` so that different components can do a simple
```
const { editingContextId, diagramId } = useContext<DiagramContextValue>(DiagramContext);
```
instead of drilling down these as props.

This could be generalized into a `const { editingContextId, representationId, readOnly } = useRepresentation();` hook.
These 3 properties correspond to `RepresentationComponentProps`.
The context could be setup by the workbench [where it instanciates the appropriate `RepresentationComponent`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/core/frontend/sirius-components-core/src/workbench/Workbench.tsx#L177).
It should also be used/setup by Portal and FormBasedView (and maybe others).

title: Edge's begin and end label can overlap source or target label
body:
* [*] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

When edge has start and end label, these labels can overlap the source/target label of edge. In this case, labels are not readable.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/4078e718-b49f-46c0-8173-96d33c33d64b)

The only way to make it readable is to move the source or the target in order to connect the edge on an other border of the source/target with no label.

It could be interesting to forbidden overlap of start/end label on other label (as done on figure here : https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/2760).

### Potential side effects

Start/end label can be far away from their connection point on the border.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Alternative 1 : Edge could stop connection just before label (and not at the border)
Alternative 2 : User could be able to manipulate label such as moving it like a node.

title: For loops in FormDescriptions produce the same id for all their children
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a blank studio and import [the View in this zip](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/files/14196134/View.zip). It defines a simple Form that can be created on a `flow::System` and displays the names (as _Label_ widgets) of all the `flow::Processor` the system contains (directly).
![Capture d’écran du 2024-02-07 16-54-14](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/dbdaa38c-edda-4bf3-a515-f7593401b5a1)
2. Create another project, add a a Flow in it, create 2 processors inside the top-level System element.
3. Create an instance of the Form from step 1 on the top-level System.

The Form correctly displays the names of all the contained processors, but if you open the browser's dev console you will see that React complains about non-unique keys:

> Encountered two children with the same key, `b91079ef-42b4-3784-862e-94b34e39d030`. Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and could change in a future version.

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/6cff9ae9-8d5a-49d8-8be1-8f2713349ace)

title: NA
body: This is not actually a bug. See ADR-108 for the details, but it's not possible to try and produce different ids in this case where the user-visible *labels* are the same.

title: Allow users to create tree widget in forms
body:

title: Add the ability to specify the position of the label of a node (inside vs outside)
Add confirmation dialog on delete
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Sirius Web does not have an undo/redo mechanism yet.
When an element has been deleted, either from the Explorer view, from any representation, or any other view, there is no way to retrieve it.
All delete actions are executable in one click.
Any accidental click on a delete action can lead to the unwanted loss of data.
By extension, some one-click actions may lead to unwanted consequences.

A confirmation dialog should be displayed when a delete action (click on the delete tool on a node, click on DEL key on a node, click on the delete menu item on an object in the Explorer view) has been called.
This dialog should avoid or drastically minimized unwanted loss of data.
This dialog should have the possibility to be disabled.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: Add support for filters in Explorer View
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

Filters action should be available in the Explorer view toolbar, allowing to hide objects contained the trees in the Explorer view.
The filters action is a menu, containing a list of filters.
A filter menu item is a checkbox associated to a label.
When the checkbox is enabled, the filter is enabled on all objects in the Explorer view.
When the checkbox is disabled, the filter is disabled on all objects in the Explorer view.

title: Fix Deck DnD issue with Portal
body:
* [ ] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [ ] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [ ] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
- other: please specify
* [ ] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All
- my computer: Windows? Linux? Cloud?
- Cloud

With Portal, the deck's card or lane feedback is shifted during the Drag n drop.
This is due to the way react-trello (by using the react-smooth-dnd component) is handling the feedback:
The feedback is a copy of the initial dom element with a position:fixed. The issue with that is that when a transform property exists in one of the parent, the top and left values used for positioning the feedback are relative to the ancestor with the transform property. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position for more details.

### Screenshots
![portal-deck-dnd](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/7601213/92a2ba7b-1232-4489-bc7c-c7aba225b6fa)

...

title: npm ci produces 401 Unauthorized error
body:
I am trying to follow the instructions for [building the frontend and backend components of Sirius Web](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web?tab=readme-ov-file#build-the-frontend--backend-components-and-sirius-web). When I run `npm ci` I get the following error and the build fails.

```
npm ERR! 401 Unauthorized - GET https://npm.pkg.github.com/download/@ObeoNetwork/react-trello/2.4.11/384ada405b80fc7105583b43f6aef05e1f26bf3b - authentication token not provided
```

I am on MacOS and my node, npm etc. versions are all within the ranges specified in the instructions.

title: NA
body:
Hello,
Since 2024.1.0, we depend on this node package (@ObeoNetwork/react-trello) that comes from github node artifacts repository.
So you should probably add a `$HOME/.npmrc` file with the following content:
`//npm.pkg.github.com/:_authToken=$YOUR_GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN`
Indeed, as for the backend part (maven), we need a github token to read modules from github node artifact repository.
I will update the build instructions, thank you.
Regards,

title: NA
body:
We will have to thing a bit about this one because on one hand, we want Sirius Components stuff (like `IInput`) to be potential causes but on the other hand, we want to use this in `sirius-web-domain`. Yet we don't want a dependency between the two since that's precisely the role of `sirius-web-application`. And the cause should be more than a simple `id`.

Would it be overkill to have a `sirius-components-events` for that?

title: Edge position computation could be improved with Border node
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [X] **I have specified the version** : 2024.1.4
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : Windows 11 Pro

### Screenshots

* When the edge cross the border node that is not the source

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/b234e49c-0274-4897-af24-efa8a7c943fd)

* When the edge cross the container node of the border node

![edgeBorderNode](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/24290600/bb71fbf3-4bf5-4f2f-9b47-6cd89bc1d1a5)

### Steps to reproduce

Try to create an edge from a side where a border node is attached.

### Expected behavior

* It should be interesting to avoid edge crossing border node at source because user could think that the edge is link to the border node and not the container of the border node.
* It could be interesting that edge is not linked to the the side of the border node which is inside the container. 

### Actual behavior

* An edge could cross completely its border node to link an other node whereas other side are available to be source of edge. This is confusing for user who could think that the source is the border node.
* An edge could cross the container node of the border node when this on is the target. It is not really clear of what is the target.

title: [PropertyView] Add a previous button to the Property View framework
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
The Property View framework allows to the user to navigate easily from an element to another one. For example, with UML, the user can do these things:
* Create a Class named _Class1_ in the diagram, then from the Property View
    * Create a Property _p1_ inside this class
    * type this Property creating a new Class _Class2_
    * set _Class2_ as abstract (for example), then the user want to return to _Class1_ easily to create new Operation inside it. 

Currently, the user need to reselect _Class1_ inside the Diagram or inside the ModelExplorer. We think that Sirius-Web should propose a back button to the Property View to return to the previous edited page. 

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: Invalid project name in rename dialog after a first rename
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new blank studio. It is named "Blank Studio".
2. From the project header menu, select "Rename".
3. The rename popup shows the current name, "Blank Studio" :+1: 
4. Change the name (say, to "renamed").
5. The header shows the new name.
6. Re-open the project rename dialog.
7. The rename popup still shows the previous name, "Blank Studio" :-1:

title: When an edge is selected from its label, F2 does not trigger direct edit

1. Open a diagram which contains at least one edge with an editable label.
2. Select the edge by clicking in the edge's line itself.
3. Hit _F2_: direct edit is triggered :+1:. Hit _Esc_ to cancel.
4. Select something else on the diagram.
5. Select the edge again, but this time by clicking on the text of its label.
6. Hit _F2_: nothing happens :-1:

title: Add Is Collapsed By Default Expression in NodeDescription entity in the view DSL
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
A new _Is Collapsed By Default Expression_  is visible in the properties of NodeDescriptions.
This field accepts boolean expressions, where `true` means collapsed, and `false` means expanded.
This expression is evaluated to collapse/expand a node on its first rendering,
The field is empty by default, which means expanded (this preserves Sirius Web's current behavior to expand new nodes by default).

title: Add collapse and expand diagram element services
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
Specifiers should be able to collapse/expand nodes as part of their tools (e.g. expand a container when a child node is created).
A new `diagramServices` variable is available and can be used to collapse/expand nodes from AQL expressions and Java services.

```aql
aql:diagramServices.collapse(Sequence{selectedNode})
```

```java
private IDiagramServices diagramServices;

public EObject doStuff(Diagram previousDiagram, EObject eObject, IDiagramServicesContext diagramServicesContext) {
  diagramServices.collapse(diagramServicesContext, previousDiagram.getNodes());
  return eObject;
}
```

### Potential side effects
The `diagramServices` variable could be extended in the future with other diagram-related services (pin, hide, etc).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
- Create a new Operation that can be added in the Tool's body. Moved to a service-based solution because this approach doesn't work well with Java services.

title: Standard tools from diagram palette do not use the same color
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else** * [X] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome** * [X] **I have specified the version** : Latest * [X] **I have specified my environment** : Windows? ### Screenshots ![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/4439675/091d5401-e5ce-44f0-bcc3-17e369aff6f6) The direct edit and trash icon does not use the same color as the other tools (Hide, Fade, Pin, Resize) ### Steps to reproduce Open any palette tool ### Expected behavior The standard tool should use the "primary" color of the CSS template. ### Analysis: The tools that use and incorrect color are provided by the backend. The fronted uses a `````` tag to display the icon for those tools. ```html
```` Whereas the working tool are inlined SVG ```html ```` It appears that it is not possible to use a color defined in the application in an SVG that is not inlined. If we try to set the color in the SVG using _currentColor_ it seems that is has not effect. ```html ``` In a simple use case, it seems also impossible to set the style to be used to render an SVG in the ``img`` tag. ```html Document
``` ![Rendering result](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/4439675/22cdc562-df26-4c95-a014-70743575b3d0) I think the following article says it is a constraint of SVG use in ``img`` tag: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Multimedia_and_embedding/Adding_vector_graphics_to_the_Web A workaround for this use case to work would be to inline the SVG inside the ``IconOverlay`` component if the iconURL is an SVG. For this we could either create a custom React component that fetch the content of the SVG and inlines it or use a existing library: https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-svg ...

title: NA
body:
> I think the following article says it is a constraint of SVG use in `img` tag

Indeed, SVG retrieved from a link are indeed sandboxed from the CSS of the rest of the page. There nothing we can do about that limitation but we still have couple of options to fix the issue.

### Use the proper color in the backend

We could simply change the color used in the SVG in the backend but it would not work for those who will customize that part of the theme of the frontend.

### Move those SVGs to the frontend

One option would be to keep all those static SVGs on the frontend in `sirius-components-diagrams` for those in questions. It would solve that issue but the issue would still appear if someone tried to add custom icons for their diagram tools and if they wanted to use the standard palette.

### Control the theme on the backend

This is not the first feature where we would need to have access to the theme on the backend of the application. Since most of the theme is serializable, it could easily be downloaded by the frontend when the application is starting up. By having the theme on the backend, we could thus give the runtime / specifiers access to the theme to compute stuff such as icons with proper color but also the default color palette in a studio etc.

title: NA
body:
I guess you did not like the solution that inline the SVG directly in the frontend 😊

Use a common identification strategy for transient representations
body:
We need to be able to identify clearly if an instance of a representation is transient or not. For that, applications contributing representations should use the same identification strategy to let us find out if a representation is transient or not.

See the ADR 137 for additional details.

title: NA
body:
On top of aligning the `representationId`, we should probably add some capabilities to contribute `RepresentationMetadata`  properly for those representations. In the past we had to hardcode some representation metadata for the explorer for example but this use case will have to be properly supported.

A new ADR would probably be required to details very quickly how to proceed

title: Align the properties of transient and persisted representations
body: We should remove `ISemanticRepresentation` and move `targetObjectId` to `IRepresentation`. We should be careful since `ISemanticRepresentation` is used at some places as the way to find out if a representation is transient or not, the issue #3303 should be considered first to stop relying on this.

title: NA
body:
The following `IRepresentation` implementations are not `ISemanticRepresentation` and thus do not have a `targetObjectId` at the moment:

* `Validation`
* `Tree` (used for the _Explorer_ view)
* `IChart` (`BarChart` & `PieChart`)

Charts are currently only used in the context of forms via `ChartWidgetComponent`, which computes a `targetObjectId`, so the `IChart` representation itslef could be passed the `targetObjectId` and become a full `ISemanticRepresentation` easily.

For Validation and Tree, there is no semantic element that can serve a the target object.
The most obvious (and maybe the only) value would by the `editingContextId`.

In the same way that we needed to make `IObjectService` aware of representations (in #3066) it should probably be made "editing context aware", i.e. `IIdentityService.getId()` and `IObjectSearchService.getObject()` should work when passed an `IEditingContext` or its id.

title: Align the management of the state of transient and persisted representations
body:
Once #3304 is done, we should be able to remove some of the differences in the way the state of a representation is managed between transient and persisted representation. Technically, the only different between the two should be:

- How to retrieve the initial state (computed on the fly vs retrieved from the database)
- What to do when a new state is computed (nothing vs persist it in the database)

By aligning the way the state is managed, we should be able to reduce the custom code that should be written for each representation, lower the risk for potential errors such as double saving and offer a uniform way to access the state of a representation.

title: Make the details view more compact
body:
The widget used in the detail view are quite generous in their consumption of space. This can make the use of Sirius Web more tedious when objects have a lot of properties since the user it often required to scroll down to edit or view a widget.

This issues aims to explore some possible solution to reduce the space consumption. The mains leads are explored:

* Reduce the padding/margin inside the widgets or between them
* Make some widgets on one line (Label and widget in one line) instead of the usual two line style (Label + EOL+Widget)

title: Avoid sending domain events for no-op "updates"
body: Currently operations like `org.eclipse.sirius.web.domain.boundedcontexts.project.services.ProjectUpdateService.renameProject(UUID, String)` *always* send a `ProjectNameUpdatedEvent` even if the "new" name is actually the same as before. This could be avoided so that listeners only get events for actual changes.

title: Document.createdOn is always identical to lastModifiedOn and updated on every save
body:
In `org.eclipse.sirius.web.domain.boundedcontexts.semanticdata.Document` the `createdOn` and `lastModifiedOn` are always the same, and do not correspond to "the time when the user created the document" and "the last time when the content (or name) of the document has been modified".

In practice they are always identical both correspond to the last time the SemanticData was saved, regardless of any actual change (and then technically not really, because boths the Document instances and the SemanticData instace will be created at possibly a few microseconds of difference).

title: Add IMigrationParticipant for model migration
body:

We also add an interface `IMigrationParticipant ` that offers methods for model migration.

title: Stop restricting representation subscriptions to persisted representations
body: A couple of representations (Gantt and Deck mostly) are explicitly restricting subscription to their events to persisted representations for the sole reason that they require a UUID based identifier in their GraphQL API.

title: Add Default Visibility Fields in View DSL

### Expected behavior

Two new fields are visible in the properties of NodeDescriptions: _Is Hidden By Default Expression_ and _Is Faded By Default Expression_.
These fields accepts boolean expressions.
This expression is evaluated to hide/reveal/fade/unfade a node on its first rendering,
The fields are empty by default, which means visible and unfaded (this preserves Sirius Web's current behavior to make new nodes visible by default).

title: Improve hide capabilities in the Palette
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
The palette provides additional hide/reveal options for nodes that contain other nodes. These options are visible in a dropdown under the "Hide" button. The image below shows some examples we could have (names aren't definitive):
![hide menu](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/6516281/768a377b-cbd8-4327-9a08-4227c7bdcf65)

- `Hide`: hides the selected element, same behavior as the current hide tool
- `Hide All`: hides all the direct children of the selected element (does the same thing as a collapse)
- `Show All`: reveals all the direct children of the selected element
- `Show Default`: reveals the direct children that have a `Is Hidden By Default` expression set to `false` (see #3371)
- `Show Valued`: reveals the direct children that contain elements

This would allow to reveal only a subset of hidden elements, which is not possible right now via the "Reveal Hidden Elements" tool on the diagram's palette.

In our use case we need such tools to hide/reveal compartments inside nodes, but the solution should work for any kind of node/layout.


### Cuttings backs
...

### Potential side effects
The "Hide" tool is currently defined in the frontend, we may want to change that and integrate it in `ViewPaletteProvider#createExtraToolSections` and `CompatibilityPaletteProvider#createExtraToolSections`.

New handlers/mutations may be required to implement some hide/reveal operations.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
We can achieve this behavior with NodeTools relying on the hide/reveal services, but this feature seems generic enough to be integrated in Sirius Web.

title: The first resize of a node after a diagram is opened is not saved
body:
Not sure if this is specific to newly created diagrams, but the steps to reproduce below:

1. Create a new empty diagram.
2. Create a node on it. It has the default/initial size.
3. Resize it so that it has a clearly different aspect ratio.
4. Refresh/reload the page.

The node should have the new size/aspect ratio, but it is back to the initial size.


[Capture vidéo du 2024-04-12 17-23-19.webm](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/10608/bd970c74-9918-448d-aae9-c4d2cf09621a)

title: Allow contributions in extra tool sections
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
Specifiers can define tools and add them to tool sections automatically created in the palette (delete/hide/fade).
This complements #3382 and would allow to define diagram-specific hide/reveal tools (e.g. "Show compartment XXX") and have them displayed alongside the other hide/reveal tools:

![contribute hide tools](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/6516281/932343bb-edf7-43d2-b06c-36c3ae3c2002)

Elements in red are default tools detailed in #3382
Elements in green are specific tools contributed by the specifier


### Potential side effects
This opens tool sections of the palette that weren't accessible to specifiers.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I am not sure what's the best approach to do this, but I have considered the following:
- A name-based approach to merge user-defined tool sections with default ones (e.g. a user can create a "hide" tool section and its tools will be contributed to the default "hide" one)
- A "Palette Post Processor" service that can add/remove elements from the palette once it has been computed (this could help fix #2461 and #3176)

Please let me know if you have a suggestion on the best way to achieve this.

title: NA
body: I think that we should continue moving forward with the current strategy where the palette defined in the view model reflect the final content. We have added in this palette the delete and direct edit tools. We should probably just continue by adding there a Show / Fade / Hide tool section with a default tool for show and hide. The currently hardcoded tools "show" and "hide" would just become default tools created in the view DSL (just like the delete and direct edit ones currently). I think the bast solution would be to stop having ANY tool hardcoded in the frontend and have them all computed from the diagram description. You could start moving on this issue by removing the fact that the tools for show / hide / fade are hardcoded in the palette and make them computed from the diagram description (don't forget to consider removing their dedicated data fetchers too s they make no sense) and we could move forward with this by removing the hardcoded tools and data fetchers for expand, collapse, pin, unpin too later. This way specifiers would be able to remove default tools, replace them, add a condition on them, change their behavior or organize them in tool section as they desire.

title: Sirius component should not add a "/custom/" prefix on the ImageNodeStyleDescription#shape field
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [ ] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [ ] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
- other: please specify
* [ ] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All
- my computer: Windows? Linux? Cloud?
- Cloud

### Screenshots

...

### Steps to reproduce

In Sirius-web, the shape field of the `ImageNodeStyleDescription` references a custom image uploaded on the server and stored in the  database. The `ImageController` uses the `/custom/` prefix on this image path to know if the image should be retrieved from the database.

But in the context of a spring server based on sirius-component but not Sirius-web, we might use the shape field to store a path to a static resource for instance. Since the `/custom/`prefix is added by sirius-component, we have to deal with it in the ImageController even if the custom image mechanism is not used.

The prefix is added by the ImageNodeStyleProvider :

```java
else if (nodeType.equals(Optional.of(NodeType.NODE_IMAGE))) {
            iNodeStyle = Optional.of(ImageNodeStyle.newImageNodeStyle()
                    .scalingFactor(1)
                    .imageURL("/custom/" + ((ImageNodeStyleDescription) nodeStyle).getShape())
                    .borderColor(Optional.ofNullable(nodeStyle.getBorderColor())
                            .filter(FixedColor.class::isInstance)
                            .map(FixedColor.class::cast)
                            .map(FixedColor::getValue)
                            .orElse(DEFAULT_COLOR))
                    .borderSize(nodeStyle.getBorderSize())
                    .borderStyle(LineStyle.valueOf(nodeStyle.getBorderLineStyle().getLiteral()))
                    .borderRadius(nodeStyle.getBorderRadius())
                    .positionDependentRotation(((ImageNodeStyleDescription) nodeStyle).isPositionDependentRotation())
                    .build());
        }
```



...

### Expected behavior

The `/custom/`  prefix should not be added by sirius-component but probably directly in the ImageNodeStyleDescription at creation time (in the studio or programmatically when using the view builder). 

...

### Actual behavior

...

Add a diagram filter view in the diagram panel
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The diagram panel has a new icon that shows a tree representing the content of the diagram when clicked.
Elements in the tree can be checked, and a split button is available to apply some tools on the selected elements (e.g. hide, show, collapse).

A checkbox is available to (un) select all the elements in the tree at once.

The interface should look like

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/assets/6516281/bb12ce1e-522e-4671-9009-5289eb5c121b)

The tree and the diagram should be synchronized: an update in the diagram should update the content of the tree (in particular the icons next to each tree node item), and executing a tool from the form view should udpate the diagram accordingly.

This feature is a particular implementation of #3428 with a `FormDescription` initialized from the content of a diagram representation.

### Cuttings backs
- The split button should only support actions that have an associated event handler. In particular, accessing `DiagramServices` from the form is out of the scope of this issue.

title: Migrate to MUI 5
body:
The pull request: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/3438 I suggest updating MUI to version 5 as Material UI 4 is outdated and does not receive security or performance updates. Also it's a complicated task to combine different versions of MUI in a single application. We managed it in our MUI 5 application based on Sirius Web, but it is really painful. Also it will allow one to migrate to React 18 later. # What is changed 1) The following dependencies are updated: ```diff -"@material-ui/core": "4.12.4", -"@material-ui/icons": "4.11.3", -"@material-ui/lab": "4.0.0-alpha.61", +"@mui/material": "5.15.19", +"@mui/icons-material": "5.15.19", +"@mui/x-tree-view": "7.6.1", ``` 2) Changed namespaces: ``` @material-ui/core -> @mui/material @material-ui/icons -> @mui/icons-material ``` 3) `` component moved to a separate project: ```diff -import TreeView from '@material-ui/lab/TreeView'; -import { TreeItem } from '@material-ui/lab'; +import { SimpleTreeView } from '@mui/x-tree-view/SimpleTreeView'; +import { TreeItem } from '@mui/x-tree-view/TreeItem'; ``` 4) Changed `` component: ```diff -import Autocomplete from '@material-ui/lab/Autocomplete'; +import Autocomplete from '@mui/material/Autocomplete'; ``` It requires `getOptionKey` if labels are not unique `renderOption` should return `
  • ` Nested `` doesn't require `key` property, because it's already returned by `getTagProps()` 5) `` and `` role attribute is changed from `button` to `combobox` in MUI . So I updated Cypress tests 11) `` adds `aria-label` instead of `title` to a nested `` 12) Tooltips works for disabled buttons only if the later one is surrounded by span https://mui.com/material-ui/react-tooltip/#disabled-elements ```diff + + ``` 13) `theme.spacing(1)` returns string `8px` instead of number `8`. So I had to add `parseInt()` in `packages/portals/frontend/sirius-components-portals/src/representations/PortalRepresentation.tsx` 14) `theme.palette.text.hint` is removed https://github.com/mui/material-ui-pickers/issues/1681 15) Slight MUI 5 API changes: ```diff - + ``` ```diff - + ``` 16) It seems that `` doesn't support `transition` attribute. If the attribute is specified then Popper is shown in the left upper corner. Removed `trnasition` from `packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/renderer/palette/tool-section/ToolSection.tsx` and `packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/renderer/palette/group-tool/GroupPalette.tsx` 17) Added `@emotion/react` peer dependency to `sirius-components-forms` to fix "You are loading @emotion/react when it is already loaded. Running multiple instances may cause problems. This can happen if multiple versions are used, or if multiple builds of the same version are used." # Cypress tests I've fixed most of the tests after migration. But there are still some problems. Tests work unstable on my machine. Maybe it works better in your environment. Could you please help to fix it? Some tests are failed when Cypress is run in a headless mode, probably because of problems with a clipboard or something else. ## When run in an interactive mode the following tests are failed for Chrome: 1) `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/diagrams/collapse.cy.ts` expected '' to have CSS property 'border-bottom' with the value '1px solid rgb(51, 176, 195)', but the value was '0.8px solid rgb(51, 176, 195)' I tried to change Zoom factor in a browser, but it doesn't help. I think the test should not rely on a particular border width. ## For Electron the following tests are failed: 1) `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/diagrams/collapse.cy.ts` In file `integration-tests/cypress/workbench/Explorer.ts` the test is failed on `cy.getByTestId('new-object-modal').should('not.exist')`. But if I add `cy.wait(2000)` before this line, the test is passed: ``` public createObject(objectTreeItemLabel: string, childCreationDescriptionLabel: string) { this.getTreeItemByLabel(objectTreeItemLabel).find('button').click(); cy.getByTestId('new-object').click(); cy.getByTestId('childCreationDescription').children('[role="combobox"]').invoke('text').should('have.length.gt', 1); cy.getByTestId('childCreationDescription').click(); cy.getByTestId('childCreationDescription') .get(`[data-value="${childCreationDescriptionLabel}"]`) .should('exist') .click(); cy.getByTestId('create-object').click(); // The test is fixed if I add the following line: // cy.wait(2000); cy.getByTestId('new-object-modal').should('not.exist'); } ``` 2) `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/diagrams/group-palette.cy.ts` Error: "expected [data-testid="GroupPalette"] to exist in the DOM" 3) `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/diagrams/node-aspect-ratio.cy.ts` Error: "Expected to find element: [data-testid="option-Node"], but never found it." # Vitest React component snapshots are outdated after migration. And to be honest I have no idea how to fix it

title: NA
body:
Hello,

Thank you very much for this detailed ticket and the associated pull request!
We will take a look at it, in the next weeks.

To update the snapshots, you first have to delete them, an then execute the test script in the dedicated package.
In your case, it seems you have to execute `node run test` in `packages/core/frontend/sirius-components-core/`.

Last thing, you commit messages should look like this:
```
[3437] Title

Bug: https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/issues/3437
Signed-off-by: NAME <EMAIL>
``` 
(you can also check commits in git history to see the format of the commit messages)

Regards,

title: NA
body:
Thanks for the answer! I've added `Bug` and `Signed-off-by` to commits. And fixed errors for `sirius-components-core`.

But now there are a lot off errors for `sirius-components-forms`, because format of CSS class names is changed:
```diff
<div
-  class="makeStyles-subscribers-126"
+  class="css-1aqjzxi-subscribers"
/>
```

(Just a side note: That's one more reason to dislike CSS-in-JS :) From my point of view these autogenerated CSS class names only add complexity and improve nothing)

New `makeStyle()` function from TSS React is based on `@emotion/react`. Here is a plugin `@emotion/jest` that should fix class names: https://emotion.sh/docs/testing But it's for jest only. There is no such a library for vitest yet: https://github.com/emotion-js/emotion/issues/3132

I'll try to find a way to remove random hashes from CSS class names...

title: NA
body:
I've fixed vitest snapshots

Defined a custom snapshot serializer in `packages/forms/frontend/sirius-components-forms/vitestSerializer.ts` that transforms CSS class names from `css-hash-suffix` to `makeStyles-suffix`

Updated vitest to latest version, because `snapshotSerializers` option was added to `vite.config.js` recently: https://github.com/vitest-dev/vitest/issues/2023

Also I've fixed some Cypress tests. It seems that `.click('top')` doesn't work well in Electron. I replaced it by `.click(1, 1)` in `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/diagrams/collapse.cy.ts`. And added the following code to this test:
```
cy.on('uncaught:exception', (err) =>
  err.message.includes('ResizeObserver loop limit exceeded') ? false : undefined
);
```
For sure it would be better to find an origin of the error and fix it. But it's hard to reproduce, it seems to be a known bug and people recommend to ignore it https://stackoverflow.com/a/50387233/632199

Two Cypress tests are still unstable:

- `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/forms/widget-reference.cy.ts`
- `integration-tests/cypress/e2e/project/portals/portals.cy.ts`

They work fine locally, so I can't reproduce the problem. However in GutHub they sometimes pass, sometimes fail.
