title: Warning: No implementation found for action type 'closeContextMenu'
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a project
2. Open its context menu in the navigation bar
3. Click on the _Download_ entry or click away to close the menu
4. A warning appears in the console: _Warning: No implementation found for action type 'closeContextMenu'_

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dd7e9824-1c7c-4aba-abe7-e827b29e3168)

title: NA
body: In `EditProjectNavbarMachine.ts`, when receiving the corresponding event we try to invoke `actions: 'closeContextMenu'` but the actual action is called `hideContextMenu`.

title: Expand-all action on very large model cause application crash
body:
After investigation, the backend response to the expand all action is correct (but very large, ~700Ko in my example, because it contains all the UUID to the treeItem to expand).
But when we try to create the subscription, the query (which contains all the expand id join) is truncated and is thus incorrect.
Apollo crashes and tries to create a new subscirption indefinitaly

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/161ae0ce-7374-41ad-a5a9-be08849ee981)


### Steps to reproduce

It can be reproduce owhen trying to expand APache ressource on a Papaya - Performance example.

title: Wrap property section in a div
body: Wrap widget returned by PropertySection with a div in order to add a CSS class to this div.

title: Change tree item context menu entries internal management
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

Currently, the `TreeDescription` class contains the list of tree item context menu entries defined for this tree.
The change aims to remove this tight link between tree description and tree item context menu entries.

title: Hovering/leaving a tree item causes a re-render or the item and all its descendants
body:
In `TreeItem.tsx` we modify the state of the TreeItem when the mouse pointer enters or leaves the item. This causes a re-render of the item and any descendent. When an explorer displays a significant number of elements, moving the mouse over the top-level ones which contain many childrens can feel very slow for something that should be immediate.

We should probably try to handle this purely in CSS if possible. It's not an immediate change as currently we use this flag in `TreeItemActionProps`, see for example `WidgetReferenceTreeItemAction` which uses it.

title: Add conditional tree item label element description
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

This work is part of the global vision for supporting the styled label in view model for trees.
Condition tree item label element description is defined as following:

```
IfTreeItemLabelElementDescription extends TreeItemLabelElementDescription {
  predicateExpression: InterpretedExpression<boolean>
  children: TreeItemLabelElementDescription[1..*]
}
```

title: Cache the AQL IServices for a given metamodel
body:
When creating an AQL interpreter with access to large metamodels (think UML), the discovery of all the available `EOperations` and their conversion into the corresponding `EOperationService`s can take a significant time (I measured around 1s for UML).
For a given static metamodel (not a dynamically created/modified EPackage), this information could be cached and reused.

This might require changes in AQL itself.

title: Uploading large models can be inefficient
body:
It seems like we can load/save/process resources several times when uploading them.
For medium to large resources this can become very slow.

title: Add loop tree item label element description
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

This work is part of the global vision for supporting the styled label in view model for trees.
Loop tree item label element description is defined as follows:

```
ForTreeItemLabelElementDescription extends TreeItemLabelElementDescription {
  iterator: String
  iterableExpression: InterpretedExpression<List<Object>>
  children: TreeItemLabelElementDescription[1..*]
}
```

title: ExplorerChildrenProvider.hasChildren calls into the database on every invocation on leaf item
body:
When rendering a Tree using ExplorerChildrenProvider hasChildren is called for every item, and each invocation on a leaf item (EObject with no proper content) ends up calling `representationDataSearchService.existAnyRepresentationForTargetObjectId(id)` which queries the database.

When displaying large trees this cause significant performance issues.

title: Clicking on edge may lead to element being deselected
body:
When you click on an edge whose related semantic object is already selected, the selection is lost.

![selectable-edge-bug](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/24937a70-228e-4b26-b49a-c94e7ede3629)

It's not the case when clicking on a node with the same situtation.

title: Add reused tree item label element description
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

This work is part of the global vision for supporting the styled label in view model for trees.
Reused tree item label element description is defined as follows:

```
ReusedTreeItemLabelElementDescription extends TreeItemLabelElementDescription {
  elements: TreeItemLabelElementDescription[0..*]
}
```

title: Add undo redo on portal representations
Enhance layout capability on property section
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

Refer to the shape for the details
https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/4085/files

title: Make the EditProjectNavbar menu extensible
body:
The menu items available on a project's navbar menu are currently hard-coded in `EditProjectNavbar.tsx` (Rename, Download, Settings, Delete):

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/515ce27e-325b-4f9e-b6e5-4ddd91ab9670)

We should apply the same principles we used for `NavigationBarMenu` here, so that downstream projects can contribute their own menu items, replace/remove the default ones, or in extreme cases redefine the whole menu.

title: Make the ProjectActionButton's menu extensible
body:
The menu items displayed for a project on the project browser (defined in `ProjectActionButton.tsx`) are currently partially hard-coded: it is possible to add new items using the `projectActionButtonMenuItemExtensionPoint` extension but not to remove/override the exising ones or to completely replace the menu.
We should provide the same kind of extensiblity that is already available on `NavigationBarMenu` in this menu.

title: org.eclipse.sirius.components.core.URLParser fails for single-character identifiers
body:
When used for example to parse an explorer id where `expandedIds` refers to elements whose id have a single digit, e.g. `explorer://?treeDescriptionId=custom_explorer_tree_description&expandedIds=[1]`, the `> 3` check in `value.startsWith("[") && value.endsWith("]") && value.length() > 3` is too strict and fails to parse the `"[1]"` value whose length is exactly 3.

Additionally, while this class is supposed to be a `@Service`, many uses explictly instanciate if with `new URLParser()` instead of injecting an `IURLParser`.

title: Export subscription hooks relevant to consumers
body:
Some hooks are used as-is by consumers, such as:

- useExplorerSubscription
- useRelatedElementsViewSubscription

Instead of forking them without any changes, it would be more sustainable if they were to be exported by sirius-web.

title: Add undo redo on diagram representations
NA
body:
When the associated PR will be merged, we will need to create these issues to continue improving the undo-redo:
- [ ] We recently add new responsibilities to the editing context, we should extract them into something else.
	- `inputId2change`, `representationChangesDescription` and, `changeRecorder` should be put into something like `EditingContextUndoRedoManager` which, with the `EditingContext` should be put in something like `IEditingContextEventProcessorState`
	- All `IEditingContextEventHandler`s should use that state instead of just the editing context
	- With this, it could be possible to move _Undo[Representation]EventHandlers_ and _Redo[Representation]EventHandlers_ in their respective collaborative modules
- [ ] We should create a `IRepresentationContext` which all kind of representation should implement for their `IRepresentationEventProcessor`
	- This would permit to extract the record of changes made in `DiagramEventProcessor` and `PortalEventProcessor` in their own services, between the refresh and the post refresh of a representation
- [ ] Bug: All event sending a `LayoutDiagramInput` are reverted with only one undo.
      This happens because all layout inputs coming from the frontend are identified using the ID of the last refresh with cause "refresh"
- [ ] Implement undo/redo for `IDiagramEvent`
	- `DiagramEventProcessor`: to update in order to record changes of all following events (same as the Hide event)
	- `UndoDiagramEnventHandler`: undo of all following events
	- `RedoDiagramEventHandler`: redo of all following events
	- `ReconnectEdgeEvent`
	- `UpdateCollapsingStateEvent`
	- `HideDiagramElementEvent` (only `canUndo` and `canRedo`)
	- `RemoveEdgeEvent`
	- `FadeDiagramElementEvent`
	- `ResetViewModifiersEvent`
	- `PinDiagramElementEvent`
- [ ] `UndoEventHandler`, `RedoEventHandler`, `UndoPortalEventHandler`, `RedoPortalEventHandler`, `UndoDiagramEventHandler` and `RedoDiagramEventHandler` : We have nothing to check if a semantic change recorded with an EMF `ChangeRecorder` can be reverted or not and once apply if it has applied successfully.
- [ ] `UndoPortalEventHandler`, `RedoPortalEventHandler`, `UndoDiagramEventHandler` and `RedoDiagramEventHandler` : Once we have undone or redone the semantic change, we have nothing "secure" to revert it if something happens applying the graphical change.
	- For now, we are applying the semantic change again, we should rely on something more "transactional", or apply graphical change first and then, apply semantic change
- [ ] Improvement : Add more feedback using message for user with undo and redo:
	- Something exists in stash for backend
	- Needs frontend change to display error when undo or redo has failed (in `UndoRedo.tsx`, in both `useEffect` concerning _undoData_ and _redoData_)
- [ ] We need to rethink if undo and redo stacks (in frontend) need to be cleared when an undo or a redo fails with error, because sometime, such action may not be done at the moment they are executed, but maybe later.
- [ ] In `UndoPortalEventHandler`, `RedoPortalEventHandler`, `UndoDiagramEventHandler` and `RedoDiagramEventHandler` all representation changes are handled in the same class, dispatch the handling in different classes.
- [ ] `UndoPortalEventHandler`, `RedoPortalEventHandler`, `UndoDiagramEventHandler` and `RedoDiagramEventHandler`: Improve how _ChangeKind_ for returned payload is computed, with a priority system for example.
- [ ] `UndoDiagramEventHandler#canUndoLayout`: We are considering that undoing a graphical node removal can always be possible while we need at least to check if the parent of a node is still existing
	-  /!\ The parent could not exist because it is part of the same removal but, we should ensure change record are made in the right order to undo and redo them in the right order.
- [ ] `UndoDiagramEventHandler#canUndoLayout`: We are considering that undoing a graphical edge removal can always be made while we need to check if the edge source and target are present.
	- /!\ Source and target could not exist because they are part of the same removal but, we should ensure change record are made in the right order to undo and redo them in the right order.
- [ ] `RedoDiagramEventHandler#canRedoLayout`: We are considering that redoing a graphical node add can always be possible while we need at least to check if the parent of a node is still existing
	- /!\ The parent could not exist because it is part of the same add but, we should ensure change record are made in the right order to undo and redo them in the right order.
- [ ] `RedoDiagramEventHandler#canRedoLayout`: We are considering that redoing a graphical edge add can always be possible while we need to check if the edge source and target are present.
	- /!\ Source and target could not exist because they are part of the same add but, we should ensure change record are made in the right order to undo and redo them in the right order.
- [ ] There is a bug with the undo of an action that remove a semantic element holding a representation that is present in a portal
	- It seems not related to the undo/redo but present since the beginning, since we did not have to handle a representation removed because of semantic removal
- [ ] Improvement : In `UndoDiagramEventHandler` and `RedoDiagramEventHandler`, are applying the whole previous layout. Instead, we should try to rely only on `DiagramLayoutChanges` when applying a `LayoutDiagramRepresentationChange` to then remove `previousLayout` and `newLayout` from `LayoutDiagramRepresentationChange`.
- [ ] Unless closing the project, and thus, disposing the editing context, there is nothing that clears out changes in the editing context.
- [ ] Improve the `ApolloLinkUndoRedoStack`: Since an `ApolloLink` propose thanks to its constructor to override the default behaviour of the `request` method we may remove our custom class to provide only the `request` method.
	- [ ] At the time the `ApolloLinkUndoRedoStack` has be written, it was relying on a regression which as been fixed.
	Since it has been fixed, `layoutDiagram` may not need to be filtered by the `request`, and thus, user actions that add an action in the `undoStack` manually could be removed.
	- The actual behaviour prevent `layoutDiagram` operation to be registered in the undo stack to prevent the `layoutDiagram` operation executing right after a "cause refresh" to create an entry in the undoStack.
	Making each user action to specifically add the `layoutDiagram` operation in the undoStack (e.g. `useLayoutOnBoundsChange#addUndoForLayout`)
- [ ] Improve the sessionStorage for undo and redo stack when undoing or redoing an operation returns an error.
	- Now, we are clearing both stacks, but instead, we could return an error telling that it cannot be done now, but maybe later (another user could perform an action that could make the undo/redo working)
	- in `UndoRedo.tsx` in both `useEffect` concerning _undoData_ and _redoData_.

title: Remove our custom EditingContextCrossReferenceAdapter
body:
It's not clear what it does (or more precisely, that what it does adds some value compared to EMF's default behavior).
When replacing it with EMF's standard `ECrossReferenceAdapter` I don't see any regression (at least all the integration tests pass).
Note that even in it's own `EditingContextCrossReferenceAdapterTest`, when not installing it in [`testMoveObject`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/emf/backend/sirius-components-emf/src/test/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/emf/services/EditingContextCrossReferenceAdapterTest.java#L83) the test still passes.

It has at least one specific issue (#1400, though I can't reproduce it on master)

Note that we still need to install an `ECrossReferenceAdapter` because `IncomingTreeDescriptionProvider` needs fast inverse cross references lookup ([SysON too](https://github.com/eclipse-syson/syson/blob/main/backend/services/syson-services/src/main/java/org/eclipse/syson/services/DeleteService.java#L61)).

title: NA
body: One scenario to validate before we can actually remove our custom adapter is to define multiple View documents with references between them (typically through reused node description), and make sure they are correctly reloaded from scratch (editing domain disposed) with the inter-document references properly resolved.

title: Do not unload EMF resources when disposing an editing context
body:
Currently the default implementation of `IEMFEditingContext.dispose()` does:

```
this.getDomain().getResourceSet().getResources().forEach(Resource::unload);
```

This is costly both in CPU and RAM for no benefit: it will iterate on the content of all resources, compute the proxy URI for every element (which can allocate a lot of long strings and use lots of memory), and then... nothing. Nothing/nobody will ever use the ResourceSet in question after that.
Unloading is only useful to force all elements to become proxies so they are properly re-resolved afterwards, but in our case its all for nothing.

On my machine, this explicit unload takes about 820ms, compared to the ~2200ms needed to load the resource set.
It's not blocking anyone as this is only done once nobody is connected to the editing context, but it's still burning CPU and increasing memory pressure for no benefit.

title: Opening a representation by navigating directly to its URL does not reveal it in the Explorer
body:
This is (recent) regression.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a project with an existing representation.
2. Open one of the representations from its link in the Onboard area.
3. The representation is correctly opened, but it is not revealed & selected in the Explorer.
4. Copy the direct URL to the representation (the current URL once it has been opened).
5. Open a new tab/window and go directly to this URL.
6. Same behavior: the representation is correctly opened, but it is not revealed & selected in the Explorer.

title: IUploadDocumentReportProvider do not cover some use cases
body:

But is most cases the error/warning we want to report to the user are found during _IUploadDocumentReportProvider.getResource(InputStream, URI, ResourceSet, boolean)_. I have not found a nice way to add elements in the report problems detected during the phase. I have tries to add some adapters or use _Resource.getErrors()_ but since the Resource is reloaded from the database everything is lost.

title: All color properties in View DSL should be required
body:
Creating a studio, the following colors are not provided by default.
Sometimes it displays an error, sometime not.
`/!\`  is used to point something that may not be related to this issue.

- [ ] The _Label Color_ of `OutsideLabelStyle` does not have default value and no error is displayed.
- [ ] All color of `OutsideLabelStyle` does not have default value when created under a `ConditionalOutsideLabelStyle` and no error are displayed
- [ ] The _Label Color_ of `InsideLabelStyle` does not have default value and no error is displayed.
- [ ] All color of `InsideLabelStyle` does not have default value when created under a `ConditionalInsideLabelStyle` and no error are displayed
- [ ] Creating an edge description also create an `EdgeStyle` with color but, a hand created edge style does not have default color and no error are displayed
- [ ] The _Background_ of `EllipseNodeStyleDescription` does not have default value and no error is displayed
- [ ] Colors of `BarChartDescriptionStyle` does not have default value, created from the explorer or using the form description editor.
- /!\ _Bars color_ of `BarChartDescriptionStyle` does not seem to be a color widget, and does not have default value, created from the explorer or using the form description editor
- [ ] `DateTimeDescription`: A date time description created with the explorer has default colors but not a date time description created using the form description editor
- [ ] The _Border color_ of `ContainerBorderStyle` and `ConditionalContainerBorderStyle` does not have default color, an error is displayed
- [ ] Colors of `PieChartDescriptionStyle` does not have default value, created from the explorer or using the form description editor.
- /!\ _Bars color_ of `PieChartDescriptionStyle` does not seem to be a color widget
- [ ] Colors of `ReferenceWidgetDescriptionStyle` does not have default value, an error is displayed.
- [ ] Colors of `ConditionalReferenceWidgetDescriptionStyle` does not have default value without any displayed error
- /!\ A `ReferenceWidgetDescriptionStyle` is not created automatically creating a _reference widget_ using the form description editor like all other widgets.

title: Add table representation support
Add an extension point to contribute menu item in table setting
Missing feedback when instantiating a project template from the dialog
body:
When creating a project from one of first the templates (the ones immediately visible on the front page), there is a spinner visible (`CircularProgress`) while the project is being created on the backend.

When instanciating the same template from the "Show all templates" dialog, this feedback is missing.

This is particularly confusing for project templates which are long to create (e.g. "Papaya Example" and "Papaya Performance") as it's not clear if the click has been registered and what is happening for several seconds.

title: Resizing a panel re-renders the opposite one
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a project with a significant amount of element (e.g. "Papaya Example").
2. Expand parts of the Explorer so that at least a few hundreds (or more) items are visible
3. Resize the "Details" view on the right

Even though changing the width of the "Details" view has no impact on the size or content of the "Explorer" view, the Explorer is re-rendered anyway, and in such a case where many elements are visible this can currently be very slow (here for absolutely no good reason).

Actually I think the whole workbench is re-rendered in such a case: both panels and the main representation area. I have not tested but I suppose even with nothing expanded in the Explorer but a large diagram visible, we re-render the diagram and get some slowness here too (this is at least partially understandable as the diagram is adjacent to the resized panel so the resize changes the diagram's viewport size, but in the case of a diagram (as opposed to a form) we can maybe avoid an actual re-render in this case?).

title: Improve [3868] Make the path of edges editable
body:
Thank you for implementing this feature in 2024.11.0! It’s an important enhancement for working with the graphical editor in larger models. I appreciate the progress made here, and I have a few suggestions to improve user-friendliness:

### Expected behavior

**1) Line Movement Over Center Points**
Enable moving the entire line over center points without automatically creating a new node.

![chrome-capture-2024-11-7](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed5275e5-2f54-4efa-92ae-93e9cfcfcf56)
but:
![chrome-capture-2024-11-7 (1)](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/129ad7ea-3891-4601-8833-f38fe567d4fa)

**2) Node Creation Confirmation**
Require additional confirmation (such as a double-click or new edge tool) to create new nodes. 

**3) Line Type Selection Tool**
Having an edge tool to choose line connection type.

![chrome-capture-2024-11-7 (2)](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c37263a9-7d15-4fb5-8c72-07e68096b7d3)

**4) Line Jump Option**
Add an option to control line jumps. This would involve setting a priority level for each line, so that line jumps are displayed based on line hierarchy.

![chrome-capture-2024-11-7 (4)](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/300d1799-9e1c-49a3-b687-9848ddb07941)


Thanks for considering these enhancements.

Undo on Details View widget only revert the value display in the widget
le Undo sur la vue Details ne fonctionne pas bien. Si j'édite le nom d'un élément, puis je sélectionne une autre propriété, alors le Ctrl+Z me remet le focus sur le textfield du nom de l'élément, revient à son ancienne valeur mais sans l'appliquer, car le focus est toujours sur le textfield. ### Steps to reproduce

The undo action undo the changed value everywhere

### Actual behavior

The undo action only change the value inside the textfield widget, without really apply the undo

title: Dropping an item on itself in the Explorer can delete it
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create/open a Flow project with at least one _Composite Processor_
2. In the explorer view, select the _Composite Processor_ and drop it on itself
3. Expected result: nothing happens
4. Actual result: the _Composite Processor_ (and any content it had) are removed from the document

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f1948ba3-faef-4261-95da-8e427c04d5a0

It needs to be confirmed, but my guess is that `ExplorerDropTreeItemHandler` (and others `IDropTreeItemHandler`) does not prevent moving an EObject "inside itself", and when this happens the element and all its content are removed from the resource's containment hierarchy.

title: Remove TreeDescription#getRenameHandler
body:
`o.e.s.c.collaborative.trees.handlers.RenameTreeItemEventHandler` delegates the rename of a tree item to the _rename handler_ of the tree description.
Instead, it should delegate to something to be determined, to handle the rename of the tree item being renamed.
The can handle of that "something to be determined" may need the _editing context_, the _tree item_, the _tree_ and, the _tree description_.

title: Improve performance of diagram viewport change
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- my computer: Linux

### Screenshots

No

### Steps to reproduce

Drag any diagram to change its viewport. You can try to do it fast, in different directions.

### Expected behavior

The diagram viewport is changed without any lags.

### Actual behavior

Diagram drag is very laggy.

title: NA
body:
Here is the fix https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/4207

The problem is that `<DiagramPanel>` calls `useArrangeAll()` that calls `useViewport()`. When you drag a diagram, a viewport is changed, so `useViewport()` hook is updated, so `useArrangeAll()` is updated and so `<DiagramPanel>` is re-rendered. It can be re-rendered hundreds times during drag

I added a new hook `useViewportZoom()` that updated when zoom is changed. It's not updated on diagram drag

title: FormDescriptionEditor crashes the frontend if the FormDescription does not have a page
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a studio and a View
2. Create a FormDescription inside the View
3. Create and open a FormDescriptionEditor on the FormDescription (which initially contains a PageDescription).
4. From the Explorer, delete the PageDescription

The frontend crashes (blank page). Reloading from the same URL (of the FDE) does not fix anything.
Going back to the project page (not the FDE representation), as soon as you click on the broken FDE to try and delete it, it crashes again.

The only fixes are:
1. Select the FormDescription itself, and delete the FDE from the "Representations" view in the right panel.
2. Add a new PageDescription inside the FormDescription so that it can be opened again.

Granted, a FormDescription without a page is invalid, but the "hard crash" on a blank page is a bit much.

Missing variable in SelectionDialogTreeDescription
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

In a `NodeTool`, a `SelectionDialogDescription` and its `SelectionDialogTreeDescription` can be used to make a diagram tool rely on a selection made by the user in a dialog.
In the expression `IsSelectableExpression`, the `self` variable gets assigned to the candidate element of the tree (e.g. so that in the tree users may only select some of the elements.).
But there is no variable for the specifier to reference the diagram or semantic element on which the tool was originally called. For instance if the goal of the tool is to change the container of some elements, we might want our selection dialog to now allow the selection of elements that are already contained by the contextual element.

title: Selection Message of SelectionDialogDescription should be an expression
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

In `SelectionDialogDescription`, the selection message is a fixed String.
It would be more interesting for it to be an expression in which we could use the element on which the tool was invoked, for instance to remind the user of which element was selected, or display some data about the element that may impact the user decision in the dialog.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Studio with a View tree description
2. Fill all required attributes & expressions
3. Create a Blank Project
4. Create a model instance of the domain you've created in your Studio
5. Create a tree instance on your model element

### Expected behavior

The representation should be created, opened and visible in the Explorer view and the central Representation area.

### Actual behavior

Nothing happens.

A first bug is in `ViewTreeDescriptionConverter#convert`, the `idProvider` should be `new GetOrCreateRandomIdProvider()` instead of  `variableManager -> this.getTreeId(variableManager, descriptionId)`.
But it's not the only bug, it needs more investigation to fix that.

title: Add icons to table column headers
Add IconLabel cell to table
Make default explorer services reusable at the view level
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The default explorer representation is hardcoded in Sirius Web at the _description_ level.
The explorer now supports multiple tree representations, which are provided as `TreeDescriptions`, potentially defined at the _view_ level.
Services used by the default explorer take `VariableManager` as parameter, which make them practically unusable from trees defined at the _view_ level.

Extracting these services would let custom explorers reuse default explorer behavior easily.
A new API could be created to expose these services:
```java
public interface IExplorerServices {
    boolean hasChildren(Object self, IEditingContext editingContext);
    List<Object> getChildren(Object self, IEditingContext editingContext, List<String> expandedIds, List<String> activeFilterIds);
   // Other services used by the explorer
}
```

Existing default explorer services would rely on this API to compute their actual result.

### Cuttings backs

Nothing identified.

### Potential side effects

The `IExplorerTreeItemAlteredContentProvider` interface (which applies filters on the explorer) requires a `VariableManager` as parameter.
Since this interface may be implemented by downstream applications, its signature won't be updated and the associated filtering behavior will stay in the existing services.
This implies that custom explorer implementations will have to handle filters explicitly.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Migrating the default explorer as a _view_ (instead of a _description_) would be another way to tackle the issue, but it is more complicated. The proposed solution is a first step in this direction.

title: NA
body:
> Migrating the default explorer as a view (instead of a description) would be another way to tackle the issue, but it is more complicated

It's not just more complicated, it would be at least a net regression in terms of performance for not much gain.

You also have to keep in mind that we need to make OUR explorer evolve over time so the behavior and signature of those methods will change potentially significantly. Are you sure that you want to "copy our behavior" and not have your own behavior (even if it starts with a copy of our own)?

I just want to be sure that you want to mimic OUR explorer on the long run because if you go this way, we WILL one day change how we do things, you WILL be impacted and we may not change back our new behavior.

title: NA
body:
Here is my rationale:
1. I want to create a new custom explorer that extends the existing one with, let's say, a new directory containing things I'll manage.
2. To get started, I'd like to first replicate the existing explorer. This is not trivial to do right now **if I have defined my tree at the view level** (I don't have any built-in services to call to perform the same actions as in the explorer)
3. I create my custom explorer services, reusing the default ones when needed
4. If a default service doesn't work as expected for me, I create my own

I understand your point about the future evolutions of the explorer. In this context, it makes sense to start with a copy of Sirius Web's behavior, but it would be easier to copy the `ExplorerServices` file I propose, instead of copying and adapting the description-level functions that are already implemented to make them work with my view-level tree.

All this reasoning is based on the fact that I'd like to define my custom explorer at the view level, but it is maybe not the way to go about it (especially given your point on performances).

title: NA
body: I understand why it would be helpful for you. If that's ok for you I don't mind having this service class, I just want you to be aware that there will be changes in its behavior and API.

title: Conditional node styles using custom colors are not applied dynamically
body:
I have two node mappings M1 & M2 on the same elements (Composite Processors from flow).
Both have the same default look.
Both have a conditional style on the same condition (`aql:sefl.name = 'X').

The only difference:
* M1's conditional style sets its background color to `black`
* M2's conditional style sets its background color to `red 500`

Given an opened diagram, initially with a Composite Processor represented using the default style for both nodes, I edit the processor's name to 'X'

* M1 is immediately updated to apply the conditional style.
* M2 is not.

Closing the diagram and re-opening it takes M2's conditional style into account.

Editing the processor's name again so that the condition is false correctly re-applies the default style to both.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c946b6c2-4e1c-486d-ab5b-9f016a2d4e7b

Studio definition to reproduce: [Studio_ Conditional Color Bug.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18096622/Studio_.Conditional.Color.Bug.zip)

title: NA
body:
It looks like we receive the proper info from the backend and apply it correctly to the Node's data:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b616bba9-02aa-4567-9f61-c43779ac1897)

Note the "background: red[500]" on the node's `.data.style`, even though it is still displayed as white.

title: NA
body:
Same value in the node's props after a re-open, where this time it is applied:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/231c9358-e236-4f3f-b36c-1944bd944b40)

title: NA
body: This is probably related to the special color name/syntax ("red[500]") which is not resolved into the actual CSS value (`rgb(244, 67, 54)`) dynamically.

title: NA
body:
*Very* partial fix:

```
diff --git a/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/renderer/node/FreeFormNode.tsx b/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/renderer/node/FreeFormNode.tsx
index b449b9ab6..b9b03f27f 100644
--- a/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/renderer/node/FreeFormNode.tsx
+++ b/packages/diagrams/frontend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/renderer/node/FreeFormNode.tsx
@@ -41,6 +41,7 @@ const freeFormNodeStyle = (
     height: '100%',
     opacity: faded ? '0.4' : '',
     ...style,
+    background: getCSSColor(String(style.background), theme),
     borderColor: getCSSColor(String(style.borderColor), theme),
   };
   if (selected || hovered) {
```

It fixes this very specific case, but should be seen as just a pointer to the root of the issue. A proper fix would need to review all our nodes and styles to ensure `getCSSColor` is always properly applied.

title: After closing the palette with ESC, direct edit does not work
Make ExplorerDropTreeItemHandler work only for the default explorer
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The `ExplorerDropTreeItemHandler` should only work on the default explorer provided by Sirius Web, but it is triggered on any custom explorer implementation.
This prevents downstream applications with a custom explorer from providing a custom `IDropTreeItemHandler` tailored to their domain.

### Cuttings backs


### Potential side effects

Implementing this will de-activate the default DnD implementation on custom explorers.
Downstream applications will need to provide their own implementation of `IDropTreeItemHandler`, potentially by subclassing `ExplorerDropTreeItemHandler` and changing the `canHandle` method.
The changelog should reflect this new behavior.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

title: Edge labels flash when a diagram is re-rendered
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Flow project with a Topography diagram.
2. Make sure there are at least a few edges visible, for example between multiple data sources and a processor
3. Move one of the data sources
4. It's subtle and depends on the diagram size/performances, but the labels of the edges "flash": they seem to disappear for one frame before being redrawn in their correct position.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e118317b-4c81-479d-8650-f69786c6a4f4)

Looking at a performance capture with screenshots, it appears that during the frame in question all the edge labels are drawn on top of each other, probably at (0,0) inside the `react-flow__edgelabel-renderer` div. It's barely visible, but in the video below, when on the frame with the labels "invisible" they actually appear on the top-left of the "DataSource3" node (the one in the top-left):

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6edd7366-94f4-4880-ad16-49a92df1d699

title: NA
body: Note: the capture above are taken using a plain Sirius Web 2024.11.0.

title: NA
body:
Putting a `console.log('MultiLabelEditableEdge', { sourceX, sourceY, targetX, targetY, edgeCenterX, edgeCenterY });` in `MultiLabelEditableEdge.tsx` shows that when finishing a move of a node, there is one intermediate state when `edgeCenterX` `edgeCenterY` (position of the main label) are at 0:


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/17ed4f99-8953-463e-9653-ef6fb996bee6

title: NA
body:
It seems somehow related to the number of bendpoints on the edge.

Here I only log when `edgeCenterX === 0 || edgeCenterY === 0` :
```js
    if (edgeCenterX === 0 || edgeCenterY === 0) {
      console.log('MultiLabelEditableEdge', { edgeCenterX, edgeCenterY, state });
    }
```

* With the default (no manual bendpoint): we get a temporary state with `edgeCenterX === 0`
* With *one* manual bendpoint, this disappears
* With *two* manual bendpoints, the broken intermediate state is back when finishing a move.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4e691894-dc10-4ccc-bbce-2f83d61293a4

List layout node with a dash style border:

There are two typos in Table variables defined in `org.eclipse.sirius.components.tables.descriptions.ColumnDescription`:

```java
    public static final String COLUMN_TARGET_OBJECT = "columTargetObject";

    public static final String COLUMN_TARGET_OBJECT_ID = "columTargetObjectId";
```

should be:

```java
    public static final String COLUMN_TARGET_OBJECT = "columnTargetObject";

    public static final String COLUMN_TARGET_OBJECT_ID = "columnTargetObjectId";
```

title: The Details view does not react when its input is deselected
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a project. Initially there is no element selected, and the _Details_ view correctly says so: "No object selected".
2. Select an element in the _Explorer_ view.
3. Its details are shown in the _Details_ view, and the onboard area is updated too depending on the selected element's type.
4. Deselect the element in the _Explorer_ (Ctrl-click).
5. Now the workbench selection is empty as it was in step 1. The onboard area is updated, but the _Details_ view continues to show the details of the previously selected element. It should be back to the "No object selected" state.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fc62370a-4c81-47ce-b9e5-9812c4082ff9

title: NA
body:
Note that in such a state the Details view is half-functional: it can *send* mutations when the user interacts with the widgets but will not receive the new values:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f46ceb68-d684-4bff-8c1a-d2f0948e14cf

Worse, if the displayed element is deleted by another user, the form stays visible but this time interactions with it completely fail.

body:
### Expected behavior

We don't necessarily know how the command was written (start with upper case or not , which character is upper or lower case ...).
And the goal of this command palette is to easy command execution so we should not be blocked by this kind of consideration.

So I propose that, per default, there's no case respect.
In addition, you can add a tool to force case sensitivity if we want : also useful :-)

### Cuttings backs

...

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered

...

title: Improve the information available to debug performance issues
body:
We are missing key data in order to identify performance issues, the following pieces of information should be added and/or documented:

### Frontend

- log the time taken by the layout
- Log the time taken by some core components of our representations (tree, form, diagram, table) using the React profiler

### Backend

- log time of each event handler
- log time of the `IEditingContext{Persistence|Search}Service`
- log time of each IRepresentationEventProcessor#refresh
- log time (with a threshold) of the evaluation of AQL expressions (log all expressions taking more than 50ms for example)
- log the time taken by each datafetcher using GraphQL Java instrumentation support

All this should be done with some easy to use configuration properties on the backend (to start debugging everything easily)

title: NA
body: As a result of this issue, some documentation should be available along with some default settings in Sirius Web to run an instance of Sirius Web with all performance log activated.

title: Display Explorer View contextual menu with right click
body:
* [X] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

When the user launch right click, the browser menu should not be always displayed. It will be useful to display the Sirius Web contextual menu.
For example, from the tree explorer view, it will be useful if the user can right-click on an element to display the Sirius Web contextual menu without needing to find the small dots button.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/16061520-cb76-4115-be30-d2de4bc93d0d)

title: NA
body:
Hi 👋

I may be able to give a look into this.
But before I do, do you have any suggestion, recommendation or requirement on both code and UX aspects?

Also when googling about custom right-click context menu a lot of concerns arise on forums about how it can badly impact user experience.  
Replacing the default browser behaviour can be something some user would definitely **not** want as it can interfere with their expectations and thus feel counter-intuitive or unnatural. Some suggests as a compromise to display the default menu, for example,  on a second right-click.

So what is your take about this? Do you want to let the user be able to also display the default menu? if yes how in terms of UI?

References:
- https://www.reddit.com/r/webdev/comments/18sa56y/how_does_google_create_a_customized_rightclick/?rdt=52726
- https://dev.to/shantanu_jana/custom-right-click-context-menu-in-javascript-4112#comment-1njl1
- https://www.radix-ui.com/primitives/docs/components/context-menu

title: NA
body:
Hello @ctmbl,

Thank your for your interest in this issue and the information provided.

Many users want this new behavior and after many discussions with the team, we agreed that it is best to display the context menu with the right-click instead of the left-click.

We will add an entry in the changelog to document and warn about that change.

Regards,

title: Add frontend extension point to wrap/augment the NavigationBar children
body:
The `NavigationBar` component already supports several extension points. `navigationBarLeftContributionExtensionPoint` (resp. `navigationBarRightContributionExtensionPoint`), but elements added to this are "packed" to the left side (resp. right side) of the header. `editProjectNavbarSubtitleExtensionPoint` (used only in `EditProjectNavbar`) adds support for a subtitle displayed _below_ the project name: ![Capture d’écran du 2025-01-02 18-05-26](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/14f0b484-fe71-496c-a107-c8716ed8ad57) There is no way to add elements around the project name at the center, to replace it or add some context (for example to be used in custom `ProjectContextMenuItem` elements). It should be possible to support all of these use cases, and more, by adding a single extension point around the `
{children}
` part of `NavigationBar`.

title: Fix a warning for an autocomplete widget

title: Lower the coupling between project and editing context
body: The identifier of the semantic data should be used instead of the identifier of the project as the identifier of the editing context. We should thus improve the computation of the editing context id from the project id.

title: Give specifiers more control over the presence of  the explorer's ExpandAll tool for specific items
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
Specifiers should have control over the presence (or not) of the ExpandAll tool in the contextual menu of items in the explorer. 
For the moment this tool is hardcoded in the frontend, and is present in the contextual menu of any element that has children. Downstream applications may want to tune this behavior (e.g. it may not be relevant from a UX perspective to ExpandAll some elements that contain a lot of sub-elements). This tuning should be possible from the backend side to allow semantic-based preconditions. The View DSL should be updated to reflect these changes.

### Potential side effects
The current implementation of the ExpandAll in the frontend will evolve to become a Sirius Web component contributed via an extension point. This will have some impact on the Tree API, in particular the `expandAll` and `exapand` functions passed through the hierarchy. 

The ExpandAll logic is used in multiple places in the frontend (in the contextual menu of trees, but also in the _expand all_ button in the reference widget or model browser). The new implementation should ensure that these tools still work.

title: Add the ability to specify the side in which a new border node is created
Add support for some (optional) impact analysis before the execution of a tool
body:
It should be possible for a specifier to indicate that a tool should display some impact analysis before the execution of the tool. For a first version, this analysis could simply list the number of elements created, modified, deleted and nothing more. It will be improve over time using other issues.

This feature should not be thought as exclusively made for diagrams, it will be requested as soon as possible for other representations such as tables, forms, trees, etc

title: Take into account all elements of the selection to compute the edit project URL
body:
It should be possible to have and thus share an URL with not only the currently selected representation but also the currently selected semantic elements. It should be noted that we should probably stop distinguishing semantic elements from the representations in managing the selection in `EditProjectView`.

The shape should thus take into accounts use cases with a multi-selection (with multiple semantic elements AND/OR multiple representations).

title: Add the ability to update dynamically the description of any representation
body:
A first version of this feature has been developed for tables, now we want to make it more generic and support any kind of representation supported by the view DSL. The shape for this feature should consider the workflow used to perform this in the user interface (should this become a contextual action in the explorer for representations?).

In a similar fashion as before, this feature should still be isolated in a dedicated module (frontend and backend). We should probably rename the project `sirius-web-table` in this regard...

title: Set activeFilterIds variable in ExpandAll
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**


Specifiers can't use the `activeFilterIds` variable in their services when they are called by the `DefaultExpandAllTreePathHandler`. The handler does not set this variable, while the `TreeService#create` method does. As a result, calls to those service will work if they are part of a rendering, but won't if they are part of an _Expand All_ query.

The `DefaultExpandAllTreePathHandler` has all the information it needs to initialize this variable, and should do it for the sake of consistency with the other contexts where those services are called.

title: Add support for the duplication of representations in the explorer
body: In this first version, we're talking about a very basic duplication, i.e. a duplication in the same place, keeping the targetObject of the duplicated representation.

title: Provide better user feedback when a Domain definition is invalid
body:
We currently have *some* validation applying to domain definitions (see `org.eclipse.sirius.components.domain.emf.DomainValidator`), but when converting a domain definition into an actual EMF `EPackage` we are much more strict than what these validation rules check for.
Indeed, in [`DomainConverter`](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/domain/backend/sirius-components-domain-emf/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/domain/emf/DomainConverter.java) we only consider domains which, once converted, do not have any error:

```java
// Only return valid and safe EPackages
return ePackages.stream().filter(ePackage -> Diagnostician.INSTANCE.validate(ePackage).getSeverity() < Diagnostic.ERROR);
```

In practice this means even with no visible validation error, a domain definition can fail to be converted and thus not deployed/available, with zero feedback to the studio maker about what is wrong and needs to be fixed.

title: Add support for widget diagnostics provider in View-based Forms
body:
Programmatically-defined widgets have support for `.diagnosticsProvider()`, which are used for example in the default details view to expose EMF Diagnostics (see how `EStringIfDescriptionProvider.getTextareaDescription()`, `PropertiesValidationProvider` and `DomainValidator` work together to implement this).

However this capability is not exposed to View-based Forms. `form.ecore` does not provide any way to configure diagnostics for a widget, and given this lack of input `ViewFormDescriptionConverterSwitch` configures all the widgets it produces with no diagnostics provider (`.diagnosticsProvider(variableManager -> List.of())`).

title: NA
body: Reopeing the issue; only the ADR has been merged for now.

title: Provide better user feedback when a View definition is invalid
body:
This is the equivalent of #4389 but for View definitions, which have the same issue: a single, hard-to-find mistake in the definition can render the whole View invalid and prevent it to be deployed with no clue for the studio maker about what's wrong.

The implementation however will be very different and much more involved as we can not simply leverage EMF's validation of EPackages as we do for Domains.

title: Swagger UI REST APIs page not available anymore
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- master branch 2025/01/09
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All

### Problem

With the bump to Spring Boot 3.4.1, and the introduction of `FrontendRouterConfiguration.java` the swagger page listing all REST APIs (http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/index.html) and the OpenAPI file (http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs/rest-apis) are not accessible anymore.
Adding `"/v3/api-docs/**"` into the list of authorized paths should fix the problem.

### Steps to reproduce

Just access to http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/index.html or http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs/rest-apis on a local instance of Sirius Web.

### Expected behavior

http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/index.html displays the list of all REST APIs
http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs/rest-apis shows the OpenAPI.json file of the REST APIs

### Actual behavior

http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/index.html displays the petstore example
http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs/rest-apis shows nothing

title: Display more complex result types in the query view
NA
body:
There is no description of the issue so I don't know if you were thinking about that but I encountered several issues with the query view:
- `aql:true = true` or `aql:true = false`: in both cases the evaluation result is `One boolean has been returned` and we don't know the value of this boolean result.
- `aql:self.myEnumAttribute`: seems enums results are not handled by the query view

title: Not all widgets support displaying diagnostics
body:
All widgets in Forms can have one or more `diagnostic { id kind message }`.
They are all computed on the backend, and fetched by the front (sett `commonFields` in `FormEventFragment.ts`), but only _some_ widgets actually display them.

At the time of this writing, the ones I see with explicit support are (`helperText={widget.diagnostics[0]?.message}` `<FormHelperText>{widget.diagnostics[0]?.message}</FormHelperText>`): checkbox, date-time, list, multi-select, radio, select, text-field and (maybe) reference.

title: Widgets only display the first of their diagnostics
body: For widgets which *do* support displaying diagnostics (not all of them, see #4412), only the _message_ (not the kind/severity) of only the _first_ diagnostic is displayed to the user (typically with something like `helperText={widget.diagnostics[0]?.message}`).

title: Provide a default behavior to return valid JSON on /api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/changes
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** : 
- commit d4df511d0
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- WSL

### Screenshots
https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/discussions/4393#discussioncomment-11821402

![402597922-1a053ae9-92fc-4a5b-8e4d-d26bb9459122](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f0cb71a-0ce0-4c59-97fb-42829a250c8f)

![402598125-fb7f45cc-31ce-4b61-bbbd-52a28fc48e16](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bf10ff19-432b-4d54-b43f-033cd81ce20f)

![402598377-45b44a83-48d2-45e9-bf01-295e36a108a6](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbab8e3e-d3db-4170-b3d3-bc923ef14475)  
https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/#



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create some project on Sirius Web (tested with Flow, Studio, custom domain, Papaya example and blank)
2. Perform a GET on the endpoint [`/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/changes`](http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/index.html#/commit-rest-controller/getCommitChange)
```py
# for example in python
import requests
resp = requests.get("http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/6ea46518-424f-4b88-bbc1-1afc2887d587/commits/6ea46518-424f-4b88-bbc1-1afc2887d587/changes")
print(resp.text)
```
see 
```json
[
  {
    "@id":"9f9cfa8d-3fd8-3fab-8e3d-38e3dd556b06",
    "@type":"DataVersion",
    "identity": {
        "@id":"84d67606-4956-46df-8db1-2ac203dd831e",
        "@type":"DataIdentity"
     },
    "payload"
  },
...
```

### Expected behavior
Return valid RFC 8259 JSON

For example when no payload is defined return:
```json
...
  "payload": null
...
```

### Actual behavior
`"payload"` key with no value associated:
```json
...
  "payload"
...
```

[according to @AxelRICHARD](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/discussions/4393#discussioncomment-11821731) :
> This payload contains data specific to your metamodel.
You should implement your own version of IRestDataVersionPayloadSerializerService.java to serialize it as you want.
An example is available [in SysON](https://github.com/eclipse-syson/syson/blob/main/backend/services/syson-sysml-rest-api-services/src/main/java/org/eclipse/syson/sysml/rest/api/SysMLv2RestDataVersionPayloadSerializerService.java), a Sirius Web-based open source project.

title: NA
body:
tested on d4df511

I'll take advantage of this opened issue to share to other strange behaviours of the API

### Infinite Loops

`/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/roots` and `/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/elements` suffers from **infinite loop** and return **not valid JSON** because of a **nesting depth reached** in the backend:
```
2025-01-16T11:52:22.259+01:00  WARN 4604 --- [io-8080-exec-10] .w.s.m.s.DefaultHandlerExceptionResolver : Ignoring exception, response committed already: org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotWritableException: Could not write JSON: Document nesting depth (1001) exceeds the maximum allowed (1000, from `StreamWriteConstraints.getMaxNestingDepth()`)
2025-01-16T11:52:22.259+01:00  WARN 4604 --- [io-8080-exec-10] .w.s.m.s.DefaultHandlerExceptionResolver : Resolved [org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotWritableException: Could not write JSON: Document nesting depth (1001) exceeds the maximum allowed (1000, from `StreamWriteConstraints.getMaxNestingDepth()`)]
```

#### examples to reproduce:
  - create a Blank Studio with a simple Entity containing itself:
  ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cff04bf8-30a9-413f-83c4-a705ae5bc992)
  access `http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/<your-project-id>/commits/<your-project-id>/roots`
  - create a new project from the Flow template:
  access `http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/<your-project-id>/commits/<your-project-id>/roots`
  ```json
  [
      {
          "consumption": 0,
          "powerStatus": "NONE",
          "status": "ACTIVE",
          "usage": "UNUSED",
          "outgoingFlows": [],
          "name": "NewSystem",
          "elements": [
              {
                  "consumption": 0,
                  "powerStatus": "NONE",
                  "status": "ACTIVE",
                  "usage": "UNUSED",
                  "outgoingFlows": [],
                  "name": "CompositeProcessor1",
                  "elements": [
                      {
                          "status": "ACTIVE",
                          "usage": "UNUSED",
                          "incomingFlows": [
                              {
                                  "status": "ACTIVE",
                                  "usage": "STANDARD",
                                  "capacity": 6,
                                  "load": 6,
                                  "target": {
                                      "status": "ACTIVE",
                                      "usage": "UNUSED",
                                      "incomingFlows": [
                                          {
                                              "status": "ACTIVE",
                                              "usage": "STANDARD",
                                              "capacity": 6,
                                              "load": 6,
                                              "target": {
                                                  "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                  "usage": "UNUSED",
                                                  "incomingFlows": [
                                                      {
                                                          "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                          "usage": "STANDARD",
                                                          "capacity": 6,
                                                          "load": 6,
                                                          "target": {
                                                              "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                              "usage": "UNUSED",
                                                              "incomingFlows": [
                                                                  {
                                                                      "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                                      "usage": "STANDARD",
                                                                      "capacity": 6,
                                                                      "load": 6,
                                                                      "target": {
  ... (goes on and on through target -> incomingFlows -> target)
  ```

### Unhandled exception

`/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/roots` and `/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/elements` throw an **unhandled exception** in the backend **for instances of custom domain** (Studio?) created in Sirius Web. Thus not returning any JSON but a template HTML.  
This seemed to be caused by a lack of serializer:
```
2025-01-16T12:03:07.218+01:00 ERROR 4604 --- [nio-8080-exec-4] o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[/].[dispatcherServlet]    : Servlet.service() for servlet [dispatcherServlet] in context with path [] threw exception [Request processing failed: org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageConversionException: Type definition error: [simple type, class org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.DynamicEObjectImpl]] with root cause

com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidDefinitionException: No serializer found for class org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.DynamicEObjectImpl and no properties discovered to create BeanSerializer (to avoid exception, disable SerializationFeature.FAIL_ON_EMPTY_BEANS) (through reference chain: java.util.ArrayList[0])
        at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidDefinitionException.from(InvalidDefinitionException.java:77) ~[jackson-databind-2.18.2.jar!/:2.18.2]
...
```  
#### steps to reproduce:
- Create a new Studio (not a blank one)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5add87a5-5f70-4862-8d37-81483666ce70)
- Create a new blank project 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a1a73c7-5e56-45a9-a7fc-e48b226ee6c3)
- Add an object from the previously created Studio 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0a5cf349-0bcf-4994-a768-0789bbbf234f)
- access `http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/<your-project-id>/commits/<your-project-id>/roots`
- this should throw an exception in the backend as shown above


Please let me know if these behaviours are expected, or if you want me to create separate issues 🙂

title: Access to the diagram variable in the diagram tool context
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
cf https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/discussions/4401

Be able to hide/show a group of relation-based Edges from a diagram palette tool.  
In order to do that: have access to the `diagram` variable in a diagram tool context to access Nodes and Edges.

### Cuttings backs

...

### Potential side effects

...

### Describe alternatives you've considered
there is no [according to @AxelRICHARD](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/discussions/4401#discussioncomment-11800260):
> So, is there a service or a way to access relation-based Edges from the "Expression" field of a "Change Context" tool?

> Unfortunately, no, it's not possible because we don't have added a variable "diagram" in this context (https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/view/backend/sirius-components-view-emf/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/view/emf/diagram/ViewPaletteProvider.java).
> With this variable, you should have then access to all graphical nodes and edges of the diagram (see https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/diagrams/backend/sirius-components-diagrams/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/diagrams/Diagram.java).


NB: feel free to edit the issue's title if not explicit enough

title: Remove last usages of mui styled

Selection Dialog is broken
body: `DialogContextProvider` is missing in `DiagramSubscriptionProvider`

title: Add the representation description name in details view
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

We need to present the representation description name inside the details view when the representation is selected in the Explorer.

Since the field is already existing in the representation description, this task is basically to add a read only field in the class `RepresentationMetadataDetailsViewPageDescriptionProvider`

Since the field to display is read only, we need a `org.eclipse.sirius.components.forms.description.LabelDescription`

We need to retrieve the representation description through its id thank to `IRepresentationDescriptionSearchService`.

title: Add edit handler for table cells in view
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

Currently, there is no edit handler for cells for tables built using the View DSL.
When trying to edit a cell, an error message appears:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad04f765-e9a7-4e55-94bd-8fe34163319f)

title: NA
body:
After investigating this topic, I noticed a difficulty concerning cell IDs.
The goal of this edit handler is to retrieve from the front-end cell widget ID, the corresponding view cell description where the specifier has described the operations to be performed when a new value is given by the user.
The way the cell parts are built from view DSL to cell widgets in the back-end code makes it difficult to retrieve the view cell description from the front-end cell ID.

title: Allow multiple implementation of IEditingContextSaver & IEditingContextLoader
FrontendRouterConfiguration should be extensible
body:
Currently `org.eclipse.sirius.web.infrastructure.configuration.mvc.FrontendRouterConfiguration` hard-codes the file extensions and the list of paths it considers corresponding to backend-supplied resources.

It should be made extensible (by taking instances of a new predicate interface, to be determined) so that downstream applications can add support for other kinds of static resources or "REST" controllers.

title: Nodes size are not the same when they should after a refresh

title: Reference widgets should still allow selection/navigation to existing values when in read-only

Currently when a Reference widget is in read-only mode, it is entirely _disabled_:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/69ddd533-e325-4f3f-8315-1da20c54c0bb)

In this state the current values references (displayed as chips) should still by clickable so that the user can select them and navigate the reference; this does not trigger any tool or other behavior which can modify the model so it should be allowed even in read-only mode.

title: Infinite loops in /api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/roots and /api/.../elements response generation
body:
originally posted as a comment of #4414 

---

* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- d4df511
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- WSL

### Screenshots

...

### Steps to reproduce
- create a Blank Studio with a simple Entity containing itself:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cff04bf8-30a9-413f-83c4-a705ae5bc992)
- access `http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/<your-project-id>/commits/<your-project-id>/roots`

**OR** 

- create a new project from the Flow template
- access `http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/<your-project-id>/commits/<your-project-id>/roots`


### Expected behavior

- don't create an infinite loop in the backend => don't reach nesting limit
- return valid JSON
- don't return duplicated elements in the JSON (cf example below with `standard` and `Processor1` from the Flow template through target -> incomingFlows -> target)

### Actual behavior
`/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/roots` and `/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/elements` suffers from **infinite loop** and return **not valid JSON** because of a **nesting depth limit reached** in the backend:
```
2025-01-16T11:52:22.259+01:00  WARN 4604 --- [io-8080-exec-10] .w.s.m.s.DefaultHandlerExceptionResolver : Ignoring exception, response committed already: org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotWritableException: Could not write JSON: Document nesting depth (1001) exceeds the maximum allowed (1000, from `StreamWriteConstraints.getMaxNestingDepth()`)
2025-01-16T11:52:22.259+01:00  WARN 4604 --- [io-8080-exec-10] .w.s.m.s.DefaultHandlerExceptionResolver : Resolved [org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotWritableException: Could not write JSON: Document nesting depth (1001) exceeds the maximum allowed (1000, from `StreamWriteConstraints.getMaxNestingDepth()`)]
```

returning (in the case of the Flow template):
```json
[
    {
        "consumption": 0,
        "powerStatus": "NONE",
        "status": "ACTIVE",
        "usage": "UNUSED",
        "outgoingFlows": [],
        "name": "NewSystem",
        "elements": [
            {
                "consumption": 0,
                "powerStatus": "NONE",
                "status": "ACTIVE",
                "usage": "UNUSED",
                "outgoingFlows": [],
                "name": "CompositeProcessor1",
                "elements": [
                    {
                        "status": "ACTIVE",
                        "usage": "UNUSED",
                        "incomingFlows": [
                            {
                                "status": "ACTIVE",
                                "usage": "STANDARD",
                                "capacity": 6,
                                "load": 6,
                                "target": {
                                    "status": "ACTIVE",
                                    "usage": "UNUSED",
                                    "incomingFlows": [
                                        {
                                            "status": "ACTIVE",
                                            "usage": "STANDARD",
                                            "capacity": 6,
                                            "load": 6,
                                            "target": {
                                                "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                "usage": "UNUSED",
                                                "incomingFlows": [
                                                    {
                                                        "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                        "usage": "STANDARD",
                                                        "capacity": 6,
                                                        "load": 6,
                                                        "target": {
                                                            "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                            "usage": "UNUSED",
                                                            "incomingFlows": [
                                                                {
                                                                    "status": "ACTIVE",
                                                                    "usage": "STANDARD",
                                                                    "capacity": 6,
                                                                    "load": 6,
                                                                    "target": {
... (goes on and on through target -> incomingFlows -> target)
```

title: Unhandled exception in the backend on /api/../roots and /api/../elements for instances of a custom domain
body:
originally posted on #4414 

---

* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- d4df511
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- WSL

### Screenshots

...

### Steps to reproduce
- Create a new Studio (not a blank one)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5add87a5-5f70-4862-8d37-81483666ce70)
- Create a new blank project 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a1a73c7-5e56-45a9-a7fc-e48b226ee6c3)
- Add an object from the previously created Studio 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0a5cf349-0bcf-4994-a768-0789bbbf234f)
- access `http://localhost:8080/api/rest/projects/<your-project-id>/commits/<your-project-id>/roots`
- this should throw an exception in the backend as shown above

### Expected behavior

- don't throw an unhandled exception
- warn the user of the lack of serializer for this project
- return a JSON close to what we get *via* the Download feature 

### Actual behavior

`/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/roots` and `/api/rest/projects/{projectId}/commits/{commitId}/elements` throw an **unhandled exception** in the backend **for instances of custom domain** created in Sirius Web. Thus not returning any JSON but a template HTML.  
This seemed to be caused by a lack of serializer:
```
2025-01-16T12:03:07.218+01:00 ERROR 4604 --- [nio-8080-exec-4] o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[/].[dispatcherServlet]    : Servlet.service() for servlet [dispatcherServlet] in context with path [] threw exception [Request processing failed: org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageConversionException: Type definition error: [simple type, class org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.DynamicEObjectImpl]] with root cause

com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidDefinitionException: No serializer found for class org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.DynamicEObjectImpl and no properties discovered to create BeanSerializer (to avoid exception, disable SerializationFeature.FAIL_ON_EMPTY_BEANS) (through reference chain: java.util.ArrayList[0])
        at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidDefinitionException.from(InvalidDefinitionException.java:77) ~[jackson-databind-2.18.2.jar!/:2.18.2]
...
```

title: NA
body:
I'd like to take a look at this issue as we may need this feature.

Just to clarify what you said in #4414 @AxelRICHARD , it's a lack of serializer that causes this issue, but a lack for what component?

Meaning, if I want to hit these endpoints for a project that is an instance of a custom domain (defined by a metamodel built in Sirius Web from a Blank Studio), am I forced to create a dedicated serializer for my metamodel, or can I provide a generic serializer that can handle instances of any domain created by a studio maker in Sirius Web?

title: NA
body:
It's probably best to create your own serializer for your own metamodel.
A generic one would probably not suits for everybody.

We created an example of a generic serializer (see https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/sirius-web/backend/sirius-web/src/test/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/EObjectSerializerTestConfig.java
and https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/sirius-web/backend/sirius-web/src/test/java/org/eclipse/sirius/web/EObjectJsonSerializer.java for more details) for our tests.

You can take a look at those files and then create your own serializer for your metamodel in your Sirius Web based application.

title: NA
body: Thanks a lot for the pointers and your help, I'll try to take a look in the coming weeks 😉

- https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/4429
- https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/4284

This ticket refers to the backend support for the publication and query of libraries, as well as the frontend visualization of published libraries. It doesn't address the integration of frontend components to trigger the publication of libraries, nor any action to perform on/with published libraries.
