  ```dockerfile
  WORKDIR /build/sirius-web
  ADD https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web.git /build/sirius-web
  ```
  which doesn't *clone* the repository but download, and then doesn't have a `.git` folder
- try to compile: `mvn clean install -f packages/pom.xml --settings settings.xml`

### Expected behavior

either:
- if no `.git` folder is found: stop the build warning the user why the test failed and how to skip this one
or
- if no `.git` folder is found: automatically skip the test and emit a warning

### Actual behavior

build fails due to test fail

title: Prevent tables from sending useless mutations to the backend
body:
Steps to reproduce:

- Open a table
- Do nothing and watch the devtools

title: Ask specifiers to opt in for specific table features
body: By default countless of features are activate and they may not be relevant (see the options of the frontend code to see what should be activable)

title: Use term of row instead of line in the table code
body:
The Table module contains two naming conventions for the table row concept. It was originally named `Line,` but the word `Row` has recently been used instead.

See for instance classes like [LineDescription](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/tables/backend/sirius-components-tables/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/tables/descriptions/LineDescription.java) or [LineComponent](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/tables/backend/sirius-components-tables/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/tables/components/LineComponent.java) vs [ResizeTableRowEventHandler](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/tables/backend/sirius-components-collaborative-tables/src/main/java/org/eclipse/sirius/components/collaborative/tables/handlers/ResizeTableRowEventHandler.java)

We need to use the same naming convention for all parts of the code and use the term `row` instead of `line` which is more commonly used to designate the horizontal element of a table.

title: Add EMF Services for Query View
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

It would be great to have some Add EMF Services for the Query View.
For a first implementation, just a few services would be available:
- eSet
- eUnset

title: It's not possible to redirect from EditProjectView without refreshing the page
body:
With the current way `EditProjectView`& `EditProjectViewMachine` are implemented it's not possible to redirect to another project by using `useNavigate(/projects/projectId/edit)`.

We can force the redirection by calling `useNavigate(0)` (in order to refresh the page) but we're losing the history.

This can happen when implementing a custom action that would redirect to another project from the `EditProjectView`.

I think we should try to let go of `xstate` here and simplify the component by only using React hooks but it's also possible to adapt the behavior of the current state machine.

As a user, I want to be able to activate (or deactivate) filters that hide (or show) certain table rows.

This mechanism should mimic the control of visibility on columns in terms of user experience.

title: Extract the model browser in generic modules
PNG export sometimes produces truncated images
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Flow project with a Topography diagram.
2. Make sure at least one _DataSource_ element is visible on the diagram and is place below all the other elements.
3. Add `?mode=png-viewer` to the browser's URL.
4. After a small delay, you should see a dialog popup with a PNG version of the diagram visible.
5. Note that the text of the _Data Source_'s, label is truncated:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/38e79fdb-7244-4a67-8ed9-00bdf3ad6601)

title: NA
body: Note that this is not a frontend issue which would now display the whole image. Opening the PNG image in a separate tab and saving the result confirms the PNG itself is truncated.

title: NA
body:
This also concerns _edges_ if they are routed "out of the box" of the actual nodes. Something like this (voluntarily exagerated):

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b6621767-5392-4746-bd41-fb3b44e54254)

title: Add support for the import of libraries
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior
The behavior is described in [this shape](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/doc/iterations/2025.2/add_support_for_the_import_of_libraries.adoc)

The main goal is to have a new command in the palette that let users import published libraries. 
This command opens a dialog with a table containing the published libraries, and provides actions the user can execute on selected libraries (import as a copy, import in read-only mode, etc).

### Cuttings backs

We will only provide a default action for the first version of the import (import as a copy).

This work is based on the work in the following pull requests:

- https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/4463
- https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/pull/4492

title: descriptionId is not expose in the frontend RepresentationMetadata
Support Ctrl+Shift+Z for redo on Linux
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

Currently, the redo shortcut is mapped to Ctrl+Y, which works on Windows but is not the standard shortcut on Linux and macOS. On these platforms, Ctrl+Shift+Z is commonly used for redo.

### Expected behavior
-     On Windows: Ctrl+Y should trigger redo.
-     On Linux/macOS: Ctrl+Shift+Z should trigger redo.

title: Allow createCommit REST API to amend commit
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this feature has not yet been suggested by someone else.**

### Expected behavior

The current default implementation of the _createCommit_ REST API does nothing, as Sirius Web does not have a version control system that tracks versions of elements/projects/documents...
But the _createCommit_ REST API is the only way to create/delete/update elements.
So an intermediate solution could be to allow to amend the only commit existing in a project.
Thus, it will allow to create/delete/update elements.

title: It is no longer possible to contribute custom tools directly to the diagram palette
The diagram contextual palette sometimes refuses to open
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Flow project and a Topography diagram with this structure:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/223f9469-7209-462a-bb9b-6bcfe96e0183)

2. In the diagram, select the "Wifi" element and right click: its contextual palette opens (OK).
3. In the diagram, select the anynomous "System" element and right click: its contextual palette opens (OK).
4. In the Explorer, select the "standard" _DataFlow_ element inside "Wifi".
5. In the diagram, select the "Wifi" element and right click: its contextual palette does *not* open (KO).
6. In the diagram, select the anynomous "System" element and right click: its contextual palette does *not* open (KO).
7. Click on the diagram background and right-click: the diagram's palette opens.
8. Now repeat steps 5/6: the elements' contextual palette now opens correctly.

title: NA
body:
I'm not able to reproduce this every time but when it happens it seems that it's because of this line in `useDiagramElementPalette` :
`!!selection.entries.find((selection) => selection.id === elementClicked.data?.targetObjectId)`

It appears that the selection is not yet updated in some cases thus making the condition false and the palette not opening

title: NA
body:
After more digging, there is also an issue due to the function `handleMove` in `DiagramRenderer`.

When selecting a treeItem, a fit screen is called thus calling  `handleMove` a lot and this function closes the palette.
If we try to open the palette before the fit screen ended then the palette will immediately closes

title: Selected semantic elements which are not displayed on a diagram stay in the selection
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. On a Papaya class diagram with two classes A & B
2. Inside A, create a new attribute, with a Generic Type which points to B.
3. In the _Explorer_, select both the attribute (displayed on the diagram) *and* the generic type (*not* displayed, even though the attribute's label computation uses it)
4. Now in the diagram select B, or A, or the diagram itself. Note that the "Generic Type B" inside the attribute stays selected in the explorer.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/032d7a8e-c063-4afe-81c8-109306da7040

This is a consequence of #3980, which requires that selecting elements on the diagram does *not* deselect parts of the selection which are not (yet) displayed on the diagram as we need to keep them in the workbench selection if they appear in the next refresh.

title: InsideLabelStyle Properties are displayed twice in Details view

title: Creating a element represented multiple times sometimes select more than it should
body:
Given a container node description with a sub-node (representing a compartement) on the same element ("self"), when invoking a tool which creates a corresponding semantic element, only the parent node should be automatically selected. It's not always the case. In the video below, both "New Project" (container) and "Sub-tasks" (compartment) represent the same semantic element, but only the container should be selected after the tool is invoked.

title: FlowProjectTemplatesInitializer should be more precise in identifying the diagram to create
body: It currently does `var optionalTopographyDiagram = this.findDiagramDescription(editingContext, "Topography");`, which will find the "first" Diagram Description with the given title, which may not be the expected one.

title: NA
body: This is related to the depth of the GraphQL query we produce [here](https://github.com/eclipse-sirius/sirius-web/blob/master/packages/formdescriptioneditors/frontend/sirius-components-formdescriptioneditors/src/FormDescriptionEditorEventFragment.ts#L105), which is not enough to fetch all the existing children. But increasing the depth blindly creates *huge* GraphQL queries for no good reasons in 99.9% of the cases.

title: Beyond the 10th line, we are no longer able to open action menu in a table
body:
* [x] **I have checked that this bug has not yet been reported by someone else**
* [x] **I have checked that this bug appears on Chrome**
* [x] **I have specified the version** :
- latest
- other: please specify
* [x] **I have specified my environment** : 
- All
- my computer: Windows? Linux? Cloud?
- Cloud

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Papaya Package table with more than 10 rows (10 classes underneath a package for instance)
2. Change Rows per page to 20 to see more than 10 rows
3. try to open the action menu by clicking the `...`  button on the 11th row.

### Expected behavior

The action menu should open without errors and the Delete action should be there.

### Actual behavior

There is a `NullValueInNonNullableField` GraphQL error displayed

The problem is that the TableEventProcessor used by the action menu's event handler is not the correct one. 
It is always the initial one and the table context contains only 10 rows. It has not been updated due to the change of the rows per page setting change.
Pagination information should be part of the table representation ID to make the `EditingContextEventProcessor` able to retrieve the correct TableEventProcessor

body:

title: Diagram can invoke a mutation even when in read-only mode
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Flow project with a Topography diagram
2. Close the diagram
3. Create a new Portal
4. Open the browser's dev tools on the _Network_ tab
5. Drop the diagram into the Portal. In this state, the diagram is supposed to be in _read-only_ mode.
6. In the _Network_ tab, notice the frontend has sent a `mutation layoutDiagram() {}` despite the diagram being in read-only.

title: The deleteRepresentation mutation is obsolete
body:
Our GraphQL Schema defines a `deleteRepresentation()` mutation, and we have a corresponding `MutationDeleteRepresentationDataFetcher`.

However it is not actually used anywhere in the front. The only ways to delete a representations from the UI is either from the _Explorer_ (which uses `mutation deleteTreeItem()`) or from the _Representations_ view (which uses `mutation deleteListItem()`).
